vjw_UPsgWtDF5aPVlSlMbw.text: This place must be paying some of their reviewers for the 5 star ratings. There's absolutely nothing great about this place. We went there last eve. Couple of hours after we ate there, my son got sick. It's been 24 hours and we're sitting at the emergency room with him. The food was horrible. The only reason we stayed and ate is because I worked all day without having the time to take lunch, I was hungry and exhausted to just get up and leave. The worst possible experience. I will never go to this place again. And I will be calling a health department to complain.

JEzsCYauOvV2u-a6rnTWMw.text: Disappointed in myself that it took this long to find this late night gem. Open until 5am, live music during early dining hours to set the tone, half off pizzas after midnight, friendly informative service from Stephan(I hope I spelt this correct), and to top it amazing food that really has that "grandmas recipe" taste. We started with fresh bread , garlic butter. Sold! Lobster ravioli and shrimp scampi... I cleaned both plates with my second basket of bread. I had the steak flambe (NY strip) with a peppercorn sauce that was just right to not take away from the steak. Sauteed broccoli, twice baked potato, and roasted peppers. He had the chicken parmigiana with and extra side of that amazing marinara sauce. Both dishes clean and cleared. Just bummed we didn't save room for dessert. Next Monday cannoli here we come! Also on Mondays they have half off wine bottles!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starters.. Shrimp Scampi.. Make sure to have bread to clean plate with
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak flambé and in he far back the chicken parmigiana

1PWlh4EGcunhPpo5UObZ0w.text: This place was wonderful and a ton of fun!  Great atmosphere and the servers were cheerful and attentive.  The Frank Sinatra wanna be kept the mood light and provided great background music throughout our dinner.  I would definitely return on my next trip to Vegas.

sgL65olng-YigJpPCMcPnw.text: Probably the best hometown Italian restaurant I've ever had! (And it's in Vegas!!!)  When you first find the place, it's sandwiched between a Dutch Bro's coffee house and a gun shop/range (very quaint location). Then when you walk in, you are transformed back in time, probably in New York around the 1960s or 1970s. A time where live music was happening, and the service was very personable.   I went there with my boyfriend and his stepmom. We arrived around 6:30 pm or so and was seated immediately. Our waiter did some small talk with us, then got our drink order. I couldn't decide what to order so I did some more chatting with the waiter and asked for his recommendations.   My bf stepmom ordered the Shrimp Scampi which she enjoyed very much. My boyfriend ordered their famous Baked Lasagna which was really delicious. The plus side of ordering the lasagna was that they gave more meat marinara sauce if you wanted more of it. (So all you meat marinara lovers have at it!) As for me, I got the Linguine Luciano which was so delicious! Their portion was huge! and I wanted to finish every bite of it but didn't have enough room in my stomach for it. I guess I shouldn't have gotten a cup of their Grandma's Famous Chicken Soup prior to my meal. However the soup was so good how could you not want to finish that???  Since it was my boyfriend's birthday weekend, the band played Happy Birthday for him and we got a Cannoli! Which was really good!   Overall experience: service, setting, and food... 5 stars!!! Totally will come back when I'm in Vegas and recommend anyone to come and eat there. Oh yeah... if you happen to be in town and you wanted to get to this place but don't have a car or don't want to drive. You could make a reservation prior to your visit and get complimentary limo service from them. (Something to think about.)  Happy Eating Everybody!

Ez3IIP2HDRhdWgZDWbUdog.text: This little jem is a classic!!! If you are in Vegas and want The Best Italian food search no more!!! This place is awesome! If you like spice the Gypsy sauce is what you want to add to any of your dishes. But the alfredo sauce and garlic loaf omg!!! AWESOME SAUCE!!! The service is 5 stars all the way. Very friendly staff!! Cheese ravioli's come 3 to a plate and are huge!!! I recommended getting them with alfredo sauce!!! Save room for coffee after as they are neighbors with the best Oregon coffee there is "Dutch Bros"!!! LoVe this place and will be back when I'm back in town. It's a must try while in Vegas!!!

wjfyGoFherpkquWXXybB8A.text: Incredible food and atmosphere and wonderful staff. The service is incredible, very friendly and know the menu. The live music is phenomenal. Overall one of my favorite places in Vegas.

leLb2WPBhq9F-TKUH_Lswg.text: This is my favorite Italian joint for date night. Really good food, wine, and live entertainment. We are vegan but still love the options available. The pasta is delicious and they have a few appetizers we can eat. My husband and I like Italian wine and they actually have some for reasonable prices. Their live entertainment is amazing lounge singer, jazz, Vegas style I always enjoy it. They have machines at the bar if you want to play and enjoy a glass of wine. Always recommend this place to my friends and family.

DTt9L_p6yyvMxIpalGzgXg.text: The two stars are solely for the entertainment director and the 2 guys in the black shirts that kept checking on us. Came in on a Saturday night, pretty busy; we were seated quickly though. Our water was so awkward and disconnected, was so off-putting. The food was the biggest disappointment. The lamb on the bed of risotto tasted like dirt. The chicken francaise (sp)? tasted like the entire bottle of salt was dumped on it. And the water...I think the ditch water might have tasted better. The entertainment director told us to tell our waiter it was our sons birthday bc they do a little something special...aaaaaannnddd nothing. Needless to say our waiter can kick rocks and he didn't get tipped. The entertainment and our two runner guys got the tip. Thanks guys. We won't be back...ever.

8S6B8mgyzVdb4Nfd0PISUw.text: I can't say enough about this small, off strip restaurant. It is hands down the best Italian food I have had, and Italian is my favorite food genera, so have had quite a bit. I ordered the penne alla forno and it was delicious! My husband had a seafood linguini and he ate it all even though he wasn't even very hungry. Dessert was excellent as well and we went on a Monday which meant half priced bottles of wine. The atmosphere was comfortable and romantic without being obvious or cliche. The service was impeccable, items were cleared from the table within seconds of being done, wine glasses were never less that half full- our server, Tony, was very attentive and made excellent recommendations. There is live music that really kicks up the ambiance and made the whole experience that much more memorable. My husband and I both agreed this was the highlight of our trip to Vegas!

L9ZZ9ZIm2YeLJc_KxKpXFQ.text: Very nice late date.... diner was delicious. Wine bottle is half price on Mondays! That was a nice surprise. Our waiter was very friendly and we had a great time! I love creeme brulee ... i ordered it and got a shirt from the house.

_H0TJwr8nZgQHbR5aTOSDQ.text: Hubby & I came to Vegas to meet my family and I really wanted to take them out to a nice family dinner.  My mom, sister, hubby and I really LOVE pasta.  This cute little place was highly ranked among the rest.  It's located in a neighborhood a few minutes away from the strip.  My first impression of the restaurant was that it was very charming and the fact that it was away from the strip was great because it was a small venue but they were still able to accommodate is with no reservation.  The wait time was less than three minutes and everyone from the hostess, to the waiter, to the live band was amazing.  Everyone asked where we were from and they loved the fact that we were representing Hawaii.  The band even played a special song for us to help bring a little island comfort to the scene.  I ordered the Pasta Alla Forno which is penne pasta tossed with chicken, shrimp, broccoli and mushrooms in a light pink sauce baked in the oven with fresh mozzarella, this dish was very delicious.  It's something that the waiter and I have never seen in any Italian Restaurant, I finished the entire plate! My hubby had his all time favorite, the Chicken Parmigiana.  He thought it was descent but felt it wasn't up to par with the other versions he's had.  He honestly felt that Olive Garden mastered that fish better than this place... My little sister had the Spaghetti with Meatballs.  It was amazing! The meatballs were so soft and juicy.  Both the Chicken Parmigiana and Spaghetti with Meatballs were both one pound plates! The two couldn't finish it... lol.  My mom had the Linguini & Clams which was fresh clams, both chopped and whole in your choice of either a red or white sauce over linguini.  She enjoyed this dish as well with no complaints.  My dad got one of the Specials that they were featuring that night, a Trio Sampler which had the Lobster Ravioli (GREAT dish), Shrimp (It was okay), and the Gnocchi which was homemade potato dumplings served with your choice of meat sauce (he ate every bite).  For dessert I had one cannoli, which was the first cannoli I've ever had in my life! IT WAS DELICIOUS! It even comes with a free shirt :)   All in all I have to say I would give this place five stars but because not everyone enjoyed there food as much as I did, I gave the overall venue four stars.  I definitely recommend this place to anyone that LOVES PASTA and isn't afraid to try something new.  I love trying different things and if you're one, this place is a MUST GO TO!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmigiana, one pound serving!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Alla Forno, my dish.  It was delicious!!!

HCBQYQ8-c-VWnC871ys3Ig.text: This is quintessential old Las Vegas!  It is an off strip location in a fantastic brick building (brick in Nevada-just sayin').  My favorite part of the experience, place a reservation in advance for free limo service! Whaaat?!  Does this place know their audience or what?!  How smart is that marketing?!  I adored it.  It was not fancy, it wasn't run down, it was perfect for celebrating and enjoying with loved ones.  There are lots of pictures and Godfather references throughout the restaurant.  I love the kitsch of the decor, it works.    Their wine menu is lean, which is fine it offered enough for variety without being overwhelming.  We stuck with Prosecco.  It was good, one option, a little sweet for me, but fine for a special occasion.  They offer gluten free pasta which is great!  We swapped it for the greens pasta on the menu and it was delicious. We also shared salads (Caesar), chicken parmesan, and cioppino.  The only disappointing dish was the cioppino.  To be fair, SF is in my backyard and we are the ringers for that dish, so it is hard to compare.  It was a decent dish, but if going back I wouldn't order it again.  We should have known better.  I took a scandalous (for me) bite of the chicken parmesan since it used to be one of my favorite dishes and it was perfect! It was lightly breaded, crispy, with melty cheese and a delicious sauce.  My stomach is rumbling just thinking about it.  Our service was amazing for the whole experience; the restaurant brought dessert over to the birthday girl and a free t-shirt for her.    I think if you are going to LV, take a chance and step off the strip for this little gem.  Live music, free limo rides, and good food - how can you go wrong?

_sBtx9m9DRHINL4ZI2lCqQ.text: Good Food, Good Service, and Good Time for All!   Being a tourist, but long time visitor to Las Vegas I wanted to get away from "The Strip" for an Italian dinner for my wife and me. We got a tip from a shoe salesman at the Outlet Mall. He suggested Casa Di Amore on Tropicana.   It was beyond our expectations! The place was full of Old School ambiance and charm. Yet it was a place that was comfortable for families with young children and other people  "dressed to the nines." Oh, did I mention that there was a musical combo there, too? George, who played the key board, to me favored Sinatra when he sang, and Paul who played the drums and also sang added a real personal touch by making friends with all guests in attendance during the breaks. At the end of the first set, we were all friends.  But let's not forget the food and service. Tony was our waiter and helped us navigate the menu and drinks list. There was nothing rote about his service. He allowed my wife to sample two wines so she could decide what to order (she is not a drinker) and modify her dinner salad as she does not like certain lettuce types. The entrees we fantastic. I had the Linguini and Clams, and my wife had the special Lobster Ravioli. Both I recommend. We had coffee drinks instead of deserts.  I can understand why there were a number of "regulars" there this Sunday night not just enjoying the food and music, but engage the whole restaurant staff as well. If I lived in Las Vegas I'd be a regular, too.

F2wtcgqP6aultXrf4wVv1g.text: What a zoo. It's crowded and very loud. The food is good enough but who want to eat in a high decibel crowded equivalent of a rock concert. We wont be back.

ebntp7ZB8GF7KnP2ZK1wGg.text: My absolute favorite restaurant to go to. The wait staff is SO amazing that it just makes the food taste better, as if that's even necessary.   Whenever I have visitors this is the place I take them to. By far my favorite Vegas spot.

td_9RL2cJIf6XDEHWHOr5A.text: Loved loved loved it here! The ambiance, the food, the people, everything!  It is very old school Italian, people even get up and sing along to the choruses of various popular songs when the singing duo comes out! The pasta was homemade and fresh. It was super busy but the waitress I had (Rochelle? Rebecca?) and the manager do everything they can to make you feel special and like you're the only one there! I truly loved the old school Italian ambiance however and all the Italian spirits and liquors. It's a great singles scene too, especially for the ladies as for once the men outnumbered the ladies by far!! My only regret is that I came here on the last night of my trip instead of the first!! Will be back again on my next trip to Vegas!!

jxBDEeZfIoMUTWTKUii6LQ.text: Yelp this place and it was open from 5p-5a, and it was 12am. Perfect! We had appetizers and took them home with us. The prawns wrapped are delish and the sampler appetizer was also very good.  While we were sitting at the bar for our food, a server came up to us and started to compliment us on our attire and was very nice and kind. He asked if we seen the live band. He said that we need come back and check it out and was sad to see us take our food to go.  Definitely going back to eat in the restaurant and enjoy the music and the FOOD!

HCrDBe66dRQ22dYYWvq9Bw.text: How have I waited this long to review this place?!? One of our favorites, we can't stay away. For romantic date night, special holidays, dinner with friends this place is the best. The servers are always incredibly friendly and helpful, the place is always lively and filled with good vibes. There are two lovely gentleman playing music for you, they take requests and have serenaded me a few times. They are one of the highlights of this place. I can't even begin to name all of the items we have ordered off of the menu because we have been here so many times, but they have all been delicious! A few of my faves are their meatball appetizers and the ravioli, but seriously try everything. We celebrated Valentine's day here this year as well, and although we don't normally do anything on that holiday we are thinking of celebrating here again because it was so much fun. Check this place out, you won't be disappointed!

BhLTEI1Cd4nuAJDtoSDacw.text: Went here while on vacation, celebrating my husband's birthday and Valentines Day. It was wonderful. All the ladies got a rose and chocolates. The live music was so much fun and the food delicious. Service was perfect.

uAml9O2qlSRjvdQLWfGoAg.text: Stepping through the Casa di Amore door is like going back in time to old Vegas of the 1960s. The decor is vintage and New York Italian restaurant style with low lighting and some big plush booths. There was a live pianist/singer there, who is talented and took requests. My husband and I requested some songs that are not well known, however he knew them all! Even though we were staying on the strip, we were willing to venture out to try authentic Italian food, which did not disappoint. I ordered the pasta with clams, which ended up being a huge serving with a generous amount of clams. My husband ordered a special, which was a pasta with pesto, seafood, and artichokes. The bartender knows how to make good old fashioneds here, and there is also a great selection of wines to choose from. The ambience is really special here, as the audience gets into the music and you truly feel like you are a local back in old Vegas.  ***I recommend making reservations if possible, as you will probably get one of the better seats. I would also recommend taking a Lyft/Uber/taxi as it would be quite a walk from the strip, and walking back afterwards could be a bit challenging since the drinks are potent and reasonably priced ;)

0srNx03VSDc4x8LH22zBLA.text: Late night hole in the wall find for us. We met up with some people here around 2 in the morning. Friendly crew there, mixed bag of patrons which was cool Met some nice people there.  Ordered the meatballs (didn't try them but those who did, raved) I had a chicken breast and green pepper pizza and it was damn good. Thin crust, just the right amount of sauce and not over cheesy and greasy. Good stuff!

DhABgD0WmB7d7UiYYRdedQ.text: First time visit tonight. Food was very good. Prices reasonable. Great live music. Service excellent.  Old school Vegas restaurant. Worth leaving the Strip for.

jq6Usj-0yAw0V2KU6aRPqg.text: We recently went here for our anniversary and man, it was a poppin place for a Friday night! We had reservations for 9 but weren't sat until close to 10 but that was okay, they had warned us they were behind. We are locals here and really enjoyed the vibe of this place. We sat at the bar and enjoyed the live music and conversation of strangers, it was great! We were seated and apologized to for the wait. We ordered the most delicious mozzarella and prosciutto crustini, they must make their cheese in house because it melts like butter, sooo good! For dinner we had the chicken piccatta and chicken Marsala, the portions were great and very tasty and our server was a great man full of helpful suggestions about the menu. Thank you for the great experience, we will definitely be back!

t14HsQVEfxg09-jWXySaSg.text: This place was SUPER SUPER cute. It is a really authentic mob looking italian place. The food was prompt the service was good. There was a piano guy who was playing requests the whole time we were there. Only downside was that every time the waiter came up to me I totally felt like I was in his way because he was refilling my drink or removing my plate. He even moved my plate away from me when I was mid putting food on my fork!!!!!!! But besides the overeager waiter the food was AMAZING!!!!!! The chicken parm was to die for and the bruchetta (Is that how you spell it?) was heavenly!!!

flOAPpPN8GunaY1DBSe91Q.text: We went to Casa di Amore last night for dinner and it was perfect. Even though we arrived at 830 on a Saturday night without a reservation, the hostess didn't give us any attitude, she just directed us to the bar. We ordered drinks and bruschetta and chatted and listened to the live music. About 30 minutes later they called us to a table, which seemed quite reasonable given the crowd.  Our server was friendly and prompt, and the food was great. We all thought the live music was a plus - more interesting than canned music, but at a volume where we could still talk. It's nice to have a place where you can hold a conversation without having to shout.  We left with wonderful memories and will definitely come back on our next trip to Vegas.

XKiu1nBTaIm0eF0EPsqeDg.text: On first visit, we walked in with a group of six people after arriving in their very old limo, which was a nice experience. It was extremely loud and there wasn't even a band playing (yet). The place was PACKED. I mean packed, back to back, like a can of sardines. It was hard to maneuver oneself to even get up to go to the bathroom. It is a lively atmosphere though, if that is what you are looking for. However this is not a favorable choice to go to when meeting someone's parents for the first time to share a great meal with conversation. We had to yell across the table at one another. Funny stuff.  Now onto the most important part. The "cuisine:"  Ok, I get it. We live in America where American Italian cuisine is heavily prevalent and this is Vegas so why not mix the two together? Casa Di Amore blends classic Italian American dishes with an old Vegas mob-style vibe to their restaurant. Dishes such as eggplant parmigiana, veal marsala, chicken marsala, baked lasagna, osso buco and the good 'ole spaghetti and meatballs are to be expected.   Frankie, Dino and Sammie would be shaking their heads in disappointment at this place.  When a customer sits down to a table, it is expected to have a waitress/waiter greet them  timely and get acquainted with the place. After we all sat down, it took anyone to come over to our table to order drinks, a good 15 minutes before we could order a couple bottles of their house wine. We were not served bread or anything.  I eventually ordered the Eggplant Di Amore. I could not believe how DRY this dish was. It was intensely dry. Being that there was spinach, mushrooms and sundried tomatoes and umm...EGGPLANT...in a tomato sauce? This should not be so dry. As I cut into it, it was like cutting into a brick. "Where are the mushrooms?..the spinach?...that sundried tomato flavor?...where is it?" I was excited to try a twist on the classic dish but was severely disappointed. Not only was the eggplant parm dry but it was room temperature, overly salty to compensate for the lack of flavor. All I tasted was mozzarella that seemed like it was sitting there for a while and a solid hunk of nothing. My mother had the Pork Chops With Vinegar & Peppers. She was excited since she grew up with this dish. At first bite, the pork chop was so tough I couldn't tear it off with my teeth from the fork! The weirdest part was that the pork had an extreme fishy taste to it! It was unbearable!  My mother's husband ordered a piece of chicken with a potato and veggies on the side...hardly memorable. My sister ordered the Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto, which was one of the better dishes at our table. There was hardly any prosciutto in it and the spinach was "missing" again. I don't know if they make their own four cheese sauce but this one was especially bland. My sister's boyfriend ordered the Veal Marsala. Ok I love marsala dishes. I even prepare in my own kitchen from time to time. The veal at Casa Di Amore was overly dry and not the tender suppleness that a great veal dish should be. The marsala sauce tasted nothing like a good marsala wine was used. I was actually disgusted. His mother ordered the same and was greatly disappointed. We also received our bread when we received our entrees! blasphemy!  On the ride home, we hopped back into the limo. The limo driver was a nice woman but we weren't told that we would share our ride with a couple of other parties. There was absolutely no lighting in that limo so we were neck in neck in the darkness with strangers. We had to wait to go home because the limo driver thought it would be fit to drop those people off first. It was about an hour wait to go home when we only live a couple streets over. The limo is complimentary, but still.  Overall, the food here is not worth a second try.The classic marinara sauce in a place like this should be a signature. It is not here. For the price you are paying, the food is completely not worth it. I can find better quality for half the price, elsewhere. I am at a dismay at the hype of this place, but I suppose it is a good place to go to if your just subconsciously craving a pseudo-Italian American dish at the last minute....desperately. Ya know...that. "I'm starving, I'll eat anything!!...let's go to 711 and get some nachos," mentality. The food was so bland, dry, too salty and their combination of flavors had no flavor at all. I've had a lot better experiences in Vegas with this type of cuisine. (Can I mention Buon Gustos? Thee Best!! Seriously, try it!)  Casa Di Amore needs to be toned down a little. Maybe it's too busy for themselves to handle? Maybe they would put more effort and love into their food and serve fresh food otherwise. Suffice to say, we will not be returning here.

NOHhopT2Yhpgsmor7w-26g.text: Wow! Great food, great vibe, had a really nice time here. Only issue was that we had a reservation at 730 but still didn't get seated til about 8, other than that the service was great, very friendly staff. The band was entertaining but could be kinda loud so it was hard to have a conversation. But I'd go here again and again!

GWGZ3Ub0UAyiQLKEX0QDow.text: What can I say.... they pick you up from your hotel in a limo... entertain you while serving really great food. Service was excellent and they take you back to your hotel when ready... a must go when in Vegas....

44ylNH7DxAdM8uPuyOgqRg.text: Everything about this place was great. I don't think the prices are as bad as other reviewers mentioned. I absolutely loved the the inside of it, my boyfriend kept saying he felt like we were in the movie Goodfellas. All the food we ordered was great and very flavorful, our server was helpful and quick with everything. I will absolutely be coming here more often.

CUR01mD-izq5nIrhzwAR4g.text: I'm new in town, noticed this place out on Tropicana, then saw the Yelp reviews and decided to try it. I love the atmosphere, love that the walls pay homage to the Rat Pack, love the very square yet cool lounge act performing in the restaurant. The host and waiters treat customers like VIPs, reminding me of Vegas when I came here 25 years ago. Nice wine list too. And they serve food until 5am! The biggest surprise was the food! I ordered spaghetti and meatballs and a caesar salad. I don't know what they do differently, but that caesar salad was amazing. Really, really great! I'm pretty sure I tasted more parmesan than I usually do, but there were some other seasonings in there too subtle for me to identify. Fantastic! The single serving of spaghetti and meatballs was enough to feed a family of four, unnecessarily large. But despite that, and I can't believe I'm saying this, this was truly the best spaghetti and meatballs I've ever tasted in my life! And I've had some of the best. I used to live i NY & NJ and I've travelled all over Italy. I certainly never expected I'd one day say the best spaghetti and meatballs I ever tasted was in Las Vegas. I wish I could afford to eat here often. That's the downside, it's just too expensive for me. But for a special occasion, or if you're rich, I totally recommend this place.

9MVqZf4hf7V2QOncaHrR2w.text: Our waiter Tony boy was great. He was super nice and informative. What an awesome guy! The food was amazing. The desert was delicious. I highly recommend this place. 5 stars easily

ZpqUa1XGLdu-_mKM2HiOGw.text: Everyone who orders a cannoli gets a free t-Shirt!  I didn't get one because I had the tiramisu....no regrets though, it was delish!

unqDKKIOuBrvNDgjT-Lb8Q.text: Really, some of the BEST Italian food I've eaten...and, I'm Italian.  The ravioli's reminded me of the ones we used to have in Brooklyn - the sauce was fresh, fantastic and not sweet...which is how most American's mess it up.  The baked clams reminded me of the ones we used to have on Christmas Eve and the chicken special my boyfriend ordered with a pesto cream on top was to die for. Old-school, Vegas atmosphere as great as the food.  Will definitely be back with family and friends for many years to come!

T1U1eH8kOrWzF8DRVa-U_A.text: In terms of Italian this place served the best I've ever eaten. The service and atmosphere was simply amazing. Will return for our anniversary!

lXITyVdgzJ1yigjcSYCF9g.text: I came here for my 21st birthday dinner with my family (we had a party of six).  First off, we were picked up at our hotel, The Orleans, and driven to the restaurant by the complimentary limousine. The limo driver was extremely nice, the music was great and it was so relaxing not having to stress over parking or finding the exact location.   When we arrived, they immediately sat us down and took our drink orders. When they brought our drinks, one of my brothers was extremely thirsty and chugged his drink. Before he could even put down the empty glass, they were there to replace it. It was crazy how great the service was. I honestly wouldn't have even expected anyone to see that he had finished his drink since they had literally just brought it to us.   We ordered a wide variety of meals from lasagna to chicken parmesan to chicken marsala. Every single one of us LOVED the taste/quality of our meal. It was by far the best Italian food I have ever eaten.  The atmosphere was great. It's a small restaurant so there aren't an overwhleming amount of people and it has a very classy feel to it. There is live music playing old school songs (Sinatra for example) and the entire ambiance is very comforting.  Lastly, we ordered cannolis for dessert. These were also very delicious. Not to mention, the great service stated earlier was maintained throughout dinner.  This place was perfect. I debated between numerous restaurants for my birthday dinner and I was far more than satisfied with my decision. My family and I will be back for a nice dinner every time we are back in Vegas.

FiMfu8jn6c8tHkE9i428gQ.text: Had Christmas Eve dinner at Casa di Amore and while things started a little rough, it ended up being a very good experience.  As for the starting out rough, I had a reservation and still had to wait about 20 minutes past my reservation time. I wasn't thrilled about that. Nor was I thrilled with the noise level. When I say it was loud, I mean it was LOUD! This is an old school restaurant in an even older building. The walls are solid brick and while that adds character, there is literally nothing to absorb any sound. The space is small and they cram a lot of people inside and all their talking just bounces back at you. Add to that a talented singer/keyboard player and you get one very loud restaurant. I would actually venture to say it was the loudest restaurant I have ever been in.  From here on though everything gets better. For an appetizer we ordered the twice wrapped prawns which were incredible. Shrimp wrapped with prosciutto and cheese and then baked in dough, served with a sweet sauce that complimented everything nicely. I loved them and will definitely get them again. We also ordered the "famous garlic loaf" which was so good after we finished it we had to order another!  After a nice house salad I received my entree of Chicken Marsala. Two good sized pieces of chicken sauteed with mushrooms and a Marsala wine sauce that was as good as I have ever had. It came with a side of pasta. I upgraded the regular marinara sauce to meat sauce and was glad I did.  For dessert if you order a canoli or creme brulee you get a free t-shirt. I wanted the t-shirt but I wanted the tiramisu more, and it was an excellent choice.  The service was good, but not exceptional. Most of the waiters do look like they have worked there forever and ours was very knowledgeable about the menu. The host was very nice even though it did take longer than I would liked to get my table.  Overall it was a very good experience. Because of the noise level I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic date unless you really don't want to be able to hear your date very well. We've all had those dates, right?  I do recommend Casa di Amore though and will definitely be back.

yGMnoZoKE6Aa-6F8Hw1GQw.text: This classic Vegas throwback is always a safe bet. Pizzas and pastas are old school and always perfectly prepared. The live entertainment adds to the whole experience. They also host an outstanding Super Bowl party every year. Multiple, humongous 12 foot HD screens, everybody gets a seat, cheerleaders, drum line, all you can eat, all you can drink. Can this little party Casa Di Amore throws get any better. Yes it can! This year at Las Vegas Hotel which means you happen to be in the same building as one of Las Vegas' sport book. So yeah, place your bets if that's your thing too. Super crowd spanning all ages. Those 12 foot screens with a sound system to match makes this event as close to being there as possible. This is one Super bowl party that is hard to beat. It's their 7th year so they must be doing something right.

4LeOzD1vyAiaC0KzuI9cSw.text: My friend wanted to have dinner in an old style Italian restaurant typical of the Rat pack with live music. Case Di Amore was everything she wanted. The waiter Tony was very good, experienced and friendly. His wine recommendation was perfect. The ambiance was what a Vegas Italian restaurant should be and the singer was very good with lots of variety and great showmanship. Last but not least the food was excellent. My Chilean sea bass was perfect and her bowl of pasta also very good. All this for a very reasonable price esp on the wine and cocktails. I really recommend Casa Di Amore!

Btbp6ZNFjuagbQUosOiO2w.text: My husband and my favorite restaurant in the world! We live on the East Coast, but have visited Vegas several times. We always make a point to go here and it's the highlight of our trip!

4yVSZRPbg3Kfo_mcNuPCog.text: Delicious food, great drinks and their customer service is excellent. Our server Sisco did an amazing job he made us feel welcomed & valued. He went way and beyond to make sure we had an exceptional time there. Thanks Casa for hiring great people like him. Highly recommended !

-u6KeRhxE3_TW-ccM3a2Lg.text: Great atmosphere, rat pack era music, great food.  My servers name was Blake and he was the best. He was very attentive and helpful when choosing what sauce to get bc they have many different choices.

MqDEQVOoWZu8E3PAWqygcQ.text: Great food, great music.  Jeff the owner treated us like royalty! The tiki bar was fabulous! Thank you Tony for being an exceptional waiter. Can't wait for the next time I am in Las Vegas!   Will certainly be stopping at Casa Di Amore for a delicious meal!

DgnTHqxD9vR2rx3blEVlfw.text: Spent my birthday here this year. The waitstaff is great.  If you want to talk to your party, be certain to get there early. It can get a bit loud when the dinner crowd comes in. The live entertainment is exceptional and will take requests. There is a lovely, yet odd, tiki bar attached. Hey, who says Italians don't know how to throw one heck of a party? Cheers!

TNpGCsyN_IBKplc_3PcKzw.text: This was our first time coming to this restaurant. It is beautiful on the inside!!!. A homage to The Rat Pack days. We had a reservation but because it was Gypsy night we waited about 15 minutes before being seated. I ordered the calamari which was delicious! Nice size, battered just right. The lemon drop was tasty. My main entree was stuffed pork chop Valdostana. The flavor was absolutely wonderful, potato was good as well as the vegetables. My only complaint is the pork chop was overcooked. For this to be a featured entree I would expect the cook or chef to know how 2 sautee a pork chop in a way where it should be melting in your mouth. Kyle was our waiter he was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. The band saying happy birthday to me and I was greeted as the birthday girl once they checked our reservation.  I thought that was very personable. The cannoli is a MUST

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Birthday Cannoli
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed pork chop Valdostana
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto Mozzarella Crostini

9Mg3_hBMFOjzSyZFg8wRMA.text: I have visited this restaurant twice both times I travelled to Vegas. It is hands down the BEST!

dwjtcRLAmuuoBBt_NFYp8A.text: We went on a double date night here and had a great time!  I didn't get any pictures of the inside unfortunately but I did of the outside tiki bar. Yes, A TIKI BAR!  My boyfriend and I shared a one pound pasta bowl and the cheesy garlic bread (got it based on reviews on here) & the couple we were with each got dishes they liked as well. Our pasta was cooked great, we loved the broccoli and the bread.. The bread was amazing! Definitely a must get. The whole inside experience is great. It's very old Vegas and the live music was great!  After dinner, we went out to the tiki bar, got some drinks and then sat at one of the long tables and played a game. They have quite a few different games to choose from and we chose to play What Do You Meme?. It was SUCH a fun game! We had a great time, hanging out, having some drinks, playing that game.  A great experience and we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YFZ6qdzzRikM_JgVTfBgCQ.text: This place has amazing pizza and pasta! The bar is well stocked and the portions are great for sharing. If you hit up their evening happy hour on the tiki patio everything on the patio menu is half off!

TXpXhuWpkQozhxjF8n3V2A.text: This place!  Over all the BEST Italian food I've ever consumed!  Split the chicken parm with my daughter!  Sooo most n delicious.  My hubby had the spaghetti n meatballs. Don't know what they do to make it so good... but the meatballs... man o man! Must have those again!  The tiki spot in the back..so fun.  Kids played uno.. dominos...jenga while mommy n daddy had a half price drink!  Oh.... once inside... very awesome old mafia feel.  Live duo playing jazz! Amaze-balls! I will recommend this place for everyone I know. Good food.. fun atmosphere... 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Split chicken parm... couldn&#39;t finish!  Definitely share a meal!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids at Tiki bar in back.  Los of photo ops

5vgm1nRLGfH7OFhK6oF10w.text: Took us 12 years to get here but it was worth the wait! Food was great; loved the Arancini risotto balls, the Veal Piccata & Chicken Parmigiana rocks! Our server Michael was fantastic! We'll be back...

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C2gt7Ryu2Bb3-Cxt6m0HgA.text: We went there with family with no idea what to expect. We were a little early and went to the bar. We were seated exactly on time. The food and service were really good. The only thing wrong was I ordered steak medium and it was crispy and really well done. But, I still liked it. Antipasto great, garlic bred great, chicken parm great. My husband is Italian and super picky. He loved it too. Music was really good and people were dancing. My only comment on that was if they turned it down a tiny bit. We couldn't have a conversation while he was playing.

8cfdCvWg0HVAdUs7pd6Yfg.text: Fun throw back! Great food, great service! Everything from the salad to the bread to the main dishes are done perfectly. If you Love Italian food, great atmosphere, wonderful service I recommend this jewel.

mUhVih6Pf5CzQxHlCIDxHA.text: When we come to Vegas this is our place to enjoy excellent food and excellent entertainment. This place is old school Vegas personified. The food is Top-Notch, from the Pizza all the way to the Steak Sinatra (which I really recommend!). Service is always great.  One of the biggest reasons we come here is the atmosphere. It's quaint with great pictures on the wall of old Vegas. Behind the bar you can find sports on TV as well as big screen TV's displaying classic Vegas scenes.   The biggest reason we come here is George, he is king of the keyboard. His melodic tones along with his keyboard really make this place a gem in Vegas. Even if the food sucked (which it doesn't.. it's awesome) we would come to see him.   I hope this place never changes. It is perfect.

027FhPV5iXMf5kH6W0RMzA.text: My husband and I are new to Vegas and wanted a simple night out without the strip shenanigans.. and we are so glad to have found just the spot! This place is so lively, vibrant, warm and welcoming. (The Tiki Hut Bar) We also had a great conversation with the owner "Alex", who is the sweetest! I highly recommend this place if you're looking for something fun, vibrant, mature and classy all in one. We can't wait to go back and try the actual restaurant! Seamed like the perfect place for a date night.

zLiZ2n_MuWWNCJOuiJ-WbQ.text: This was easily the best restaurant we ate at in Las Vegas. It was recommended to us by a couple that we met at breakfast one morning and I am so glad we tried it out. It was easy to get a reservation and they even provided transportation for us! You can't beat that.  The service was phenomenal. Our waiter, Paul, really made the night special for us. There is live music there and you can even request songs to play, and of course our wonderful waiter made sure they played a song for us. Now, about the food.... wow is all I can say. I ordered the gnocchi special which came with beef tips, gorgonzola sauce and basil. It was exceptional. My husband ordered the Veal Parmesan and ate every bit of it. We also couldn't resist getting dessert so we had the cannoli and creme brulee because they are both made in house (and you get a free t-shirt if you order one of these). Talk about melt in your mouth perfection! Needless to say, if you are in Las Vegas make sure you come here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée... just divine.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli.... mouth watering.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmesan. Perfection.

saDIURElJlC1w-Nm5O5o8Q.text: Absolutely amazing! Everyone in our party said that this was the best meal they'd had at a restaurant in a long time. Food and service were both excellent. We had a pesto pasta, lasagna, chicken Marsala, cioppino, a cannoli and a slice of cheesecake. Every dish was amazing and the cheesecake was the best anyone had ever eaten. The only downside to us was that the musician they had was incredibly loud. Very good, had a Sinatra sound, but very loud. We were at a small 4 seater table and still having to almost yell at each other to hear. Overall, we would go back in a heartbeat, just at an earlier time before the music comes on.

OYEgef96TRMwJ6LBx1wEtQ.text: Excellent food and service and great atmosphere. Inside you feel like you're in old Vegas in the days of Frank Sinatra, outside your whisked away to a Caribbean paradise great music on Wednesdays and Thursdays on the patio

2xrenQhoAe6OBc-y7frzHQ.text: This place had the best restaurant Caesar salad that I have ever had. They will pick you up on the strip, which is awesome. Crusty bread, huge pasta bowls, and an ambiance reminiscent of Vegas in the 50s. Get the Neapolitan Bomba for dessert. Oh, and the service was fantastic and they gave us free T-shirts.

NTfQuZroQpNVkJ9663RrVg.text: I love the food and vibe honestly it feels very authentic!!! If you havent been before you have to try it out atleast once!! ....it is pricey but worth the money and taste

EHnKSr4utmqkBE0uhXSF_g.text: My truly favorite place to eat Italian food. Everything here is amazing but the pizza is the best thing here. You truly cannot beat this pizza. The staff is also very good and when they have their live band I have such a good time. It's a great place for a nice dinner with family or to just get some take out.

DW18wNg2IlVJHhRx7fBnBA.text: We stopped here on Thanksgiving post Black Friday shopping after finding the reviews on Yelp. This is a huge hidden gem! The outside and inside are so drastically different and we could not believe how late it stays open! Our server Kyle was entertaining and provided his recommendations. He kept our drinks full and checked on us often. Extremely good service, especially for around midnight. We ordered a pizza, the garlic bread, marinara sauce, and a side of Fettuccine Alfredo. The Alfredo sauce was the best I've tasted in my entire life. At the end of our meal we also ordered a tiramisu which was delicious and had an excellent amount of espresso. I highly recommend this place for the ambiance, wait staff, and menu selection.

_MD4qhgxKJyaDyZyJvS7xw.text: A LV Local took me here for dinner and everything start to finish was amazing! The hostess and server were incredibly sweet and the food was wonderful. If you're staying on the strip, I highly recommend grabbing Uber to this place. Very old school Italian, dimly lit and a live band. Portions are large so you will leave satisfied! Enjoy!

hhc5Qq5tb2ZNuBCEWH6pdw.text: Kind of disappointed on this one... Its been around for so long I figured it would be great, but.... It was busy so service was VERY slow... Got the app after almost 30 mins and we ordered food at the same time... it was OK, the shrimps were over fries and almost black. When the entree came out, it was COLD and flavorless.  The server and live music saved it though, otherwise out would have been an all around bad experience, but I can definitely say I won't go again

ZN2IFJ7B8JUM3w9mtRFC-g.text: Went for our anniversary dinner and we loved it! The atmosphere & staff were both amazing ! The food was also fabulous ! We both got the chicken parm with a garlic loaf & a side of meatballs. Everything was amazing. Next time I would get extra sauce on the pasta that comes with the chicken parm. Overall great place. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm

Ir3Gkp8SybouKakozgqkBg.text: This restaurant is pure old Vegas. You walk in and are engulfed in vintage burgundy and gold. There is a lounge singer who sings the classics loud enough to hear, but soft enough to not intrude. We came hear with two out of town friends. We got the bruschetta and calamari for appetizers. The bruschetta was delicious, with sweet, ripe tomatoes. The calamari though was the star, very lightly breaded and flash fried, it was the best calamari I've ever had. We all shared  a bottle of wine, which was reasonably prices and tasty, a Malbec. For our entrees we ordered fettuccine with shrimp, linguini with clams in white sauce, chicken Parmesan, and gnocchi with prosciutto and spinach is a four cheese sauce. Everyone raved about their entrees. I had the gnocchi and the gnocchi were pillow soft. The sauce was rich and elegant. We ordered molten lava chocolate cake and passion fruit bomb for dessert. The cake was good, exactly what you would expect. The passion fruit bomb was divine, the sorbet inside tart mixing well with the outside, sweet chocolate shell. Altogether the meal was $208, a fair price for an exquisite dinner with excellent service.  A tip for the next time we go... Bottles of wine are 1/2 off on Mondays.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini and clams in white sauce.

nA_MF5WZofAaqmW_bJ3oMw.text: This was my and my boyfriend's first time here and our server Robert made it an excellent experience! There was really good live music, delicious drinks, and great food, and Robert made sure we were taken care of. He answered any questions we had and explained what the best dishes were. The bruschetta tasted fresh and had plenty of topping on each crostini. We weren't too excited about the baked clams appetizer, I don't think I would order it again. My boyfriend got the steak flambe and I got the scallops Florentine, and both dishes were delicious! We had to end our meal with dessert, and both the cheesecake and creme brulee definitely hit the spot. While we ate, the drummer of the band came and played on the tables and glasses, which was so fun to watch! Overall it was a great experience. We will definitely be making a trip back (but not on Tuesdays!) and hopefully Robert will be able to help us again.

R5yLBlTroq-GsWG6NsMepQ.text: This place is awesome always was. always will be. it's a little taste of New York.       old-school. good food good waitresses and waiters.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KRBA-sKoE6d6Pgp52P2QLw.text: The food here was delicious. I ordered the chicken parm and it was probably the best I've ever had. It was a good portion and so tender and juicy. The service was great and the atmosphere was awesome. There was a live band playing. The prices were a little more on the expensive side. I am use to paying 15-17 dollars for my chicken parm and it was 22 here. After taking a bite into it, it did not bother me one bit.   This place is located off the strip and you will need to make a fairly decent drive to get there. Thank goodness that Uber is so cheap out there in Vegas.  I definitely would recommend that you come here, you won't be disappointed.

4PcOVlWIZjnjQ3rTN-ecmQ.text: My husband and I dined for the first time at Casa Di Amore last night, after multiple recommendations from friends and family. It totally lived up to expectations! The food was delicious, and the atmosphere was great. We loved the old school Vegas vibe. The live music was entertaining, and it was nice to have dinner be a social experience. I can't wait to go back! We started with the prawns. They were delicious. I had the Eggplant Di Amore and my husband had chicken Marsala. Both were great. I can't wait to go back!

elZPHwIabgJDUSJ92PtejQ.text: This is one of our favorite places in Vegas. It gives you the old Vegas feeling. It is dark with classic old vegas decor & live music from the past. The service is always prompt and friendly.  Too Many dishes to write about but we have been happy every time and usually order something different each time. We do always order their cheesy garlic bread which delicious. The prices are reasonable and they are open late.

O2omJ_JlRvB2QytEwgm8VA.text: The service and atmosphere was very nice, almost 5 stars I would say! The sad part was that we had a reservation at 8pm and did not get sat until almost 9:30pm. At least there was an area in the back we could wait in, but we did not understand why there would be an outdoor tiki themed bar at an old-school Italian restaurant. Did not make much sense. I was so excited to take my family from out of town here as I heard many locals rave over it. The loud vibe was really fun and nice. The wait staff was not the best, as I had to check many times on our table and once it was already ready and they had not came to get us. The live music was really old school, but kinda crappy. I was so excited about the food as I heard amazing things. The appetizers were good, bruschetta and calamari. We then proceeded to order and our waiter told my sister that the Gypsy pasta was a 12/10 for deliciousness, not spiciness. We all eat very spicy food regularly, but the pasta she was given was not edible whatsoever and posed a risk. We asked for marinara sauce to help make it less spicy, but even with 3 cups of sauce, it was still too spicy to eat and not enjoyable whatsoever. The lasagna and cioppino were solid, not amazing. What was most disappointing was my Steak Flambe. The waiter recommended it to me and said it was his favorite dish and described it as a Steak Diane sauce, so I proceeded to order it. Everyone's food came out before mine, so I was waiting for the table side flambe service as a Steak Flambe is generally prepared. A few minutes later, I got a plate of food that looked like something a rookie eater would be served when ordering a steak at a crappy breakfast diner. The steak was cooked to my liking, but it was extremely rubbery and had no flavor. The sauce was no Diane at all, it was almost worse than a Salisbury steak sauce. Absolutely horrible for $35. The twice baked potato was horrendous, and I could have had a better one at a fast food restaurant. Same with the veggies, nothing impressive. All in all, I was extremely disappointed which really sucks because I was sooooo excited to try this place after recently moving into the area. Probably will not be back. Hopefully you have a better experience!

TCs4hoWmJR6iIgZD6Giejg.text: A staple anytime I'm in Las Vegas. Forget the strip and head here. Always fantastic food, a great bar, live entertainment with crooner singing the staples from old Las Vegas, and deserts that are made fresh and  make you wish you hadn't eaten so much of the fantastic Italian cuisine prior. If there's a wait, no worries, just walk next door and shoot at the range for a while.  All in all the best Italian in Las Vegas.

TwKRU2jobvKcvED_koA6-A.text: Another overrated Yelp restaurant. Food - 3 stars. Nothing special. Prices are very high. I would say $$$ at least. Service - 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread

NcryH52rGTPjeSO1uE-32g.text: Was looking for a family style Italian restaurant and saw the reviews so thought we'd give this place a try.  Wow, every dish was excellent and well deserving of the reviews.  I was a little concerned about getting our food on time because they had two large parties and the restaurant was packed but they were prompt delivering the food and kept checking on us.  Great service.  We had the arancini and garlic loaf as apps.  Small Cesar salad was excellent.  It's easy to mess this salad up with too much or too little dressing or just poor dressing period but the salad was well balanced and the dressing perfect.  Dinner was the osso buco, chicken piccata and chicken marsala.  All perfectly done and the chicken was moist.  About the only thing that wad just so so was the garlic loaf.  I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a family type of Italian restaurant.

crFtmjfJWyQNoNpJ6BOcPQ.text: Love this place.  Definitely call ahead with a reservation or go to opentable.  Had the zuppa d'clams with white wine. $16.  Dozen large half dollar size clams in a wonderful broth that comes with garlic bread for dipping - although their house bread is yummy for dipping as well.  My friend drank the broth like it was soup!  Also ordered the meatballs as an appetizer.  Wow.  $4 for 2 large meatballs - just slightly smaller than a tennis ball.  I asked for extra sauce to dip that yummy house bread in after my friend drank all my clam broth :/  We ordered the osso buco $42 which is always a hit.  Comes with risotto.  Can get a side salad or soup for an extra $3.  The Caesar had just the right amount of dressing.  Only thing missing was the anchovies.  Special soup today was Boston clam chowder.  My other friend used his finger to clean the cup clean.  What's with my friends and soup?!  I digress.  I ordered the penne pesto (garlic, pine nuts, basil, parmigiano-reggiano with heavy cream $22) I failed to see the page description of ONE POUND PASTA BOWL and ordered grilled chicken as an add on.  I was shocked to be warned that it was a $10 add on but wanted some protein to go with my oh-so needed carb craving so I agreed to it.  Later I found out that you can add chicken to the fettuccine alfredo for only $3 which made no sense but I didn't bring it up.  It did turn my 5 star experience to a 4 star.  My other friends ordered the linguini and clams (oth chopped and shelled clams $24.  Half the size of my penne but he could finish his pasta and I took mine home) and the rigatoni.  Server commented "excellent choice" to the rigatoni order and not to the other 3.  Didn't get the price but he ate it all.  Was on the one pound menu (emoticon with the big eyes)  I tried to look it up on their online menu but it wasn't there but I did notice that several items on their physical menu were not listed.  They also have daily specials.  Today was a grilled chicken and filet tips - both sounded fantastic.  Hopefully they'll have this on our next visit.  PERKS and FREEBIES!! free t-shirt with cannoli or creme brulee purchase. free limo service from the strip - bummer doesn't benefit us loyal and awesome locals who want to enjoy some wine with our pasta - or soup if you're my friends. lol

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso buco with risotto. $42 tender, juicy and just excellent. Could have used a bit more sauce.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne pesto. 1 lb bowl $22 - add grilled chicken $10. Delicious but a rip off! Only $3 add with fett Alfredo.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute area for live music. Gaming in background at bar.

UEVz_UvT2C2uDK9ewan7GQ.text: Every time I go to Vegas, I'm from California, I come to this Italian restaurant. It is the best in Las Vegas! It's off the strip about a mile or so, but worth the drive or cab ride. From the moment you make a reservation, to walking in the door and being greeted by the host, to meeting your waiter, the service is impeccable!   Now, for the food...I had spaghetti and meatballs. They do not skimp on the portions. I have left overs for days, or you can split a meal with someone. This spaghetti is almost identical in flavor to the spaghetti I had in Southern Italy! Sooo amazing! The meatballs aren't the best I've had, but they are great too. I absolutely adore this spaghetti because they cook the noodles to perfection! My partner got Lasagna, he loved it! My mom got chicken parmigiano, it was also delicious.   I also had a party of ten, with a reservation, we were immediately seated and served drinks. Our food came out quick, & piping hot! Our server was so nice an assertive, he always smiled and took care of every need! The manager even came over to make sure everything was perfect! Now that's service!   On top of all, they had wonderful singers, two gentleman sang some of our favorite frank Sinatra songs, and serenading a 90yo birthday girl! It was fun to watch. I just love this restaurant and everything they do!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. -Gubiotti Family

Am1M_e-q_NRili5dmyq10w.text: One of the best chicken Marsala dishes I have ever eaten!  Service was phenomenal, special thanks to our waiter, Stefan, he was amazing.  I highly recommend this restaurant and We will definitely be coming back on our next trip to Vegas.

9h1nVdCDbv1LcqL9kF4B3A.text: Awesome Italian restaurant not too far from the strip. Crowded but the wait wasn't unbearable and the live musicians created a nice ambiance. The cocktail was average (lemon drop martini) but the food was definitely the highlight.   Tip: ask for a side of hot marinara sauce (which does cost extra) to go with the complimentary bread - it's amazing! Super flavorful. Same goes for the baked lasagna with meat sauce. Hearty, filling and bursting with flavor! Consider this place to be one of Vegas' better kept secrets!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Lasagna with meat sauce!

0qP_bVSSz2rGN3LdiNKLXQ.text: Have never had a bad meal here... tonight was awesome had Roshy for our bartender and she was awesome... food was incredible and the atmosphere was even better

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3bG0Y9Aj8JykjfT3Q_j3Ng.text: classic italian red sauce restaurant. the chicken parm stood out. very las vegas. friday night was happening.

Ge_prNiBUmTguy0QsVKKlA.text: We had read reviews about this restaurant and booked it for Christmas dinner and we're so happy we did. The entire experience was one I will never forget. First they offer free limo service from your hotel you just have to call ahead of time and reserve it, then when you walk into the place it is like stepping back in time The service was great and the food was tremendous. I got the Scallops Florentine, One of my sons got the twin fillet mignon, and my other son got steak flambe. We all got the Caesar salad to go with that and everybody loved their meals. To top it off they have live entertainment with just a variety of old music and it appears they take requests. We figured this restaurant had been around since the 60s but found out it's only been around for about 13 years you wouldn't know it and it was just like old Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops Florentine
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak flambé
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twin fillet mignon

y4kQtO68LXPjbwtYgiR3YQ.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant.  It was very quaint and had a small jazz lounge appeal.  The food was good, the staff was friendly and the live music was awesome!

VwbydFfDdyAmTa2TKyUhtw.text: More like 4.5   First time I walked in here, I was a little scared that I might be walking into the Mob's headquarters. But after we were seated, boy was I charmed by this place.  There's live entertainment on the weekends (not sure about other times) and that man can sing! He knows how to work up the crowd and get people dancing. It's just a feel good environment and everyone makes you feel like family in there.   First time I came, there were 3 of us and we decided to share everything we ordered: the antipasto sampler, eggplant di amore, gnocchi alla prosciutto, and their special of the night which was a herb chicken with pasta. The food was nothing short of amazing, except for the gnocci. It was too rich for my liking. Cheese sauce plus the gnocchi, which are just potato dumplings, was just too much. But other than that, food was pretty great.  Second time, my bf and I started off with their fabulous garlic loaf. When they say fabulous, they mean FABULOUS. It was stuffed with garlicky cheese and just hot out of the oven. Delizioso! Then we had the twice wrapped prawns which had a tasty sweet walnut sauce. It was pretty good but I'd say it could use less filo dough and more prosciutto and cheese. Still not bad though. Lastly, we had the fettuccine alla pappasito and that was excellent. The sausage was spiced perfectly and there was a large helping of them. Also, usually if you split an entree, they'll charge $5, but our waiter just brought out an extra plate for us to split it at the table so the $5 charge was waived. Super nice of him!  This place has been fun times each time I came and I think there will be many more visits here. Good food, live entertainment, great restaurant!

pZ67Vpo18xYwrb5ljjsXGw.text: We took customers to Casa Di Amore tonight for dinner. Tony was our waiter and he was amazing. The food was on point and more importantly our customers had a good time..... However do not take the Limo.... The driver was RUDE... There was apparently a mix up of some kind and we were suppose to share the limo... Taking customers out we declined to "share" being late and not wanting to be a shuttle with multiple drop off's... The driver was rude and lectured us on our decision not to share... He argued with us... I still tipped him well for a 5min drive but in hindsight I would not have tipped him at all.

wOq-PpdYfgGbp2759H8VUg.text: First time here, classic Italian old school place. Apps we shared mussels, calamari and some amazing meatballs. I had the veal parm for dinner, one of the best I've had. Great place that the locals go to, and worth the trip off the strip!

hoosPpYk2pzdNSbJKxyE1g.text: First time visit, very impressed.  great crowd, live music on Saturday night, more of a neighborhood place, nice alternative to Strip.  We both ordered specials as entrees.  And the cannolis were delicious.

3qWpf2sEvVeHjKn-BgRiNA.text: Food was very good.  The waitress (Toni) sucked I think she forgot to put our  food order in.

sinKNoJq-vZmeEE6Ayue8w.text: Well yet again the reviews let me down it had so many high four and five stars that I thought this must be the absolute best Italian food ever so we went there thinking we're going to have fabulous Italian food and as it turns out it's just average the portions are very small and the plates start at $28 so just for Two Plates without drinks it was $66 you add on some drinks and an appetizer and with the tip out the door you're at $110 for two people... I eat at a lot of fine dining establishments and for the price I would not have paid more than $50 for the dinner,drinks and everything... food wasn't nasty but it certainly wasn't nearly as good as everybody said it was and the portion sizes are ridiculous vs price!!

YUB1aPQG6bPOXmVZwqqn2g.text: My husband and I were looking for an old-style Italian restaurant.  We didn't want to eat at a trendy or chain restaurant.  This is exactly what we were looking for!  It had that old charm to it-- leather seats, dimly lit, live music.  The food was amazing.  We had the calamari for an appetizer.  It was good-- we've had better.  The garlic loaf was cheesy and warm.  My husband had the eggplant and raved about it. I tried the lasagna and think it's the best I've ever had.  It was a little pricey, but still less than comparable food on the strip.  Definitely worth a try if you want to go off the strip!  But, if you're looking for a younger crowd, you won't find them here (at least when we were there).

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna

PT5B5IKrH-9W413sqEsiyA.text: Pros: Good and friendly service Free limo (I doubt otherwise the place would be popular - quite far from The Strip) Nice, home-like atmosphere  Cons: Food. Poor presentation, very average taste, absolutely nothing memorable.

81Lq6vWTZuMxsHRYqaSZ8w.text: I'm sorry , but the cheesiness of this place ruined my experience. Their only saving grace was that at least they say that their Italian-American cuisine. The old school Chicago Italian blah blah style is so overplayed that honestly nothing was exciting or new about it I.e., Italian American club, buca di beppos etc... I'm from milan, and the food was like olive gardens. Thank god I was invited otherwise I wouldn't step foot I'm the place. Fail.

gOWPo8ZfsXLEqMVMjuLYHA.text: Holy cow!! This place was amazing. We took advantage of the limo service from our hotel. The limo driver was extremely courteous and professional. This place is classic Vegas. Old school charm, delicious food...even a lounge singer. Our waiter Brad was great, made great recommendations and got everything perfect and timed just right.  I highly recommend a visit to this place whether you are a local or a tourist.

Hss3SovCJChlLr_YX0ODjQ.text: So I just left this place and I must say for starters I wasn't impressed at all. I usually don't go off the previous negative reviews but in this case I should've listened. Upon arrival we were greeted promptly which was a plus and seated right away! So far so good right? Even our waiter was very professional and customer friendly! So let's get to the food. Ordered the chicken Parmagina and Lobster ravioli dish(tonight's special) I wasn't impressed with my food by far and neither was my friend with his dish. I really have had much better Italian at places like Buca Di Peppo and Lavo inside the Palazzo has the best Italian dishes and service hands down! If it wasn't for the good service I may have rated lower but for those of you wondering about the limo? It's a JOKE! An old style limo with a driver in a cheap suit! Please.. Will not be retiring good thing open table awarded 1,000 dining points tonight :-/

IB58Z3vY0xmveZvx74z_tg.text: After a 2.5 day video game binge I realized I was hungry, at midnight, on a Sunday ...  so I set out to find some place that was a) open b) would feed me (not just get me drunk), and c) not jack in the box(or anything of the sort).  What I found, was Casa di Amore.  First, let me say that I wasn't expecting very prompt or excellent service given the time and day, but within a minute of walking in I was seated, and very shortly there after had a glass of wine. :D Clearly I was happy with the service.  The menu was quite expansive and the wine selection was very good. After ordering, the wait for the food was relatively short given the time. around 20 min if I remember right. ... WOW! the food ... damn it was good!  The atmosphere was relaxed, not too loud, and quite comfortable all around. The background music wasn't the typical Italian joint 10 song album on repeat, it had quite a bit of variation, still lounge music but at least unique, in a way.  I'll definitely be going back, likely many times. I gave it 4 stars, would have preferred 4.5 though. Only reason I didn't give it a 5 was the price of the food. It seemed everything started at $20 a plate BUT it was worth it.

CSWAq3tm_lb4jNXXitKXKA.text: My sister, nieces and BFF took me here last saturday for my 50th, and what a wonderful evening it was!   First, a limo from the restaurant picks you up from wherever u are staying free of charge, how great is that! It is an older limo but has character and sure beats a dull cab ride any time!  We had just come from seeing Jersey Boys so this added to the theme of the evening. Now you have to reserve in advance for the limo and tip the driver but totally worth it.  The restaurant is very old Vegas decor and you would expect  Sinatra to walk in any minute. So charming. And there are a few older gentlemen crooning live which adds  to the ambience.  Our waiter Brad was very knowledgeable with our food selections and had a wonderful, playful personality. Everyone in our party ordered a different entree and all agreed the food was delicious.   Our limo was waiting promptly after we dined to take us back to our hotel. I  recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants delicious Italian cuisine and an unforgettable experience.

GtUkXsVbFEzXAvzM3sx3vg.text: Delicious food, fantastic drinks, live music, incredible service... A must when you visit Vegas!!!

7HOQa7iYuq0wqrVj_g9k6w.text: Nice old school Vegas look and feel. Very small, so I recommend a reservation. I had lasagna, my friend had chicken parm, and we had the garlic loaf....everything was amazing! Another nice thing, they are open until 5am....perfect for vegas lol!

BUxLs0UKbG1dm0PM2nwBsg.text: Haven't been here in a while, and finally went today! AMAZING! They had live music, GREAT food and awesome service! A little on the pricey side, but worth every penny! Great for date night!

AGuj1_qiTpozLL2Ji72PTg.text: Old world Italian at it's finest. Screw the on-strip fancy pants joints, if you want a taste of what it's like dining in an old-school Mafia style Italian eatery, this is your joint.   Exposed brick, colored Christmas lights, live music (or singer I should say), classic Vegas photos on the wall and a more than friendly staff to ensure your experience is fantastic.   The food (in my humble opinion) was DELICIOUS, however I feel they are a bit heavy on the price tag (hence the star short of perfection). I mean, let's be real, for $19 I could make eggplant parm for an army, ha ha!   Perfect date place, dim lighting, great ambiance (as you've read in most of my reviews, ambiance is extremely important to me..makes the food taste better), and a friendly staff.   I celebrated a big birthday this year and courtesy of some pretty amazing people choosing this venue, I had the BEST time!   Check out Casa Di Amore for a swanky night out on the town with your guy or gal..totally worth the experience.

PJKcvL4xe-D2xZJPfvVKlw.text: If you like the movie Goodfellas & you enjoy authentic Italian food, you have to come here. I absolutely love this place.

fGYJGgfzdPgCE90ZFAv6yw.text: Found this amazing little place on Yelp! Used our restaurant.com gift card to get $50 off our meal as well. Great wine selection, beautiful live music, friendly atmosphere. Shout out to Michael, our server for a job well done. He took our pic, didn't rush us, explained everything thoroughly and was just a stand-up guy. As a restaurant manager, I'm pretty picky about everything when it comes to the service industry. I would hire him anyday to work in my place. Bravo!! We will definitely be back for Michael.

z4IS67y0TdUJ6dHLkYRYyQ.text: Wow! Why bother with the strip when you can go to this place? Authentic Italian food that's home made. I ordered the fried calamari, mozzarella sticks, lasagna and a side of meatballs. All of it was high quality and outstanding.

Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

uWne_rhZkEALmC8laIy3yg.text: Totally awesome place, they even picked us up from our hotel on the strip. Italian restaurant, food was great, my wife had Rib-Eye steak and I had Scallop pasta special. Old school like a place Frank Sinatra would hang out. And they put us in the front room right by the piano player who was great.

SZyfOSm9ixxVi2bwSF3A2Q.text: My fiance and I have eaten here several times and its always an amazing experience! The food is always delicious and the vibe is always calm and relaxing! and when there is a pianist; he rocks as well! Very dim lighting which makes it easier to get into that comfort zone... Their salmon dish is to die for, their pastas are tasty & the tiramisu is outrageous! Also if you buy a dessert you get a T shirt! Super cool! Must go to spot if you haven't already! Also, the Clams & Shimp scampi is pretty delightful too!

gsd766JYRkKk3WPRnaJTvQ.text: Several of my friends have recommended this place over the past couple of years and I finally got around to checking it out this past Saturday night when I had some friends in town.   The first thing you'll notice when you walk in is the ambience. It's a very cute little place and they take pride in the fact that they are reminiscent of the way Vegas used to be.   They had a small two piece band that was pretty good, not great but definitely cool to have live music.   I went with the chicken marsala that comes with pasta and added meatballs. The food was good but I also would not call it great.   Our server on the other hand, was quite possibly the best I'd ever had. It was immediately apparent that he was passionate about his job.  After our meal, the manager came over and verified that we had an enjoyable experience and I also appreciated that.   My actual review would be 3.5 stars but since that's not an option I'll round up to four because of the amazing service.   Give it a shot.

K3KIfoQJ2O5xrvZVRboMZQ.text: The scenery was good the food was delicious and the music choice was absolutely lovely. The steak was nice and tender with a great flavor. I really enjoyed it here.

r-XiOBi6T21fPXDnel_KQA.text: Beyond amazing from when you walk in to when you leave service is amazing food was beyond amazing will be going back our server suggested what we should have and it didn't fail will be date night restaurant for us

Ix_bEhNuBW8tGuLBUk3-8Q.text: Wonderful environment with special ole school vibe/theme I had a New York New York martini which was on point. As an appetizer the Prosciutto Mozzarella Crostini which was delicious and Caesar salad (wish i had some vignette). For the entree i had the Ribeye steak Florentine cooked medium well; it tasted wonderful but the cut wasn't tender enough; all in all it was a enjoyable experience and I will be back! Oh the bread with garlic spread was delicious. Lastly Kyle as a server is bomb should you be so lucky
