dJhB7o22sYkrKO1sNcxcsw.text: This is our go-to anytime we are in Vegas. It's off the strip, but not far. From the outside you would not be impressed,, but once you go in the vibe is classic old Vegas. From the live music to the red booths, it's dimly lit and romantic. It isn't quiet but it isn't so loud you can't hear each other talking. We always get the Osso Buco and it's consistently the best we've ever had. We also got the seafood special for the night which was great also. Fresh hot bread, a full bar, extensive wine list, and a good variety of desserts - along with great service - completes the experience. Robert was our server this time and he was fantastic, but every other time we have dined here we've had great service. If you're in the mood for some great Italian food while you're in Vegas, skip the fancy options on the strip and give this little joint a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Buco served on a bed of risotto... delish! Best we&#39;ve ever had!

RMNFthN6kHdO8YWUouTbDg.text: Great food,great atmosphere. Appetizers are delicious. The live singer sounded great and was very engaged with the diners. The service was quick and friendly. The drinks from the bar are cold and made with knowledge and tasted great. The menu selections are tremendous and make you want to order a couple things. It left me saying next time we come I want to try that. When the food came it was hot fresh and tasted perfect. Will go back again and again.

JfVZ1YaV6uUzBjFhdcr_Lw.text: I love this place. It's off the strip (which is a bonus in my book), they always have live music, and the food is great. We come here every time we're in Vegas. Whenever someone is looking for a Vegas restaurant recommendation, I always point them to Casa di Amore.

RdV7AXF8PiNHmSSnmUaCuQ.text: I've eaten here many times.....both soups are excellent.....  The lasagna is very good....dark brown sauce.....pork dinners are my favorite.....Frank Sinatra steak is extremely good...  Wish there were more old style restaurants like this....  Excellent service

LHIrdglr3mtjB3k6mzKo8w.text: Breaks my heart to give three stars. Been coming here since I moved to Vegas in 2007. In fact, this was the first restaurant in Vegas I went to. Back then? Great bartender, superlative steaks at a fair price, and a manager who knew my name. Who knew my wife and who appreciated big-spending return customers. And my wife and I brought family, dear friends, and clients here. Often. For years. We've spent untold thousands of dollars here over the years. But we went here for my birthday this past Friday, and right away it was different. Drinks were poorly made, subpar ingredients, and the food is clearly not at the level they were turning out even five years ago. Subpar steaks, weak apps, bland sides. What a True shame. The waiters here remain great, but even their courtesy, kindness, and professionalism couldn't make up for the marginal quality of the food. And they seem to value loud and obnoxious tourists over locals now. They didn't used to. As I say, it breaks my heart to give them a bad review because Casa was part of our Vegas life for years. Maybe it was an off night. I get that. But it didn't feel like it. This formerly locals joint has slipped. Far. Too far for us to return. What an absolute damned shame. We used to love Casa.

Jvrynl73EWvzcyZmdomzjA.text: Amazing foood, service and decor.  Love this place.

qVuswsl-FxMfvpq4Nr4BFw.text: The place is phenomenal! Portion sizes are HUGE, prices are decent, atmosphere and service are AMAZING!

1nS4w6x5PCwMhuPTR2tVNA.text: Nice stop. Open late. Live music Everyone enjoyed their meals  sure we will visit again

ukGmGLN8ryHpkgvTauXfwA.text: Great Tiki Bar on the back patio which makes this place worth the trip. Great cocktails and live music were present for all of us to enjoy! We did not have the opportunity to enjoy the cuisine but did enjoy their pizzas which were delicious! I will definitely return to try and award them their 5th star

0mGm1Qpc_lq9UiSLwABg6Q.text: We found this restaurant late at night heading home from the bar and craving some Italian food in a town with surprisingly few choices after midnight. I think we were the only table in the place. Wow, am I glad we stopped. Grandma would approve of the sauce here. Filled up on spaghetti, salad, arancini, and the best bread right from the oven. Nice bottle of red too. Excellent casual service and a great value for a really great meal in a very expensive city-

vY8_NDndi9mDqpbV6rgtNw.text: another favorite spot. My family of 4 wanted something low key for my husband's college graduation. Laid back atmosphere. We ordered the pesto 1lb penne pasta, fettuccine, small pepperoni pizza, Calamari and meatballs. Food was delicious and Service was great and they had live music at the restaurant. Monday's are half off on wine bottles. I will definitely stop by again.

d7iJTv5mpxNdTIhH_c2hRg.text: 01/05/2019 *******This neighborhood jewel is on my 'regular rotation list'.  I often take my grand daughters (4&9) here for pizza and they love it. My eldest actually chose a family dinner at Casa Di Amore as her 'birthday gift' from Grandma.  This was what she wanted because as she says: " I love that place".  So tonight we went and had the time of her life...as we left she said, "I will never forget this Grandma".  (Yep we all teared up).  From the kind efforts to seat us near the live entertainment, the Kiddie cocktails, the delicious pizza and our adult pasta choices...things just continued to get better. Happy Birthday was sang to G-daughter with smiles never fading. Wishes were shared to her from other customers.    A large wedding party came in and the Bride danced her groom then with G-daughter to celebrate both of their special days. FOOD DELICIOUS- MEMORIES PRICELESS!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bride asked her for a dance..so special.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying her &#39;kiddie cocktail&#39; and dinner.

p8KnItxGFr1Doqe-Yc7y9Q.text: This place is a hidden gem!   The restaurant itself is very elegant inside and offers live music while you're dining. A Frank Sinatra atmosphere to set the mood whether you're on a romantic date, or simply dining with friends and family. Reservations are recommended.   The food quality is excellent. My personal favorite was the Spaghetti and Meatballs and Minestrone soup. Decent size portions depending on what you order.   There is a tiki bar attached to the back of the restaurant. Per the staff, it's not opened year round. Summer is a good time to check it out. Tuesdays and Thursdays are the days to avoid as they have it closed. Unfortunately I was unable to experience it the first time I came here but hoping to go sometime soon.

axs4ryDtfSE_FQsXc9cYBw.text: Consistently the best Italian food in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is fun and very old school Las Vegas. This is the first place we bring family when they come into town because it is convenient to the airport and the strip. Order anything off the menu because quite frankly it's all great. Hours maybe a bit of a challenge as they don't open until 5, but honestly with the wait for great food that is much less expensive that the hotels and great service as well. This will continue to be our go to place for great Italian!

1Lska-kVIzmFG1BBH0iqzA.text: Not only was the food excellent, the atmosphere was great! The service was amazing!! I couldn't of asked for a better place to take to take an out of state guest for a great meal and casual entertainment!

oKiRmvVbdgc8D1oGY212Xg.text: What a great little gem.  Wanted to find a place with live music and great food.  The musician they had was perfect, love the old Vegas vibe.

3i6YlkKVro4lbeFNi2lD9A.text: We came here on a Saturday night.  I booked the limo expecting to have to share it.  Limo driver shows up on time.  No shared ride, he took us directly to the restaurant.  Nice limo too.  Bonus.  The place smells good when you come in.  We waited for our table at the bar.  My GF hit four of a kind on a VP machine and won over $200.00.  Nice way to start the evening. $$$  Really, this place is awesome.  From the drinks, the food, the live music, and service.  I had the Veal Parmesan.  It was terrific.  GF had the Lobster Ravioli, #2 Daughter had the Cioppino.  We shared the Fried Calamari and a Antipasto Salad.  There was so much food!  Perfect old Vegas style without being cheesy.  Take the one you love to Casa Di Amore.  It's a classy move.  We'd go back in a minute.  Loved this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge Antipasto Salad!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good calamari.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Video porker at the bar.  We won!

DVDdTMZXrpWrqQgFqSwCug.text: I came here on the recommendation of people I know that have said this place was awesome and a great date night place to go to...but sadly my experience sucked i made a reservation for 730 it took around 30-45 min to get seated even after making a reservation a week ahead, the place was super loud with the live Music which made it hard to try and hold a conversation with my wife but I should of done my research on that part so that was on me. The food was okay my wife liked hers a lot, as for me the linguine with clams was ehhh..hopefully this was just a bad first experience and later if we ever go here again it mate turn into a great one but as for now it wasn't the romantic outing I hoped for or planned for

G616IbbbegBY3OGsSH1Msw.text: My family came here for the first time, everything was great about this place. Seriously can't complain..  will definitely be back!! Our kids even enjoyed it :)

8mLVgsjvR3TNZotx_N2--w.text: I've never left a restaurant before...in fact I don't think i've ever felt the need to leave a review before. But as I write this we are sick in our hotel room with wicked food poisoning. We ordered the calamari, stuffed clams and penne in vodka sauce. We didn't wait for the penne. We sent back the food and left. The calamari was so greasy and it came out brown instead of the usual golden color you would expect. The cuts were too thick as if the squid that they used were larger squids for stuffing. The stuffed clams were little cherrystones that tasted more like uncooked breadcrumbs than actual stuffed clams. The ones i've bought frozen at Vons are at least edible. These were gross. The food poisoning most likely came from the calamari since my wife didn't touch clams. In the process of writing this she's been back to the bathroom 3x to hug the bowl. Great way to spend a weekend.

eQ5MeC7lGzmb1_Y9u90S7w.text: Delicious! Off the strip but well worth going to. One of the best meatballs i've had. The bread is delicious, freshly baked! Friendly staff. Definitely going back on my next Vegas run.

joTOqg_QmdLla8Zn1L7BYA.text: We went here for dinner as a group because someone had heard about the restaurant and knew the owner. It is a few miles from the strip, so normally we would never go here. They will send a van/bus for free to pick you up and return you to your hotel if you request it. Just tip the driver! The food was very good and we all had different dishes. Spaghetti and meatballs were excellent and the scallops au gratin were great too. My wife had a chicken dish (don't remember the name) but it was very tender. The dessert cannolis were great. We had a fun time and would definitely recommend going off-strip to give it a try!

l_7X3C05PdpzHbG978sPmg.text: We went to Casa Di Amore on Christmas Eve for dinner. There was a mistake with the complimentary shuttle we reserved, but the restaurant paid for our cab, which was much appreciated. The restaurant was very busy with live music both inside the restaurant as well as at the outdoor tiki bar. We were able to grab a couple seats at the inside bar while we waited for our table and had two excellent cocktails; better yet, they were comped when you play the poker machines. We got seated a bit later than our reservation time, but the food was well worth the wait. I had the veal francaise and my mom had the veal cannelloni; both were excellent! We probably could've split the cannelloni, so if you don't have a big appetite, I'd recommend splitting that and maybe getting an appetizer. This was our second time at Casa Di Amore in two months and I'll go back every time I'm in Vegas. It's a cool old school place with good service and even better food; I totally recommend it.

l2OCnF9HOIfEmaIVprQMuQ.text: This is more of a 4.5 star review. I took my mom here on Christmas Day for a wonderful dinner. The service was friendly and prompt, and the food was delicious. The live music and ambience were great. This would be a five star review aside from the Negroni I ordered being watered down - I could barely taste the Campari! Either way, I strongly recommend and I would visit again.

cTalLRvg7QCOpJ2vQoaPAw.text: The food was very good. The service excellent. Very friendly staff. Music was kept low but romantic

CKoVc4rGUUva65vuRFqPRA.text: Highly dissappointed. Restaurant was too busy so we ate at the bar because staff said there is a "bar menu that has some items from the regular menu." Fine by me. I ordered a build your own pasta for 20 bucks which was basically a scam dish. For 20 bucks the bowl was the size of a appetizer bowl really. It had probably about 1.5 cups of noodles and 2 meatballs. This was absolutely ridiculous for the price!!! Needless to say we left mad and hungry. I looked at the menu for regular dining and prices are way higher...im sure the dish may be a Little bigger -Hopefully! Couldnt even get bread at an italian bar for the price! Sadly wont be back to even try the full on restaurant. This dish needs to be lower in price especially for the bar.

DWbDNWTkskssdOb8PF2DKA.text: We had the car pick us up from the Mirage. The driver, Oscar was very friendly. We are here on a Monday night and drank a bottle of Valpoli Allegria. Can't beat 1/2 price bottles. Husband had the Osso Buco Veal. It was so tender you could cut it with a fork, delicious too. I had the Gnocchi Proscuitto. Yummy! It was fantastic. We will definitely return on our next visit.  The band was great, food was great, our waiter, Steph was exceptional. Thank you for making our 20 year anniversary memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi prosciutto
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Veal.

Pd_RMewveqfbdXP1kjGspA.text: Food was awesome. Not your basic steak potatoes and veggies. Flavor for miles. Service was great. Todd was a great help with suggestions and wrapped my meal to go. It was a new experience and we'll delivered. Thanks guys

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XBt0FbCptCt5IFJ4xgVVzA.text: Their new outside Tiki Bar just opened and it is fabulous~ great decor~  cozy atmosphere and you can even hear the live music coming from inside through their large open window. Nice!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There&#39;s a lot more to see than what this picture shows come on down and check it out

FKkwkA9-uI2Oj1_RFYvNxg.text: Come for the live entertainment! Great singers while we visited late at night. They also offer a limo pick up from your hotel if you reserve in advance.  The food unfortunately was JUST ok. Ravioli is oversized and a little doughy, but tasty. Order in the blush/vodka sauce which is better than the Alfredo. We tried both.  Caprese was disappointing. The tomatoes looked like they were winter tomatoes (pale!!!) not summer tomatoes (red!!!). Not sure why since we came in the middle of June and this place is in Vegas.  The lasagna was 100% mushy in each layer and was unappetizing. We had to send this back sadly. Also disappointing since this is a very popular dish and we would expect for it to be spot on!  Atmosphere here is divey, dark, and a little tacky with colorful lights near the bar. It seemed like they have gimmicks to get you in and have a great time (wonderful music, limo ride) but the food is just ok.  Service was excellent. Our server took care of us and didn't hassle us about the lasagna. They were packed on a late weekday night and getting our food took a while.

tvtzTTgu_Gfz0VgGA0zEpQ.text: We ate here 12/23/18. Started with Osso Buco appertizer which was O.K. I had a strange Clam Chowder made with a fish broth instead of cream, it was different, but O.K. The veal Parm was not crunchy, maybe they just baked it instead of frying it first. It was O.K. I had spumoni for desert and it was not ice cream, but gilarto. It was not O.K. For $170 a meal should not be just O.K.

c8jG03DrJSlljWyUxox4GQ.text: We stopped by on a Sunday evening for dinner. I'll get straight to the point, the four and a half stars are well-deserved. If you aren't too worried about price and want some delicious Italian food, just go.   It was a little busy and we didn't have a reservation, but luckily they had an open table for us. The ambiance feels very old school and cozy. It's a popular spot for visitors, but the service was still quite good.  We ordered Linguini Luciano and Gnocchi. Both dishes were very very good. Some of the best Italian food I've had in Vegas.  It does come at a price though. Expect to spend a little more than you would at Olive Garden.

2JJF4G3KknutpSi6iVECQQ.text: The atmosphere is very old school Las Vegas.  The live entertainment is fun. The food has always been great.  I have been going to Casa Di Amore for 14 years.  It is one of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas.

kLn8NeHTPb9O-30pwHNssA.text: restaurant is going downhill beyond I wish I never came is messed up my birthday first of all every time I come here its jam packed to the ceiling and I don't know why the food is not all that great but now it's even terrible not even edible restaurant is not calm and nice it is haywire nervous racket I ordered the shrimp and spaghetti spaghetti was overcooked they hardly put any sauce on the spaghetti I had to ask for more sauce which they charge more money and the sauce what they called gypsy sauce was burnt it was burnt to the max I had stomach pains as I was eating it you're not supposed to eat burnt sauce had the antipasto salad and it was good before but now it was just water so that they did not put any dressing if they did all I tasted was vinegar and water I had to ask for more dressing which I was surprised they did not charge me for the dressing their so called complementary bread is burnt and hard as a rock had a terrible time terrible experience left with a stomach ache and heart pounding and we got a free limo ride which I was embarrassed to Ride in it is a piece of junk it was dented and there was no interior lighting or nothing I never seen a limousine with no interior lights like neon lights and we was with other people in the limousine which was not right and we did not even finish our dessert and they drove us out to go to the limousine cuz those other couple waiting overpriced crappy burnt food and too nervous restaurant besides that our waiter was good but I wish I would have spent my birthday somewhere else and I wish I woulda took my car instead of taking the rundown limousine I will not go back in that limousine if they paid me . . I am very upset i did not finish eating my food . Owner came to me and said there is people waiting for you in the limo. So thanks casa di amore for  giving me a stomach ach and heart attack  and for not letting me finish  my food to go back in your run down limo .

a7v__Coo5LA-8ahLJq2FUg.text: I went to Casa di Amore, or as I like to call it, "Casa di A... MORE PLEASE!" with my friends Pat, Kohl, Nick, Gilburt, Yabo, Mensah, Shawn, and Masoli. Our waitress was a quick-wristed, Italian woman called Guiseppe. Masoli organized the dinner, so he put a lot of pressure on everyone at the table to order foods that rhyme with his name. Unfortunately, this limited us to ravioli and cannolis. The live music was incredible, although some of the lyrics were a little bit different from what I remembered (e.g. "when the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie that's Masoli"). The women there were much nicer than most women. Instead of getting angry when I asked them questions on their way to the bathroom, they just ignored me. Guiseppe gave me a cannoli even though I didn't order one. In Italy, this means a woman is in love with you. "Cannoli" literally translates to "little tube". The suggestion was obvious; she wanted a little tube in return. I decided I couldn't reciprocate the gesture when I saw Guiseppe offering cannolis to literally everyone. Casa di Amore:  Masoli, ravioli, cannoli

dCssuLctCmNfRD26XK0J9A.text: After driving by for ages, we finally tried it. It rocks in it's own way. This is your parents ( or grand parents) Italian restaurant. It has an old school, casual feel. It is loud and fun. The room is lined with pics of old Vegas. They have comfy booths, a bar in back, live music and all the usual red sauce type food along with a few unexpected items on a good sized menu. I had the Eggplant Di Amore which is similar to Lasagna and a side of meat balls. My partner had the Chicken Marsala. the food was very good. The Meatballs were fantastic. Casa Di Amore is going to be my new meatball fix spot. Our waitress was excellent, very friendly and helpful with all of our questions. All in all it was a fun lively night with good food and service. I will return soon.

FlXesShXT3U10I0L1m_HsA.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. One would never guess how awesome this pace is by looking at just the exterior. It looks like a hole in the wall joint, but once you get inside, its a cozy traditional NYC italian atmosphere. Our server, Stephan, was great. My husband and I moved to Las Vegas from Chicago, and we've been very unimpressed by the service in this city. Stephan was a breath of fresh air. The food was fantastic. I'm a New York Italian, and my husband has worked with traditional Italian circuses, and we were very impressed. This place has so may specials (half price bottles of wine, half price pizzas and cocktails) and it's open and serving until 5am to boot!!! This place has now become our favorite hang out in Las Vegas. I would recommend it to anyone, and dare them to not fall in love.

0_VfvR_ZjsdU9-j1DcjUaA.text: We had a wonderful experience. The limo arrived on time (and it really was a limo). The driver, Oscar, was very courteous and helpful.  The restaurant was very much like an Italian restaurant you may have gone to during the Brat Pack era. Our server, Tony, was excellent. He helped us order our wine and food. The Bruschetta was to die for!  I had the Eggplant Di Amore which was heavenly.  Live music (not some DJ ) made the night that much more special.  Heartily recommend this place!

tlVbgKND5ce0XFHYq7kghA.text: Amazing restaurant. Amazing food. Amazing entertainment. Amazing ambiance. I would highly recommend anyone to visit casa di amore. It's so beautiful and intimate. Very old vegas

rBU4rY1lx7h02cfFoIT4Yw.text: We had Christmas dinner at Casa di Amore and loved it! It was so nice to get off the strip and enjoy truly good food in a nice environment. My steak was absolutely phenomenal - perfectly prepared and served with a delicious peppery sauce. My fiance's linguine and clams was also very good. We had the tiramisu for dessert - delicious. Adding to the great food was the attentive service, unique atmosphere and very enjoyable live music. I would absolutely go back here on our next trip to Vegas and highly recommend it for anyone looking to get off the strip and enjoy a more local dining experience.

tq3_5LClhEJ-5b166zfnwA.text: Everything is amazing! The staff are kind and very accommodating. Food in unreal! This is our anniversary spot!

MbMsgn5kpeO-XxmWcagvpQ.text: This place was awesome! If you want an old Vegas experience go here!  Italian-American food that was very good, good portions and reasonably priced.  Our server Toni was so nice, friendly and made our experience there worthwhile.  The performer (George Bugatti) sounded just like Sinatra (if you closed your eyes, you would swear it was really him).  It was nice to go somewhere off the strip and have it give you the Vegas feeling.  They even have a limo (free w/ tip) to come and get you and bring you back if you want.  You get a free t-shirt if you order the creme brulee or cannoli for dessert - which we did. There were quite a few birthdays/anniversaries that were being celebrated.  I would highly recommend it and will make it a point to go back when I return.  One last thing - there was a lieutenant in the air force who was being deployed next week there with his family.  The restaurant must have been notified about it b/c they announced it and everyone clapped for him.  They comped his dinner which was extremely classy in my book!

nc2iQFdDNO_10rbftdXnPQ.text: When we arrived, it was around 1 am. You have to ring a doorbell to be allowed into the building, which could be either entertaining or annoying depending on your disposition. Once inside, there's a bar area and then a restaurant right past it. The walls are decorated with photos of old Vegas's hey day, with Frank Sinatra, the Flamingo, the Sands and other old locales pictured. It's pretty cool, and during their earlier hours they have live entertainment performing.  After midnight they have a special on their bar menu, 1/2 off on all the food. It's basic appetizers and sandwiches, like wings, chicken fingers, sandwiches and pizza. They also have 1/2 off wine on Sundays and Mondays, which we took advantage of while we were there. Their full restaurant menu is also available, so it's worth checking out.    We started out with a half price bottle of wine that was suggested by our server. It was a good choice, with low-acidity and a robust, smooth fruity flavor that beautifully compliments a variety of meals. We enjoyed it, savouring a glass each throughout our meal and bringing the rest home. It's a really nice deal! Worth going on a slow day to take advantage of that fact.   Matt, our server, was pleasant and performed a polite demonstration of table service with our wine. He handled the front of house aspect very well considering how busy he was, going back and forth from the restaurant area and the bar.   Our meal started with a bread basket with butter and then the caprese salad. The bread had a crisp exterior with a softer interior and was good with the butter. Not baked on premises, I'm guessing- more likely from the Great Buns bakery down the street, because we were given a loaf later and it was completely identical to the first, a signature of mass manufacturing. I didn't eat too much of it, though, because I didn't want to fill up on starch. As far as the caprese, the tomatoes were mushy and largely flavorless; mealy and obviously refrigerated. I understand the necessity of doing so, but in a dish like caprese salad, comprised solely of the tomatoes, mozzarella, basil & olive oil, it's imperative that the ingredients be Truely flavorful. It was mild & a bit mediocre. We ate it, but it wasn't really worth getting excited over.  We then had the Osso Bucco, or slow-roasted veal shank in a tomato based sauce, with a side of risotto. I immediately noticed that the risotto was REALLY dry and crumbly. Because of the sauciness of the osso bucco, it worked out well enough for me to eat a small portion of the meal, but I wasn't particularly impressed. On the menu they brag that the meat is so tender a knife isn't needed, but I used one. There are tendon pieces, or tougher ligaments that need it on the outer portion of the meat but the interior it IS indeed very tender.   This is a restaurant with potential, though it failed to meet my expectations. My boyfriend and I shared our meal and we had enough leftover for our lunches today.   I may come back to enjoy their half priced wine and chicken wings. It seemed the bar had a very boisterous clientele, so maybe that's the place to be at the time of night we were being served.  We took most of our meal to go. I asked about how dry the risotto was, so the server promised it would be rehydrated for me to take home. Upon reheating for lunch it was still crumbly and dry, though perhaps slightly better. Our server gave us a loaf of free bread to take home with our leftovers, which was a nice touch.

LWCJyT0-TTlCFipRxpB-yA.text: Can't say enough about this place.  Had dinner here on 5/11/13, and it was wonderful. Try the Cioppino, it is Excellent.

WRPtmJRVP_3_PJWMjbhF_Q.text: This place is totally Vegas. Food is wonderful. The atmosphere is old Vegas. The complimentary limo is a bonus. We frequent this joint every time we get a chance when visiting Vegas which is often. There's always a lounge singer which feels oh so Vegas.

S-qdf2T5PnCvpVjMZvTpdg.text: This is my most favorite restaurant here in Las Vegas. I love the ambiance and love the food! Staff is pretty good gets really crowded at night so I suggest making reservations.. I suggest stating with the Bruschetta and the caprice.. really delicious! And for the entree i would order their version of a spinach tortillini or their chicken parmesian.. their pizza arent bad either all very good. prices, may be a little pricey but well worth it.. They also have a live band in the evening you may want to call them and ask. I highly sugget this place if you want to relax and enjoy an italian style ambiance with good food. only downside is it is located in the horrible neighborhood just make sure you park your car in a well lighted area..

BBH2Zclb5XCUZalHt-wISg.text: Went out on Yelp and read the reviews. Went to setup a reservation through Yelp and the earliest we could get a reservation was 2 hours out. Called the restaurant and they confirmed they could take us with in 1 hour. Of course, we opted for the 1 hour. Our party was eight people.  The staff was lovely as well as the food. The portions were large and we were able to split meals between two people. The staff was okay with the splitting of meals and continued to give us great service.  The atmosphere reminded me of old style Las Vegas of the 60s and 70s. Tables were set in such a way you felt like you had your own space and were not sitting on top of others. The booths were in the old style as well. The entertainer for the night sang mostly Sinatra and Martin songs. He did an an outstanding job.  The next time I am in Vegas, I will be eating here again.

x9qN160W4oRqxSLmxtO1gw.text: Been wanting to try this place for quite awhile and finally got the chance while my parents were visiting for the holidays.  Everything about our experience was incredible...starting and ending with our awesome waiter, Brad.  He took care of us from the moment we sat down and at every step along the way....we will definitely be requesting him for our [many] future visits.  Everyone at the table enjoyed all items that were ordered, starting with a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc, followed by an appetizer of mushrooms and followed by 4 very different meals; ranging from eggplant to salmon to chicken to veal.  The portions were huge but our take home containers were surprisingly light.  Whether you are a local or a visitor, you won't be sorry with a visit to Casa Di Amore!

Twx5ReBGl8H7CLPrXjo0ng.text: Like going back in time.  This is The real Vegas Paul and Randy style!  The veal Marsala, cioppino, and antipasto were legit.  Loved everything about this restaurant.

DFhXFUYmCbjhmxh2Z4BuVA.text: Went here the other night with three others after finding it on Yelp, we all loved it!  We were picked up by the free limo service, on time, and taken to the restaurant.  Great vibe and energy in the restaurant, and the chicken parmasean was one of the best I've ever had.  This place is so much better than just about all of the overpriced places on the strip.  Some of them are worth it, but if you're in town for a weekend, I'd definitely mix in this old school place one of the nights.  Only thing I didn't really care for was the canole; the creme brule was amazing though.

nDelNWVvITGVshF6jljOyg.text: We loved this place!  The atmosphere, service, food, and free limo were perfect. I highly recommend the basil Bloody Mary.

9AgtiA4Xiv3a92tkPBTijw.text: Food was good.  I wouldn't say it is fine cuisine, but it was good.  Basically just good down home cooking. The reason this place is so cool is what I would call the ambience and the old Vegas feel to it.  I would definitely come back for the experience and bring some out of town guests to see an old Vegas feel and what seems more like a locals place.

ge_gxS8wFTxETkwqwBu6sA.text: This is my favorite restaurant I've eaten at by far. The food is amazing and the decor and friendly people make it a great experience.

iO8mVID95e9pk_NpIV2D2w.text: Had dinner here on a Saturday night. Great food, great music, great atmosphere. I had the gnocchi with meat sauce and it was delicious. The jazz duo played a lot of great standards. It has an old time Vegas feel to it.

iTwptI-cie1-FrisqJUnOQ.text: Food is always delicious. Get the eggplant di amore and you won't be disappointed! There is plenty to share with enough to take more home.  Ambiance is spectacular. It's always noisy and fun. There is a nightly house band that plays anything from Sinatra to Fats Domino- so much fun!!!   You will likely wait, even if you have a reservation. Just knock the chip off your shoulder and enjoy. It can be about 45 minutes because the place is packed and no one wants to leave their table.  I've never had a good experience with the limo service. You will probably wait about 1 hour for your return ride, so be sure to request the limo long before you order dessert or request the check. The limos are old and the driver doesn't adjust heat or AC so you'll probably be uncomfortable.

P-kgHIWO5uwmb3IzmzSJeg.text: I am a vegas local born an raised and I was driving by this place a few years back.  Their are a few other Italian restaurants in town that have gotten rave reviews but as far as I am concerned, this is one of if not the best places for Italian food in Las Vegas.  The food is always cooked fresh and is very good.  They also bake their own bread.      I almost always sit at the bar in the back and gamble and drink.  Service at the bar, or if you decide to dine in, is always phenominal.  Keep in mind it is a small dining area and bar, however, it is well worth the wait.  I honestly have no bad reviews on anything.  Food, service, gaming, etc.      I will be trying a few places around town to compare and will write a follow up about a week or two from now.  If you are from out of town I would highly suggest this place for your Italian fix.

YKqoGV4irLJdhN0Du1Wbyw.text: This is our favorite restaurant in town. When we have to entertain people from out of town or have a special occasion or just a date night, this is our place. We celebrated our engagement here.   Do yourself a favor and eat the stuffed pork chops here before you die. The best I have ever had. They have a great wine selection. The family and friendly environment adds to the quality of this place.   You can not go wrong. The prices atmosphere and lets not forget the amazing food have this place right up there with the best of Las Vegas. Sure it's not the most expensive, rare, or trendy place in Vegas, but who the hell wants all of that all of the time?

T5au8_KFzQD9K237xrk1Cg.text: Definately a place that is a little cheesy and has the Cliche of what one would expect from Italian food in Las Vegas. However the food is very good and the service is very strong. A great date place for people that don't take themselves seriously and wan't to have fun. The Steak Flambe was very good and the Chicken Picatta my friend had was good as well.

g21PKBj3xzYDFnL_laGYeQ.text: This is the real deal! Old Vegas. Wonderful homemade Italian cuisine. The live music is wonderful (thanks George!) with the sounds of the 50's. But if there is a request, they will do their best. We were celebrating my granddaughters 21st birthday and I was afraid that this place wasn't to her liking but she said she loved it! Not a big restaurant so be sure to make a reservation. A bit noisy but lively. The service was incredible. A little pricy but for the experience, it was well worth it. They also will pick you up in a limo and take you back to your hotel, complementary. I was told they are closing down next week for remodeling but will reopen with wonderful changes. I can't wait to go back. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because they picked us up in a new red van rather than a limo. When I told my waiter I was disappointed, he made sure we went back in the limo. The food.....amazing!

puQr-vGC7-v8Z7dlmxSaUw.text: My husband and I went because we wanted to get off the strip (i.e. lower prices for a 4 day trip!) and enjoy some delish Italian food.   Casa di Amore is your spot - they offer to pick you up in a limo and then you take a step back in time.   We ordered the chicken parm & it was amazing - must order whenever you go to this restaurant! It is the perfect combo of chicken, cheese and sauce. yummm :)  Also, their drinks are very reasonable at about $8 each. If you are a bit of a wine snob, you may want to bring your own bottle and pay the super reasonable corkage. :)  All in all, great experience & would highly recommend!

LmIqH5val8cZX6xYeq_3EA.text: Brad was the best server ever! ****We are from SF California and were not expecting an exceptional server on a Thursday night in LAS VEGAS. He went above and beyond our expectations. Not only did he cater to our specific needs but maintained an upbeat spirit throughout the process. Thank you BRAD! You rocked!

ZqaPfSEFTF5qtLVJtf_SLg.text: This Was A Great Restaurant It Looked Elegant And It Had Live Music Came Here To Celebrate My 6 Month Anniversary With My Girl And We Loved It. The Waiter We Got Was Really Nice With Us Ad Helped Us Pick Out What To Eat.

lfy_iLuE2Ihql8m77xv53A.text: We go there every time we go to Vegas and once we went on valentine day great food and very friendly staff this would be the fifth time in three years

2LuvxbYJdOj6QQXXOPrd0g.text: Old school Vegas at it's best.  This place is arguably the best Italian food in town.  I had the Eggplant de Amore with a side of meatballs.  Both were perfectly cooked and incredible.  It's a bit pricey, but well worth it for a special night out.

paQBg3SusZj4MsNTENnx9Q.text: The food was awesome!!! The decore is of "old Vegas"  aka frank Sinatra you can definitely see some of the rat pack ratting here!! I had the stuffed chops two 8oz delicious

JOXKb-VVi6bLDnX4Veq62A.text: Not quite 5 stars, but neither is it 4 stars. I agree with Dad on this one: 4.5 (Unfortunately, I can't give half stars). But since everybody else LOVES this place, I'll bump it up to 5 instead of giving it 4 stars (this one's for you Dad, since I just rated the Buffet at the Bellagio for Mom).  A limo from the restaurant came to pick us up at 7:25 PM for our reservations at 7:45 PM. Dad said the limo was complimentary... I have no idea. Dad did the research and made the reservations- I just tag along and eat.  GARLIC LOAF: Loaf of homemade bread sliced and stuffed with garlic, Italian seasonings, mozzarella and parmesan cheese. It was VERY good, albeit a little salty/garlic-y. And maybe a little too cheesy. But still delicious.  OSSO BUCO: It literally is fall-off-the-bone good as the restaurant claims. Not too salty (which is a big thing for me). But the shank is HUGE.  PORK CHOPS SICILIAN: I think Dad ordered this. Two 8 oz pork chops served with potatoes and vegetables. Definitely a man's meal.  CIOPPINO: Very tasty dish comprised of fresh seafood including: lobster, clams, mussels, scallops, crab, cod, and shrimp. The soup part goes very well with bread (but I'm trying to lay off the carbs). I'm pretty sure Dad enjoyed it, though. He claimed he was stuffed, but kept dipping bread into the soup.  Dad also ordered a side of meatballs, which I heard were pretty good, too. There's just a little bit of spice in it to add a little kick, according to the waitress.  The waitress was extremely friendly, and there was live entertainment. Unfortunately, we had no room for dessert. Definitely next time, especially since they're open until 5 AM!

49mF2gknI5N2ipqUP5Bx9A.text: Went here for my wedding as the last time I had reservations I ended up leaving because the host didn't know what she was doing. Party of 15 great live music great wait staff. They made it real easy on us. Normally I come here for the food. It's normally very good. They changed a lot of the items to cut corners. The clams that people rave about are now 1/3 of the size. The portions are half of what they are normally and seems like the quality is down. Bad food good service and atmosphere. I most likely won't go back as the last 2 times were pretty bad.

mxX9H7H3pDYnD8CZl2HqsQ.text: Okay so me and my husband dine out a lot and when we dine out  we expect a nice experience.  I was very excited to try this place since it had such great reviews however my excitement went to pure disappointment when I walked in and they sat us at a small tiny ass table right in the middle of the walkway with people bumping into me  and every staff member walking right past us for 15 minutes not even asking us if we want anything to drink,  this table was obviously on the pay no mind list Now normally I'm a nice person I try not to get to diva but this table was actually really ridiculous,   ok enough about that so I went up to the manager and I said to him do you have a different tableabd within I want to say 10 minutes 15 minutes he had a different table for us which was great he was also taken care of also at the end of the night.   Other than the whole table issue everything else was pretty much okay the atmosphere was really nice the food was okay not the best I've ever had but it was good.  I think this place is more interested in catering to larger parties  then a small bill for two people which is understandable that they going to make more money on a larger party then they are two people I get it but still we are paying customers so we should be just as important.  Um I'm not sure I'll come back maybe I will but at least I can scratch this one off my bucket list.  Oh and by the way I never got my free t-shirt with my cannoli purchase so for that reason I'm taking another star off.

KfVnj00uj_N-U-I6Tfvx1Q.text: this place is off the beaten path and very unassuming in the strip mall area, but we had so much fun here, that it is worth the trip.  The wner is entertaining, he plays instruments, sings to everyone and keeps the atmosphere very upbeat and fun.  We came with a big group from work and we were all apprehensive about the appearance and the location, but were we surprised.  The waiters were terrific, the place was filled with locals and the decor is that old school rat pack, Vegas as it used to be style, its really nicely done.  I had the veal. Tammy the linguine & clams, we both shared and the food was great, portions were huge and the rest of the people we were with all had the same compliments.  The drinks were healthy and the wine list, although limited, was sufficient and well thought out.  This is the type of fun place, that the owner should be proud to own and as a patron, i was glad we were lucky enough to go in here.  I will definitely be back again and again and if we laugh 1/2 as much next time as we did last time, then it will be 2wice as much as we would have expected anywhere else.  I could go on and on about this place, the food, the music, the fun, the people, the service, the friendliness and spirit - were a perfect combination and even as i finish this review, i wish i were there.

n7w4nNVW4INwH_KTinRu5w.text: My friends and I went to Vegas for a girls' weekend.   We had one night where we were going to splurge on dinner, so we wanted the second night to be more low key and less expensive.  I did a search on Yelp and found Casa di Amore and decided to try it.  As someone who grew up in Vegas, I really don't expect much of places that are "off the Strip", but I will definitely be going back here!  First of all, the fact they have FREE limo service (although they do suggest you tip $5 per person per way) to and from the restaurant is awesome.  Granted, the limos look like they stepped out of 1992.... do they even make maroon limos anymore???  Our driver was really nice though, and impressed us at his ability to maneuver the traffic even though he was, shall we say, a mature old chap. :)    The restaurant is this cute little brick building and seems a bit out of place on the street.  Inside, it is reminiscent of something you would find out of "The Godfather" (minus the guns and shooting).    Ahhh,.... the food was SOOOO good.  We had to place a second order of the bruschetta - it was the best I've ever had.  We decided to order family style since there were five of us, and I'm glad we did because the portions were huge.  We got three dishes - the clam linguine, eggplant parmesan and I can't remember the third... but all were amazing.  Seriously - I highly recommend trying this place out.  It is a small joint so definitely make reservations before hand.  Also, allow plenty of time if you decide to use the limo.  We had tickets to see a show afterward and our limo driver ended up leaving to take someone else back to their hotel... we had to wait for twenty minutes for him to come back and barely made it to our show in time.  But our tummies were happy so we didn't complain too much. ;)  This place is definitely old Vegas in a good way, and worth a trip to try it out!

TEQn8mmaBi3QgQMgeifikA.text: Continues to remain my absolute favorite restaurant in Vegas!!! I wish there was a way to give this place more than five stars because they deserve an extra five . Have yet to have a mediocre dish. :) MMMM

xDNZ0IRHl0Qv-xf4p1cTDg.text: Old Vegas charm with delicious food.  The dining room was filled to capacity. The staff was both friendly and helpful..  We were asked iff we were celebrating anything. The waiter would request a song from the musical duo . I  ordered the scallops in a cheese and mushroom sauce served with twice baked potato and broccoli.  The other entree shrimp spicy tomato linguine.  The bread is served warm and with herb butter.  The waiter took care of the  dessert, cannoli and cheesecake.  Perfect

tHSkgpIF99kbcEpa1sCgdg.text: My wife and I went there last night sept 27 2015 for dinner. As soon as I walked in I loved it. It's an old school feel and vibe with very friendly staff. Great live music. We talked with other tables. And the food was unreal. What a great experience. Coming from Boston and growing up with Italian food I can honestly say when in Las Vegas go here!

-eWM09_2UeSxx4M5nSep8A.text: Amazing best bread and Stephen is the best waiter ever!  The pasta, steak and atmosphere is super!

jxiWqB20wkKZbagqjPQF5w.text: This was the first time I ate out on Easter, instead of cooking.  What a nice change!  My family enjoyed the live music.  The waiter was really pleasant and professional.  The food was excellent.  Chicken Marsala, calamari, osso bucco was so tender it fell right off the bone, and what flavor!!  Yum.  I think I can make eating out for Easter a thing now.  Tonight we ordered dinner to go.  Stromboli, I heard my husband order this over the phone.  "Ok I'll have that, and that, and that too".  Pepperoni, veggie, and sausage.  It was a hit, my sons gobbled them up.  What a great find; great food, great service, and entertainment.  I'll miss this place when I leave Vegas, but I'll be back again!!

hrDNZTuS7ePRbDe1eBWx3w.text: I can't say enough about the good vibes, good service, good entertainment and good food over at Casa Di Amore. I've been in several times over the years and it's always a great experience. I dined there with out of towner family and none of them had been there before. The common thought was that it reminded them of old school Las Vegas. I arrived a few minutes early and our table was put together even before our actual reservation time. Our server was accommodating and helpful guiding us through the menu and he even put up with an indecisive 9 year old. Whether it's a date night or an upscale old Vegas family outing, I highly recommend checking this hidden Las Vegas gem out.

UAcO4AqVUoRIEnkR8Ep0iw.text: This was my 5th time here and my friends 1st and we both love it!!! Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious.  The gypsy pasta was perfectly spiced  The Cioppino seafood stew was the best we ever had  The pork chops were cooked to perfection   Pizza and Alfredo was also spectacular  With a friendly and classic environment and the staff on top of everything this place is a must go

zaO8Rv1aNkFp_u6gVmbb3A.text: Such an amazing hidden gem! The front is super classy and romantic. But then the back patio is such a nice reminder of the island style of back home. The pizza was delicious and half off! We will DEFINITELY be back soon. Check out Bounce and Lady Reiko on Monday nights to get your week started off right!

NMDE-rtoP2lCvjWlRMkxHg.text: First time ever at Casa de Amore and we tried it during the biggest celebration of the year, New Year's Eve 2017! The place did not disappoint. From the moment they greet you on your arrival to the time that they seat you & take your order and serve, it's a smooth and seem less process. Our host, Tony took very well care of us and gave us recommendations that were superb. We were personally visited, at our table, by the manager, Smith who checked up on is and gave us complimentary desserts. I have previously sent two separate family members who each got married in Vegas to Casa de Amore and each of them gave high and great compliments to the place. Alexandra, the lady who took our reservations and who welcomed us as soon as we arrived was very sweet, professional, cordial, & it shows that she loves what she does.  The food was magnificent and the entertainment, by Paul and Randy was so lively and fun. I think that every selection in the menu are all very delicious.  I recommend this place to everyone. It's like going to one of our family parties that I grew up doing.

_XwX2NUxEn_cyNwBkZoYBQ.text: Came here tonight with my wife for my birthday dinner and it was soooo delicious!!! Our waiter, Stephen, was so attentive. He brought out some marinara before hand to try with our bread, kept acknowledging that it was my special birthday and had the pianist sing for me while they provided an INCREDIBLE cannoli!!! My wife and I ordered the Gnocchi alle Prosciutto and the baked ziti. Half way through we swapped so we could get a taste of both. Although both were incredible, my fave was the gnocchi. Sooo amazing!! Cannot wait to come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dinner! Great ambiance.

SXDQQvfkY1Igm8PkM5eY8w.text: Best plave for anniversaries or special occasions. Its open until 4am. Has a nice cozy atmosphere. Food is Delicious and Desserts are all soo good

XtgkLzhssRx_t-R-h1VBcQ.text: Where can you get a fabulous Italian dinner at 12am when in Vegas? At Casa Di Amore!  After a night on Fremont Street a group of six of us took a Lyft to this fantastic place.  Time has stood still in this place. The walls are decorated in pictures of Frank Sinatra,  Dean Martin, Sammy Davis Jr., Joey Bishop, Marilyn Monroe and many more. Lovely Italian music fills the room. It's funny how these song are so recognizable when you hear them. There was also a tiki bar out back that we all ventured out to see when we spotted the giant gorilla. We finally all got settled into our booth ready for our midnight feast. The menu is everything Italian you can imagine. We got garlic cheese bread, lasagna, giant raviolis, fettuccine and one pound pasta bowls!  We ate until we could eat no more. The food was fresh and tasty. The staff were so friendly and fun. I saw a small stage where the band plays nightly. Oh how fun that would be to see. I felt like I was in the Moonstruck movie eating dinner with the Castorini's.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant Raviolis
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s Amore!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One pound spaghetti and meatballs.

gCk0iGco0Ts2cryCuWPaLg.text: Old school, great Italian restaurant in Vegas! Food is wonderful and the service is outstanding. The atmosphere is nostalgic! Don't visit Vegas without checking it out!

1SBo1qCP8yQ57UYEBX45GQ.text: This is a great restaurant in a random location. Hint: You can request free limo service from anywhere on the Strip. It's quite small, so definitely make a reservation.  The ambiance and decor are the True draw of this spot. It's very old school Vegas. There are old school pictures of Vegas and various celebrities all around the restaurant and bar.  At the rear of the restaurant is the bar. There's video poker, of course. Hint: If waiting at the bar for a table to be ready, they cannot transfer your drink bill to your table, so you must pay the bartender before being seated at your table. There are several cocktails and a few wines by the glass. The wine menu was a little underwhelming.  Despite trying to be more upscale and fancy-ish, this is a rather casual spot. There were kids running around and lots of folks in jeans and sweatshirts.  The live music is a great touch and adds to the ambiance and decor. However, it also escalates the noise level. Between the band and the patrons, we couldn't even hear each other - and we were at a tiny two person table. Hint: Request a booth on the far side from the band. There's some seriously awful acoustics in this place. The noise level and the inability to carry on a conversation with your date really kills the romance.  For food, we opted for a side caesar salad, the bone-in ribeye steak flambe and the gypsy pasta. The food portions are pretty generous. The salad was nothing of note. Hint: While there's free bread, they don't give you olive oil and balsamic vinegar, just butter. The steak was tasty, but not mouthwatering or crave-worthy. The gypsy pasta was crazy spicy - and I love spicy. It was almost too much it was so spicy. And the pastas are 1 lb, so it was a significantly large portion.  The service was nice and friendly. Our waters were never empty, we were checked on, etc., etc.  All in all, I like the concept, which is what gives it the 4 stars. And I'd be willing to come back, perhaps on a less busy night, and try some other menu items. But I didn't love what we ordered and the noise level seriously dampened our experience. While a good spot if you're looking for a vintage Vegas vibe, If you're looking for a nice, romantic restaurant, this is not that spot. But totally good for experiencing that old school Vegas feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gypsy pasta
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak flambé

ZZtHYgX3PR_YXE2RbMXTrw.text: We have been here on numerous occasions. It is one of our favorite places to eat. The restaurant feels like ol -Las Vegas, the 2 man band sing songs of Frank Sinatra, Sammy Davis Junior and that's just to name a few. The whole experience is wonderful.

JkjSaW6mGQcbQqbzheD_FA.text: Saw this restaurant featured on jersey shore takes Las Vegas so I told my husband we should try it since I had never heard of it before. Made reservations for 5pm on Friday. We were the first ones there. It's located in a big of a sketchy part of town and doesn't look like much from outside. However it's romantic and makes you feel like you are in another era.  They open the doors right at 5pm. I would say make sure to have reservations as they filled up fast as soon as doors opened. The service was amazing and attentive. The food was authentic & amazing Italian.  You have to order the garlic loaf with marinara sauce. Mmmm to die for !! I ordered the Osso buco and it was the best thing I've ever tried ! For dessert we got a cannoli. The order comes with only one so if you still have room order one per person lol. I was stuffed so sharing one was fine. As locals here in Vegas we definitely will be back and bringing family & friends.

Zn23mOYoxVMCRQ_2wpyv7g.text: Walking into Casa Di Amore is like walking through a time portal - you are transported back to a time when Vegas was classy, opulent and fun. Big leather booths, lounge singers and black-tie service await you. The food was very good, big portions and decent prices. I really enjoyed dinner, and our server Stephen was excellent.

zJVyIOEC9OTKSYZdT8_xxg.text: Drinks were well served - no skimping.  Food was delicious and server was friendly and very helpful.  Live music and ambience reminiscent.of Vegas in the 60's.  Loved it!  Will definitely recommend to friends and will return.  Extra benefit:. they provide round trip transport from your hotel.

DNgucoLKCC8l8kCqYTfg3A.text: Amazing! Best experience at a restaurant. I will come back to Las Vegas just to come here again. Phenomenal service. Great live music. Very engaging. You feel like the restaurant is all about you.

JWUIyE58_PWinDZVSN1JBA.text: I can't say enough about our dinner there last Friday.  Just the most pleasurable delightful, tasteful experience ever.  I have lived here since 1985 and am sorry to say I did not ever hear about this restaurant until my daughter brought it to my attention last week.  Best baked clams ever.  Best rice balls.  My daughter, the vegetarian, ordered the house salad and eggplant parm.  Both delicious.  My husband had the lasagna, delicious as well.  I was just slightly disappointed in my veal special.  It should have been Milanese but had a sauce which it did not need.  We ordered 2 desserts.  Cannoli, and spumoni.  Both excellent.  Best part of the experience... our server and the 2 piece combo!  Just love it.

i5eyMZf2q8WR1cPPVmBkeQ.text: Ok so How do you describe this place? Well it's Old Vegas in all its glory. When you walk in you are transported back to 1950s 1960s Vegas. The decore is dark. Old pictures of the casinos, tables with candle lit wine bottles. Our Server was Brad.  A veteran server who is well versed in the Menu. Quick wit, And makes you feel welcome. Now for the food. We started with the calamari. It was cooked and seasoned perfectly. I had the linguini and clams in a white sauce. Clams were perfect and fresh. The linguini Wes well done and sauce.... let's just say nothing was left on my plate. We had the Astoria Prosecco with our meal and finished it all with that cannoli. Full belly and content. I almost didn't want to leave. All that was missing was Bugsy Segal to walk in.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qSvnFzQU6f9Lf9NuJMUzgQ.text: What a COOL LITTLE PLACE!  Found this place by just doing a random Google search for good Italian restaurants. Checked the reviews and decided to give it a try.  We made reservations on a hunch that it may be a good restraunt and could get busy. When we first arrived, it was at the very beginning of dinner.  The place had only a few customers besides us. Well.... we learned quickly, good thing we made reservations,  because the line formed like lightning! We were treated by our Server Stephen, who explained all the HOMEMADE recipes on thier menu, how they have a band that starts shortly, and proceeded to give us a short story on the background of the restaurant. Its family recipes, family operated and how they love to hear the customers say it feels like home. They have a 60s-70s old Vegas decor, live band, and Everything we tried was absolutely on point. Service is very focused on making you comfortable and full of amazing food.  There were couples actually dancing near thier tables to the music, atmosphere is very very cool and vintage style Vegas. We came from across town to try it, and was pleasantly pleased. They are definitely not a turn and burn get you in get you out hurry hurry cause we dont want you here type of restaurant.  We HIGHLY recommend them and ask for Stephen. I'll bet I've driven  by this place 100s of times and never knew it was there.. I could kick myself for not finding it sooner.

BPTysX-_9B7XI8oDKv58pg.text: The way old Vegas used to be . Great service ! Great steak !! Come in and call for reservations it is busy !!

b0X0xjDx6aNfccIi5QqZDw.text: Talk about place with personality and lot of that old school vegas nostalgia. I meet friends visiting for dinner one night. It was my first time. As the night went on realize Casa Di Amore is pretty cool spot for lot of reasons. I had ask my friend who mind you doesn't even live here find I feel hole in the wall spot. He was watching reality show jersey shore and guess they were in vegas came to eat here at Casa Di Amore. I was like interesting.  So to start defines hole in the wall for me. It located off Tropicana past eastern and really not in the best part of town. It small place so easy past by it. I did! The best way if going for the first time look for Dutch Bros literally neighbor good to go. The minute walk in was totally nothing I would expect from the outside or the area. There no windows all around the building so going in for the first time like bam. Lot of nostalgia photos of old school Vegas from pictures of the strip, back in the days of the rat pack, and not doubt know walking into italian restaurant. It low ceilings so the place give it even more of intimate vibe, lot of booths on the sides (the booths got that old school lounge vibe to them) never see that style much, and the best part mention all this old school.  They have live band three piece band. Not sure often they play but they were there when I went and they were great! They play all your classic italian songs that you know and also take requests. The band all packed in tight in one spot. All older gentlemen so make it more classic vibes. We went on half price wine night so talk about packed. They literally not open table and wait list. So if you go on that night plan ahead. Half off any wine pretty good deal. We had two bottle that night for the table.  The food is solid solid classic italian food. They cover just about every dish you could imagine in pretty big size menu for that size restaurant. I ended up getting the baked mostaccioli. I enjoyed. The marinara sauce was good. The pasta was cooked perfect. Sometimes bake pasta dish worry about the pasta. It still was moist and al dente with the nice top layer of melted cheese. Overall hearty dish. I order side of meatball just wanted to try. It was good. Nothing would rave about. We ordered bunch of appetizers all to share. They were all just solid classic italian food. Calamari, Fried Ravioli, and few more. The house bread is pretty tasty stuff too. The portion size is one thing LOVE nothing small about any menu item. I look around the table like dam that good size portion. I had hard time finishing my dish.   The service was five stars. Our server was awesome for big group. All first time great job explaining everything the half price wines, the menu, specials, and five stars on point.   So if looking for classic straight forward italian food. Off the strip Casa Di Amore great spot.....!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mostaccioli and side order meatballs

91h2UE_rrlBcoFdoUNIJwA.text: My Italian mother said, "This soup tastes like something my mother would have made" , which says it all!   I took my parents here on a long weekend trip to Vegas.  I heard about this place from someone I met on a business trip in the Midwest and he said it was his best Italian meal he ever had (which I doubted at the time). Sooo glad I took a chance as no one could stop eating.  The prosciutto mozzarella crostini with red pepper appetizer was a perfect way to start the evening.  The ciopino was a major hit. Service was fun and on top of everything.  Live holiday music made it a tad loud for conversation but it really rev'd up the mood.   People rave about the garlic loaf but we all thought the house bread with the ciopino broth was the better option so you can pass on that.  We think you can pass on the eggplant parm as well.  Everything else was superb and just a fun place to be.   Did I mention wine bottles are half price on Mondays?

fT6z5vP0TQc2uJ-FeSiAdg.text: This is an Italian restaurant owned by husband and wife whom I had the pleasure of meeting. They were very welcoming and personable. Our waiter brought us warm bread and softened butter and greeted us with a welcoming smile. He told us the specials and soups for the evening and I decided to order one of their specials which was the barramundi fish topped with tiny lobster with a light herb red sauce. It came with creamy stuffed potato sprinkled with paprika and herbs and a variety of steamed vegetables. The fish was cooked perfectly which was very moist and the stuffed potato was so creamy. Also you can add a soup or salad for only $3 so I decided to add one the special soup of the evening which was clam chowder and it was also good. For dessert I had the tiramisu which they make in house.  It was very creamy and light and so delicious that I wanted more of it. The restaurant was decorated like an old world style Italian restaurant with pictures that adorned the walls and it's a little dark in there. They have a singer with a drummer on Friday's and Saturdays there and the drummer goes around before they start and on his breaks to talk to the guests. In fact they dedicated a song to my friend and I while we were eating dinner even though it wasn't a special occasion at all. He said it was just because he saw 2 beautiful girls having dinner together. I thought that was really nice. Our waiter gave us great customer service. It was really busy that night and it was a Saturday night. Also they have a tiki bar with lounge chairs outside which we went to hang out after our dinner. It was really fun to hang out at the tiki bar. They will also start to have a band out there when our warm weather is more consistent. Overall I would recommend this place to anyone for the food and service and also if you want to just come and hang out at the tiki bar outside for a drink or 2 and have food out there. Also the food outside in the tiki bar is a different menu. You'll be very satisfied when you visit here.

fs5WHxLpBaVsE1JfzAUUHQ.text: This place was so yummy! It was a great birthday dinner and Stephan made the experience all the more special he was a great server and the food was delicious with massive portions

sgnxRWpEd49At9CkS4LOaA.text: The atmosphere here is great as well as the waitstaff. I got the gypsy pasta because I love spicy food. This dish is very spicy and the typical person would not be able to enjoy it. The flavor of this dish is very good. My belly was a lil on fire I'm not gonna lie. The bread is tasty and crunchy! I loved it. We ordered the calamari and it was yummy as well as the sauce. I just gave them four due to my salad being a little bit old (brown edges on the leafs and really droopy pieces). Overall I appreciated the meal and it's flavor. The ambiance and wait staff made our visit great. Oh! They have great live music too!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gypsy pasta (pretty hot).

iKVYviWIDvPPJslq-7YcRQ.text: Let me start by saying i wish i took pics. Food didnt last long enough. Pizza was AMAZING!!! Also had the garlic loaf with some sauce on the side. Garlic loaf....fantastic....sauce on the side..BLOWN AWAY!!!! Next time im there I'm gonna have to ask them what else that sauce is used on because i make my own and quite proud of it!!! This put mine to shame!! I'm not sure if it's because I was caught off gaurd not expecting much or if it was because i didnt have to spend hours prepping and a day and a half simmering. Personally....i think it was JUST THAT GOOD!!! I love chicken parm....saw menu and though HELL NO to $27...now im like....hereeee..TAKE MY MONEY!!! Also....can't quite remember the hours but the tiki bar out back (kid friendly) has pizza and drinks half price!! Gonna give a shout out to DUTCH BROTHERS next door...without them i would have never spotted this hidden little gem!!!

n4U-hMAfe_TuTLLXC1snKg.text: What Vegas used to be!  Old school Italian dishes. We had lasagna, giant raviolis, and spaghetti with meatballs. Try the ice cream bomb for dessert. It's a scoop of spumoni ice cream in a hard chocolate shell. Spumoni ice cream is 3 flavors in one - cherry, chocolate, and pistachio.  It's a staple in Italy.    The night we went they had live music.   Very big portions and great table service.   Delicioso

ufzjmjrPqa3-I3wMWUHqVA.text: Nice place to come hang out on a date or with friends. The place is intimate. We came late so the live band wasn't playing, but I'm sure it's a nice touch... they had Neo Soul music playing instead which I liked. The food was good. The calamari & the ceasar salad were my favorites believe it not. I got the stuffed porkchops... it seemed like it would be good but they were kind of bland, but a little salt & pepper helped. Overall... it was nice. Definitely cool that they're open so late.

KZXR9Lv8Wta-HP8LHOrFlQ.text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere! Joanne waited on me in the bar area. She was so knowledgable and familiar with the menu. I had arancini and chicken piccata. Their marinara sauce was delicious! I will definitely be going back!

Q3epoZuonX01_JOcvYyu5Q.text: I've been here twice and since my first visit my likes and dislikes have changed because of several reasons. First visit was a dream and my second visit was iffy.  Let's talk about why...  My first experience here was like no other in Vegas. I usually stick to the strip and veer off only when it's a True joint to go to.  This was one must visit. And we had a friggin blast. The meal was so enjoyable and the entertainment was what was expected. Exceptional.   The second visit was anticipated to be top notch because by that time we learned a pro tip. Which was you get a free car service to pick you up and drop you off after your meal.... WHAT!  Super awesome tip from a fellow YELPER. Thanks cuz that worked out great.    That advantage of that service. Our driver was exceptional and even checked up on us during our meal. So sweet!   This is were my review goes grim. Holy crap... the menu special was not what I expected.  You better know your fish when you order it and know what it looks like.  My sea bass was not chelean. It was from somewhere else sea bass. Wtf. Lmao. Anyway still good but not what was expected.   Order freely tho because everything we've ordered has always been great. Make sure to order the Canoli for desert. You'll love it and you get a free novelty shirt to go home with.
