BvbHVFxkKORjReGoOMeCEA.text: Brian (busser) PHENOMENAL Chicken parmesan with Lobster ravioli special  And prosciutto mozzarella Cristinis.  I couldn't write the enough to describe how tasteful this food is

FxF1X-jcI7S7yOPZKtdBfw.text: 2nd time eating here. In LV for business and pleasure (combined wedding anniversary). Enjoy getting off the Strip and local restaurants. First time back in the fall was absolutely perfect. This time was perfect as well. Wait staff was very attentive but not overbearing. Appetizers and entree was excellent.   Had the combo app. While it is a lot of fried food, everything was great. Split the Chicken Marsala for entree and it was very good. Personally, had the Chicken Parm on 1st visit which I prefer. Desert was the cheesecake. Not sure if I've had better (even in NYC).  The only subpar comment was the cocktail. Ordered a Scotch neat. Very small pour for the price.   The ambience feels like "old Vegas." The entertainment is enjoyable and not overbearing. Will always make a point to go anytime I'm in LV. They even have complimentary shuttle back to the strip. No reason to waste $ on Uber.

DqWDMwPLhP1QxQs1aHpd4A.text: Old school Italian. It's like going in a time machine back to 1978. Food was on point. Egg plant parmigiana was delicious. Prices are very moderate. Great neighborhood Italian spot.

U7lOZ1AkbZxmRlLjbH8u5A.text: Food is priced for the amount not the quality. Servers really need to be mindful of their verbage around guests and not push them to the side in order to get by. Tables way to close together.

XzsOWThaUvhP7YhyYHsi9w.text: So I'm in Las Vegas for a class and I needed to find a place to eat dinner. I had prime rib last night so I thought why not Italian...so I yelped and found Casa Di Amore.   This place is off strip obviously and is located in this sort of weirdly constructed plaza. The parking is "limited" in the sense that there are only a few spaces pretty near the front...but there is a bunch of parking located in the back. You can come in from the back but I didn't know that. Anyway I got here around 545-6pm. It was already full of patrons not entirely packed but for opening at 5pm I was surprised.  I think this is where a bunch of locals come to eat...which is pretty cool. I was seated immediately...party of ONE. Haha! Their menu looks pretty extensive...but in reality the last couple of pages are just wine. I decided on the frutti di mare - seafood linguini - you have the choice between white and red sauce and I chose white. The dish itself is $35 and you can add a side salad or soup for an additional $3...which I did...Caesar salad. They also give you some fresh bread with a delicious flavored butter or you can also dip it in olive oil and balsamic vinegar.   When my entree came out...they started some live music. Great singer singing in the Frank Sinatra style. The pasta was cooked the way I like it...but for some they may think it's a bit over cooked. There is a ton of seafood in it which makes it a bit more worth it in my mind as well.   I think if you're interested in going off strip this is definitely a place to check out.

Qd2UYc9hObswNdZeOh1Ang.text: I was looking for some new Italian dining & found this place like a hidden gem that isn't too far from the strip. We were arrived before 5pm & waited until they opened at 5pm. We chose to sit at the bar area & played video poker. I love the vibe here & the service is nothing to complain. They also have live music that started playing at 6. After having dinner, we came out side to the tiki bar area which is really interesting so we can stay chill & watch football. I am very glad that I came here & found out about this hidden gem.

Df93azerX46hvVhh0pTu7A.text: Casa Di Amore is truly a hidden gem in town! I know many people dine at the restaurant because of the delicious food, well last night I had the pleasure of attending a private party in their newly renovated outside bar/ lounge area, and I was blown away. Not only is it beautifully designed, it is very clean with amazing tiki bar vibes! Great seating, cozy outdoor lounge sofas, and fun games, with plenty of misters and fans to keep guest cool and relaxed!   The menu at the bar is different then outside, but still fabulous! It's always happy hour, how awesome is that?? Let me just add that the pizzas are delicious! The veggie white pizza is to DIE FOR! We also ordered the meat ball sliders, as well as the anti pasta salad, both very fresh and yummy! What I really love about the happy hour menu, is the fact that it's not just only bar food!   Casa De Amore is a great place for a nice Italian dinner, yet offers plenty of versatility, especially if your feeling up for a drink, you don't have to go far! Just step outside and enjoy! Such a great spot  for a date night, and an even better place just to hang out with friends,  whether it's after work, or a night out.   PS. I totally forgot to take photos but I will be sure to add them when I return. Caught in the moment!

D16v1gjcs6zZJo4ewecg4w.text: Visiting Las Vegas and we read about Casa Di Amore. We called last minute and the hostess was kind enough to reserve a table for a party of 12 on Friday Evening.   I can't say enough great things about our experience. From the top notch service, superb food and fantastic live music- it will be our first stop when we return. The gypsy sauce was fantastic with a spice you've never experienced.   You can't go wrong choosing this place. They make you feel like family.

cWzIqPwOez5oonsPpJy4yg.text: This place is such a hidden gem! Great atmosphere, amazing food. The service was 10/10. Our server Kyle was very attentive on answering first time questions. We were impressed by the Busser Evan. He had such a great attitude very friendly and was quick to help out in any way he could. The service here made our first time experience very enjoyable. Looking forward to the next visit.

o_1VL7M9e1FZuXag0fmBjg.text: Casa Di Amore was recommended on a FB group that I am a member of. So I thought my husband and I would  try it out for celebrating our 10-year Anniversary. We were not disappointed. The food and drinks were excellent and the service was exceptional.  We ordered the twice wrapped prawns for our appetizer. For our entrees, I ordered the chicken piccata with angel hair pasta and my husband ordered the chicken parmigiana. Everything was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wCzF2MP2jh4LGQHRBQoRkQ.text: This place is TOO Cute!!! it SCREAMS...Vegas BABY Vegas! While driving to my kick ball game I saw this adorable place and decided it looked hopeful. When we walked in they asked us if we had a reservation and we did not. I laughed because the place was empty so why in the world would we need a reservation!? VERY soon the place was FULL!!!! The live singing was such a great added touch to the ambiance! The old Vegas feel and the waitstaff MAKE THIS PLACE!   On to the food.... I had the chicken parm and it was not bad.. not the best I have ever had but it certainly wasn't bad! Their homemade bread and garlic butter was yummy!!! The best part of the entire meal was their chicken alfredo!!! To die for!  I recommend this place highly and to top it off they have a limo they will pick you up in! You can't get more vegas than that!

jZ5xA1bfGHS0ZXmaBr1lBw.text: Fantastic food. Simple solid classic menu. Great service from a staff that wants you to enjoy yourself. Lots of locals eat here. Limo service to Strip hotels is a great touch.., love this place, we come here whenever we get to Vegas!

C3YQHow10jYYX5di2ixEiQ.text: Very good and authentic Italian food, great staff and atmosphere. Hidden gem and great local spot

u_uN4PoEstJJQnQGEVtm2w.text: If you're not up for really crowed and loud restaurants.. This place isn't for you. Food was amazing! Music was wonderful! And the staff was wonderful! First time eating here and definitely will not be my last! Our server Brad was awesome! Love this place!

dq8VTlqwaH05xkPJnQPYDA.text: I'm very glad that I found this place on yelp. It's a gem! I will definitely come back when I'm in Vegas.  The old School Vegas style and entertainment were enough for me to really like it, but the food and service were  amazing.

ajoq8aNmrsMxOwPGWj-U7A.text: I really enjoyed Casa di Amore.  The ambiance alone is very old school Vegas...but be prepared for the facade.  We almost did not go in the restaurant given the facade.  I'm not sure if they have more parking in the rear but we both thought the front looked like a ghost town when we pulled in for our 7 PM reservation on a Saturday night.  Remember the abandoned restaurant the Fratelli's were hanging at in The Goonies?  Similar.  Anyway, glad we went in.  The food was superb, the atmosphere was perfect and the service was fantastic.  The entertainment...well, he sounded JUST like Frank Sinatra...but he looked like Ronnie from Jersey Shore.  Still great.  Pricing was pretty moderate.  I was full and happy when we left.

iDrGmbk4VMvMBwoCzyxnCA.text: Gr8 old Vegas ambience.  My meals have been inconsistent.  Had baked eggplant dish di casa which was overcooked.  Other times, I have had perfectly prepared dishes.  Place is a cross BTW a romantic dinner getaway and a loud party place.  Service can be inconsistent too.  Otherwise, nice menu selections, generous servings and comfortable booths.

zcQslw4Dzqsm-uZzsgIOqg.text: Aside from the yummy steak entrees and live music, our server Stefan made our dining experience to this place memorable. We're first timers to this place as recommended by a business associate and Stefan made sure we were attended well. Thanks for taking good care of us!

wGWMsn-9Bqz7lNPQErQ-tA.text: WOW.  First of all a few things that might have skewed my experience.   1) There's no decent Italian in Hawaii 2) I just spent the rest of the weekend in Vegas spending triple digits on food that wasn't astonishing.  THIS PLACE IS AMAZING  It's open super late, the staff is incredibly accomodating and the food is out of this world.    we got pasta, pasta and pastas and destroyed their large enough to share portions individually.  NOTE:  Their Fra Diavolo is not joking around, i spent a week eating sichuan hot pot and this bowl had my mouth on fire.  Super thankful we ran into some friends that live in the area, otherwise we would have never found this place.  SO GOOD.

b3GGGka6XpIKmOZN0bZexg.text: We came here for the first time to celebrate our anniversary! It was exactly what we hoped for! Great atmosphere, live music, wonderful service and very delicious food. Small place with a locals feel. We went on a Wednesday and it was busy so make a reservation and try it! You won't be disappointed!!!!

pPoOvR7WqEZa7R1FO7B8Vw.text: Old school Italian restaurant in Las Vegas off of the strip.  Think Rat Pack meets Elvis. Great good, wonderful service and 3 piece band keeps this place as a must do while visiting Las Vegas !!!

3VwULLbzsxmRWz9470_KHw.text: After driving by this place a million times while previously visiting Vegas, I sincerely resigned to never eating there because it looks really cheap and cheesy.  After searching for the highest ratest restaraunts in Las Vegas however, I found that this place had wonderful reviews AND free limo service!   So, during our las LV stay, we called the phone number listed on the website, made a reservation for dinner and limo pick up.  Easy!  The very friendly limo driver gave us a courtesy call to let us know he has ten minutes out. He greeted us with a handshake, a smile and great conversation.   We were promptly seated and offered drinks when we arrived to the restaraunt.  And, yes, it is as cheesy-looking as I thought it would be.  However, the entertainer was great, singing and playing the piano all night.  You can tell it's a locals' spot with all of the great banter going on around us.  My partner ordered a steak, and I ordered a chicken dish...it was all delicious.  The service could not have been better.  If you are looking to get off the overpriced strip and try something new, do it here.

xHRtxYe-5vlsmSRjoAR_wg.text: Called at 5pm to make a 830 reservation on a Friday night and was told it should not be a problem.  This place is awesome I was here on my 5th anniversary with my Lady and we ended up getting a table right in front of the musicians and it was amazing.  I wish they would have kept playing non stop but I understand that they need to pace themselves and give people time to chit chat.  Great service friendly place I wish I lived closer I would come at least once a month.  Thank You for a wonderful night!

UTYXPWCN89BiXyL6PWf60w.text: Wow, what can I say.  We came here because of the great reviews and we were not impressed.  No, it wasn't bad.  It just didn't "blow us away" like some said.  We ate here on a Wednesday night and it was pretty full.  The service was good but the singer was not very good.  I felt embarrassed for him a couple of times as he kept hitting the wrong notes.  The music was a little louder than I liked and it made it difficult to have a conversation.  The food was very tasty, the portions just right, but the prices were a little steep for the location.  $22 for a plate of gnocchi was a bit too much for this old building.  I say that if you drive a 78 Cadillac and think slicked back hair is cool then this place is for you.

G9BZ2_cJ_0nnzjta5_nM7Q.text: What a fun place to be! Love the atmosphere, decor, no valet parking, and half price wine on Sunday and Monday! There is live performance and totally old NY Italian feel. Awesome!   The food is good too. The green salad came with real "green" instead of iceberg, the chicken noodles soup is delish, and the bread is warm and addictive. My friend ordered the house favorite vinegar and pepper pork chop and he loved it. The spice and vinegar is too pungent for me but for those who love it, it's great flavor. I had the fillet and risotto special. It's good but not great. The steak over cooked and risotto too mushy. Not gonna dog them for it. Still a great experience. Definitely will return when I'm back!

eJLai_2ytcJWwklS9m9XuA.text: What a great place.  Just like all the other reviews said.  As soon as we walked on we felt like family.  The band was playing and there was a real buzz the place.  Our server Brad  was wonderful.  You could tell he really enjoyed his job.  The clientele was many locals but we felt at home.  It was classy Italian.  Food was good and drinks were strong.  I can't wait to go back and take my friends.

Q_lWa1SsUjNDtvl0cN-xTQ.text: Easy parking, seated us on time, fantastic waiter, fantastic food, great old world live jazz band.  I will definitely be coming back!!!

pjvLcMKc7pRVJU9aFZzM8A.text: This was such a fun night here. It really is a locals place. The only bad part about the night was we had a reservation and it took them 45 minutes to seat us so maybe they overbook or don't plan well for how long people will linger.  It was half price night for wine so you could get a bottle of wine for the cost of 3 glasses of wine so we said why not! It was very much the east coast style Italian restaurant. Small, dark, intimate with a real lounge style singer covering all the classics. It was a two person band and they did a pretty decent job of everything they did.  Be prepared to be a part of the act. We were there mid week and during our 2-3 hours of being there they sang happy birthday 6 times and the whole restaurant joins in!! It was great!  Now how about the food? I was expecting to be unimpressed but it was pretty darn good. Don't be looking for Italy style Italian food but instead think heavy New York Italian and you will be bursting at the seems and very happy. For the older crowd I am sorry to say they do not have spumoni. My Mom was with me and she was really hopeful that a place like this would but everything we got was great. I had chicken parmesan and she had a pasta dish.   If/when I go back to Las Vegas I will get off the strip one night and eat here again.

yUhxPq1wOrvypCZ3kVNQbA.text: The food here was pretty good. I had an Italian seasoned steak that was perfectly cooked and my dad had chicken caprese. The tomatoes on his meal looked like they came from a mass produced hot house and had zero taste. I lived in Italy for 3 years and even a tourist wouldn't get tomatoes like that. He was very pleased with the chicken under the tomatoes and ate all of it. The service was prompt but the server didn't know much about Italian food or pronunciation....lol!

htalzhTJtUj4M2M1KdVTkA.text: A group of 10 of us had a fantastic time here!  A live musical duo performed fantastic standards and provided great entertainment.  Our service was fantastic even though they were busy.  The food was solid, garlic bread strong, cioppino was decent with a fantastic broth and the wine was enjoyable!  Not my first time here and not my last.

9Vk4vz-mJwSWYeKhErAshw.text: Don't bother making reservations. We made reservations for 7:00pm, we were seated at 7:35, waited over 20 minutes after being seated without being offered water, no menus, no bread...nothing. All the while the entire staff took time to go sing happy birthday to two tables. Finally we had to walk out as the service was so unacceptable, waited a total of 55 minutes and not even a glass of water!!!!

FB_asPvKXqT9nWcwBIIzNw.text: LOVE this restaurant ... delicious food! I would like to say I have tried several dishes but every time I go I am compelled to order the gargonzola gnocchi with state bits ... it is absolutely to die for but they don't have it every night so schedule accordingly!  The ambience with live music after 6 PM is delightful and I always feel taken back to the 60s. The complementary transportation with Craig to and from the restaurant from the strip was an added bonus. Tip Craig generously as he has 17 grandchildren!

rJP-EWVBkksGcOBNhI5nVA.text: Last night was my first experience of many to come at this restaurant! The Calamari was delicious, the garlic bread to die for, my husband had fettuccine with chicken and shrimp,  it was awesome and more than enough food for him. I had salmon, veggies,  and twice baked potatoe, yummy! The service was delightful and the drinks were great! The 2 man band added a nice ambiance to the restaurant! Thanks for the delicous meal and welcoming ambiance! We will definitely be back!

lT5UD_P1gbnn-BFAPxicPg.text: Unprofessional jerks. We have come here several times and the food is delicious with quick service. But when I have a reservation for 7 and they don't honor it and have me wait in the bar with not even a comped drink while we wait and lecture me about how reservations don't mean that they will have a table waiting I think that shitty attitude and and pretentious BS needs to be called out. Good food. Shitty manager shitty hostess and shitty scheduling system willing to screw over loyal customers.

cX3CJL5Xuv25kMAStsedBQ.text: Had a great late night family dinner. The food was great, the services was amazing, and the place has a great atmosphere. We caught the tail end of the live music performance which was fantastic. I wish they would have played longer.

-Bo94itBVxUIHFAeLmXMGQ.text: Old style vegas restaurant for sure. Dont let the outside of the building discourage going there. The food was great and the service even better. We got there early before they opened for dinner and there was several other parties waiting as well. That was a good sign!  We got seated immediately and our waiter greeted us and explained the specials. He took our drink orders while we glazed over the menu. From their bread, salads, pasta or steak everything we ordered was great.   Live music and the bar in the back made the night.

oiRkPYSuUbJ7muNP5cOgyw.text: By far the best Italian food in town atmosphere is fenomenal Tony our waiter was awesome and amazing great place greatly recommend

AfnLZd6_eMXhKg22GjUDYw.text: We went to Casa d Amore since we hadn't been there in a long time.  We were so disappointed in the food. We ordered chicken parm and eggplant parm. Both were bad. The eggplant tasted like freezer burn and the chicken tasted like a slab of processed plastic. Nothing tasted fresh. It was awful and overpriced for the quality. It used to be one of our favorite places, but we won't be back. Service was ok and they did make a small adjustment on our bill.

zkSVQwgjqph-yX63cs6Yzw.text: The food itself AMAZING. The entire staff was so friendly and gave excellent service. I was overly pleased with my experience here!

hlU43vQuQIUByOg6ds9_Hg.text: Been to this place a few times and it has always been great until this last time.  We were sat in a small 2 person booth by the bar in the very back corner of the restaurant.  I was facing the back wall so it sucked.  Also we were being served by the bartender and she was so busy making drinks that she didn't have time to serve us well.  And when she did come over to take our order you could tell she was super rushed to get back behind the bar.  So as long as they sit you in the reg dining area this place is great.

LIsohRzKWeOlIgxuu92Nhg.text: I loved this place. If you want to try authentic Italian food, this is the place to go. They have live music which is so awesome. The place is really busy so it is a good idea to make the reservations in advance. I tried their specials, the seafood combo including lobster, crab, shrimp, and clams. It was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RGbDvLPRHhXdezDsUKA3mw.text: When the moon hits the sky like a big pizza pie that's amore... This restaurant is definitely an old Vegas experience you have to try at least once.  We were sat at a table very close to the front and had an up close view of the entertainment. We enjoyed listening to some old love songs some Sinatra and felt like we had stepped back in time.  We ordered the antipasti salad, and it was delicious and huge!! Salami, marinated veggies, large pieces of cheese and a great vinaigrette. We looked like we barely made a dent in it and had to take some home. The waiter offered to store it in the fridge for us and I thought that was a very nice touch.   My partner ordered the steak flambe, which has a delicious Demi glaze and was cooked to a perfect medium.   I ordered the lobster ravioli which was served in a red cream sauce. The ravioli had perfect pieces of lobster in them and the cream sauce was flavorful without being overpowering to the pasta.  The bread was fresh and warm and our server made sure we had fresh bread for our entrees.  We finished off the evening with a cannoli and it was one of the best I've ever had! We even got a "leave the gun take the cannoli" t-shirt!   A great time with great service! Definitely a check off the restaurant bucket list for Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The huge antipasti salad! It was great!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak flambé. Delicious!

QqyNP0GYXWNqfBNW8KdHag.text: Some hiccups from the start with the food and drinks but they made it good.  Lower stars mainly because the music is a major attraction and the speakers are blown.

xcXq9Ld4KpZEZP-PxL-0Vg.text: We were looking for Italian on our last night in Vegas. Thank goodness for Yelp as the reviews brought us to this awesome restaurant. We had 24 total in our group. The place has a really cool old Vegas vibe, live music focusing on Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin type tunes and awesome food. Great customer service from our waiter, Tony. Cannot say a bad thing about this place. Will be a new favorite restaurant while here in the future. Cali approves and gives two thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WyXtrx4a0JBEWllAjOIIIg.text: Great food and great atmosphere.  True Italian Chicago vibe. Already been there twice!

1m5NnvfAWmLQLRw5kS2zlA.text: What a great find. Food and wine were great. Atmosphere and service top notch. Very comfortable  place.

bSa2p0VQ-BNdAIENytujfA.text: Superb,  classic Italian food. If you are visiting Las Vegas you must try the pasta and meatballs as they were excellent.  Our server Brad gave us the best service I have ever experienced in a restaurant.  Highly recommended Casa di Amore for great food, fine live entertainment and excellent service.

GG6M8VKohn2gOKxhzS5qVQ.text: We went here after reading great reviews and we honestly couldn't understand why they are rated so high.  They had live music which was great, but way to loud.  We had to almost yell to hear each other over the music.    Upon entering we were met by a server who ended up being our waitress who was anything but hospitable and service oriented.    Food arrived and it was as if it came from a box.  Nothing was fresh as the menu stated.   This place only received three stars because of an amazing employee named Cisco.  Had it not been for his amazing service and friendly attitude this would have been one star at best.

nfUi0NGEpjXPDZyTqUSvGQ.text: Went tonight for the first time for my daughters birthday. It was a party of 10. We were only allowed to pick one out of 4 entrees. 1. Spaghetti and meatballs  2. Chicken Parmesan 3. Lasagna  4. Fettuccine  None were worth the $50 per person! Honestly, the Olive Garden is better! Pasta was bland ( marinara) and the chicken, although it was tender, there was so much mozzarella on it, that's all you could taste. The 20% gratuity was mandatory. I tip according to the food and server. I usually do tip that amount, but being told I had to really irks me! And spending $500 for mediocre food was ludicrous! Won't go back. Being of Italian descent I admit I'm picky, but even the others were not happy with their food.

kyKLbtXWoxm4vBx7ycchdA.text: The best kept secret in Vegas, if not the entire western region!!  Amazing service, live band playing ole favorites that everyone sings to, homemade grandmas marinara sauce, garlic bread, the best drinks, it is like being back in the 1940s!!!!  Oh & you HAVE TO get the garlic bread, I can't even describe this one, it's indescribable!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  BEST RESTAURANT EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Angelo
