s1YY7rVmEOH0rY38ny_Hyg.text: We went on a Saturday in hopes of trying out the new Tiki Lounge out back, but it had been rented out for a private party. The hostess was very friendly and apologetic, promising us we could get tiki drinks at the inside bar, which unfortunately was not True as the Tiki bartender was devoted to only serving the private party. We decided to stay and sit at the bar, and we ordered appetizers and drinks- all of which were delicious. The bartender was efficient but gave off an "I hate this job" vibe, and the customer next to me was obviously a regular who complained loudly and non-stop about the crowd. The live music was a bit too "slow jams from the 70's" for me, and we sat through 5 performances of "Happy Birthday" in less than 2 hours. The food and service are pretty good, but the old-school atmosphere wasn't my style. Still want to try the tiki drinks, so will return for that.

b_jvVPHydIrRYF5jq6FKaQ.text: Food was delicious.  So flavorful, tender, I  didn't even need a knife to cut into my piece of meat.  The service was excellent.  We didn't know we needed a reservation and even though they were already pretty booked they squeezed us in.  Thank you so much.  My husband had been wanting to come here for quite some time already.  They have someone  playing music after 6pm( I don't know if it's everyday). My husband and I truly enjoyed our food and our evening dining here.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l_vsuXkaZAUMilKT2CMN_g.text: Fun place with live band on Sat. night. Four of us showed up without reservations but the lovely Maitre'D found us seating in the packed place within about 10 minutes.   From the start our server made us feel like part of the family. Stephan (sp) was great ensuring drinks were full, telling us about the red sauce's history and telling us the band members' names.   The environment is noisy and casual. A few less decibels would have made conversation a little easier for our 65+ year old ears! The waiter also mentioned there is a shuttle bus if necessary.  Dinner was a bit overpriced in my mind. $200 (with tax & tip) for 4 of us with 3 drinks, 3 dinner salads and no dessert tops our usual bills by at least $50. I had the fruitti di mare which was about the most expensive thing on the menu at $35. It was good, but really for 2 shrimp, 2 clams, 3 mussels a handfull of calamari and I believe some fish $35 was defi itely high. I usually pay about $28. It's my go to comparative dish by which I judge Italian restaurants. I ordered the Frau Diavlo sauce which did have a kick, just the right amount, but lacked maybe some garlic and could have used a bit more salt. The portion was generous (I took half home) but not as generous as the lunguini with calamari which was about $8 less.   My husband's scallops au gratin were superb. I would have liked to lick the plate! Perfectly cooked scallops in a marvelous cheese sauce had him nearly drooling.  Our friends, Italians from Chicago, both enjoyed their meals. It was great to hear compliments from them on the red sauce.   All in all, aside from the noise level (it was Saturday night) and price tag a very enjoyable evening with warm, friendly people. We're looking forward to trying it again during the week!

rmVlNb3KGHXePI5BttBa5Q.text: I was so disappointed last night 8/5/18 I've been dining here for the past 10 years every time I come to Vegas which is at least 4 times a year. This was a must go to place. Service was good when she was around... it wasn't to busy only a third full. Which was shocking to me cause it was always to capacity the plus thirty times I've dined here.  Food Average at best. We had the chops and peppers my go to Chops were bone on for the first time and about a third smaller My G F had the Cioppino it was okay nothing to write home about We were told this was the best dish in the house.... Hummm  The prices have gone up the service was a2.5 when every other time I've been there has been a 5 star experience great service not last night.  I usually always recommend Casa Di Amore Sad to say ill say go at your own risk To much money for average meal

fOwK8bzpTJnqxNDCPCtoVg.text: Pork chops and peppers Gypsy pasta  Antipasto salad  Chipino all was great  Service atmosphere it was great

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qjf2rVy8I5ENIrQkVlYQ7g.text: What a pleasant dinner, went to Casa Di Amore to celebrate 9 mos with my gf. The server was very knowledgeable and made great recommendation. This place exceeded far beyond my expectations. Their house made sangria was refreshing, the Sinatra steak was very succulent. And the calamari was breaded perfectly. They had live music, a gentleman was playing the piano and was singing some great classics. Would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QBoWkq_fFlbqXwocHddNSQ.text: Casa Di Amore is a long standing Las Vegas Italian restaurant. Decor is vintage Las Vegas with photos of the original hotel/casinos. Lots of history!  We had reservations and were seated promptly. Lucky to get the last booth. Shortly after we were seated the room began filling up. Two nearby tables were being set for a party of 16 and party of 8. On this evening the two piece band provided a variety of easy listening music.   The menu has a wide variety, meats, seafood and pasta's. Also a nice selection of wines by the glass and bottle.  After a few minutes our server Robert appeared and offered us a selection of water. That was followed by a basket of crusty bread and butter. We also received some olive oil and balsamic which was a wonderful complement for the bread.  Our starter this evening was Baked Clams. Ten nice size clams stuffed with bread crumbs, garlic, parmigiano  reggiano, oregano and parsley all nestled in a tasty broth. An excellent appetizer and delicious broth that was soaked up with crusty bread.  Entrees included Chicken Piccata and Cioppino. Two large boneless chicken breasts sauteed with butter, lemon, mushrooms, white wine and capers. The chicken was fork tender with the sauce having a rich butter and lemon flavor. The chicken is generally served with a side of pasta but was swapped for a double baked potato. Plenty of chicken was left over to take home.   The Ciopinno is served in a large bowl that contained a large portion of seafood including lobster, clams, mussels, scallops, crab, cod and shrimp. All floating a savory broth. Plenty of broth to be soaked up with more of the crusty bread. The Cioppino was excellent, served the way I prefer, without calamari.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Piccata
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Clams

IHa-7ItWtR2DRa_jxGGOuQ.text: This is my go to Italian restaurant. Service is great and the music is cool-only if you like old songs.  Monday's are half off wine bottles.  My favorite is the NY steak flambe and scallops. Ask for Estafan and say hello to Smith

LO7MvINmVplNxxI_CGDQ-Q.text: Ambiance is really nice. Server sat us and brought some stale bread to us, it was pretty bad. Party of 4 and only 1 of the dishes were good. Do not order the steak or spaghetti and meatballs, it's a waste of money. The cannoli for dessert was disgusting...very gritty texture and seemed not fresh at all. Drinks were good. I'm never coming back.

0I0nxAxj4pDlx_RTFs91rw.text: Absolutely amazing. I love coming here. The first time we came here I thought we were going to be left with a bad impression. There were no tables open so we sat at the bar, once a booth opened they gladly let us sit there instead due to the people who made the reservation never showing up. Food is delicious and service is very fast. Second time we came here our food was out in less than 20 minutes and we were seated right away. The tiki bar in the back is nice as well, you do not have to pay or reserve the seating areas if they are open, overall this is a great place to eat and dine at, just wish they would have more open locations!

XTpRVnqmks_XmvL2B9WJJw.text: Casa Di Amore is a great find while visiting Las Vegas. We stopped by on a Saturday night and it was dinner and entertainment. Dinner was wonderful. We had Eggplant Di Amore and the Stuffed Pork Chop Valdostana. The eggplant was a great flavor assortment of cheeses. The pork chops were savory. The service staff were very accommodating and friendly. The entertainment was a delightful pair of gentlemen on drums and keyboard with a fun array of golden oldie songs.  Locals who frequent the restaurant even got up and danced. Good food and fun place!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy eggplant dinner
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great pork chops!!!!

zjVDYpr1Ju9xKRT1Acb0kw.text: This is the culmination and definition of Old Las Vegas. It is good Italian food great service and my party thoroughly enjoyed being there. My only criticism was that the room gets a bit loud. If this was my place I would begin the live music which was excellent at 7:30 p.m. instead of at 6. Otherwise I will return with more of my friends and family.

yyU4Fix1Lu29qXh4L0sEeQ.text: For great Italian American meals this restaurant just a few miles off the Vegas strip delivers! Great food, great service, great ambiance! Our waitress Rochelle made our visit enchanting. Our meal was delicious. Old school Vegas slides on the walls. Even a crooner belting out Sinatra classics. They even got us a complimentary shuttle ride back to our casino. (Book a day in advance and they'll pick you up too!) What a lovely experience. Will return again when visiting!

iN-FxgVs1VYt-tZhIllEZw.text: Service was excellent! Fave items were the garlic loaf for $6. The Osso Buco was not bad, but just not to my taste. It's a preference thing. Generous portions with the mussels. Can't wait to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Famous Garlic Loaf
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Buco

dzuMVhMedFOm8EZNQV0ZeQ.text: At any moment, Sammy Davis Jr. and Frank Sinatra could walk through the doors. Okay, not really because they're dead, but Casa di Amore has nailed the old school Vegas vibe.  The servers were well-polished and unpretentious. Even the manager was extremely hospitable and treated us like family.  My family and I ordered the following:   Lasagna    A Chicken Marsala    A Eggplant parmigiana   B Fettuccine Alfredo   B  The pasta is made in house, which I love. Now if that weren't enough, you also get FREE entertainment. That's right, live music and the singer has a lot of soul. If you're fortunate enough to chat with him, he'll share fascinating stories about everybody who's anybody in the music industry.  This place stays crowded, so make reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fettuccine Alfredo is one of their most popular items.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna is made with beef only.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding Live Music

LWIAL5mFCHEx5bXg6k9sWQ.text: I was looking for an authentic Italian restaurant and this has been the most genuine place. We came when there was a live band playing old school music that I felt like I was Henry hill on his first date.  The vibe was real good and the food was better. This place will see me again.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QCCQuLvpj3KGloM8wYxHGw.text: I made a reservation with open table for 9PM and arrived and checked in before 9. They were very busy but we could not even sit inside so they asked us to wait in the back where it was outside stormy and freezing. We saw people coming in after us and being seated ahead of us? It looked like they had signed up on the waiting list as they came in?  We were finally seated at 940! No one apologized or offered anything? All the waitress said was customers weren't leaving very fast! I was close to going somewhere else and won't ever go here again!

NBQxNUvcKi6V0Uor0YkNug.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I have to come here! The live music is the very best part and is always on point.. the Scallop Florentine was very rich (glad I split it), and they have half off bottles of wine on Mondays! Also, there is a very cool (very random) tiki bar in the back that had its own live music

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ie-0eQtTsjVK-pofZWtPYA.text: Absolutely top-notch Italian food.  Service is spectacular and the food is superb.  Even the bread shows an attention to detail that isn't found in other restaurants.  It's pricey, but you get what you pay for, so don't be intimidated by the menu.

uqRgCxLfJiwwa5Onj5yGDw.text: We have been going there for years. I used to be 5 star. The last three times we went was absolutely gross !!!! we just thought maybe it was a bad night for the chef the chef the first time and hoped it would be amazing as usual so we have it a few times more. A waste of 140$ just for us two to eat. The server with the too knot bun was awful. Didn't go over specials or ask if we wanted to hear it until we asked. Would be talking to us as he was waking away. It was just horrible!!!! Cold food after waiting forever and the baked clams were just bread crumbs! Like literally bread crumbs . I will never step foot in there again. It use to be a packed house and people waiting outside to eat. On a Saturday night at 9 pm was three tables and that included my husband and I. Awful waste of money and didn't eat our food to go to fast food after ! Highly disappointing and don't recommend

UE1X38X2kdR5ROzflsbADw.text: Overall, the food & service were mediocre.  The highlight of our dinner was the osso bucco - I would suggest it to a friend.  However, do NOT try the twice wrapped shrimp appetizer!  OMG - what is that??  Is it wrapped in donut dough?  And is the dipping sauce a caramel base?  It tasted like carnival food.  We were confused & so were our taste buds.    On the other hand, the entertainment is pretty solid - some might say "jaw dropping!"

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yI00AvztSsgJWMOlrhWDtA.text: So I thought long and hard about this review as I really wanted this to be one of the high lights of my trip. Tour guide suggested this as a local spot with home cooked food. Online they offered free limo service for the strip hotels so I booked about 2 months in advance. My pickup time was 7pm with dinner at 7:10-7:15 (this is what the girl on the phone stated when I booked).  The day of the reservation we got out side about 6:50 and at 7:05 when no one came I called the restaurant. They stated that they were trying to call me all day and that they had a party of 46 that they gave our table to to accommodate them. I stated that I never received a call and I gave them my phone number. The guy on the phone said that the number was written down incorrectly. That should of been the clue to not go but I had a gift certificate and the guy on the phone after several apologies stated that if I got a cab the restaurant would pay and they would seat us as soon as we got there. So ok we got there and could tell the dinning room was small and filled!!  The hostess seamed new and I gave our name several times as she was trying to add us to the 46 party. A guy came over greeted and apologized for the mixup, took my receipt for the cab and said we would be seated shortly. We walked over to the bar and ended up waiting about 45 min. At that point we moved back to the hostess station as I felt we were forgotten. About 15 min later and more headache we were seated.  The waiter was the best part of the dinner he was friendly and engaged.  The (I guess) manager came over apologized again for the mix up and offered us dessert.   Now if that wasn't enough there was a 2 man band playing that was also very good and I could of sat there for hours drinking wine and listening to them however at one point the restaurant let the organizer of the 46 sing and than speak to their group. At that point all the other tables were told by their tables that we had to be quiet and constantly heard (sssh) (sssh).  We got our food and it was ok.   But at the end of the day with everything else that happened here did not live up to my expectations.  I get it was 46 people and they didn't want to loose that bill but they should of just closed the restaurant for a private party especially since they literally took over the restaurant!!  With that experience I wouldn't go back.

TfBjK53htBzgrmMB7AJr3Q.text: Over priced I was in shock to see the new menu prices the quality of food was ok but no cigar spaghetti and meatball $23 dollars cut me a break and everything is ala cart The restaurant parking is difficult and doesn't seem safe Will not go back

tzdSqqjehY86hfIafXO-Lg.text: To start my review, this will be the nice version I bet my mother will write one too and she is much harsher than me. So... good or bad news first? I'll do bad (maybe the good will make up for the negative). We made reservations 2 months in advanced at the time they had a limo service they offered to pick you up from your hotel to the resturant. (Hello bonus!) I loved this thought because it is quite difficult to get from one place to another one block in Vegas is very different from a normal city block. Anyway, we waited and limo never came (7:00) we called and they told us the limo broke down (a while ago) and that we will just have to catch a cab and they will pay for it (I was very understanding). Oh little side note we have been in Vegas a week now and this is the third place we've booked in Vegas that has called telling us their car or bus has broken down. So we got to the resturant around 7:20 they said they would sit us immediately (they didn't) we didn't get seated until 8:10 (reservations were at 7:10). Now this is we're I will stop and say that there was a huge factor in this they had a 46 (or some ridiculous number) of singing women (annoying as crap they were all drunk old women who claimed they sing in a group which I personally thought that was just a college sorority thing) party. Their reservation was 7:30 (we overheard). They got seated right away. Now I also learned the bus (they lost their limo a while back) had to pick some of these women up. Myself I have never worked in a resturant but I do have many many friends that do or have. I decided to text these friends while there (during my very long wait) and they all agreed that the party of 46 should've reserved the entire resturant (it was a pretty small place maybe 8 or 10 tables not taken over by these women) or the manger/boss/whoever should've personally reserved the resturant just for this party and not allowed any other parties in that night. Now the good news the food was great the service was amazing and I say this not because they had us wait so long and didn't pick us up but because I truly believe they have amazing service every other night. Personally if the party of 46 was not there that night it would've been a perfect night with great food and my review would be a tad shorter and five stars. The staff was very nice and wonderful people so I do not really blame anyone for what has happened tonight except for the group of 46. So in conclusion (cause I've basically wrote an essay hahaha) it was a terrific resturant very good atmosphere but for any groups of 46 please request the place to yourself for the night and for any mangers please allow them. Overall I would recommend to a friend and this review got good stars for the fact that tonight was not the restaurants fault (fully) but just bad timing and planning.

g8hy8JgHgwWIYZUXT1q7eQ.text: excellent local italian restaurant off the strip. food very good and reasonably priced . staff are terrific.  very friendly, never an attitude. highly recommend. mike s henderson

lMcM9ElMI0oxP1DDe6hR2g.text: When planning our most recent trip into Vegas, the girlfriend and I decided we wanted to get away from the Strip and do something different, and Casa di Amore seemed to fit the bill. I made reservations with their complimentary limo service a little over two weeks in advance, just to be safe, but I think you could get away with reserving it the week of your visit. Our driver arrived promptly and was very friendly on the short trip to and from the hotel. Upon arrival at the restaurant, we were seated promptly and treated to exceptional service from our waiter, Stephen. He was very professional and extremely helpful, but also very personable and friendly -- he earned one or two stars on his own. (I had no idea about the pint chug challenge at the Aria, but thanks to Stephen, I'll be trying that on my next Vegas trip.)  The food was nothing short of delicious. I ordered the Chicken Caprese at Stephen's suggestion and my girlfriend ordered the house specialty, the Osso Bucco. Both dishes were tender, flavorful, and came in very large servings. Neither of us had room for dessert, though there were many tempting options on the menu. (It was challenging enough finishing our bottle of wine after all that food.)  Great ambiance. The live music was entertaining, the decor hearkened back to old school Vegas, and every staff member we encountered was wonderful. Could not have asked for anything more in this area.  One more note: while this place gets the $$$ by Yelp standards (upwards of $30 per person), it's fairly priced for a delicious Italian meal in a very fun environment.  Throw in the free limousine service, the discounts on wine bottles on Sun/Mon, and the exceptional waitstaff and it's unlikely that you'll be disappointed in your dining experience.  We'll definitely be bringing friends back with us on our next weekend in Vegas.

myxCGqYes5ljMvS86gNkFw.text: Great service, great staff!! and the food was good. Our calamari was chewier than we thought, like it had been frozen then fried.  The canolie at the end of our meal was fermented. It tasted old and not sweet but very bitter. Very big choice of Amazing White Wines. This family friendly place, has a live band to keep you occupied in your seats while you wait a while for your meal. The price is a little high, for not getting fresh food. Two days after eating here, my husband and I can't stop going to the bathroom. I'm assuming the food that we thought was okay, wasn't. Go for the wine and the music. My opinion.

f6I8bJQbOhndyCPuKwOtCA.text: Tony was the best, Great service and food.  I will be coming back for sure to have tony wait on me again.  Love that they give you a free t-shirt with purchase of a cannoli.  For sure stop if your looking for late night Italian food and great service.

OmY8LFHXmMH_PTDZuC0AgQ.text: You need to make reservations a half hour before you actually want to eat. Very loud, but great for parties. The food is absolutely amazing!

UE4luAtya-E0fic2urcKkA.text: Sooo sorry to add this. Haven't been here in awhile and loved it before. Just not what it was:-( Music was fabulous, service was excellent BUT rating food 6 out of 10! Enlarged the kitchen to NO avail. Food was mediocre at best:-( Definitely one and DONE! Heading west to Mastrioni's.

Lc6GwL-9wa58oRZqwfvlXA.text: WOW. Thank you Yelper friends for referring us to such a gem. Absolutely a new favorite for us. Came in this Friday evening to a full house complete with live performers. Being Vegas natives we really appreciated the atmosphere- odes to old Vegas Strip scenery and pop culture/entertainers. The noise level is a little on the loud side, but we actually enjoyed being able to carry on a conversation without worrying about being overheard or being too noisy. Everybody is too busy having a great time. And as busy as they were tonight, we were still seated within 10 minutes. Score. No need for us to order any appetizers, as gratis fresh hot baked bread and butter was provided. Oh my yum. Who doesn't love a hot bread roll fresh out of the oven? So tasty, nonetheless. We helped ourself to another as soon as the first quickly disappeared from the table. The gnocchi alla prosciutto was to die for. The cheesy sauce was light didn't overpower the taste of the prosciutto. A delicate touch of spinach was a perfect inclusion. And a perfectly sized portion for a hungry tummy! Boyfriend had the chicken parm with a side of meatballs, which were wonderfully tender and juicy. We finished our meal with a cannoli. It was baked just the way a cannoli should be done- toasted outside (not soft!), rich and thick cream on the inside.  Staff was all incredibly friendly. Our meal was concluded with a visit from the manager who made sure our experience was to our liking and shook both our hands. I wish we could remember our server's name, he was awesome! Thank you all for such a great evening! We will definitely be back soon!

AidjG--cMQ2eAGeAhzYjSg.text: I had heard such positive things about this place, so I had to check it out. Let me just say that it was very good! The food was delicious and the wine our server recommended was perfect. The service and the ambience was even better than I expected. It's such a charming place! I would highly recommend going here for a  nice Italian dinner.

Rwb2E7MDQiIoQDMUIsALMQ.text: What a fun place!  We were staying on the strip and the restaurant sent their van to pick up our group and return us to the hotel after dinner--a very nice touch! This place is old time Vegas at its best.  There are vintage pictures on the wall of Vegas locations and the many movie stars who have played Vegas locations over the years.   There was live entertainment the night we were there which only added to the ambiance. Our server was very customer service oriented and took the time to answer all questions we had about the menu and the specials that evening.  There was about 7 of us and we all seemed to order something different.  Everything was fresh and delicious--especially the Sea Bass that was the special fish of the evening. I could sense that this is a mainstay location of the locals and it is always nice to find a diamond in the rough!  Can't wait to go back on our next Vegas trip.....

Gktlp3MWliyzZGNLN8CJpg.text: The restaurant itself was very unique along with the live two-man band.  However, beyond that not many great things to say.  The cab ride there and back was $50.  They only had one of three limos operating that night so we didn't have any options other than a cab.  We had reservations for 6:45pm.  It wasn't until 8pm that we were finally being seated at our table.  What's the point of a reservation?  The prices are way too expensive for the quality of food.  The pastas aren't even made in house.  The sauces were bland.  I found adding copious amounts of salt gave the food some flavor.    One other good thing was our server though.  Very friendly and took the time to answer all questions we had.  Was it all worth the far trip and the long wait....no.

iF9JZPmV71F0ACfae9SJtA.text: While looking for Italian on Yelp we had Casa de Amore on our short list. What a great experience - felt like we stepped back in time to what Vegas was like (before we were of legal age to experience). Stephen (our server) was excellent and engaged us in conversation from the get go which is so key to experiencing great customer service today. The food was incredible. Music was amazing and made us feel like dancing - terrific singer/musicians playing old Vegas tunes. We started with calamari with the marina sauce (yummy) and an Opollo Zin wine together with the bread/evoo-vinegar. The Pasta allo Fordo was amazing, penne arbiatta the best spicy ness, and the kids has homemade chicken soup (Gma's recipe to die for), spaghetti/meatballs and fettuccine which were all great. The cannoli - lets just say this rivals a a famous baker who's jersey roots has a shop here in LV. Direct your orders here vs there!! Thanks Stephen.

Ga9naqAU24yupojcSHH-tQ.text: Did come back, this time with my MIL and SIL, we had a real good time, the place was packed and jumping. The last time I was there it was for an early dinner and we were some of the only people in the place, this time as I said jumping. They had a singer at a keyboard and he brought the diners into his act, the atmosphere was more like being at a party, a total turnaround from my last visit.  Food was very good, everyone enjoyed their selections. The t-shirts were a nice bonus.

lAJo7NP4h9REb_8I6qW_IA.text: Wow!! Never again. This place is so expensive. The bill that I had could have been used for Giada's Italian restaurant on the Strip and most likely could have been a heck of a lot cheaper. Come on, I order a thirty dollar plate and your going to charge me four dollars for the Alfredo sauce? Yes it's a cool environment and the staff was friendly but as soon as we sat down we were advised that there is only one server and it may be a while. For a 160.00 bill your going to staff one server? The food was not bad but got cold after a few minutes. The pasta was not consistent. I'm so sad to leave this.

i3LiKGD1vnyKJ6zLPFIybw.text: Love this place!!! Super tasty fresh meals. Friendly service and great old school Las Vegas: music and decor. Classy but not overdone!!!

OIsqGvG4CY_6EDQMNZNkoQ.text: First of all let me preface this review by stating I have lived in Vegas for over 20 years and have my favorites in town for Italian food and this is not one of them.  I loved the warm cozy atmosphere and the music was a nice touch however it was drafty in the restaurant and very busy.  The food is over priced and the drinks were very expensive.  I got sick after eating the chicken parm.  I am from the east coast and I that's what I was expecting however sadly disappointed.  Chicago joes is better food and less expensive

PMyl5c2K0djMGsn6pR5hlw.text: We went here for our anniversary last Sunday. Food was amazing. Definitely order the bruschetta. It's one of the most delicious things ever. Just do it. Our server Michael was so friendly and made our experience even better! He told the band it was our anniversary and they wished us a happy anniversary and played us a song. Very sweet. And he gave us a cannoli to celebrate! Great evening :)

76nsFdhPClZ2lq843DfZyA.text: I would like to say this was one of my favorite restaurants so far! I had called for a last minute reservation and the young lady did her best to fit us in at the time I had requested. The place was super busy but the moment we got seated our waiter came by took his time to go thru the menu with us and offered us some wine and bread. Service was amazing!!!!! I loved the live music and they way everyone was so into it by signing and having a good time ! The food was beyond amazing !  For desert we tried the cannoli best damn thing I have ever tasted in my life  ! Overall this place was amazing I recommend it to anyone !

p_uxE6yfE0Pptu_0S6Q3Sw.text: Went there last night and ended up with food poisoning couple hours later. The place was great I love the dim lights and the candles on the table. It was a little too loud for me everyone was yelling at each other just to hear each other. Staff was great. My husband had the Frutti De Mare and that's what made us sick.

mX1WVwNkyfCyFhZY04Zbwg.text: I loved the food. It's everything you'd imagine a good old school Italian spot to be.

cjfHXW7Q4HVzEPssXQtJuA.text: The food was delicious, once we got it. Unfortunately we waited so long we had to get our food to go. The lack of organization and service soured our experience enough that we won't be returning. We waited 90 minutes for our food due to another party's food coming up around the same time. For a business that has been around this long I would've thought they'd have figured out how to handle that.  That was a poor excuse for letting us wait 30 minutes past when they were "plating" our food for us to actually get it, without giving us the courtesy of checking in to let us know some mistake had been made. The place was swarming with servers, if ours had been overloaded we'd be able to be a little more understanding.   By the way the crispy salmon is a solid choice. The Alfredo with sausage was good as well. Our sons ravioli seemed like it used the gypsy sauce instead of a standard marinara and our little guy couldn't quite take it.

itspTElS3zT2xe1QzJlQFA.text: AMAZING food!!! We had a wonderful time here. Our server Tony and was the best, he recommend some of the most delicious dishes on the menu..   My ribeye steak fiorentine was so tender a juicy so was the steak flambe. We also shared a dish of homemade fettuccine alfredo.  The cannoli was the best ended to the dinner, you also get a t-shirt when you order it.  Call ahead for the free limo ride to and from your hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Cannoli!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A side of Fettucine Alfredo
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Flambé

yjnxuexTWOR-nxS06rWn9A.text: Great dinner place to hit for authentic late-late night Italian food. The service from Stephan was wonderful. He was attentative and well versed in the menu options. He gave great recommendations and was quick. The pizza was great and the pasta was super cheesy. The pasta was light on the lobster for the price as it had lobster flavor but not many pieces of lobster in the dish, but the flavor was Great! We frequent Vegas and since they're open till 5am we will definitely be back!!

yBfD9hvtLoFkHYhoTiR81Q.text: Old Vegas gem off the strip.  Fantastic service and live music.  Chicken Parmesan is a winner, enough for two people.  Monday wine specials can't be beat - make sure to make a reservation for this locals hangout, restaurant is small.

_2_or4adVdspZ-Jcg4ZE2g.text: We loved Casa Di Amore.  We started with drinks.  My companions had the express cocktail and loved it.  We started with calamari and bruschetta.  For my entree I had the Baked Mostaccioli.  It was delicious.  The server was great.  I'd say this was a 4.5 out of 5 stars.  My only disappointment was that there was no lemon cake on the menu :(.  Eat here!

7c6wCt_UrvyIKSqZ48rdNw.text: The food was great. The service was outstanding. It was loud because of the live entertainment, but it also added to the fun experience. I had veal parm, and my friend had gnocchi with white wine cheese sauce. We also started with a side of meatballs. Everything was excellent. I did wish I had gotten the marinara instead of the meat sauce on my pasta. The marinara on the meatballs was much better.

-zcW7_oy_rYGfEKEO90sTQ.text: The ambiance makes up for anything else you might not like. I am a foodie but picked this particular place based on other yelp reviews - how could I resist the chance to step back in time to old-school Vegas? Holding True to its reputation, Casa Di Amore had a two-person band cranking out tunes old and new, taking requests, and flirting with the audience. Our server was attentive and helpful and while I wouldn't give the pizza 5 stars, the Osso Bucco and Cioppino were quite authentic.

nCYelqRSJHI7XkblbPbATA.text: The worst meal that I ever had. The bread was not fresh. The baked macaroni was dry and tasteless.

HJHc3CFAHMsjM1XnZr9OsA.text: Excellent restaurant! Went to dinner here for my bachelorette party and it was amazing! The food was delicious and the service was excellent! Loved how they played live music too! Also, they drove us back for free!

te0j7k9vomW-5xmW3BWcTA.text: Was recommended this place by a fellow lover of eggplant and I'm glad it was.  Everything we tasted was amazing. The staff was amazing. The ambiance was amazing.  We'll be back for certain.

lJs2cqiNAslObyNMk0a6Iw.text: We come here every time we're in town, great food and wonderful service I highly recommend it!

tj4RXpbvRbuuXjdA1h_8Lg.text: I looooooooove Casa Di Amore!!!! We always stop in and have dinner if we're in Vegas! Antipasto for two is always amazing and it's a lot of food! I always get the Parm so I'm not sure about anything else. What I do know is that it's good and it gets busy call and make a reservation.

ObrAj8MFxyOz_w-NHxeDqA.text: We loved this place!  From the amazing staff to the two band members, it was a wonderful experience    The  spaghetti is a must as well as the cannoli for dessert! You wil feel as if you stepped back in time to the "old" Las Vegas days....

0u3buQQCFeqJtuNdVR6p8w.text: I absolutely adore this place!!  I've visited this establishment with three different loved ones and have yet to have a single disappointment!  I took my mom here about a week ago for a dinner date and she said multiple times that the chicken parmigiana has to be the best she's ever had.  I definitely agree!  The price point is a little high, but comparable to other unique Italian dining experiences.  The portions are very big, and the food tastes just as good the next day after being heated up at home..  Whatever you do, have dessert!  I had this chocolate molten cake and my mom had the spumoni, both were equally amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake, just wish it came with vanilla ice cream!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spumoni
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmigiana

ug4jPOa99Tp0BX_YgW7EZw.text: Service is always great! Staff is super friendly and quick! Food is amazing and you get what you pay for and more! Plus the live music! Very traditional Italian style! Totally feels like a scene out of Goodfellas! I love this place, can never go wrong here!

TEJmcR0kaI6MMbId-799-g.text: We have been coming in here for over 12 years and it never disappoints. Great atmosphere and great food. It's always hopping and busy so expect a lively experience. Be prepared for a great meal and a great time. We will be coming back here forever.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The band is great and the atmosphere is second to none.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ftScYsDTIUe0EXJPGHT4pw.text: The service was amazing I really recommend it for pizza with the special hot sauce that they provide  and the egg plant Parmesan

4RWFgGiJBCqO9jkaVGR-Pw.text: We stopped for a couple of nights in Vegas on our way to Scottsdale AZ for Spring Training.  After checking around for dinner places to celebrate our 25th anniversary, we decided on Casa di Amore based on other Yelpers' reviews.  We wanted someplace off the Strip that locals might go to.  And boy, did Casa di Amore deliver! It looked & felt like old Vegas, during the Rat Pack days.  The decor, the entertainment, the 'feel'; it has it all.  An added bonus was it was half-price wine Monday.  ALL bottled wines are half price!    The service was above & beyond from our waitress, Lynn.  She let us taste a couple of wines before buying. (She also let me try the gnocchi before I ordered but asked me not to tell so this is our little secret.)  Hubby had the rib eye with cabernet demi-glaze & peppercorn sauce. It was cooked to perfection. I had the gnocchi florentine with prosciutto in a white wine cream sauce. Lynn said we can request any ingredients be added or removed so I added sauteed mushrooms.  M-M-M!  Desert was a wonderful tiramisu.  The live entertainment was a two-man combo, keyboard & drums. They looked like they could have played the Sands or the Stardust way back when. The dinner music just adds that little 'something' to make the night special.

Y8yFrvqf4VfarcSO9mYGpA.text: I love this place.  Very traditional home cooked like Italian food.     I had a friend try the steak and oh it was incredible and tender with a demiglaze.  I will have to order that for myself sometime, but I get distracted by the baked Mostaccioli frequently.  I tried the baked lasagna, but it was not a solid lasagna slice like you would expect.  It was loose, disappointing.  I tried my friends vegetarian meatball dish and the vegi meatballs were actually quite good.  I am a meat eater and I may order some for my meal next time.  Basil flavored.  Cocktails are really good here.  All sorts of flavors.  My favorite part: I love the 60's feel with lounge musicians.   The night gets better the later it gets. They will even pick your group up at hotels, but not residences.  Too bad for me.  At least the walk isn't too far.  I hope this place never changes.  It just feels so good to be here.  The staff is super friendly and I will be coming back here for a long time.  If you are looking for a quiet place to go, this is not it.  It is fine for children to come if they can handle noise and people.  Good place overall, good food.  I bring all my friends here when they visit, or just when I need somewhere fun to go with my husband after a long work day.

dPgMWheMZuw_sURlJ_iKyw.text: Whatb a great little Italian restaurant.  Had dinner there last night and there was a live band playing Xmas music.  The restaurant is a old time vegas  feel to it.  The food is excellent.  Most italian restaurants cook northern italian, this one has a Sicillian flair.  Since I am from NY and Italian, giving this restaurant 5 stars says a lot!

pHxWgyacQ8Junr0HMuxNTw.text: Awesome classic Vegas Italian restaurant. I will definitely return. Lovely band. Romantic place for lovers.

nHoil0qA2EHNLKlm8mkq3Q.text: Great food, atmosphere & service. The fried calamari is the best in Vegas. Don't forget to have a cannoli and get a t-shirt on the house.

4rb9pw7-zJI52YG4GKNKbA.text: Awesome Italian Food! Moving from NJ I know some good Italian food . This place is the best I've had in Vegas. Great old Vegas atmosphere with live music every time I've ever been. The service was great also! Highly recommend Casa Di Amore :)

yqUZtTxuG3PyY3dl7tATdg.text: My husband and I went here while we were in Las Vegas. It was my first time!! I LOVED this restaurant and it will be a favorite, when we go to Vegas! The food was great, there's live entertainment and out waiter, Brad, made the night!! I HIGHLY recommend going here!!!

E9-_hDIgk1ckDPgThX1E4A.text: In town for a convention and looking for some good Italian not on the strip. Found this place on Yelp (as I so often do) and was for the most part not disappointed.   Staff was very friendly and service was good. My drink never ran empty, dishes were cleared promptly and the server was gracious.   The live music was a nice touch. I arrived around 6pm and the place was pretty empty but by 7:30pm the place was packed. It was quite loud which made for a good atmosphere and since I was by myself it didn't really bother me but it might be hard for people trying to have conversation.   The lobster ravioli and Caesar salad were good, as was the warm bread. The exotic bomba, which is tropical sorbet in a white chocolate shell was quite delicious.   The reason I gave four stars instead of five was the shrimp scampi. It was just ok. I love shrimp scampi and this just didn't hit the spot. Maybe next time I would stick to a standard pasta and sauce dish. Based on the service and all the other items I would recommend it and would go again.

-9fJ5kY6WQyZ6mgjPZEmzw.text: My second favorite Italian place in LV. Great good, good service, and "old Vegas" atmosphere. Try it, you will like it.

AFE1xT10mlpmaJNUktOSoA.text: Fantastic food and great servers!  Very fun atmosphere. The live music was fantastic. Our server took lots of pics on our phones for us and we didn't even ask.  It is an awesome restaurant.

XLcBXPba_atrz5YAp1iC6w.text: This place was really quite good. I'm giving them a rating of three stars for a couple reasons. One the place tries to sell itself as being a little higher class than what it really is. It's in a seedier end of town actually not that nice inside.  Having said that, the food was quite good. The sauce was good, garlic bread also very good, and they had a surprising prawn appetizer which they wrapped in bacon and served with a peanut caramel sauce.  All in all a good spot, just know that if the prices were a little lower and you have a better understanding of where you're going it makes for a better experience. No need to dress up

8UoiAWmD5qnmvqGJaFucsw.text: This place is awesome. "Vegas the way it used to be" is there slogan and they are spot on. Great food, great ambiance, great service, and great entertainment. Diandre provide absolutely great service. Can't wait to come back!

AyyQqXRuSH-NhurMpzcI3w.text: I have been coming here since I moved to Vegas in 2006. I love the food here. I've tried maybe 3 plates to be honest, once I ordered the Shrimp alla Vodka it was all over. That's literally the only thing I've ordered since my third time there. It used to be 24 hour food, then it stopped being 24 hours and went to 3 am - 10 am bar only, now I'm not sure what it is because I haven't honestly been there in about a year. But I think about it daily, and wish that it was closer to where I live or drive past for work so I could go there for food. The last time I was there it was the same waiter that served me 10 years before, and just about every time I'd been after my first, and he not only remembered me but covered the cost of my desserts as well. I recommend this place to anyone coming to Vegas looking for an "authentic" meal, but also to anyone that lives in LV that hasn't been here yet. This place has both ambiance, with the 2 person band playing old Sinatra classics, but the locked front door and open backdoor with security checking you in feeling like you're something special for knowing one of the few LV secrets left in town. The food, let's be honest, is better than whatever the cr@p was you ate at the casino last night. If you're a local, you know that because you don't go to casinos anymore. The ambiance is like a 1970's gangster get together with Sinatra wannabe's crowing in the background. Not to make the singers sound bad, but nobody is Sinatra except Sinatra, so F off haters. They do their best, but that's all they can do is their best. Nobody is Sinatra except Sinatra. Story end. The food is better than anything you'll get at some overpriced Strip extravaganza. It's not new, or special, just the best. If you want the best, come here. The locals know it, and if you don't and you're a local, rethink your life. You don't truly love Italian food until you've been here.

arHnF9g-2pFamIWxcjF3Wg.text: This is my favorite place to eat of all restaurants I have ever tried. The atmosphere is fun. Go with a date and it's romantic. Go with friends and it's fun. Host a group of people and it's even more fun! Can be snuggled in a booth or take over the center of the place with your group. Can sit up at the small bar too. The waiters have always been what seem to be handsome Italian men and the most fun servers. This place reminds me of a venue that would be in a mob movie. Has live talented music.  The food is some of the best I have tasted. The Garlic Loaf is to die for! Alfredo is my favorite. And the limo ride to and from the restaurant is complimentary with a tip to the driver. FOOD ALLERGY- I was planning a small party here and they offered to get special ingredients so all who had food allergies could enjoy the food.

j1WR2jfOlJUP6HuuZSrQRw.text: Tony was amazing, the oso bucco is the best in Vegas hands down with a risotto that leaves you wanting more!

ljGZwTsWCzUWnqemIEMciA.text: We took our friends to this wonderful place last night and had a great time.  Randy and Paul were there playing some great music and took our requests which made the wives happy.  Great food, great music, life is good!

aQxUmdM66YW0QFFi1mTrsA.text: We went here last night and ordered the lasagna and vodka penne pasta also the cannoli and got a free shirt! The wine is half off on Mondays on full bottles and we ordered our favorite type of Italian wine sangovase. Tony was our server and he was one of the best servers I've ever had. We loved the experience so much I can't get over it!... We will be back ASAP!!!!!!!! Total the night was 100$ which was great for a bottle of wine, dessert and 2 entries

UkMzH4RlOj_XTvwuW08KbQ.text: What a bizarre little restaurant. Friend and I were driving down Trop and craving Italian. Saw this place out of the corner of my eye and decided to swing in. Didn't have high hopes because of the name (seemed a little cheesy), but figured it was worth a shot. There is some sort of inner-dimensional time shifting porthole just outside the front door, because as soon as you step in the restaurant you transported to Brooklyn circa 1978.   The place was packed, and I mean wall to wall. Grabbed a seat in the bar and just fell in "like" with the place. I can only describe the whole event as surreal. There was even a guy at the bar that looks like he was cast out of "Goodfellas." I still think he was paid by the restaurant to be there.   Service was good, ambiance was outstanding, food was 4/5 stars. Had stuffed ravioli, the cheese was great, but pasta was not great. Salad was very good with a house made dressing. Also ordered spaghetti with Gypsy sauce. They will warn you that it is spicy. Let me warn you, IT IS SPICY. I had to dilute it with marinara. Very good though, and the meat balls were great.   Would have given 5 stars but I thought it was a little pricey for both location and quality of food. Also, I am pretty sure my Johnny Walker Black was a Red. Might have been a mistake on the order from the noise of the festivities, but I got charged for a Black.   I would go back, mostly for the ambiance and that Gypsy sauce. I recommend it, but stay away from drinks or your bill will be high, high, high. And make sure you stroll through the bar to see if they have the "Goodfellas" guy there, he made my night just by his presence alone.

gJgWPWeH_gdQp08oq6VjEA.text: Live music till 10pm on week days. Good service. Antipasto was very good, nice selection of meat/cheeses. Sauteed mushrooms appetizer is worth passing on. Had veal and chicken francaise and both were tender but sauce was very heavy vs brothy,lemony, buttery it should be.  Theirs was more like the consistency of a hollandaise sauce. Good dessert. Overall good, I just live across town and came after a Rebel game cuz it was close to T&M. Would I travel across town? No, would I stop by if I was within 10 minute drive-yes.

gZxcYYhwMkXZO0o0GpJVZg.text: Went to Casa Di Amore on Saturday December 12, 2015. Great atmosphere in that it is great for groups or for a romantic date. There was great live music playing motown and a lot of Frank Sinatra.   We initially had a bad experience with service here. I made a reservation for four for 8pm, and we were not seated until 8:30p.m. The manager did not really acknowledge the fact that we were waiting so long. After our meal, the manager asked us how our experience was and I complained about the wait at the beginning. The manager gave us free desert, which to me made up for our initial bad experienced.  I am coming from NYC so I know good Italian food and am used to NYC prices. The prices here are around $25-30 per plate which is the typical NYC mid-range restaurant price. I ordered the Veal marsala and it was delicious. My father ordered the Veal francese and he found it to be very good. My mother and girlfriend had different scallop dishes and really enjoyed them.  One cool thing I learned is you can be picked up and dropped off by a limo for free from anywhere on the strip (obviously tipping the driver though) but you have to book in advance.   Overall I would say this is a very fun place to go, good food, good atmosphere and fair prices.

H8tDbEvMTVIvbcuwuoX9Ig.text: After seeing this place on Jersey Shore: Las Vegas, my boyfriend and I decided to give this place a try.   This place is hands down DELICIOUS! Upon entering the place, it has a good atmosphere with live music. My boyfriend and I seated right next to the live entertainment. Usually, with live entertainment, we would literally be screaming at each other, but this place this was not a problem. We were still able to talk to each other while the live entertainment is going on. Service was excellent.  We had their garlic loaf, chicken parmigiana and eggplant di amore.  Their must-try dish from this place: GARLIC LOAF!   Overall, this place is AMAZING! I would definitely come back here.

Ezksvp00IJZn_glaVBKdog.text: You must, must, must go to this place! I think it is one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas... ok I've only been here 5 times. Before you read further and you plan to go, you must agree and be able to leave any funky attitudes at home.  Debbie and Donnie Downer will get lost and wind up at Denny's.  If you're ready here goes...  Ok... its not close to the strip and actually the first time, you will think its too far and that you've made a mistake.  But don't give up!!! I repeat, Do Not Give Up. What you will get for your time and effort is a great meal in a happy place with people who are celebrating life.  Really can you ask for more? If you do Shame on you! You've missed the point about why we love going out to eat!  Ok here is my break down.  1) Surprise factor- the outside and location are the perfect counterpoint to the inside. 2)The front desk is friendly and quick.  3) The calamari is fantastic 4) the drinks are great and reasonable 5) the portions are huge 6) the food is delicious- the meat sauce? Forgetaboutit! 7) the chicken marsala- excellent 8) order a dessert for $10 and you get a teeshirt. 9) the guys singing are "so on point" with tunes from the past. 10) if you want to, you can dance And 10- drum roll please  They have a shuttle to take you home.   How can this not turn into a perfect night? Ask yourself- don't we deserve this! And the answer is Yes, We Do!

il3RdlS0i2EdaaGfu_dfDQ.text: Went to celebrate a couple of birthdays and anniversaries this past Saturday and to start we got a complimentary ride to/from our hotel so we didn't have to drive. Craig the driver was great and gave us recommendations on what to order!  The ambiance is nice, just a little noisy but it wasn't a big deal and that was probably only due to people having conversations over the live music. Which was great!   The bread was warm and well toasted and the garlic butter made for a great start to our dinner. We ordered 3 baskets of bread which we ended up regretting because we couldn't finish our meal or we over ate by a lot! Haha! The clam chowder was delicious and so were the salads. The main course were all very delicious! I ordered the shrimp scampi yum! My brother ordered the seafood bowl (don't remember the name) but Craig recommended it and he loved it! My mom ordered fettuccine Alfredo (her fav) with shrimp and she loved it. My husband ordered chicken parmigiana and he said it was good. Finally my dad ordered one of the specials which was breaded chicken with veggies and I think (I didn't pay enough attention as I was really enjoying my dish) baked potato and it was good.  We never made it to dessert sadly. :(  Our waiter I think was Kyle...? (He's somewhat new in town) anyway, he was great! He was patient as we had him come back a few times for our order because we couldn't decide.   This was my husband's and my second time back and we'll be back!!  I just want to add that no one ordered steak because we went to a steak house the night before so not sure how that is but based on what we got I'm sure it's good! Price was good for what you get!  Hope you enjoy it as we did!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lhrKUMhrqHSdyY8fAFcGUQ.text: The food was excellent but our server - Tony - was terrible.  I ordered a glass of wine - which he totally ignored. I had to ask the water server for it.  Our dinner took forever- which I had to finally ask the water server why was everyone else getting their food amd 20 minutes later we still did not have ours?  Not once did "Tony" come by and explain why we did not have our food. The manager had to make sure we got after I had to complain.  AND our friend who was with us - was celebrating her birthday.  We let "Tony" know and - go figure - he forgot.   I totally recommed Case Di Amore but request any server but Tony.

SxfllRvnxJjIMGGhz6Oldg.text: Case di Amore was one of the best dining experiences I've ever had, it was a breathe of fresh air and pretty much out of this world. It started of with the restaurant sending a courtesy shuttle to our hotel to take us to the restaurant. Craig our driver was such a gentleman and very kind, we enjoyed the ride there almost as much as the food haha.   Once we got there, we felt like we were transported back to the 1940s. There was live music playing Sinatra's hits and the ambiance was incredible. It was very charming, we had to keep reminding ourselves that we were in Vegas. The staff were so warm and welcoming. We loved our waitress Claudia, who seemed to be very passionate about the food and excited to share it with us.   The food was out of this world! If there is one thing I could recommend, it is the garlic loaf. Cheese on the inside, cheese on the outside.. lots of cheese!!! The jumbo homemade ravioli with the meat sauce was made from scratch. It was some of the best Italian food I have ever had.   At the end of our meal, Alex (the owners wife) came by to check in on us. We talked for 15 minutes where she shared some of the history of the restaurant and her own background. She was so kind and accommodating.   If you want exceptional service, amazing food and a warm ambiance that makes you feel like your transported back to the 1940s, this is the place for you. We are already counting down until the next time we get to go there!

yK4-svNRAwMwwuweN_270w.text: Old school Vegas atmosphere meets some pretty good food and stiff drinks with live music geared toward the elderly, way too loud and none too hip which really put a damper on the ambience.  The fettuccine alla Pappasito was excellent, super flavorful Italian sausage amongst a bed of pasta with four cheese, sweet onion and wine sauce.  Delectable.  We also tried the gnocchi, which is in a similar sauce but that comes out just a little too salty from the prosciutto.  Still a good dish though.  Great bread and butter provided.  Drinks-wise we had a yummy chocolate martini and the mamma Mia margarita, the latter of which was very strong as well as tasty.  You get your moneys worth in the booze.  We split two desserts, both perfect - the chocolate souffle and the creme brulee.  Neither could have been better.  But, holy crap the awful live music.  So loud.  So "easy listening".  So...not good.  Think of the worst music your seventy year old parents listened to in the 70s sung by someone who didn't make it on his own and that's about accurate.   Tip:  If you are going to pay for live music at your restaurant it should be better than playing the radio and not so loud that diners can't comfortable converse without shouting.  I take a star away for the music, which is something I don't think I have ever done before but we were so glad when the guy went on break for a bit that we joked about whether we could tip him to take a longer break.  And every restaurant we have been to since that played some recorded rock music at a reasonable volume has garnered some extra appreciation from us.  Maybe find out when they don't have live music and go then?

WQ154Bk7WvH-jiJIrAFhrw.text: Have you ever seen the movie Casino?  That is exactly what this place reminds me of.  Low lit, a live two man band and very good food.  I don't need to go on and on about this restaurant because it doesn't need a lot of up sell. It's good.  That's all you need to know.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

igO1T8kOQ1fkP1n0_tTSXg.text: We have passed by this restaurant a million times before and finally stopped in last night. It has an old Vegas feel (in a good way). The lighting is dim, there's a bar in the back, and entertainment every night.    The live band was amazing playing oldies like, stand by me, sittin on the dock of the bay, and they even sang the ABC's to entertain my kids which luckily the crowd thought was funny as well.   The menu is big, they have it all! If there is an Italian dish you are craving you will find it here. They even have a kids menu. We ordered chicken parmigiana and osso buco. It was delicious!! Oh and the cannoli for dessert was so so good.  Service: the service was ok a little slow but ok. The one thing that angered me was, we were 5 people and a baby. The baby sat in a high chair... didn't order (she's 1 and ate off of our plates). But when we got our bill we were still charged the 20% gratuity because of the baby!!!! To me that is absolutely ridiculous.

IJyA_AZQA-6_1s0jsxci3g.text: I love the ambiance of the restaurant, the live music and the customer service was amazing. Food was so cheesy, the chicken parmigiana and the lasagna was delicious but it was too chessy for me. It was kinda pricy but servings were a decent size. I am going back for their gypsy pasta!!

Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

H2x7GxwKTS-65YjBNoZNgA.text: Okay everyone, listen up...I know the secret to avoiding shi**y service at Casa of love: come right when they open! I've been back at least three times since I wrote my original review and have thoroughly enjoyed each visit more than my last. When they first open, you're treated like kings, the food is prepared carefully with extra TLC and the tiki bar in the back is perfect after you eat!   My favorites: calamari, garlic cheese bread fo lyfe, veal parm, stuffed pork chops, antipasti platter/salad (HUGE) & the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo - their fettuccine is made in house which is even more special.   This is quite possibly my top three favorite Las Vegas restaurants. You should definitely go (and go early if you do)!

Kz7t0yHJZkL_BSOaXXbQ7w.text: 5 Stars definitely! This is off the beaten path a little bit, but if you're staying at a hotel on the strip, they will pick you up for dinner! This a total throw back to old classic Vegas. I love it.  Old pics of the strip, tufted leather booths. Great marinara sauce. Our waiter was a talker! Live entertainment in the evening, and there's a big tiki bar behind the restaurant (we have kids - we didn't go).  Anyway, the food was delicious and abundant! We had the calamari fritti, baked ziti, sausage, meatballs, steak.  All excellently prepared.  For my particular taste, everything was heavy on the salt, but the family did not seem to mind a bit.  We are definitely coming back.

crKzAd9ot5R742bQzyxwew.text: Service s 5 stars al the way.   Staff is great   The atmosphere and the live music are wonderful and the fact that they're open till 3 AM I love it  The food on True other hand.  Its not so great.  I live on the strip for the last two years I've never been here but I thought I'd come try it out  I had the spaghetti and meatballs and the meatballs were barely room temperature.     The meat sauce just didn't do it for me at all.  M  The Cesar salad tasted like maybe it was made an hour prior and chilled in the fridge it was a little soggy  Not sure if I'll be back

8xidB1Ac6o52PZBkCSeDdw.text: Have not done a 5 star review in a while but this place definitely deserves it . My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday we got here on a Sunday evening at 5pm got to park in front went in got greeted by a friendly staff and sat down almost immediately. They have pictures up of old Vegas ,actors and other stars all over the combination of brick wall and dim lighting definitely set a more romantic dinner atmosphere along with the music in the background and the live singer was setting up to get his show started . Wish I could have had some wine but I'm pregnant at the moment so it will have to wait .  The server was quick and so was the table runner we did not run out of anything or had any complaints they were aware we were on a time schedule and were fast .We got warm bread .  ordered the calamari the best I have ever had so meaty with a side of Marinara sauce ugh it was gone in 2 minutes!!!...our meals spaghetti and meatballs basic I know but every year on my bday I eat pasta yum the portion is so big I took left overs and still had enough for lunch and dinner next day .  He got the Rib Eye ripped right off the bone perfectly seasoned ...what rib eye ?! Lol plate was wiped cleaned .  The only thing was the water i don't like faucet water but that's not their fault I ordered a Diet Coke instead .  The food , the service , the ambiance deserves the 5 stars !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uFz6He_e4Y2uTT37BUOnLg.text: Every time we visit Vegas, we go to Casa! Great food, friendly waiters, old school entertainment makes the experience fun and memorable! Only complaint is Smitty the manager is no longer there! I miss Smitty!!

SRx88QQeix4QRFsLBTmFgw.text: My fiance and visit Casa Di Amore every trip to Vegas, and we are always impressed by the staff's presentation and commitment to providing customer with a wonderful experience. This year we decided to spend our Valentines eating at Casa Di Amore, we didn't call ahead for a reservation but showed up around 7 PM. We were told at first that that there are no tables and were no longer taking reservations. We completely understood. Although after waiting to see if there were any cancellations a staff member informed us that a table was prepared and was available.   Upon being seated they provided a complimentary chocolate heart candy box to my fiance which made our time at the restaurant that much better. We had a wonderful time as usual dinning at the restaurant. Even with no reservation, the restaurant being max capacity we didn't feel at any time rushed. This just shows you the level the restaurant operates to create a great experiencing to guests. As usual our plates were wonderful, and the atmosphere perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

hcLNnxy1QPhjqhcnAEVbtA.text: Their slogan is Vegas like it used to be. The food is very authentic Italian and videos of Dean Martin, Frank Sinatra and Elvis play on the walls. An excellent singer/pianist plays old songs from the era. Order the dessert and get a free shirt! The spumoni bomb, lava chocolate cake and cannoli are amazing. I had the shrimp fra diablo very spicy and great. This was my Mother's Day dinner and it was awesome. The staff is also attentive and cheerful

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert and FracDiablo

sRRjZMfRa6-xGAvzUnzXNw.text: Excellant food and service!!   Our server Josh was the best!  He was up top of everything we needed all night.  Came in from New York for a family reunion and was so impressed.   Asked Josh to take some pictures for us and he even was able to get Shania Twain perfectly in the background without her knowing!  Do have pictures of the appetizers.  But we had the rice ball, mussels in red sauce, fried calamari. And the baked clams.  Never have I gotten 18 calms in one order for such a great price.  Every thing was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ciappino-  lobster, mussels, crab, shrimp and more in light tomato broth.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini with white calm sauce
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La bomba.   A great big ball of ice cream covered in chocolate.

apodUcuf6revY9eRmtNAMg.text: Went to eat at this place with my husband. Been here for years and surprised we are now just trying it. Place was clean and staff was friendly.  I was not able to see their bathroom. At the time we went there was live music which gave the romantic feel.  This place is good for a dinner date...Drinks after work.. or with family.  For food: Bread was mediocre.  1. Hot antipasto platter: mozzarella sticks and calamari were good.. but I personally loved the shrimp and the ravioli the best.  The nation's marinara sauce it comes with is absolutley amazing. 2. Osso Buco was very tender and juicy. Definitely recommend! 3. Cioppino: if you're a seafood person this is an awesome soup dish. I'm not really into tomato based broth but this broth was delicious and very addicting. Definitely a must try. 4. Side of meatballs: if you don't have a dish that has them you can order these on the side. Very tasty and hearty. The meat sauce that comes with this compliments very well. I found the bread useful here  5. Tiramisu: even after being so full.. this dessert was finished. Made with love and total perfection.  Also lighter and fluffier than other tiramisu I have had  Overall the place  is great.. I would've given 5 stars..if not for these few things: parking is not the best... place is very crowded... found it very loud. Note we did come at a prime dinner time.  Hope this helps! Don't forget Monday is half priced bottled wine!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot antipasto platter
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs

5atI9OZomRHo_NzB4J55aQ.text: Had dinner here on Christmas Eve 2018. Great atmosphere, feels like you're in vintage Las Vegas! We sat right in front of the  entertainment- they were great! The food was superb, I had Chicken Marsala & for dessert- the Chocolate souffle cake   P.S. the service was excellent!

HUTulfP3G05djqHkZhY-5A.text: This off strip Italian restaurant was a gem of a find.  The interior was dark red and there was a musician singing and playing the piano.  The noise level is a bit loud but the food more than made up for that.  Our party of seven  ordered fried calamari and arancini rice balls for appetizers and they were amazing.    Our main dishes included osso bucco,  linguini with white clam sauce,  seafood pasta,  stuffed pork chops,  cioppino,  and pasta Luciano.  The osso bucco was fork tender and very tasty.  The seafood pasta came with plenty of seafood and pasta.  The cioppino came piled high with shrimp,  calamari,  clams,  crab claws,   lobster tail,  and mussels all steaming in a very flavorful broth. Probably my favorite was the pasta Luciano which had a spicy tomato base with tons of calamari and linguini.    For dessert we split the spumoni ball and tiramisu.  The giant spumoni ball was a huge ball of spumoni ice cream coated in chocolate which was delicious.  The tiramisu was creamy with just the right amount of espresso.    Also,  this restaurant offers transportation to and from the restaurant from your hotel/resort so you can drink at this wonderful establishment and not be a designated driver.

nHMMM3MbxF105wv8pGNo_g.text: Super fun place. Great food, awesome live music and a totally old school Vegas vibe. Oh yeah, and they have kick ass little tiki bar on the patio! Awesomeness all around!

-wwZvH2hJlnrbuqXAEXxWg.text: Two words: Osso Buco.  I didn't even order this dish, my husband did, and the little bites I had were heavenly.  This is your place for delicious, homestyle Italian comfort food. Portions are deceivingly large, I suggest trying to share something.  I was so sad to leave half my entree because I had no fridge or micro in my hotel room.  I should mention that this place is noisy, even when the musicians are not singing, so don't expect to have any quiet conversation here.

LXDms_F6qhu4uiWUaojtCQ.text: Decent Tiki drinks at $11 a pop- okay sounds good, it's Vegas. Hour and a half behind reservation- okay I'm hungry but I'll wait since you said I was next on the list. Serve the people sitting next to us at the bar the full menu because they complained-fine I'll deal with it, some people like to make a scene.   Okay dude got here after us, reservation was after us, complained and got seated and upgraded before us because he made a scene.   Lady is now complaining and about to get the manager. Now I'm getting the hang of this. Just complained and made a whole thing and look I'm really getting seated this time.  So if you want to make a scene, yell before a heavy meal, and get all worked up then this is the place for you.  Food was mediocre.

0gyL-sSyLJPQFc9o6sCyJg.text: WOW!! Such an unforgettable experience at Casa Di Amore! Tony our waiter was amazing! The chicken Parmesan is delicious! I ordered mine with angel hair pasta- the sauce is so good! My husband ordered the Steak Flambe with the bernaise sauce- rib eye! It was delish! For dessert we got the cannoli (shells are flown in from Brooklyn, NY weekly and they stuff with cream to order) and we also got the Spinoni (flown in from Italy!) WOW!! Desserts were amazing! The live music is Motown jazz and excellent! Will definitely return soon!! Plus, I also got a free t-shirt with my cannoli dessert!!:)

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z--1kbhuF2iD_Ie7ekjxqw.text: If I were speaking strictly food alone, this is a 4 star place.  I'm giving it 5 stars for the experience  - that of a 1950s style eatery complete with live music and a very attentive and friendly staff.  We made reservations on a Wednesday night, arrived early and were still able to get seated relatively easily around 7pm.  It get more crowded as the night progresses.  Casa Di Amore has a number of classic Italian dishes.  We got the Mini Oso Bucco ($14), Calamari ($14), Gypsy Pasta ($26), Chicken Marsala ($27) and the Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto ($23).  All portions were quite generous, and in fact I could have eaten the Mini Oso Bucco as a main.  We had freshly baked house bread that came with garlic butter plus oil and vinegar.    The Oso Bucco was very tender and the risotto it came on was excellent. I definitely would recommend this dish!  I liked the Calamari but it was borderline too crunchy.  Probably the "worst" dish was the Gypsy pasta.  If you're used to Thai food, it's not that spicy - has a nice kick, but I didn't find it that special and probably wouldn't order that again.  Overall, a fun place to take friends from out of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari appetizer - well seasoned, borderline on the too crunchy side
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gypsy Pasta - linguine with a spicy marinara.  This was ok, I probably wouldn&#39;t order it again
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto - home made gnocchi with prosciutto, white wine and spinach in a four cheese sauce

Unps5eJKkelmqJtFI6Encg.text: Best Italian restaurant in Vegas I've found to date! Everything is homemade, amazing service, and live entertainment. I always bring out of town guests here and locals.

YAgbfRJ7ewOb7bADVca1bA.text: This place was great - if you're looking for a semi fancy off strip restaurant with amazing pay and attentive service, give this a try. I made a reservation for 8 and they had us sat, wined and dined in no time, plus there was a cute jazz band as well as a fun tiki bar patio out back. Good times!

el4sRh7_qNL7zq0JZXrqWA.text: Went here for my son's birthday back in June. It was good, but not great as the reviews suggested. We ordered the garlic bread that everyone raved about - it was similar to what I make at home. It was good, but nothing special. The Caesar Salad was HORRIBLE. Nothing good about the salad at all, and I love Caesar salad. The entree's were all good, except my order was wrong. I ordered Shrimp Fettuccini and they brought me chicken. When I told them that wasn't what I ordered, the waiter said it was....the other 3 in our group all said "no, she said shrimp." Anyhow, they remade the order, but it took me so long to get it everyone else was done eating. Whatever my son ordered, he liked it but commented "It's good, but for $26, it isn't any better than the $14 version I've gotten at (another restaurant)."  With that said, the Shrimp Fettuccini was AMAZING. Probably the best I've ever had, which pretty much made up for everything.  The restaurant/bar is pretty loud. At first I found it really annoying, but after a few minutes, I got used to is and it really wasn't an issue.  I would eat here again just for the Shrimp Fettuccini. I would pass on the garlic bread, the Caesar salad, etc.

B_qkL0B47_k6zsj_0Xv7KQ.text: A little slice of heaven. A wonderful New York style Italian Restaurant.  Big portions, fabulous food. Highly recommended. . We will be back soon

W_GgkHJHyxZ6aLY94IvGDg.text: I got the Penne Vodka with a side of meatballs. The Pasta was nothing special, and not worth the $26 price tag for sure. Meatballs were very good. My boyfriend got the Chicken Parm which was delicious. Good atmosphere and very nice staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne Alla Vodka w/Side of Meatballs. $30 Price Tag-Not worth it.

Ywkg78EZ2RotWb3wkrIslw.text: With 8 guys our here on a golf trip we can always stay on the strip and eat in the hotels upper echelons type places but being adventurous we always try some local places with flavor.  Off we go to this highly reccomended place where locals go to feel old style Vegas with pictures of the rat pack everywhere and a two piece jazz combo play nightly songs from the days gone by.    Arrive and don't know what I was expecting as far as ambiance but it is really nothing much as far as esthetics go here.   Seated a long table and can see this is a problem as the normal tables for 2 persons they have 3 tables for 8 of us having 1/2 the guys on table corners and all squished together.  After a little prodding and the fact we were ready to leave we are moved to a table / booth large enough to accommodate us. Not a good start.   A lot of Vegas locals and kids? At 8PM on a Thursday night.  From gym shorts to nice outfits is the motiff while the majority of the place looks like they just left LA Fitness.  Nice restaurant put on a pair of jeans and get rid of the cutoff sleeveless shirt for god sake.   Wine list is in short Awful. No Value whatsoever, no variety of any substance, what is there has no vintages and anything worth wild is completely overpriced.  Order some wine which takes forever to arrive as hot fresh bread with garlic butter is provided.   Menu is large, diverse and very good looking hope the food makes up for the other issues.  On we go to the food.   Salads Cold Antipasto for 2 $20.00 good, with some meats and cheeses but no top shelf cold cuts here.  For $20.00 you some Procuitto would be nice.
