Cesar was pedestrian   $11.00 Stuffed Pepper with meat and cheese, marinara and rice was absolutely Fantastic best meal on the table.   $5.00 sausage and peppers side as an appetizer was delicious   $14.00 shrimp wrapped in Procuitto then baked in filo dough was a don't order again appetizer.   $18.00 Lobster Raviloli were good.   $11.00 Spinach Salad with Honey dressing as good as it gets.   Entrees:   Veal Osso Bucco $43.00 over Risotto with sauce was truly a work of art. (3 of those were consumed)   Basic Chicken Parm was good certainly better options on this menu.   Veal Marsala was fresh tender and tasty as was the Veal Francais.   Seafood Frutte di Marre in White sauce was fantastic, fresh and full of taste.   Stuffed Pork Chops with Procuitto and mozerella were good but not great though the brandy cream Sauce on top was delicious.   Note both bottles of wine were absolutely awful.   Service was OK nothing spectacular while the little band did entertain us with music during our 2 hour meal.   All and all not pricey and food was good to very good. Service was average and atmosphere in my opinion was a little lacking.     All and all a good experience, and certainly may visit again if local, but for 8 guys used to the finer things in life, I certainly believe we can find better venues.

5Bqn-3ynPVJamchxG7sgOQ.text: I can't believe how many 5 star reviews are on here. Yelp has failed me for the first time in ever! I tried this place 3 times in about 3 months I started this review in Jan and thought I'll wait.....give it one more try 3rd time's a charm right, it's not, at least in this case. This was from my experience back in February.  I had faith Yelpers! We had a reservation at 8:15 we arrived at 8:17 I know a couple minutes late, but the parking was not convenient, and it took us a minute to walk over there. We gave the girl our name, and waited. and she told us we could wait at the bar, unfortunately my mom cannot be at a bar for personal reason, so we declined, but there was no where to sit or wait. after about 10 minutes I asked when we would be seated and the girl told me 'when we have a table' and told me I could wait at the bar, for a third time now; and at some point the manager walked over and told us we could wait at the bar, and we were in the way; but we couldn't be at the bar and there was no where else for us to be. Well we finally got seated when we started discussing going somewhere else by this time it's 8:45. So Much for reservations. Then there was the awful service, we sat for another 10 minutes before the server came over to get our drink order, and rushed through the specials. and treated us like we were bothering him when we wanted to order an appetizer. Once we did that we didn't see the server for another 15 minutes. And only after I went to the front to ask if he could be sent over because we wanted to order. Finally we did,  the manger delivered it, and asked how everything was. So I told him it was a bit disappointing because of what had happened. He said he would take care of our appetizers for this inconvenience. I asked for fresh grated Parmesan for my gnocci but they don't have that. I thought is was a pretty common thing to ask for in a nice Italian restaurant. Well the food was good, not great, definitely not worth the wait and lack of customer service. At the end of our meal the manager ended up not taking our appitizer off the bill. I thought he must have forgotten considering it was extremely busy. So I told the server he asked the manger and came and told us the manger didn't tell us that. I asked if I could speak to him after waiting another 15 minutes just to speak to the manager he came back and told me there was nothing wrong with their service and he wouldn't be taking anything off the bill. This is what made me decide NEVER again. I didn't ask for anything or expect anything, but don't tell me you're going to do something and then not do it. Especially the manager. Aren't the employees gauging how to treat customers based on their treatment of customers. I did call and complain the next day. But still nothing. No invitation back no offering to give us anything. Nothing but we'll look into this....great.

PIGaG1Y_x7gMvxThB10q_A.text: The best! THE nicest people work here and shared their restaurant with us.   Joanne makes an amazing cold, dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives. She couldn't be sweeter.   Paul is the entertainment director and plays the drums while they belt out Sinatra and Deano hits. He's dapper and quick with a smile.   If you're looking for classic, old school Las Vegas this is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cold martini, beautiful woman, and live band playing great tunes - yes please!

V8e0ShM-qB2_Kwb8UEMXmQ.text: This is by far one of the most delicious Italian restaurants I've been too. The appetizers, the complementary bread, the cheese bread, the entrees are incredibly delicious! Not to mention, they have live music, it's a great family friendly restaurant outside the Las Vegas strip! It's definitely worth the wait and reservation! Take a visit, and enjoy!

Vbp-yPhrrGBdKMYqzC8ScA.text: Great Italian find off the strip. The staff treats you like old friends and even arranged for their limo bus to take us to our show. Best cosmopolitan I had in Vegas (without the crazy prices) and food was like eating at my Italian friends house. The live music transported you back to the Sinatra days. A great mix of people both young and older. We will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy cosmopolitan!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GgARYriHrCYIlMzVlI0qgg.text: Best Italian restaurant in Vegas.  Good drinks, good food, music and ambience.  Very classy!

SWgNPi41VB7_d2U4Gy4ntg.text: I'm a little tough to please when it comes to foodas I have an italian grandma that spoils us with home cooked italian food. I just feel like the food is a little over priced for what it is. The waitresses seemed a little bit curt, perhaps cause it was a busy night. They had a jazz band playing, so that was neat. Their cannolis are delicious!

ZhcwZ71r-nMcqblBilpa8A.text: Just went to Casa di Amore and discovered Tiki di Amore. Gem of a spot in an unlikely location at Topaz and Tropicana (between Eastern and Pecos) ... Island vibe, comfy seating, great menu (half price all the time ... killer value), cool music, TV's is just the right spots, little hideaway huts ... 2 thumbs up for this place. Loved it ... definitely worth the trip

i36IhleiguqT9hXCHPdO-Q.text: Awesome Frank Sinatra atmosphere. Love the live music playing when we went.

1txvXKahhVf5ySx6ssqS6A.text: This place is a must see in Vegas! The food is phenomenal and the service is out of this world. This is True Italian how it should be. The bartenders are great and the band plays great music for you to get a real feel of old school vegas. You have to check it out! And they have a tiki bar out back that has half priced drinks and half priced pizzas.

xbJMLA2jeZ9O9Ts1xH-VCw.text: Here are just a few things I did not see on the other reviews. First as has been mentioned good Italian food but for off strip a bit pricey. They are closed on Tuesday which you dont see very often. They are opened until 5 am in the morning. From 11PM until 5AM there is half off Pizzas and Cocktails. And yes they sell Pizza and its quite good.

kqw1UYgiaNbmeNpRlUt73w.text: Half locals, half tourists, this place perfectly captures a 1960's New Jersey Italian restaurant. It's that red sauce Italian all the way, but damn good. The atmosphere is perfect off-strip Vegas: it simulates some other time & place, but does it so authentically that you'd almost think that this is what a Northeast Corridor Italian restaurant is still like. Which is to say: the locals nay not even fully realize how impossible it is to find a joint like this in the rest of the US anymore. Mostly, it's the most enjoyable restaurant experience I've ever had in Las Vegas.

9O8pj6wx-p8UTskxtgOo6Q.text: Amazing service and even better food! Great atmosphere! Definitely a new favorite for date night!

7FpQeWsJtH2AxT8PCpODHw.text: Hands down best Alfredo I've ever had in my life, no joke! Ambience was great too, tables are kind if close but has very homey feel and live band was good, tool any request. Is my go-to spot for romantic dinner next time I'm in Vegas!

18NFSML2pYz9mCjzUdrFlg.text: This place has old school Italian charm and ambiance, from the decor and band music to the service and the home cooked meals.  Nothing fancy which suits us fine - because this is what an Italian restaurant should be, non-pretentious.  if you've been to Little Italy in NYC, you know what I'm talking about.  We were seated at a table in front of the band that plays soft, easy listening music.  There was a large table near us and they looked like they are from The Sopranos -- awesome!  The waiter was friendly and attentive.  We ordered the calamari to start - The waiter gave us bruschetta on the house because we waited slightly longer for our calamari but the wait was worth it. Calamari cooked perfectly and was lightly battered ..we have not had it like this since we lived in NYC.  The home-made marinara sauce was perfect!  I had the shrimp fra diavolo - delish!  My bf had spaghetti with meatballs and the marinara sauce - he finished it dry with the bread.  Hey, if you can't find good Italian on the strip, or can't stand waiting on line for dinner, this IS the place to go!!  We will be returning on our next trip to Vegas.

TnSrB4kh3aw_1SDuqEvzrg.text: Finally, a place to go in Vegas that's not totally overrun by tourists and has food and atmosphere that rival some of our better restaurants in Chicago.   The decor and ambiance were outstanding. It has a somewhat over the top Rat Pack era Vegas thing going on, which was great. There was a live singer the Saturday night we went. I half expected the ghost of Dean Martin to breeze in the door any second. This restaurant is relatively far off the Strip down East Tropicana but they will purportedly send a limo to pick you up. I didn't see this limo but if it is anything like the decor in this place, you'll most certainly turn a few heads as it picks you up in front of the Bellagio.   The food is traditional Italian. Lots of pasta dishes that you'll probably be very familiar with. Service was very good. Our waiter was attentive and the items we ordered came fast. They ran out of Cannelloni that we ordered and threw in a free desert because of it. Nice. Old school service.  The lasagna they did have was nicely done. Plenty of meat in meat sauce, and cheese in the product. Well seasoned and flavor. It was served at the right temperature - not scalding hot like many lasagna dishes you get.   The eggplant was pan fried and then served with red sauce, cheeses and a side of pasta. It too was very good. Portions are not ridiculously large like they can be in some traditional Italian restaurants like this, which is good because if you're staying in a hotel, you obviously can't take anything home.   If you're staying on the Strip, a trip to the Casa will be a nice way to get away from the tourist throngs for a few hours. A definite thumbs up!

QBhHDqfxqE8fY7P2hXvlGw.text: You cant turn down a free limo ride! I went here for my birthday, and everything was excellent. Service was top notch, great food, and live music. I would highly recommend eating here.

DGhpnCtcm2gGaOpQ2zLNbg.text: Wanted to like this place. Took the family here for dinner. The entertainment was the best part of the night. Food was average @ best. Super expensive for what it was and compare both the quality and $ to the strip. It was loud which was not quite what we were expecting. If this is old Vegas I'm happy to keep it in the past.

i9yZNsSJyiYz1bz8An2eVA.text: I savored every damn bite. Old school Italian. We stuck with the simple dishes and each was 'slow down mouth this is the good stuff' damn damn damn with a side of hot damn.

ipOqupv3gjcl-R4uif3rXg.text: came here last week around 330pm only to find out they have new hours..  'open 24 hours' on the huge sign outside.. but 'new hours 4pm...' on the paper on the door. booooo! i couldnt wait.. so i came back on friday. (thats why i knocked off a star).. anyway..  started off with bruschetta and fried ravioli. the tomato on the bruschetta was sooooo refreshing..juicy.. the italian bread was perfectly toasted.. and the cheese was fresh. fried ravioli was not too crispy and the cheese oozed out when you took a bite.. no cardboard tasting ravioli here.. it was good even without the marinara sauce!  i had the fettucine ala moro d'venezio. fettucine pasta with sliced and crumbled sausage with a four cheese sauce... need i say more? the pasta was tasty with all that cheese but the sausage left me speechless. i love sausage.. but not when its too salty. and this was the best sausage i've had in a while... *drool*... the leftovers were even better....  i love the atmosphere in here. friday night... there was a duo singing sinatra among other old vegas style icons.. my friend requested 'young at heart' and got lei'd! lol.. she was summoned to the stage as she sang along and got lei'd... how fun is that! you just gotta bere here to know what im talking about! dim lighting with cushiony booths and a bar in the middle so you dont feel too stuffy in the 'house of love'.. kind of throws it off a bit..but i like it =)

5TzSFLdIfIrG9Z_CaBklSw.text: Service was excellent once we saw our waitress and told her we had a show to get to.  My daughter had the shrimp scampi, and I had a perfectly cooked New York steak.

4xoaCpXmDWoUXOA7hu4nyQ.text: The food is always good at Casa Di Amore they have a wonderful Gypsy sauce it is a fried tomato paste that is very spicy with lots of crushed pepper and oil this is my favorite thing on the menu and I Dip my bread and fried shrimp in there it is wonderful pasta is always good cherry pepper steak and pork chops is off the chain it is a must-have if your first time going there the waiter Brad is always nice and speaks gypsy language which is a plus and makes it funny to be there music is always good place is just fun all around

xbHViHSIO1H6BfSwxX3cHg.text: I've now been here 3 times and it's been awesome each time! A free limo ride to & from the strip, good service, great atmosphere and amazing Italian food...I look forward to visiting Casa di Amore every single time I'm in Vegas!!!

9XySK4IlMk0Q-sGSfTQTjQ.text: The food here is fantastic, and the atmosphere is noisy and busy like the Italian restaurants I remember from Boston, though the pictures of old Vegas on the walls remind you where you are.  There was a singer/keyboard player there during dinner, but his music was not too loud or intrusive and he wasn't bad.  I had the rigatoni pesto, which has a flavorful pesto cream sauce, and I enjoyed the house dressing on my salad.  The bread was warm, and the butter appeared to be lightly herbed.  They unfortunately no longer seem to make their desserts in house, so no cannoli for me.  Probably a blessing in disguise, since (and this is unusual for me) I ate the entire large serving of pasta they gave me, and dessert might have pushed me way past too full.

mCxiJt0KjeVDp2wPDJNg9Q.text: Went there on superbowl weekend..loved it definitely a regular place to visit when I go to vegas again. And the free limo ride was a huge brownie point winner.

s9fEwhSE6nYPXVC42SuvyA.text: Okay, I'm gonna give them four, but there is a story behind this and its up and down. I planned a very romantic surprise weekend for the wifey in Vegas. I found this place and thought it would be fun with the live music, limo ride, and an escape from the touristy strip. Well, about 30 mins before we were supposed to be picked up I get a phone call indicating that the limo had broken down and we would have to catch a cab for which we would be reimbursed when we got there. This ruined the surprise and was barely apologized for and, if it wasn't already 8:45 on a friday night, I would've tried to get in somewhere else. After a very long and roundabout cab ride, we arrived and were told our table was not ready yet. 15 minutes later we were still waiting and very unhappy, so we told them we were leaving and they called a cab that they would be paying for.   While sitting outside, the manager walked up and apologized for the inconvenience and the unapologetic rudeness of the extremely unprofessional hostess. He told us, "I don't want you to leave...not like this" in his best Pauly Cicero voice. He offered to take half off of our bill if we stayed, so we did.   We ordered the hot antipasto sampler ($18) for two which was huge. There was plenty of fried mozarella, ravioli, shrimp and calamari. all of which were good, especially the ravioli! and the marinara, was like nothing I've had since being back in NY. I got the Dei Frutti Di Mare ($26) which was very good. The broth was pretty thin, as it should be, but had great flavor. I really enjoyed this one, lots of seafood. The wifey got the Pasta al Forno ($26), which I bitterly admitted was a little better than my dish, but whatever, they were both very good.   The atmosphere is kind of old, Italian American, somewhat of a stale, used-to-be-filled-with-cigarette-smoke kinda smell. But, honestly if it was really bad, the wifey would not have stayed as she is very, very picky. It was very dark and the music was alright. It was old, Sinatra/rat packish covers from a mildly entertaining fellow that seemed to enjoy his job. It was alright.   The best part was that the manager also slipped us a free entree gift card for a future visit and then they managed to get the limo up and running for our ride back. We did have to share with another couple, but only for the first half of the trip and they were very nice and friendly. the limo was very small and seemed like somewhat of a party limo type of thing, but it was still a nice touch. We might go back, but would make back-up plans in case the limos breaks down again. It is kinda off in the cut in a shadier area.

JP_PIHo2GzrqHYZvnY250A.text: After looking on Yelp and Trip Advisor, I was excited to take my parents who were in town visiting to Casa di Amore. I've heard good things about this place and was sure to make reservations as it was a Saturday night. As we walked in, the host informed us they were running 10 minutes behind. It was a nice night so we decided to wait outside. After waiting 30 minutes, we went inside to check and were told there was one party in front of us. After waiting another 15 minutes, we went in to check again and the hostess told us that she had accidentally cancelled our reservation. No apologies were made for the miscommunication at which point we promptly left. I was extremely disappointed by this first impression and living in a town with so many great restaurants, I doubt I will give them a second look.

WGTXYb7oBBqylAmp1UnWHQ.text: Great place nostalgic of old Vegas.  I should say the pasta much more tasty than the steak.  Great veal parmigiana .  Free limo..what else can I say?

ErAJhMWWxQO7QykScY5FaQ.text: Old world Italian with good service, great food & charming entertainment. Been there twice with big groups & Casa di Amore did not disappoint! Take the drive away from the strip to get here--you'll be glad you did!

WfUZy_SGpRQdGl8Pr8mYWQ.text: I joined Susan and a few others for my first Yelp event : an evening (roundtrip) limo ride to Casa di Amore.  The restaurant sends its own branded red limo to pick up customers on the Strip- more fun than a plain old taxi ride. The limo isn't all that big but I'd never been in one before so it was kind of cool playing with the buttons for the "mood lighting" and the A/C (and laughing as Susan accidentally found one that suddenly separated us from the driver with a metal partition!). :-)     The restaurant definitely has an old school Vegas feel.  Photographs of Vegas line the walls of the dining room in a chronology, starting with Old Vegas and ending with modern, color photos of the Vegas we see today: gaudy, colorful and sparking! A lounge singer plays the piano and sings old hits such as "Copacabana" (he even had backup singers for that one- don't know where the background sound came from!)    Some in our group had a vested interest in a football game. A section towards the back of the restaurant sports lounge seating and widescreen TVs showing at least a couple of football games, so they could easily walk back there for a closer look at the game from time to time.    As a vegetarian/vegan (depends on my mood right now) I was surprised at the paltry salad offerings- I had hoped for a nice big salad for my dinner. Instead, I opted for the small, plain house salad that comes with your order. I chose the penne with greens as my entree (escarole cooked in olive oil). It was very tasty and a bit rich- made me wonder if there was a touch of cheese in it, but I forgot to ask.  Anyway, I had a good time with the charming and funny Yelp crew  (Myke, you are a blast) and enjoyed a nice meal as well.

vUM_wKDl3VaNW-_nkU40hQ.text: Made a reservation for 8:15 for 2 and still wasn't sat til 10:30. By then we no longer wanted to stay. Loud and obnoxious atmosphere. Live music was awful. Osso buco sucked. We left immediately after we were sat and went to CAPO'S on Sahara where the food was phenomenal and the (live) music was beautiful. Real Chicago Italian in a romantic setting, it was a perfect ending to my birthday dinner. I do not recommend casa di amore.

IHs0414UcuO9nyLwA8mdAw.text: Casa di Amore feels homie and comforting and that goes for both the decor and the food. I read that this was one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas so we came here under that impression. Having the bar set as high as it can be, the men in my party ordered the chicken and veal parmesan while us girls asked for an antipasto salad, salmon and bruschetta. My date who's half Italian approved the chicken parm with penne pasta! I tried this dish as well and I thought the chicken was moist and tender; the pasta sauce was delicious - over all a great dish!   My antipasto salad was good but a bit too acidic for my taste. Instead, I ate some of he bruschetta and I really enjoyed those.   It can get really loud in here once the live music starts so if you want to eat and talk, perhaps you should show up before 6:30 pm.

5ZRGXYIT7ef5C1hy_ODn6Q.text: New favorite Vegas spot. Great food, great people and great music. Worth the drive. They treat you like family. Chicken parm is the way to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Living the dream.

4BZ7fSfMou3b9b1luvyxZw.text: Horrible stay clear they do not know the meaning of a reservation waited more than an hour to sit after our time, order was wrong than was cold and undercooked.

ljRBcLRYVhIgbcS7RXHPwQ.text: Great waiters - Amazing Italian dishes...a restaurant that is like a friendly neighborhood of family and guests. Loved the singer and drummer, creating an ambience that was relaxing entertaining and full of good energy. Such a nice contrast to the glitter and artificial fluff on the strip...this restaurant is authentic with genuine Italian cuisine. Thank you Casa Di Amore!

jRONAYtnwz_cUGErkJbBZQ.text: Loved  is a great and romantic full energy , life music just make really good place , I went to many fancy places around the are , but here was friendly tony , thank you for you great service , and randy and his music loved .

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diablo pasta
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi proshuto

OyTxRhTJ93IjA7FWicEQsA.text: Another hidden gem in Vegas. What a blast with family and friends. Paul Stubblefield stole the show on stage. Great service and food!  Picked us up at hotel and drove us back....great deal with 1/2 price wine on Mondays!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nebraska says &#34;Boom!&#34;  Great place!

q46uEGLZcdzi4YcSExrmrQ.text: Wow! Spaghetti and meat balls can't be done better here! So good! The live music is a nice touch. So much fun! I will return!

DU1se5YPA7jMsHb5l9ODEw.text: If I could give six stars to this place I would. They have incredible service, food and entertainment. I've gone in small groups and large groups and everyone I've been with has had an amazing time; even the friends I thought wouldn't enjoy it loved it.   My last time here I came with a group of 19 people. I called a week ahead of time to reserve our table. Another awesome perk of this place is that they provide free transportation from the strip in their limos. I had already known about the limos which is why I called so early to reserve them. We were all able to meet at the main valet of our casino and ride together to dinner. We got to the restaurant and our tables were ready. The food was quick to come out and was delicious. The waiter even offered to take pictures for the whole group. Everything was perfect.

_rTtbO0eocq_0NTeU06NSA.text: Amazing place! My brother and i took our mom here for her birthday... Its an unexpected place ... A hole in a wall kind of restaurant...   We went in and they asked us to wait at the bar and they will call us when our table is ready... Only thing i would say is me and my brother got some drinks and the bartender creeped me out a little because he kept starring at what i was gonna write on the receipt when i closed out my tab...  Any ways... We got our table and our waiter was really nice... He told us about the specials they had... I got the similar to baked ziti and my brother got the chicken Alfredo.. My moms choice was pretty bomb.. She got the steak rib eye with peppercorns and glaze on it... It was delicious!!! There was a live band playing music which fit perfect with the atmosphere... Definitely recommend this place... Coming back soon!

_GIYg7imWkNXseKJxaAIsw.text: Very cute Italian place off the Vegas strip! It's a small place so you cannot be afraid of small spaces or eating close to your neighbors. It also was quite loud because there was a large party in there of about 25 people and they also have live music playing through dinner. I loved the music I thought it was a nice touch to have some entertainment so you could take your time and eat dinner. The pasta was very good but the bread that most yelpers recommended was not anything to rave about. It actually reminded me of breadsticks from Pizza Hut so I guess if you're in to those..then try it. I actually did not take any pictures because I was too excited to eat that the pics were an after thought! Sorry :) but I would recommend the fettuccine Alfredo and a side of the meatballs! I didn't have room for dessert because I started with a house salad which was also very good. One of the best things about this place is they have a shuttle that will transport you to and from your local hotel but you have to book in advance because it fills up quick! The prices were not much cheaper than anything you can get on the strip but it was still nice to venture out and check out what the rest of Vegas has to offer.

811J1Mc4znahEQBMjI4Xyg.text: This place is really fun! Number one, the food is fantastic, and there's plenty of it. The motto of this place is "Vegas the way it used to be." We had a party of four that arrived around midnight; this place is open till five. I had cioppino which was really good, others in my party had different things but I was too engrossed in my cioppino to care! Wine on Monday is half-price and the place was packed. I think there were four or five birthday parties here, including one with little kids. They have a two piece band, both of whom sang and doubled on multiple instruments.thank Frank Sinatra meets funk and a little New Orleans thrown in. They rocked, the food rocked, the waiters were great, what a totally cool place. It is about two or 3 miles from the strip, so you see a mix of locals as well as well informed visitors. If you decide to come, be prepared to have a really good time.

XFaZnu3Iatv1xZM0JYfIkA.text: Another great dinner with co-workers. We come here every time we come to Vegas for a trade show. Never disappointed!    I had the scallops au gratin this eve (without the mushrooms) and it was delicious. Melted in my mouth.   Excellent service. Great atmosphere with live entertainment.   A must go place to eat when you visit Vegas!

PJQSaPZIMUxWif_lOPamTg.text: This restaurant offers a wonderful atmosphere that goes hand in hand with the friendly staff and delicious food. The pricing is perfect. It's worth leaving the madness of the 'Strip' to go here and have a decent Italian meal. Highly Recommended.

zKmkcj0uhAbsahhCN5aDXQ.text: This place was awesome! The portions are huge! The service is gigantic! The kids got cannoli's for dessert which came with a free t-shirt. I would definitely come back to this place. The manager came to our table after dinner to check on us. I am stuffed to the hilt!

v70b7oNTXquxaZ7QRptuAA.text: Wow! Brilliant old school Vegas experience. Free limo service to and from our hotel. Phenomenal service, delicious food and I have to recommend the buffalo mozzarella bruschetta.

InVD9HZQxW8REiOSpZpTHg.text: Casa di Amore was recommended to us and is a great example of authentic Italian food prepared like Grandma cooked back in the old country.  We dined as a party of four adults.  There was a tasty gluten free penne for one of us (she ate every bite!).  Another ordered the baked mostaccioli and it was also tasty and filling.  I wanted the Linguini with Clams but chose the Frutti Di Mare instead.  It was excellent.  Others in my party agreed it was the best choice at our table, although everything we ordered was flavorful.  Before dinner, we enjoyed the calamari appetizer with marinara sauce.  Simply awesome!  Complimentary table bread was never offered, which is odd for an authentic Italian restaurant.  So we ordered garlic bread but didn't know it is made with melted cheese on it.  It tastes really good, but one of us could not eat cheese so we needed to order a second one minus the cheese.   Our reservations were at 5:15pm, just after opening, so the restaurant was fairly empty.  They accommodated us to sit in a booth where we could watch the LA Kings play in the NHL finals during dinner.  Our server "Toni" was fun and attentive.   The restaurant is quite a distance from the Strip so they offer a pick-up service, which is convenient if you don't have your own vehicle.  The driver was right on schedule picking us up and "Sig" drove us to/from safely.  The wait to leave by limo was longer than expected, but we still made it to a show at the MGM on time.  Don't expect top of the line limousines.  For a driver gratuity of $3-5 per person, it is better than a taxi ride!  If craving good, authentic Italian food, we would eat there again while visiting Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari

ggaeDUw2Vj-E9DLCVMxQJA.text: Horrid from beginning to the end....Service or rather lack of from the beginning Horrid Apps Horrid. Greasy and tasteless and than the Main Course was even brought burnt........but EXITING the door was rewarding to never look back  if i could rate this at less than a star I would.....

klr49tTojknXbGFmWvoMag.text: Service was impeccable but unfortunately I did not only go for the service I went for the food..  I love Italian food and am very Familiar with authentic Italian  The appetizer bread is amazing  but I asked for butter and it tasted like it had been  in the refrigerator wide-open all night. The bread was great with some oil and vinegar.  We had the Lasagna and Eggplant di amor. Both with fairly dry and we had the server bring us some more marinara and it still didn't do it :(   All in all we did have the creme brulee for dessert. It is homemade and was delicious!!   The service, bread, and creme brulee are great but if you plan to have a good on entree based on what I had (which is said to be the favorites)  I would not recommend this place  Ps: the live music and the low lit he ambience is awesome so if you're looking just for a date and not worrying about food or for late-night pizza it would be fine

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live music
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant di amore

vVDkST2hl6_V1LDfnxpidg.text: Place was packed and looked like a great neighborhood place to go. Very friendly for sure.  Wine by the glass was on tap.  Not a fan of tap wines.  We both ordered the specials. My husband loved his. Mine was lobster & asparagas, but almost non-existent; mostly cheese and pasta.  I think if we'd stuck with something like spaghetti or lasagna and ordered a bottle of wine, I would have thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

IqrdEg1Q6RhIYTp0HlVD5w.text: This was our favorite dinner in Vegas!  We went based on Yelp and Tripadvisor reviews- so glad I did my research, or I NEVER would have found this spot.  We took a cab (didn't know about the complimentary limo service!) and I started to wonder where the hell we were going- it was a 20.00 cab ride from the strip.  When we finally got there, the cabbie said we shouldn't have a problem getting back because the machine gun range next door was very popular with the tourists...  We walked in and were promptly seated by the hostess, who told us that the musician was taking a break but would be back soon (singing keyboard player who interacted w/willing dinner guests). Our server was extremely helpful and luckily, we were there on 1/2 priced wine night (Sun and Mon) so we got an excellent Chianti.    We started off w/the calamari, which was wonderful and there was a ton of it!  It was very crisp and had a lovely marinara sauce.  I had the 'grandma's' soup, which was delicious- chicken noodle-y and very flavorful.  I was in the mood for red sauce, so the server recommended a sausage pasta dish that was normally served w/a pink sauce, but said he'd make it w/red (amazing!!!)  My husband had a strip steak which was served w/a twice baked potato and veggie...all good.   When it was time for desert, we declined- but our server said we had to try the cannoli and we'd get a t-shirt...I'm a sucker for a free t, so we got it to go.   The server told us about the limo service and said that the driver was off because nothing had been scheduled- but that his manager was more than happy to take us to our hotel.  We took him up on the offer and rode back to the strip in style.    I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone, in fact, I gave away the card our server gave us w/his name on it (Christopher?) to another trade show attendee.  Sorry that I can't give his name, because he was great!  Later, while walking down the strip, we passed a particularly hungry looking homeless guy.  I asked if he was hungry, he said he was starving...I offered him our leftovers.  He happily took them and was very grateful.  About 3 minutes later, I realized I'd given away my souvenir t-shirt, but I bet he needed it more than I did.

q7rxj1d7gy6wM600xVFfwg.text: best italian restaurant i've ever eaten at in my life !!!!!! i was a server/bartender in my 20's & 30's, and i have worked for a number of italian restaurants, some actually great places.. nothing holds a candle to casa de amore', it is the italian restaurant that you must make time for when you visit vegas.. they are closed tuesdays, but when they are open, you will find the service, decor, dishes, salads, & drinks absolutely too notch and unforgettable.. the bread is amazing, the salads are delicious, and the pastas, well, let me tell you it's the best italian i have ever had, ever.. they have live music most nights, and the waiters i met there i will never forget their kindness and thoughtfulness till the day i die.. i absolutely love this place, and will be sad when i leave vegas for not being close to them anymore.. get there as soon as you can, you won't regret it .. !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melanie wondering if she&#39;ll have any leftovers to take home.. (not !!)
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome atmosphere !!

0aYjhzKSZk-p7RDA4D5clw.text: I am writing this review because I dined at your restaurant a couple of weeks ago and I was not pleased. Food was below average and there was no room to move. Tight quarters to say the least. Our server was Toni from Brooklyn and she was FABULOUS!! Made us feel like we were part of her family. It was loud to begin with and to top it off there was a server ( male ) tall guy that was extremely loud with his table next to us and he took about a dozen pictures constantly bumping us. At the end of the dinner, an African American man came over and asked us how everything was. We still don't know who he was as he never identified himself. Very creepy!! Kept staring at us. Will not be back.

SRQ6GRkdU5GKxBKtFV_QoQ.text: It's funny that I went here after I watched the Anthony Bourdain where he bemoans the trend of traditional Italian-AMERICAN food disappearing, as it dissolves into a mishmash of regional cuisines of Italy. Is there something shameful about a veal parm? Not in my book, and not in Bourdain's either.  Old school, dark walls, candles on the table. I also had the pleasure of watching the Godfather on AMC's mob week before I went here, so it was awesome seeing pictures of old Vegas like the Sands with Dino and Frankie on the marquee. They send a limo to pick you up, and all you have to do is tip the driver.   Onto the food! Well first the wine. Their wine list was surprisingly pricey, but the cheap 30 dollar chianti was a solid pick. The bread was uninspired, the butter clearly pre-frozen. I ordered the pork chop saltimbucca, half order, because TWO 8oz pork chops is a little too much. It was pretty good, a little salty. My friends ordered lasagna, fettuccine, eggplant parm. I tried all of them, and while it's nice to have these italian american classics around, I could have made these at home for half the price, easy. However, it's a solid place and I liked that it was off the strip and not touristy as hell.

GOmwwQMaA9ZBtlLQtPySvQ.text: Geez I so want to give these guys 5 stars but I just can't. Regardless of short comings, I do highly recommend this place. It pays homage to old Vegas in a very special way which makes it worth it. On the bad side, our limo to the restaurant had no AC, our waiter forgot about us after our entree was served and it was quite expensive for what it was BUT, the 2 man band made it totally worth while.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These guys make this place!!!

RhGmKvaI8owCGc7Up9yVwQ.text: I looked up this restaurant and read the reviews.  They were excellent and so was our vist.  MICHAEL our waiter was EXcellent.  Food was fantastic and music was great.  Will return fagain.  Very memorial evening.  Thanks michael. SMITH AND THE CHIEFS.

68LZUiLI0rHnT4l8Dgs53w.text: This restaurant was fabulous - well worth the drive from the strip.  Usually I'm not a huge fan of live music but I enjoyed theirs.  It looked a little quiet outside but inside there was a packed house full of loud italians and good portions of delicious food.

gujnTVveLd9ToRvHlnmJdA.text: Decided to go here based on reviews on Trip Advisor (instead of my original choice of Batista's Hole In The Wall), plus the Restaurant.com certificate, plus the fact they pick you up in a limo if you make reservations over the phone far enough in advance was what helped us make the decision to eat at Casa Di Amore. I arranged to have the limo pick us up at the Rio after "The Rat Pack Is Back" show (after the meal, he returned us to the hotel we were staying at, the Flamingo). Neither my mom or I had ever had a limo ride, so this was a good treat. The driver was nice and very chatty. When we got inside Casa Di Amore, the hostess took my name but acted like I hadn't made a reservation. Although it was Mother's Day, it was a Sunday night, at 10pm, and it was not busy, several tables were empty, but we still had to wait about 10 minutes. The entertainment was just packing up, so we missed that completely :-/ Our waiter (I think his name was Bradley) was not very nice, in fact, he was a bit of a jerk. He was really short with us the entire time, and made several rude remarks to me.I think he saw my Restaurant.com certificate, and every restaurant we went to on this trip and used one of these, we got poor service from the waitstaff (which is ironic since they are guaranteed a bigger tip with one of these certificates) I have a lot of indigestion issues, and basil doesn't agree with me, so when at Italian restaurants I always order regular spaghetti w/ marinara sauce. I've never had an issue. But, this sauce had large strands of basil, as well as small chopped pieces of it. Also, the portion was puny, maybe about 1 cup of cooked noodles. My mom got spaghetti w/ meat sauce and meatballs. Her plate had a HEAPING portion of food. I know she had meat sauce and meatballs, but there really shouldn't have been that big of a difference between our portion sizes. Anyway, I notice all the basil on my food and immediately start the long process of picking it out with my fork. I haven't even taken a bite when the waiter noticed and asks how our meal is, my mom asks him if they have a sauce w/o so much basil, even asks for the sauce from the kids menu, but he tells us this is their plainest sauce. He then tells me that he can swap it out for something else, but what else is there if this is their plainest sauce? I go on, and try to eat my spaghetti. I take a bite, and follow it with several gulps of water. My mouth HURTS. In the next 15 minutes I go on to take 3 more bites, but each one is more excruciating than the next. I feel like my lips are on fire. Waiter comes up to us again and asks how everything is, and I tell him I just cannot eat the food in front of me. He tells me, "you should have said something when I asked earlier." He pointed to my food, which originally was just about 1 cup of cooked noodles and I had only eat 4 small bites, and went on to say, "its obvious you ate most the meal. What do you expect me to do? I can get my manager out, and I KNOW what he will say." I argue that I only ate 4 small bites, and my mom steps in asking if I could just get a small side order of plain noodles, then I chime in that I want no sauce that I'll just put a little parmesan on top. He says he can do that, but I'll be charged for it. What else can I do, I'm hungry. He brought it, and I ate it just the way I said I would. It was fine, but I was still hungry, so I ordered Creme Brulee (& which comes with a free t-shirt). The Creme Brulee was good, still warm so I waited a minute or two or else the top wouldn't break just right. When he brought the check he pointed out my original meal's costs, then the side of noodle's cost, then he pointed out that he took off the cost of the noodle side, saying "Because I'm just a nice guy". Listen, when someone -- especially a waiter -- tells me that he's a nice guy because he's doing something that just basic customer service, you know they are just another jerk. Then he goes on to say, again, "if I had told any of this to my manager, he would have charged you for that side. But, I'm saving you the trouble. I'm just nice like that." The funny thing is, as I was paying the bill, my mom was outside smoking with the manager, and she said he was really nice. There's no way he would have charged me for that little side when I barely touched my meal. The only time our waiter was truly nice to use was right before we left, when he saw me taking photos of the canvases of old Vegas, and he offered to take a couple of pictures of me & my mom. And when he brought my free t-shirt out, he brought several sizes so I could compare. That was the nicest he was the entire time we were there. I would go there again, for the limo ride and the atmosphere -- but not the food -- I'd go there for drinks and dessert, and watch my friends or family enjoy their meal, then I'd grab a bite at my hotel afterwards...

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-rXpsz4Rpu_iP2xNad2Pyg.text: Love this place! Yes they were under construction but it's ok. Went with 8 to celebrate my husbands birthday. They were fantastic. The manager didn't charge us a corking fee to open my husbands gift of crown royal since the bar was closed and they were fantastic in serving the cake that I had dropped off. We come here at least once every few months. The food is fantastic! Very friendly server and very attentive!

P0rKZLndFKMcWEGlMc4Erg.text: Fantastic in everyway! The food is excellent with a diverse menu of Italian Dishes. Great appetizers, many choices of Italian Style Chicken, Steak, Seafood, Pork and of course pasta classics. Everything is fresh  from the pasta to the seafood. Fresh french bread is served while your waiting for your order. Classic "Old Las Vegas Vibe" in the decor,  music and atmosphere. They even have a live band. My husband and I were so full we could even consider dessert from their array of dessert choices. We had enough to take home to have for dinner tonight!  He had the Veal Parmigiano the Shrimp Al Diablo. Both served with linguine with homemade sauce. This is definitely a gem in Las Vegas. We are locals who will  continue to go again and again! The staff is fantastic as well. Perfect for a special occasion or just because you want great food.

-INA0Lnj45mwLknGDJegmg.text: The good, the bad or the average first? - I will start with the good.  The good....The restaurant is far enough from the strip to avoid a majority of the tourists, but not too far where the cab ride will be more than a couple of glasses of wine. We walked into the restaurant and man was this place packed, but not a touristy, crazy, I gotta get outta here packed. It literally felt like I walked into a scene from "The Casino". Family and friends were sitting at tightly packed tables chatting and laughing, a live two man band was against the wall belting tunes and the walls reflected old school Vegas pics. MY KINDA PLACE, I WAS AT HOME!  The bad...My three person party walked in for our RESERVATION, told it would be a few minutes, so made our way to the bar. The first 45 minutes of waiting was not too bad, but as our wait dragged into over and hour it was clear that people were just not leaving their tables (and why would they when the wine is flowing and fun is being had). The bar and walls around the bar were packed with other parties waiting....waiting......waiting. After a couple of advances to the hostess station and getting the "15 minutes" "15 minutes" line, we were finally sat after about an hour and a half wait. The worst of the worst was when the waitress came to the table and commented to us as if we had multiple heads "So, you guys have been waiting a long time", no apologies.   The average....The food and the service. Nothing much to wait an hour and a half for.   Thoughts...If you have a big party or can get in without a long wait, the ambiance is worth it.

SL4I4c5rUg0dP_VPxjL3cw.text: My dance group and I traveled to Las Vegas in December. In total there was about 30 of us. We were looking for a place to have one last team dinner before returning home. I called asking if we they would have room for us in about 30 minutes. They said they would try their best but can't guarantee all the tables will open up. We arrived in 20 minutes and they were all ready for us! Our dinner here was one we will never forget! The staff was so friendly, the waiters and waitresses were extremely accommodating to our large group, the food was amazing. THE SINGERS! They sang some Chicago songs specifically for us as we are from Chicago and even let one of us get up there and sing a song too! Definitely some of the best service we have received. Would recommend to anyone!

bskhNleGMPFwTqnpC-KFCw.text: I never have a bad experience here and I think that is more because of the amazing service than the amazing food.   My girlfriend and a friend of ours stopped in here on Saturday night after a long day of baby shower planning/shopping. We didn't even realize it was Saturday night at prime time (6:00 p.m.) until we walked inside and the place was PACKED. There was a wedding reception being held as well as regular dining reservations. We didn't have a reservation, but the manager came over and said, "You can have this booth but you guys have to be done by 7:30, and that should give you plenty of time. Does that work?"  OF COURSE IT WORKS.   We got the garlic bread loaf (heavenly) and I got a Caesar Salad to start. Yum! I love their dressing!!!!! I ordered the special for the evening - Lobster ravioli (tossed in Vodka sauce) and it was perfect. It came with NINE HUGE ravioli stuffed to the brim with deliciously fresh lobster meat. The sauce tasted great too, and I know my vodka sauce - trust me! ;)  My gf got the chicken parm and she almost finished the whole thing. That's how you know something is good! I had a few bites and really liked that the chicken was moist but not too thick! Our friend got the fettuccine alfredo with chicken and she barely even looked up from her plate before she finished eating. So, I'm assuming it was perfect.   Overall, I give the food a 4.5 (it's not THE BEST ITALIAN FOOD IN THE WORLD but it is VERY GOOD) but the service gets a 5++++ star rating. Brad, our server, was on his toes all night. He had recommendations, explained the menu, was friendly, never let any of our drinks get even close to empty, and had things taken care of before we even needed to ask. Thanks, Brad.   I like that this place is away from the strip and I really love how dark it is inside. There's usually live music in the form of a 50's era style crooner and the decorations are flawless. Stone brick wall - PERFECTION.   Check it out!!

tZ-9UHywsdKpe-4XEMFVEw.text: Honestly such a hidden gem went in last night and our server Michael was awesome. Very knowledgeable and attentive. The bread is to die for we got full off bread and salad. And our entrees were the best Italian we've had in vegas! And their live band was a great definitely will be doing back!!!

Yj0RF-ZIB1o2qgCg6O186g.text: Service was great, our waiter Brad was amazing. The food was so-so, a little over priced. I had chicken parm and it was bland. My friend had penne alla vodka and it was delicious. If I go back that's probably what i would order. The live music was cool, but if they played "Happy Birthday" one more time I was going to lose my mind. Overall I was underwhelmed and disappointed  in the food.

C2GRRXxt8ZQMreO6SB_lXw.text: Really wonderful little Vintage Vegas place. Nice wait staff and good food. I am a hard nut to crack with Italian but this place passes my tests. Good stuff. The food was wonderful and authentic tasting. My only complaint is they aren't open for lunch (?)  Very nice, but this place is on the small side so if you have a big party you might want to call ahead.

1xgJRnx1YOeokYEOrWU7ZA.text: Michael is the best waiter! So nice and attentive and honest! Food was great, ambiance was nice and the entertainment was great! Very old school Frank Sinatra Vegas vibe! Breath of fresh air from all the trendy overpriced strip restaurants! Local place. Check it out!

v0SFK_JIHYvXwIldbEjsgA.text: A hidden gem off the Vegas strip. First off, the service is incredible! Everyone was super friendly and appeared to be helping each other out to serve food, refill drinks and clear tables. Even with that, it was still clear who our waitress was and she was super attentive to our needs and was very knowledgeable about the menu and daily specials. I believe her name was Joanne, so kudos to her! She's awesome! The food is here is amazing! I tried the ravioli, but based on the menu, I don't think you can order something "not good" here. The cocktails are also well-made and they certainly don't short you on the liquor. Even the pre-dinner bread is good! :) The manager was present the entire evening and was talking with folks as well as stopping at tables to check on people. He was very nice and welcoming. The live music is also a great bonus to this place! I will absolutely be back here and rant and rave to anyone traveling to Vegas to dine here. As another reviewer said, it is worth the drive from the strip (I believe they also do transportation, but call ahead!) and you should not leave Vegas without dining here. I second that!

zLCLdRHz8-WA5gJk3r62Bw.text: Casa Di Amore is my favorite restaurant! Me and my boyfriend come here often and always get the best service. The people who work there already recognize us and we're always greeted with smiles. One of the servers already knows what we tend to get, drinks and food which surprises us each time. I love the Chicken Alfredo and the cup of homemade chicken soup. I've brought my family here, and even my picky nephew loved their spaghetti when he usually doesn't eat restaurant food. Since I've had food at Casa Di Amore, I have gone to other Italian restaurants and do not enjoy the food as much anymore because I end up missing the taste of Casa Di Amore's food. The music is also great! Come here, you won't regret it! (:

OLN9JrYB33QRlf_a9GfFZg.text: I loved this place! It was my favorite part of a whirl-wind Vegas trip :). The older musicians playing standards are phenomenal, and so fun. The food is old school Italian, which I very much enjoy. The front of the house staff is second to none. Plus, the whole place is like traveling back in time! My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is because of our waitress. We had a large party, and had warned her we would be splitting the tab... She said, "no problem, I'll print multiple receipts so everyone can circle what they had." So we do this, and she cops major attitude because we gave her 5 cards (NOTE: I know this is annoying for a server, but she said it was fine when asked about it). We proceeded to wait for a full 30 MINUTES for our checks to sign! The night had been perfect for me up to that point, and I'm sad it ended on a crappier note. None-the-less, you (review reader) should DEFINITELY go here! Especially if you like nostalgia; this place is very much for you ;).

lxyy95_Z5GPWQMYTgQ-aIQ.text: I went there for an early dinner recently and overall it was a fun experience, albeit an expensive one.  The prices are higher than the quality and that's really the bottom line here.  The service was excellent.  Every member of the staff we encountered was professional, knowledgable, and personable.  The food, while overpriced, was still very good.  I ordered the half serving of the stuffed pork chops and it was very tasty.  The cannoli for desert was very good as well.  Others at our table ordered a wide variety of items, to which the consensus was the food was great.   So, really you are paying for the ambiance and the service.  The interior of the restaurant is dark and has an old school feel to it, which to me is awesome.  The only sticking point is the prices on the menu, where I feel you can absolutely get food at least as good at other places for a better value.  I will go to Casa Di Amore now once in a while to change things up, but not as my mainstay italian restaurant on town.

MVHal6Zi9ktHpnAn-07uwQ.text: This place is not good! Service was slow. Food took 30+ minutes to come out and was a just a bit above average, but not great. Food was overpriced as well. Oh!  How can I forget about the entertainment?!! That was so loud and "cheesy"! I'm not trying to be mean, but it was way too much for a Wed night.

IZ63wtMs21_8m6gQ4S-6ZA.text: so my lady on her quest of the best chicken parm in vegas has taken us to casa di amore.. let me begin with what vegas used to be is a understatment because im sure old vegas wasnt decorated in swapmeeet renderings of old school vegas pics.. on to the food the bread stale not even warm the butter kept in the fridge so to hard to spread.. i had the baked something or other which was a penne pasta ricotta cheese meat sauce and mozzarella i wont brag about it especially for $20.. her chicken parm now a decent size and well seasoned but definetly not worth $24.. now the service was horrible we seen our waiter 2x once to take our order and once to fill our water since that was all he offered us to drink.. then when we attempted to use our restaurants.com app gift certificate he said we cant accept the app u need to print it out we have never had this problem before and we use these all the time ..when we asked to speak to the manager he said hes gonna tell u the same thing wrong answer buddy just go get the boss.. now the african boss runnin the italian spot kinda odd i dont mean african as in a black guy i mean like from africa african.. im not being racist bcuz i am black myself..anyway he was kind enough to allow my lady to go to there office and print the gift cert but was rude to her the whole time i didntgo back there bcuz i was already irritated at this point.. so after all said and done my meal was as still $35 and i woulda rather ate macaroni grill ill never go here again!!!!!!!

zSOEtxs2VRdKtu1OeJNiTg.text: Food was excellent, service was also very good.  Those are the positives.  Negatives - We got seated one hour after our reservation.  The lounge singer was loud enough that normal conversation was not possible.    If you want old style Las Vegas off the strip with really good food, and don't want/need conversation and arrive knowing that you will probably be seated late than this is a good place to go.

pyiJcViImbgSgHnuEm-dkg.text: Thank you Yelpers once again for leading us to another great restaurant based on reviews herein.  We had the distinct pleasure of dining at this hidden gem recently.  We had not planned nor did we have reservations to dine, yet, we were cheerfully greeted by a True gentleman, who did not condescend, but, asked us to "please" wait in their lounge.  We did as bid, and "won" our part of our dinner check at the video games in the lounge.  How much better can it get?  Much, much, better!!!  Once our attention was drawn to the actual restaurant, we discovered wonderful photos, melodious melodies by famous crooners, ie., ole Blue Eyes.  Wine selection: excellent, ceasar salad: excellent, chicken marsala;delicious, Sad, but, okay: pork chop ala Italiano: tough.  Service: more than excellent.  For a dining treat in between losing $, GO, feel, and fall in love all over again with a great and genuine restaurant.  Bravo Casa di Amore.

WM_VYRf1ZOsUGlA1lIqa-g.text: We called last Friday at 7 to make a reservation for 7:30. They say fine, we can make that. So we drive in. We find out that there are numerous parties ahead of us, waiting for a table. After waiting in the crowded bar area for 15 minutes, the host tells us that there are still 3 parties ahead of us. Called up yelp on the iPhone, made a reservation at Strings (a few blocks away) and left the place.   This is just unacceptable. It's obvious they do that just to attract the customers from the strip (and they are located WAAAY, WAAAY off the strip). If you don't have a table, just be honest and tell us so.  Don't make us come in and wait for one hour.

NyS2VYFbCy9l1sHPXzCQMg.text: This is perhaps the worst Italian restaurant that I have been to. I ordered Chicken Marcela and the sauce was like thick gravy,  Tasted terrible. I was using a 2 for 1 coupon and it was still overpriced.

zZqav1h4x-7cOc9ZJ0tGXA.text: You cannot beat this place, when it comes to good wine and untypical italian food. Will always be a fave when in Rome. The bartenders and servers certainly know how to guage their audience. It's fine dining, but when you care to speak your mind, the staff gets you, and I dig it..

Ip4LXXhVZ8ltmfTRx0zyTQ.text: was at this place again....11/29/08. this place opens at 4pm and so i called to ask what was the wait time without resevation and i was told no wait. so we got there at 6pm. there were many open tables. our waitress was Toni. she was good until she forgot about us when i needed more bread and more coke. i stopped eating for a few minutes waiting for her to come by and ask her for bread and coke.   so i ordered spaghetti in marinara sauce and a coke. my bf has some alfredo pasta with sausage and he ordered a side of meatballs( which is 2 of em). my spaghetti was really good. the house bread is good too..so warm and soft! he liked his pasta specially the sausage. the meatballs were to die for!!! so good! YUMMY!!! i wish i could make some like that. for everything we paid $41.   there was a guy singing...it was just one guy and a keyboard. he sang christmas songs and played peasnuts songs on the keyboard. my bf really liked that. he loves peanuts specially charlie brown.

BXGKF1kmuosaliJLgYtG_Q.text: This place deserves every star.  If you are looking for a real Vegas experience, this is the place. Great food and great entertainment.  George Bugatti doesn't disappoint.  I will definitely make this place a "must visit" every time I go back to Vegas.

RK7LK65wUEsu_jUpdN2EuQ.text: We booked this place for our wedding party of 40 with only 4 days notice and without eating there prior- we had never even seen it as we were just in Vegas for our wedding.  We hit the jackpot!  The staff was extremely gracious and wonderful service! My family and friends thoroughly enjoyed the dinner and atmosphere that they were able to provide to us-very old school Vegas with Rat pack pictures everywhere and a 3 piece band singing Sinatra and all the classics.  Another couple even got engaged that night while we were there!  The waitstaff was patient and sweet with our large party. Our children were treated wonderfully.  The band was fantastic and the bandleader took the time to speak to me and my new husband personally and was so sweet as to ask for song requests. WE LOVED IT!   More than one of our guests mentioned that they will be coming back next time and will be recommending to all of our friends.  They even have a limo that you can reserve to pick you up from your hotel-just have to book that ahead of time but we were able to get it on short notice with some luck...

rqy3r1aFsC-pgXgxAtLYvg.text: Casa Di Amore is great! I loved the garlic loaf and the chicken angelo was to die for! The music on Friday and Saturday nights is nice too! They have a great old school atmosphere and good service. If something is not right they go out of their way to make sure they fix it which is cool. Their pizza is awesome too! I like that they are open late.

gxgAZo-09viM6q6DkrLxaQ.text: Wow, the staff at this restaurant ROCKS, they are some of the best I have ever seen, everyone has a smile on their face and is such a pleasure.  The food is very good, the place is loud, talking is very hard,  They have some great live music, so just be prepared to have some good food and very little conversation.  The only disappointment was the 'Fabulous Garlic Loaf', man, my mother could kick the crap out of that.  I was expecting this great Italian bread loaded with garlic and butter and baked to perfection, what I got was a hot loaf of bread and some garlic butter...really, for $5?  You guys should re-think this.  But, the place is always full and the food is good and the staff is AWESOME!  I will be back.

1KniroA_BoafsMswqHngPg.text: Food is great. Intimate. Lounge singer sounds just like Sinatra. Did I say the food is great? It is. We took the complimentary limo to and from our hotel. Nice touch.

jKxGjS9kUg7QHFwMvGDD1A.text: Every time I go here the place is packed.  Wonderfully decadent dishes, live music, good wine, and old school feel.

DNthJv6Bhq5KZnfAqCQN_A.text: Makes you feel special, offered us complementary limo service on our next trip, (we were staying at Sam's town, and they still offered the limo.) The lounge act harkens back to an earlier vegas style, and the food had great prices for proper portion sizes.

BlqjFHwhUBe8a-FqTJIdPg.text: Tony the limo driver came and picked me up with my two clients at Mandalay Bay right on time in the red limo. Tony was a really nice guy and gave us some information about the restaurant since it was our first time dining here.  When we get there we were greeted almost immediately by our waiter, another Tony. He was friendly and offered recommendations for both wine and entrees. This place is OLD school Vegas. Dark, red booths, a guy with a keyboard singing some Sinatra, Dean Martin and the like. I got the peppercorn steak as this was a recommendation by Tony. My clients got the Osso Bucco and a pasta dish. We were STUFFED as the portions were HUGE! Not only huge, a lot of love is put into these dishes. Great food, great service, great ambiance! I went outside to make a phone call and talked to some people outside who were locals who dined here regularly. Locals and out of towners alike are treated like royalty. There is nothing better than a great meal with great service and GREAT people taking care of you. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back on future Vegas trips.

LB1Z6vRBlpYgh9zYqD81kg.text: Went with another couple and WOW, was the food good!  Two of us ordered the Eggplant Di Amore (slices of fresh eggplant breaded and layered with ricotta cheese, mushrooms, spinach and sundried tomatoes, topped with parmigiano-reggiano and mozzarella cheese, then covered with tomato basil sauce and baked until golden brown).   This was so delicious, I wanted more.  Also was ordered at our table was the Veal Francaise and the Veal Francaise.  Both meals were also enjoyed.  I will be going back for round 2!

OQudy3MNnaMpHrE8o7rttQ.text: . Of course many Italian restaurants clown Casa Di Amore if you want to get hardcore or technical. It is not fine dining in any respect.  They are a little messy as far as menu's being dirty etc. very slow at seating even with reservation. the price point is about 5.00 too much for everything. However the good parts - For a neighborhood place you cant get better Italian than this.I have been 4 times now All the food minus the house salad is absolutely excellent. They do a killer Burrata cheese appetizer. The pork chop with peppers is exceptional! Amazing acid and great spice. cool ambiance old school style. The waiters are not top notch by any means but friendly and they try. So far there is not a better quasi - budget Italian place in town.

WX6Xv1uhnOSAZT2GWJvD8w.text: We last dined at this old style southern Italian restaurant in 2005.  We each ordered chicken angelo - mushrooms, olives, and artichokes in a lemon butter sauce plus complimentary cups of chicken pastina soup.  The soup was okay, but the chicken angelo fell a little south of mediocre

mBfbZXKvX7kectUufMkbHA.text: This was our third visit.  I highly recommend the place.  Yes, it is situated next to a gun shop in a very off-strip location, but once you are in the door, you are captivated by the retro vibe, the good Italian food and the live music.  We have always enjoyed our meals here.  Worth a visit.  Half price wine bottles on Sunday and Monday are a bonus.

p4jHFE6n_i_e1a77N4xoKg.text: We were picked up at our hotel by "Johnny Limo" in a cute purple limousine, arrived at the restaurant and upon walking in I felt as though we had stepped into a scene from the Sopranos.  We joined our friends, some of whom are Vegas locals, and I'm so glad they let us in on their secret spot.  The food was amazing!  Our table shared about 5 appetizers and everything tasted fresh and authentic.  I especially loved the roasted red peppers and fontina cheese.  I ordered the scallops as my meal and they were big and tasty, covered in melted provolone.  Thanks for the ride Johnny, can't wait to come back to Vegas.

5q3KtG8juYQ3jJ0omtqETg.text: I really love this place.  Live music, old framed pics of Las Vegas, good service, great food.  Bread is hot and fresh and they have a free limo ride to and from the strip.  I am a local now but for really good Italian food, you gotta come here.  Tiramisu kicked ass by the way.

NM9mA7l1a7dLOW-5nu_lZw.text: AHH Casa Di Amore...randomly a great time. The first time I walked in was really akward as it is a small little entrancein the front, always locked and you have to go around to the back for entry and push a button. I felt like I was going into a speakeasy. The owner is always out and about talking to people, because he is wasted. funny. There is "live entertainment" which is a guy or  2 on a small stage playing keyboard and eye fucking every woman under 65. Thats right ladies, he's lookin for love! Funny thing is, he has groupies...sad sad groupies throwing back wine like nobody's business. The pizza is good, the bartenders are cuties, you can get pretty crazy there and it's cool.  I like it there and will be back, as soon as this hangover wears off..

5pXSNJiKYpbLg1zBCJHS1g.text: We were visiting Las Vegas and had this restaurant recommended to me by friends who visit Vegas a lot.  It was my friend's birthday so we wanted to go somewhere fun. The limo picked us up from our hotel, he was on time and very professional.  And then we got to the restaurant.  The place looks amazing.  You feel like you've stepped back in time and that a member of the Rat Pack could walk in any moment.  The service was wonderful. The server made sure to bring my friend a birthday drink, made great suggestions and made us laugh a lot.  And the food was delicious.  We split two bowls of pasta and a salad between three women and were absolutely stuffed.   The wine list is terrific too.  Then cannelloni for dessert which I couldn't eat because I was too full but my friends said it was divine.  This will definitely be our go-to place when we visit Vegas. It was great to be off the strip and hang out around locals.  Plus the band is here is FABULOUS.

G_sjyGgFwSWK73aXJaYwRg.text: Food was very good,especially stuffed garlic bread, unfortunately,several problems were encountered. We were seated very close to a wedding party, and our chairs were constantly being bumped by guests and servers. The singer, within 2 hours, sang5  songs, 2 of which was happy birthday. Noise level was excessive. Server had no clue if they had certain foods, and manager, at least we thought it was the manager, did nothing but walk around doing nothing all night, till we left, then asked if everything was ok.  drinks were not served in correct glasses. I will try again, since the food was yummy.

xrj6tZZmMVA5JQ_J-xGc1A.text: It felt like we stepped back in time when we walked in the front door.   The wait staff (Tony) was great and the manager thanked us for coming by.   The food was very good, they had live music and the atmosphere is fun.   We were a little skeptical based on the location but went based on great Yelp reviews and reviews on other sites and we were not dissapointed.

kGjp2ca4VoBOwirKdwlW5Q.text: Wow, I hate to sound grumpy, but I feel like I went to a different restaurant than the reviewers who gave it 5 stars. Over priced and marginal food at best. Sadly, my favorite part of the meal was the half priced bottle of wine. They had a keyboard player and violinist and they were talented, but the volume was so loud we couldn't even hear each other talk. The room is so small, the music just overpowered everything. Won't be back any time soon.

-fl8lbRZ71RXqfHWpa7XGQ.text: Italian DISASTER!  This place promotes itself as if it is bigger than it is, so they stuff you in the bar to wait then cram you around a table in the cramped dining room.  Family style?  Not my family.

KuVMuEFuKNY26-4AFxjZAA.text: Now this is a hidden gem in this cookie cutter dump of a town.  Doesnt get much better than this.  Love the atmosphere here.  The food has always been spectacular.  Been here 5 times and never been disappointed.  Spent a New Years Eve here and it was fantastic.  Highly recommended.

JvwIiOF9JrN5kCQl8fQvdg.text: A real East coast neighborhood Italian feel. Godfatherish. I fully expected to see Frank or Dino in the next booth. Not a tourist joint. I loved the atmosphere lots of families, birthdays, just regular people. Food was good, not great. Entertainment and atmosphere made up for it. We  went on Sunday, half price wine night. Very enjoyable experience.I would recommend it. Prices reasonable.

izdZFAhEpJOBNEMTPHoowQ.text: oh how I miss going to you every night after partying, I miss your warm Calamari and oh music and old Frank and Dean bar scene .....

koI8r8gpjQ1_x_A3UyMQdw.text: Casa Di Amore is a small, quaint, romantic Italian restaurant with pretty good food.  It can be a little pricey, but it's worth it for the ambiance.  I ordered the Lobster Ravioli which was quite nice and my friend ordered a steak, which he raved about.  The live music adds just the right mood, with the swooning sounds of Sinatra and a couple bottles of Chianti, who wouldn't feel amorous at the House of Love?

ofpPMbwMntaqdc2R2pDBkA.text: This is a great place to go off the Vegas strip (about a 10 min drive) and they offer a free limo ride to and from the restaurant.  They have half off bottles of wine Sunday and Mondays.  Great Italian food, full bar and live entertainment nightly and the atmosphere is very laid back.  The restaurant looks like a whole in the wall but you must try the food here when you're in Vegas!

RG5kgShmGubV7FkTtvRr8w.text: Went here this past Thursday night around 10pm. Reserved the limo to pick us up from the Strip. He was early and it was perfect because we were hungry, free limo ride was awesome.  The place is cute, decor was inviting and i liked the setup. Four of us came her to check out the place (first timer's) was thinking of maybe booking it for a dinner reception after our wedding next year. We all shared two entree's (cus it was pretty late to be eating Italian food) and two side salads and bread. The lasagna was really yummy, we ordered some chicken dish i cant remember the name but none of us cared for it the chicken was a little dry, but the pasta it was served with was good.  The entertainment was alright not as exiting as all the other yelp'ers made it come across. Maybe we came too late?? Anyways we will be back, but i don't think we will be booking our dinner reception here afterall, only because it is away from the Strip and i think i would prefer more of a banquet hall facility.

epcHMFrZLK5rc9BMRgYT8w.text: This was our 3rd time eating here and it got better everytime. The live music is great. The food is the best. The service is amazing. We went there on a Monday night. Tony was our waiter. Very friendly and knows everything on the menu. He provided Exceptional servive. Ill probably ask for his section the next time im in there. He told us about the !/2 price wine bottles.. We ordered a penot noir form oregon that wsa great. He told us about the specials and one of them jumped right out for me. Tenderloins with gnocchi in a white gorganzola sauce. I odered that and my girlfriend ordered a penne and veggie dish adding sausage to he. Both dishes had great flavor to them. we started off with the "prawns". Never tasted shrimp like that. perfectly baked. The sauce is a little on the sweet side but still worth adding on. The mussels in marinera were so good we were dipping our bread in to eat like a soup. Having eaten a whole lot didnt have much for desert. but when Tony informed me that its shipped from italy and light, I had to try the cherry bomba. He was on the money again. Full and happy we hung out for a few and listened to music. not once did it feel like they were trying to get us out the door. perfect setting. Even better service. I highly recommend this place. You wont be dissapointed!!!!!

EPlj6-4vWnqc_OzqMHdSuA.text: Thank you yelp for helping me to find a great place for me and the girls to have dinner in Vegas.  We were in Vegas on a family trip this past weekend where we rented a house- 7 couples and 5 kids (all under 3!).  For girls night out we hooked up the 'puter and checked out yelp for something close.  Casa Di Amore was close, Italian, and had good reviews.  We were dropped off by one of the hubbies and were going to have the staff call us a cab- but low and behold- they have a limo!!! We asked if they could take us the the strip after dinner and they could!  It was really fun AND the food was so good.  We had a few bottles of wine and the bill was still under $40 a person.  Plus, they gave us each a rose AND there was a lounge singer.  We felt like we were in a movie (Swingers was mentioned more than once).  What more could a group of hot mamas ask for?  I recommend this place if you are looking for something away from the crowds where you and your group can have a nice meal for a reasonable price.

b6nMSSNIA3rE5yQryFw6kQ.text: Place is so solid. Sunday nights 50% off all wine. Good mood music. Great food. Fun staff. Just a really good spot off the strip. You cannot go wrong here. You will leave in a GREAT mood....especially if you get the Veal Osso Bucco. Enjoy.

F62drKhjP9fTIjj2ZjD_Wg.text: Small Italian restaurant with a big heart.  Full bar with plenty of seated waiting area. Call ahead for reservations and for free pick-up/drop off limo service.  We went on a Sunday nite (packed) which had live music playing rat pack inspired songs. The chicken dishes were phenomenal, especially the Chicken Florentine and Chicken Marsala.  I had the Linguine with clams (white)....AWESOME!  We were too full to have dessert but the next table over ordered what looked like a chocolate/vanilla delectible...shoulda moved over to take a spoonful. Downside? had to wait just a bit for our table but it was worth it.  The environment is much what you would want a small, dark, hole-in-the-wall type of place to be, serving great food, great drinks, and having a manager care about the service you're receiving.  I would definitely go again!

bD-YXrDXmKfShoTr-vUi3w.text: What can you say about a restaurant that gives you old style Italian-American food with the casual ambiance of Momma's kitchen but still maintains a gentler, kinder Old World dignity? We loved it! We got picked up by complimentary limo and whisked to the restaurant like we were special visiting family from out of town. The Sunday and Monday 1/2 price bottles of wine are an excellent value especially with large groups. The antipasto platters were a big hit as well as the appetizers...there were forks flying back and forth; I expected sparks! The stuffed portobello special that night was to die for good. The portions are little large, but hey, it was our first night in Las Vegas and airplane food is non existent these days... My seafood pasta was tasty but the mollusks were a bit gritty and there was some broken shell pieces....quite the surprise to bite down on a crunchy shell that you thought was a piece of mussel....the lighting is very dim. But I just ordered another bottle of Barbera and moved on.... My husband's pork chops were excellent, but he is picky about his cheese, so the fontina was not to his taste....but I just ordered another bottle of Barbera and he moved on.... The rest of the group ate, drank and enjoyed their meal immensely while being serenaded by the keyboardist....who kept mentioning it was my birthday....but I just ordered another bottle of Barbera and, so do you see where this is going? It got a little raucus....mea culpa Tony (our waiter).
