The complimentary tiramisu they sent over for my birthday was excellent, and the creme brulee done to perfection (most brulees are overcooked like a custard; this was creamy and fragrant with vanilla bean). If you want authentic Itatlian gourmet, then go someplace that charges for the tap water and you can wear your cruisewear. But if you want good, honest food that is the a product of the evolution of Italian immigrants making  American ingredients their own, then you gotta try Casa di Amore. Did I mention they have Barbera?

6M8oXyNX9U0nwKMzBIN3Mg.text: Somewhere, between the days when the Italian mob used to run this town and today, Italian restaurants in Vegas started acting like the coward bully who only starts picking on people and acting like a big shot when he thinks the teacher is not coming back. Most of them have great food and many of them try to show off their connections to the days of old, pretending to be something they never were and never could be.  Casa di Amore is one of those establishments that has a real connection to Vegas' past, but lacks the pretention of those other joints. Everyone here, from staff to management to the customers who make Casa di Amore their regular stop, is genuinely low key and laid back. They're far more interested in making sure you enjoy yourself with some old-time Vegas than trying to pretend they are some big shot from the glory days.  The food is exactly as good as you expect and never let's you down. The price point is extremely reasonable, especially on half price wine bottle night.   Stop in and you'll be made to fell at home - with a great meal and a fabulous experience.

cjuhTqtWMu7y9emfw3e87g.text: Nothing but good things to say about this place. Everything was perfect! From the food to the service ( Brad was our server and he was awesome), to the live misc and old Vegas feel. I'm pretty sure we will be back every time were in Vegas. We started with the Calamari and Bruschetta. I recommend both. For our main courses we had the Veal Parm (based on our servers recommendation)... Great choice! And we had the Cioppino.. Loaded with goodness, it was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parm
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino

Tr9paDo2IUVvf0ZZ1zGkmQ.text: Hey Now! This place is really old school Vegas.. The Mafia looking owner greets you at the door, great nightly entertainment. Food is genuine Italian. Service is outstanding. They even have a stretch limo valet both ways for just a tip! We make sure to stop in every trip. Members of R.com, and they have a coupon in this year's LVA MRB..

1Ca8buFZDz5Ey90TyM_WWQ.text: What an amazing atmosphere!! You feel like you're a mobster in a movie like Casino or Goodfellas.  The food is amazing and the service was unbelievable!! Brad was our waiter and was awesome!! He made sure to explain all the dishes, recommendations and even took the initiative to take a picture of the group without us asking!   The music was great with one singer sounding exactly like Frank Sinatra!!!  The restaurant is great for everyone from young professionals to senior citizens!!  This restaurant was such a great time that we didn't even know we were there for 3 hours!! They also provide limo rides from the strip and back which makes you feel like a high ranking boss. I'm from Vegas but whenever I have friends come in from out of town I'm making it my mission to have dinner at Casa Di Amore!! Also, if you order the creme brulee or cannolli they give you a tshirt that has the famous Godfather quote "leave the gun...take the cannolli" which is awesome. My wife and I can't wait to come back!!!

D_mqMxh5k-SnyAM43xGhXw.text: My husband and our friends were headed to Vegas with some friends to celebrate our 15th anniversary. We wanted to try something authentic and off the strip and I looked at Yelp and found this place. Since I had never been in a limo I was quite excited that they provide free limo service to and from their restaurant. We were picked up promptly at 6 at the MGM for our reservation at 6:15. We were sat immediately and greeted by a very pleasant server (Lynn?) She was very attentive at first but as the restaurant filled up we saw her less and less and seemed like were an annoyance when we asked for something. Drinks were very good, so was the bread. My gnocchi pancetta was TOOOO good. Amazing really. I have had a lot of gnocchi and this was obviously made fresh. Husband had fettucine and said "meh". Couple with us had lobster ravioli, he said the sauce overpowered the lobster but that it was still good. They also had steak and it was the best steak i have ever tasted. It actually melted in your mouth. Thankfully it was big enough for her to share :) We had canole and creme brule for desert. I have had much better creme brule. I wasnt impressed. The canole was pretty tasty tho. The ambiance is really great. It has the feel of old 50' s mobster style Vegas. Red paint and bricks. Just cool. The live band was awesome and really set the tone singing Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra. So where does the star fall off of a 5 star rating? When we went to pay the bill I had a restaurant.com gift certificate (which by the way is a rip - dont use them....lots of hidden fees and rules - pain in the butt). I gave it tand my credit card for the remaining balance to the server and she disappeared. She brought back a receipt and our friends bill which they paid. I was confused that I didnt have a receipt for my credit card and tracked her down because she was not coming back to our table. I asked if the bill was settled and she said it was and said goodbye. The limo driver then drove us to the strip. Half way there we were basking in the great meal and mood of being in a limo and satiated. When the phone rang. I could hear the limo driver talking about an unpaid bill. He asked me if we had paid and I assured him that we had. He argued with someone on the phone and then handed me his cell phone. The guy on the other end asked if we had paid and I told him what had happened and said the server confirmed we had paid. He said for some reason she didnt run our card and therefore I gave him the card info again over the phone. I did not appreciate the insinuation that we were dining and dashing, especially since we were obviously taking THEIR limo back to the strip. WTH? I also didnt appreciate the server not taking responsibility for her mistake and then putting the issue on us while we were trying to enjoy our limo ride back to the strip. I spent 5 of the 10 minutes on the phone with the staff working out payment. I think they need more servers because our server was fantastic and then when it got busy we barely saw her and this mistake occurred, surely because she was busy. Still obnoxious. All told, we would go back but I really was pissed about the payment issue.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Canaole
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi - pancetta-  yum

sxaTTAs4zHSRlND7YlHCUQ.text: Got to love old-school Vegas ambiance: velvet walls, high booths, a gaming bar in the back with random regulars popping through the back door.   A 1-3 piece music act delighting the room with Mob-age treats. The food is excellent; the menu extensively covers Italian favorites, classics, and a few twists.  Spicy lovers, do the Gypsy sauce if you can handle it. They have delicious veggie meatballs.....but you have to pay extra for them......only sometimes. Bar specials after midnight Open 5pm. to 5am Closed on Tuesdays

jIFuvOY00yvwblx-M5FPwA.text: Valentines Day Hideaway....I almost hesitate writing this review because my husband and I consider this our secret  rendezvous. Some things just have to be yelped about and this restaurant definitely qualifies.   From the appetizer (BAKED CLAMS ARREGANATA $14.00 my favorite), The Salads( Caesar 3.00w/entree- is our Favorite), GARLIC LOAF $5.00 (Must Try This) VEAL DI AMORE $29.00 (My husbands doesn't sway)Tender pieces of veal, pounded thin, sauteed with mushrooms and peas in a creamy veal flavored sauce over capellini.(my husband substituted the pasta for GNOCCHI for 5.00+)  FRUTTI DI MARE $28.00(My NEW fav. I try something different everytime, but I might not anymore!) variety of seafoods including shrimp, scallops,muscles,clams and calamari in choice of red or white sauce traditionally served over linguini.(Substituted the pasta for GNOCCHI for 5.00+)  We didn't order dessert but if you do you also get a FREE Casa di Amore t-shirt (with specific desserts) They also offer FREE limo-rides. Might have to take them up on this offer soon.  PLUS amazing entertainment (Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin our Favorties!)  and top notch service will keep us coming back.  DON'T FORGET THEY TAKE RESERVATIONS that are required on special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. VEAL DI AMORE and FRUTTI DI MARE both where substituted with the GNOCCHI.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No better place than &#34;Casa Di Amore&#34; (House of LOVE)  for celebrating Valentines Day!

fl_DkkIIIqeMQ4DBgEJXFA.text: I am not sure which good thing to say first, since the entire visit was amazing. I made reservations a couple of weeks before our visit since we would be in town for a few days. This was no ordinary day for us, we were renewing our vows after 25 years and didn't want to go to just any restaurant. We wanted to go somewhere special. Casa Di Amore was definitely that. We arrived still dressed from the big day. We were greeted by multiple members of the staff and congratulated over and over. Even many of the locals (we knew they were locals because you could tell this was their local place to go to eat) stopped by to talk with us.   We were seated near the entertainment and had a great view of them playing and singing. The food was AMAZING. I had the salmon and it was probably one of the best salmon dishes that I have ever had. My husband had the chicken marsala and he finished the dish and loved it.   The staff went out of their way to ensure we were having a good time and that we were recognized for our special night. So much so that they had the band announce our names and why were there (to which the rest of the restaurant gave a round of applause and their congratulations, some even stopping by the table) and the band played a song just for us.   I cannot say enough good things about this place. Please do yourself a favor and get off of the strip, eat at a local place and have an amazing time. We will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

xWagzAf1f5NWdO19rgHWFw.text: Came here for the 1st time tonight and I have to say I am very happy I did. I ordered the homemade cheese ravioli with marinara and it was the best ravioli I've ever had. The Caesar salad was delicious too. Only complaint I have is, it does get pretty loud and busy so it's probably not a place for an intimate dining experience. All of my party enjoyed their dish except for one person who ordered their special sea bass. She said it tasted frozen and didn't like it too much, especially for a $40 dish. However, I was pleased and will definitely come back in the future.

3JNl8a0jJqRPobVeubNReg.text: Didnt expect a nice restaurant to be in a location like that.  When we walked in we were greeted by a very friendly staff. The atmosphere kinda reminded me of a nice italian places where a mafia family might have a meeting in the corner table while listening to some amazing live jazz music. (did that make sense?)  The appetizer/entree were both great and the owner/manager even stopped by to say hello and chatted with us for a bit to make sure we were enjoying our dinner.  We were too full to try the dessert so maybe we'll get a chance to try it out next time. All in all, a great dinner experience and will be back here the next time in town.  Great to take a date. Also good to take family, friends, coworkers, and customers.  Recommend making a reservation b/c it started getting pretty busy after 6:30pm when we were there.

V4Lwp1-C_Y_1gTFP7mq6GA.text: Italian food is VERY easy to mess up..I.E : olive garden..a place where the last thing you taste is something from Italy.  Lots of pseudo places, wanna be homemade spots try to mimic a great Italian flavor but fail tremendously. That is why I am so glad Casa di amore is still around  The ambiance of the place is great. The tables, the little stage with life performance, the bar and the service reminds me of NYC or san Francisco. Lightinig is very soft making the experience a mix between romantic and sexy.  The food is great as well!. The bruchettas are fresh and tasty and the consistencyof the calamari was great. The antipasto portion is pretty big and presentation is great as well. FYI, their bread and butter is AMAZING..just be carefull you end up like me and eat too much of it .  The entrees were as impressive as the appetizer. My lasagna tasted like homemade, and my friends white sauce seafood pasta was good. We noted that the noodles were a little on the plain side, but the sauces and seafood were able to share some of its flavor with it  Some days this place has some specials on wines . Be sure to ask your server about those before ordering. You might be able to save some money.  If you still have room for desert. Try the Tiramisu or caneloni. Freshly made and packed with flavor.  Hasta la pasta!

J1qTBt6Ap7sIDilScvbobw.text: Wonderful food, great entertainment and stellar service. Our server Michael was great. As a gluten intolerant customer, I figured I'd have little to no options at an Italian restaurant. Not only did they have several options, but Michael was quick to navigate me through the menu. The scallops were delicious and my fiance said that his gypsy pasta was a wonderful spicy dish. If we lived here, we'd be back in a heartbeat. When we come back to Vegas, we'll be sure to come again. "Just remember, leave the gun, take the cannoli"

ZddCKuDwm9MOlosV0R1Thg.text: We were in Vegas for 5 days. On the last night we decided to eat outside the strip, away from the hotels and malls. We found this lovely place on yelp. It was exactly as I read in the reviews, great ambience, and tasty food. The service was fabulous! Don't hesitate to oh there but book ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Self explanatory and as delicious as it looks

3O4FzbYVtoFz20OGnUemuA.text: First off the food is amazing. You will be happy here with whatever you order.    My major gripe is being told I cannot sub a menu item without being charged extra.....or if I was here for swing shift they wouldn't even entertain the thought of a special order.   My specific case was wanting a meatball sub with meatless meatballs. The chef (NOT the batender who was nice) said they will have to charge me an extra $3 for the substution. Mind you, they are the same price on the menu.  It just left a bad taste in my mouth, but the superb food has had me back since then and I enjoyed it immensely.  Its unfortunate that one incident has left me hesitant to return and their policy of letting the chef run the show instead of paying customers sucks....but if you can stomach the 'no special orders' policy you will be just fine here.   On a side note, the video poker there is quite stingy. All I do is lose, lose, lose. Not even in a fun, i win a little and give it all back sort of way. I straight up lose hard and fast.

bry48Xe_9o8xoUSxhC4UZw.text: This place is awesome for a date night! ;)    I stumbled across a review for Casa di Amore reviewed by another yelper Karlie G-and decided to try Casa. I had a wickedly wonderful female coming to visit me from LA that I adore visiting me last weekend, and wanted a place to take her that was romantic and cozy-and not on the strip.   Checked  the website after reading the review-free complimentary limo ride if you have a reservation for dinner?!?! Yes PLEASE! Called the number on the website (you can't get the limo through normal website reservations) with the only requirement being you have have to be picked up from a hotel. Perrrfect!  I could drink with my date!  The person I talked to-Phil, Paul? I can't remember was super cool, had a pleasant demeanor, had me scheduled in no time flat to be picked up from palace station 15 mins before our reservation, thanked me for choosing casa and even put in a request in my request for a booth.   Our limo driver Byron picked us up right on time He introduced himself, was pleasant, opened our doors for we were on our way!   Arrived around 7 at Casa Di Amore, and was wondering what to do with my wine glasses and my other bottle of wine we hadn't finished. Byron took anything I didn't want to carry and put it in his trunk and we proceeded right inside-carrying our wine glasses from earlier straight in with us.   Greeted by a super cute, and courteous door girl, I didn't catch her name she was keeping the circus in check around her and doing a great job. She smiled as soon as we came in, and I think she even knew my name as soon as I walked in even though I had never been there before based on the time I walked in and my party size! Nice! What a pro!   Walk in and the atmosphere blew me away!  The place is not huge by any means, but it just big enough to have an organzied chaos and frenzy of laughter, the smell of italian food, servers zipping about-the kind of place that makes you feel cozy and warm.   Our seats were not ready yet, so they politely asked us to wait in the lounge area near the bar and Byron took led us to the back. We were still drinking our wine, not a thing said by anyone carrying in our own wine glass-double Nice!  A really good lounge singer was belting out some classics and originals and a keyboard player was right in sync with him-he was working hard for the money on the intimate little stage right in the middle of the place. It was just the right loudness to fill the room, without drowning out the conversations people were having.   We sat for 10-15 minutes, I lost track due to the wine and a little buzzed, but the atmosphere was so enjoyable we didn't even notice. .  A few minutes later we were seated. Our server showed up right away with water's with lemons in them nice and chilly. We got a HUGE 6-8 person booth I requested for the just the two of us-even though the place was packed on a Saturday night-Kudos Casa!  Our server, who was a really nice blonde, asked us about appetizers, but we skipped that figuring we'd get bread and I had read the portions were large.   I ordered the Lobster Ravioli without looking as the rest of the menu, my date ordered the triple cheese pasta and we ordered a bottle of Cabernet. Everything on the menu was priced reasonably as were the bottles of wine.   I'm almost out tryping room, so I'll wrap it up.  I agree with Karlie G-The food was an excellent 4 stars-but the service was 5! -the ambiance a& atmosphere-outstanding. I'd tell you more about the night... but we finished the second bottle...and its a lil fuzzy-aint gonna lie. Never ending Bread basket, 2 Caeser Salads and 2 Entrees and a bottle of wine with tip about $100-not too shabby at all- Everything else melted away staring into the eyes of my companion...and it's the perfect place to do so- Ill be back for sure. ; ) Thanks Casa!

D8_QEn0liUOj9gucJJJsGA.text: I had the baked mostaccoli and my girlfriend had the pasta al forno. I have to say pasta is my favorite food and it's tough to disappoint me, but we were disappointed.   The noodles were slightly overcooked and the pasta al forno had no sauce in it. It was a pool of grease.   After seeing the photos on Yelp I have decided to go back and try some other dishes before giving up on them. We also had the calamari which was also a mediocre 3 stars. For the price we definitely wouldn't relive this meal, but we'll try them again.  The live music bumped my review up to a 3, otherwise this would be a 2.

4awILyiXOhci7J28G-b-lQ.text: Had a killer meal tonight The pork chops with vinegar and peppers had this great sauce meaty and filling. I've eaten here before I did not like the lasagne It was way to cheesy the ravioli the same. I'm so glad I gave this a second chance Yummer's  Tony our waiter on point Good job.

UW39qSf_oXQZduTtuyPVvw.text: It is the best pasta I would recommend everybody thank you so much they have the best service They have the best dessert thank you again I will come again I will tell all my family and my friends

pEkLMniSgOyCDZxs5tPelg.text: I came here with my friend one night before we went to a show on the strip. It was ok, but nothing to write home about (just yelp about!).   We started off with the bruschetta, and it was probably one of the best that I've ever had. It's not super hard to make this, but it was still delicious. For the main course I got the osso bucco which is supposed to be a favorite, but I wasn't thrilled. The risotto was overcooked and didn't have any flavor. Even adding salt did nothing for it. The meat wasn't even as tender as I've had before. The tomato sauce was good, but then again, it's tomato sauce. If you're messing that up, then you should be making Italian food. My friend got the eggplant parmesan, and she really enjoyed it. Again, she said it wasn't the best, but not bad either.   The dessert was weird. We got the dream bomba, which was SUPPOSED to be peanut butter ice cream, with a caramel center. Well, there was no caramel center, so we just ended up with peanut butter ice cream. Again, it was fine, but it wasn't as described, and it was just ice cream, nothing special. I wouldn't come back here, and I probably would recommend this to a friend. I can think of 5 other Italian restaurants I'd rather spend my money at.

Rm-NSJyyAj60QruSitbEQA.text: We came here for my niece's 21st birthday on 2/28 and it was AMAZING! The atmosphere was perfect and the waiter went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. The live music during our dinner was awesome and they even sang happy birthday to my niece. The food was to die for and I'm already counting the days until I can make it back to Vegas to eat here again. They also offer free limo service to people staying on the strip which made it even more worth it. There's no excuse not  to go here while you're in Vegas. Make your reservation now!! You won't regret it.

_uHbUbx4zqgKD39n4lZZeQ.text: I am a local and have always brought visitors from out of town to Casa Di Amore because of the great ambiance, food, etc. Brought my friend there recently for a big birthday and booked a booth. There was no one in the restaurant when we arrived so we told the hostess we were there and were having a drink at the bar, next thing a bus load of people arrived (CES convention) and we were handed the half booth by the stage. Ended up eating in the bar area which was very disappointing. I enjoyed my salmon dish, but my friend was disappointed in the chicken alfredo. Also, beware if you buy the coupon at Restaurant.com, it is only good for after 9:30 pm - that was changed this year.

vjTOc1trrg_HpboTwvXg2g.text: Classic Las Vegas at it's best! Experienced and friendly staff prepared to guid you and enhance your dining. The food is spot on and generous. A must for every visit to Vegas

32Ag4A45VVJNg2Sxk87hFQ.text: I visited this place with my family. They came from across the country to have a great time in Vegas. I really loved the live music and the food. Our waiter which of course I forgot his name ( pony tail young guy) was amazing! He was super sweet/kind and very helpful. The reason why I put a low star is because a waiter was rude. I think his name is Nick (white male, bald spot, round belly) I asked him when the bread will be ready because we have been waiting quite a while, he said, " You'll get it when it's ready" The restaurant wasn't that crowded. His day was probably bad and just took it out on me. He didn't need to be like that.

be5rcHtMlpDj0hnigJjpOw.text: Old time Vegas restaurant. Now that's Italian. Live music evenings. Family went other night enjoyed entire evening. Band members sang to little nieces. They loved it. Danced.

WDv459x6ST7ZE_CoWq_Tbw.text: My favorite restaurant I have EVER been to!   Great service, Great people, Great atmosphere! We always go here when we're in town and will keep doing so. They have live bands playing and they do fun songs that you can really get into, they sung some Sinatra and it was awesome. The band members come by and talk to you on their breaks and you all become family. Atmosphere is darker, more "Romantic" "relaxing" type of setting.. definitely old school Vegas with pictures of celebrities  all over the restaurant.   the food is PERFETTO! My favorite dish is the  Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto. I get it every time! Great wine and drink list. Service is fantastic even when they're crazy busy. You HAVE to get the cannoli's! FANTASTIC! (You even get a free shirt with it.)   If you're staying on the strip ride in their complimentary limo! Very clean and did I mention... COMPLITMENTARY?? No nasty expensive cab ride, and it's nice to get off the Strip for a bit.  I do recommend making reservations (at least for the weekend) because they get crowded fast for dinner time (Hint: make reservations online for easy and fast booking..but if you want a limo you do have to call).  As far as attire goes, you can either dress up or dress casual (I always go for some type of special occasion so I'm dressed up, and no you won't feel out of place.) Great for a date night with your special other half, or for a family get together graduation, bday, or even bridal shower celebrations!

hbiCD2RNw1HsgyBUL8--bA.text: this place is purely old school and a perfect choice if your on a late flight arriving in vegas (they stay open till 2 am).   this restaurant is a favorite of the locals and was recommended to us by our cab driver, who was clearly on his game.  the decor is old vegas, so you are expecting frank, dean, sammy or even elvis at anytime. in the case of elvis, please note he would not leave the building until he finished his meal. that's how good the food is and at a reasonable price point!  our waiter michael, promptly introduced himself and was spot on throughout the meal. we had the meatballs for an appetizer which were a generous portion, very tasty and were accompanied by an excellent tomato sauce. apologies, i forgot what my wife had as i was too busy eating,wtf? however she was enamored with her entree as well.   again, kudos to our waiter michael, who was informative, well spoken and makes you want to revisit as does the food and ambiance.  we shall return!

rmVY_q_42AkF8XY-eFJGZw.text: I wanted to be impressed. I took friends that wanted Italian to this location. It was loud. The service was poor.  The food was decent - but I wasn't wowed. If the service had been better it would have meant a lot.

KNGH6j-aCOWd5JFmfVYzkw.text: New Vegas tradition. My wife,sister,and brother in law dined here a few weeks ago and it was great.  Had limo pick us up at strip hotel ( only us four in limo) and took short ride to restaurant . Slow night so we were seated as soon as we arrived. Small place but great decor and the live music during dinner is just great ambiance.  Great server Great drinks Excellent food ( had the veal ) Free ride  Pricing is normal for Vegas, but I expect to pay 30-50 a piece for dinner. The difference here was the service if you treat people with respect in turn great service. We all loved it will be back every time in Vegas.

eMM3qLfHHMjlYeyLi5EMJQ.text: Casa di Amore reminds me of a scene from the movie Goodfellas. You have a duo singing classic Frank Sinatra and Sammy Davis Jr songs, and amazing Italian dishes. It's a local spot way off the strip, but if you call in advance their courtesy shuttle will provide you with roundtrip transportation.   I ordered the baked lasagna and shared the massive serving of spaghetti and meatballs with a friend. Both were delicious. The homemade sauce makes all the difference, both a must have.

RWCKrO-tamNICKeM3ocEUQ.text: If you love old Vegas vibe...you will LOVE this place. Live entertainment...spend your evening being serenaded by old blue eyes Frankie, Sammy Davis Jr. And Dean Martin. I found this gem through a restaurant.com website. Went on a Monday night. The special was lobster ravioli and shrimp with pesto over linguini. We ordered one of each. Awesomesauce!!!! And Monday is 50% wine so we had the Sangiovese from Tuscany. Wow! For dessert...ordered the Creme brulee. Got a free restaurant T-shirt with "Leave the gun...take the cannoli" on the back. Food-SCORE! Wine-SCORE!! Entertainment-SCORE!!! Old Vegas atmosphere-SCORE!!!!

ZlQLZcrgrPVvtKSvBcZ0xg.text: Great old Vegas feel, talented entertainment, delicious food! Definitely an experience to remember!

vRlaX50n3_l4L5Wmo1bcIg.text: Cioppino was delicious. Our waiter, Tony, was so genuine and kind. The bomba dessert is great, I preferred the mango one. Live music is a nice touch. There's a bar with those gambling machines.

zpaOhS4it6-Vk9clH--0kg.text: The best Italian food I've had in Vegas. The atmosphere is great, it is small inside, which can be a problem on busy weekend nights, but it creates a really good vibe, especially when the live music starts. I in general am NOT a fan of live music while I am eating. It is often too loud and the performers are typically of average quality at best. I was pleasantly surprised when the music started halfway through my dinner here. The volume level wasn't overbearing and I could still have a conversation with the people at my table without having to yell over the music. The quality of the performance was also pretty decent. The service here overall was great, our server was very attentive and friendly throughout our meal. The food was delicious. I had the chicken parmesan and it was probably the best chicken parmesan that I've ever eaten...anywhere. Will definitely be coming back here soon.

Kv6k-s4LLRmGdsgK-Z0M-Q.text: Never have we had an experience like the one we had here...  We arrived and were asked if we had reservations which we did not, as this wasn't a planned stop.  After being seated at a table which was clearly an afterthought  (it was half a table and half booth seating  you had to sit side by side) which was fine with us as we aren't particular and it faced a small stage but didn't face the rest of the restaurant.  We placed our order for house salad and a build your own pizza.  We asked for all veggies and no cheese.  (We don't eat dairy or meat.) After waiting for a bit, a manager came to our table and stated that the chef would not accommodate our order.  He will in no way deviate from the menu and basically told us he has standards to uphold and obviously we were below them...  We were taken aback as we have never been treated like that before.  We have never had a restaurant not accommodate our diet in some way.  Needless to say we sat in the parking lot for a bit in disbelief.  I wouldn't recommend this establishment to my worst enemy.  Would of given zero stars if it were an option!

Uqk88__p7qBv7ePJOFIkwA.text: I looooved this place! I just moved to Las Vegas in June and my boyfriend took me for my birthday. The food didn't disappoint one bit it is a little pricey but so good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bruschetta was amaaaazing

Q1zX5pLNabu1rujpL6CgLA.text: OUSO BOUCO!!!!  This place is AMAZING!!! We go every time we are in Vegas.  I always have the limo come get us at our hotel and tip the driver.  The food and the entertainment are worth 10x the price

bpQiKPVpCiowwi75B8FvqQ.text: My absolute favorite Italian style restaurant. I've enjoyed the Canteloni, salads and bread! The shrimp cocktail was a old Vegas favorite, too.   So I stop in on a Wednesday after a long trade show at 9:30. Barely found a spot to park and the place was packed! Only in Vegas. Brad still hamming it up at each of his tables as I ate at the bar - no option!   The menu has changed, but the same flavors and presentation. I'll miss my old favorites, but grow up fat boy and suck it up! Try something different. This trip I ordered the Chicken Parmesan....this partially due to Peyton Manning and all of the "hammered in your head" commercials on Sunday football. Dang Nationwide Insurance. Class's was no slouch - full of flavor and worth every bite.   Service is fantastic and I'm sure they make a huge tip base as when people are happy - many go 25%+. Brad is that type of server.   Anyways - this is just another one of their huge base of Yelp reviews. A True 5 star rating - Enjoy and always win big.

kQQTXi-5ZQFhe-cp5JfdBA.text: We like "old school" restaurants, especially in that old school town Las Vegas. The atmosphere here didn't disappoint, with the decor, the bar and the 2-piece music combo. The classic Italian food didn't disappoint either. It was excellent, hot and well-proportioned, just like everything in Vegas should be. However, we were within seconds of walking out at the beginning. Although we had a reservation, our table wasn't ready. We were asked to wait at the bar, where we were ignored for a long time. When I went up front to ask about our table, the hostess played dumb & said she thought we sat down to eat at the bar (we stood the whole time, are tall, and could easily be seen across the room). We were then told that a big birthday party was taking up a lot of tables and resources. Well too bad. You don't overbook your restaurant & shut out people with reservations.   I was literally waving my car key in front of the hostess when we were finally seated. The Maitre d' then proceeded to shake my hand about 10 times to apologize, which I don't love if I plan to eat bread. He did give us free drinks & dessert as I recall. Still, it's better to get it right than to have to apologize for getting it wrong.

UfXn5F6_RmcFFIbqx6toSg.text: I'm a huge fan! Live music, old school Vegas style theme, and delicious food... I'm sold. I've been coming here for years and I honestly feel it continues to get better and better. Brad has been my server several times and he's awesome. Treats you like family and provides excellent recommendations. If you're debating between this and a different Italian restaurant, choose this!!

faAfGCqVvo3yWA2NoVrMaw.text: My husband is a steak snob.  We have tried almost every steak from the strip and back.  He said his ribeye was the BEST that he had had since moving to Vegas!  Very lively crowd.  Great "OldVegas" style lounge singer.  Would recommend reservations if going on a Saturday night.  Wait staff ULTRA attentive!  All over a five star experience!!

q5taB7KkiKEF4rXPUtM5zg.text: We went late on Sunday night and the place was packed and we didn't have reservations. Didn't think we'd need any at that time. However, they were able to seat the 2 of us right away at one of only 2 tables available. The food was phenomenal and the staff was very friendly. Our waiter, Tony, was very personable and attentive. My wife needed to custom order her dish and they gladly accommodated her needs. It can get a bit expensive if you order an appetizer, dessert and a lobster dish. Our dinner for two, even after using a $25 gift cert from restaurant.com was $98 including tip. If you order a canoli or creme brulee, you get a free souvenir t-shirt.

3ZGPnkHckG4yIJkhtx0fyw.text: It is one of the best Italian Resturaunts I have ever eaten at across the US.  Very friendly staff.  You make reservations and they will even pick you up at your hotel and take you back.  The price is very reasonable especially for the ambiance and for Las Vegas.  It makes you think of Vegas of Old.  Very charming and had a wonderful time.  I will go back any chance I get.

J9zOIHANxzs1fYs7TfBJYA.text: We were recommended to this place by some friends who told us to get the Steak Sinatra. We had it and think it's the best steaks in town.

qYEwdC2wCO48BJJ5tkUohg.text: their pizza is the closest thing to east coast pizza. mmmm. the feel is old school vegas and they have a guy that sings frank sinatra and dean martin song. so cute for a nice date night.

TNaDij3lljLFk6rLjJ1ZmQ.text: A trip back into Las Vegas history. Wonderful food, great music and a fun teeshirt that comes with the dessert.

kKUOfs3yG3a-jbB10a1UKA.text: Great food, wonderful atmosphere, service and music.  Perfect spot before or after the airport. Eggplant di Amore was delicious and huge portions.  Stuffed garlic bread is amazing and the wine selections and prices are fair.  We will definitely be back. *I heard they offer half portions of entrees if you ask so this would be a good idea unless you are splitting.  It's a little loud with the music so not ideal for a quiet dinner but you can get a table further away from the stage if you make a reservation.

AMTJop2jzcmg3EmT9bjPGw.text: Excellent food great service old school Vegas all the way. Will be coming here religiously. Our server Bead made our night excellent.

KbXLgxaAh5Z1hYRhqPnXGA.text: This place was pretty cool and the food was delicious. I ordered the rib eye steak and was not as tender as I thought it would be. It was good. My husband ordered the chicken park and loved it. My favorite was the cannoli and the mozzarella sticks. Our waiter was really nice and attentive. I really liked the wall art, it was old school Las Vegas. I enjoyed it!!!

NOtfagdnqvJkf9cYWGZO6g.text: This restaurant is a gem, and nothing short of perfection. Around 9 on a Monday night, I was surprised to see the restaurant so busy. It didn't take long for me to realize why- this place is so much fun! The decor is warm, cluttered and in your face Italian, but most definitely in a good way. Booths are cozy, tables are close, and it feels as if you're sitting down for dinner with family and friends. There was live music and a welcoming atmosphere and to be honest, I wanted to stay all night. Service was attentive, very informative, but not overly pushy. I didn't feel like our server was trying to get money out of us, he truly seemed passionate about the food and was quick to offer recommendations without being pushy, which is a HUGE plus in my book. We shared the calamari appetizer, my boyfriend had the Linguine Luciano (warning VERY spicy) and I had Fettucine Alla Pappasito. Both were superb. This was a real treat, and I can't wait to come back! Not at all what I expected to find tucked off of Tropicana. Perfect date night location or place to bring the whole family. EXCELLENT!

-R26vKROjxM0k9PiJjxpKg.text: Totally authentic Italian food!!  The limo driver was fantastic and the Frank Sinatra singer was great.  We had a group of ten and were taken care of like we were family.  I had the veal piccata and was pleasantly surprised.  The cannoli was fantastic and my husband's birthday was celebrated by all!!!

FMeMCFPiOx_BqdNQA_Nkyg.text: The atmosphere of this place makes it great as soon as you walk in. The food was really good and the portions were adequate. I had a stuffed pork chop and it was AMAZING!!!  The Alfredo sauce is pretty amazing too. The prices are a little on the high side but worth it.

L91qm7V-xrywZHhFZLziFQ.text: Seamless limo pick up with really hospitable driver Dick whisked us away from our hotel right to the doorstep of Casa di Amour. Make sure you set this up with your reservation. Well paced out meal, great piano man and excellent food. I'm from New York and really this food was comparable to New York City quality Italian. Had the eggplant parm, Caesar salad and my wife had Lobster ravioli. Recommend the house of love to anybody.

I-oEon6NcKBUIJVCCuvCAg.text: Amazing atmosphere. The live musician was incredible, sounded just like frank Sinatra. The food was outstanding. We ordered most of the appetizers on the menu and I had chicken for my main entree and everything was outstanding!  They even have a complimentary limo service that can pick you up and take you anywhere you'd like afterwards.

wYgbIbE07EUgumm8Mpxweg.text: The best Osso Bucco I have ever had. My wife had the Ciopino and said it was the best since 15 years ago in Conneticut. Our waiter Tony was great, Sam picked us up in the tips only limo.  Half price wine on Sunday.  Old Vegas style, I sure wish this place was back home. I will be back every time we return!

xXErf3zchsNS-isrEhoyoA.text: The food was tasty though I didn't really eat much because an hour before going, I had just stuffed myself at a buffet the way you do when visiting Vegas. So I'm just going to discuss it point by point:  The limo to the restaurant is awesome! The really nice driver picked us up in front of TI and drove us to the restaurant and back. He was really patient. At the end of the night, he had another party to pick up but was really nice about getting us to make up our minds whether we wanted to go or wait until he came back.  The server was awesome! He was super sweet and really helpful when my sister and I couldn't figure out what wine we wanted. I also kept running to the bar area to watch the SC game at one point after ordering a new bottle and he brought my glass to me at the bar. Sweet! :o)  The bar area has the standard bar/pub feel. TVs everywhere you turn. The bartender is really nice even though she was a fan of either Ohio or Oregon, I forget. Well, either way, she was not a fan of SC. :oP  There is a guy who plays piano and sings all songs Dean Martin/Frank Sinatra-esque. Gives the entire place an old school Vegas feel.  All in all, I had an awesome time there. The antipasti were delicious. The wine was fabulous. The game was SHWEET (though unrelated to the restaurant but it just added to my terrific experience because SC won WOOHOO!!!) :o)

PYlHRdgXw0qAsRPESrxz2A.text: Went to Casa di Amore for my pre-60th birthday dinner based on Yelp and Trip Advisor reviews.  We weren't disappointed.  Not in the best of neighborhoods, but well worth the trip.  They do provide limo service but I was too late to request  the service.  Highly recommend Gnoochi and Prosciutto.  Quite honestly, the main courses ordered at our table were all great!  If you want live entertainment, get there after 7pm. Otherwise they have CD's playing of old time Sinatra, Tony Bennett and others.  Would absolutely go back again!

Nh1vXFMmQqFx-sluFHZujA.text: as an extremely serious italian cuisine critic blathering from a mouth spanning from generations of proud & well-fed italiano descendants, I typically dined @ Casa di Amore tenuously. The gnocchi was pretty good, salmon was exceptional and the service was very friendly & knowledgable. Entertainment very nice, and the dark lighting & photos throughout of old Vegas very comforting. The crowd was very loud and boisterous, enhancing the old italian family dining experience. No surprise that the pricing was way out of line though. fifty bucks for a decent dinner and a cocktail?... seriously, like they should be spoon-feeding me & wiping my chin @ those prices.

5dBIi6BD3Gd6RPMI-aE6Dg.text: The perfect resteraunt!  From the service to the food, this place is top notch!  The best Italian resteraunt I have been to in Vegas hands down!

PytYeMoMK2dp8KMEiFC4Sw.text: First time eating here and we were NOT disappointed! The Fettucini Alfredo was wonderful but would stood out more than the food was the atmosphere and wait staff. Our waiter Stephen was super attentive as were the bussers and all the other staff helping. The live music was such a nice and classy touch and the restaurant itself was super cute...what I imagine old Las Vegas was like. We would definitely go back!!

PXPcjw_gboKDFcjhQqq_HQ.text: This place has amazing costumer service everyone that works there is truly nice. Our waiter who I don't remember his name was really nice to us and was friendly from start to finish. As for the food I'm not a huge fan of Italian food but my girlfriend is so I had to take her here after reading the review. The food did not disappoint everything we got was delicious. Best part of it Was that my girlfriend loved the food and when she's happy I'm happy!! Since then we've been here a few times now and we plan on going back.

7ep3OdfI5fF_XxMuqUq0Mg.text: Omg! This place is why I go to Vegas! It's off the strip in a regular neighborhood but when you walk in, it feels like a traditional Italian restaurant you see in the movies! Beautiful piano playing with wonderful singers, doesn't overwhelm the dining room setting at all. Service was exceptional, food was superb and the overall experience is what makes this restaurant so special.

Mb-quKOIfVt_C6odwFcUXA.text: Our first visit to the restaurant was based on the reviews. The service was excellent, our waiter was polite and friendly. The food was not. The restaurant claims that it's "old Italian," but, the food was over cooked, bland, too salty and the seafood tasted fishy, no pun intended. Fish shouldn't taste fishy. We were a bit disappointed in the end. We will unfortunately not be going back.

8-K7y5ozWgDnT2Xup2Tq4w.text: Since we were planning to be in Vegas for the Rascal Flatts concert at Hard Rock, and having the idea of trying somewhere new for dinner, I made a reservation at this place for my BF and I after reading the good reviews.   Firstly, they arranged to have their limo come pick us up from the hotel right at 4:45p for a 5:00p reservation - nice. The driver was right on time! The drive over to the restaurant was a little longer than anticipated (I had mapped it out at only 3 miles from the hotel) but apparently there was major construction underway on Trop so he had to go an alternative route to avoid that. He gave us a heads up before we arrived that they were in the process of remodeling the restaurant - oh ok.   As we walked in, there were a few tables already occupied but, upon being seated for a few minutes, we realized it was DEAD quiet. Strangely no music (I had envisioned old Blue Eyes crooning in the background as we were sipping our wine and looking at the historic Vegas photos on the walls). Our server informed us that because of the construction, their music system was disconnected. That definitely reduced the "ambiance" factor, but about 15 or 20 minutes in, their live music duo started to play oldies. I enjoyed it, but my BF thought it was cheesy LOL.  Anyway, on to the menu - many choices from chicken to meat to pasta! We ended up ordering bruschetta and a simple salad to start, the mussels appetizer, and 1 lb. of spaghetti (yes a whole pound - we've never seen that anywhere!) with pomodoro. The bruschetta was awesome, the spaghetti was pretty decent, and the mussels dish was nice as well (mostly because of the yummy sauce) although they were the big green lip - I prefer the smaller ones.  We were pretty full so decided to pass on dessert (didn't want to be falling asleep at the concert). By the time we finished, we were right on time to get with our driver again for the drive back to Hard Rock. Smooth sailing, tipped driver and bid him farewell.  Overall, it was an enjoyable meal but we definitely came at an awkward time because of the remodeling. I think I'd like to return to this off-the-beaten-path restaurant after the expansion is complete to get a more accurate experience. I actually may return next month when my Mom and I will be there for a 2-night getaway. Saluti!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iZn4qtvgCYTDMCaffMdHiw.text: What's to like: An old school "lounge" ambience.  You'll feel so Mafioso.   Live music, played with the perfect volume to allow dinner conversation with having to speak in raised voices.  50's pictures of vintage Vegas landmarks and images of the Rat Pack adorn the walls.  The service is outstanding.   The food is reasonably priced and better than average.  It's good... not fantastic.

adNS6X4TnaxuFFxzoezGzg.text: I've eaten here a couple of times. Great food! Friendly staff! Excellent ambiance.  Can't wait to visit here again.

X9TIehcRZ6xqkwFWIWyeCw.text: Definitely one of the highlights of my trip we had dinner there twice The food Is fantastic antipasto Fried shrimp With Linguine topped with a spicy red sauce some of the best I've ever had including NYC they call it gypsy sauce - The video machines at the bar free drinks actually won some money had dinner and drinks just a wonderful time. If you enjoy Italian this is a must go to. Argentine Cowboys Boston mass.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fGYnvA7o9VMm_Uo-sTujhQ.text: This is a True gem. The menu is as delicious as it is diverse. George has crooned to diners for years, and his vocal talents are remarkable. In a town filled with lounge singers, his entertainment chops are special. Plus, CDA has lots of Old-Timey, nostalgia  And, it is perfect for a date, a family meal and a dinner party.   Just finished off the Pork Chops & Vinegar dinner. A classic! Great service from Brad and Nicole.   Spend your money and your time in this spot!

_oopKNqymIkENeJK6GRDVw.text: Ok...I travel a ton and I mean more than any human should.  As such I eat out a lot.  In fact I eat Italian out a lot including places like Federal Hill in Providence.  On top of that I'm a pretty damn good Italian cook myself.  Enough said.  I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!  Let's just say they get their cannoli shells from a bakery in Brooklyn!!!!  Their food is excellent....their marinara is excellent, their pasta is always cooked spot on.....their sausage and peppers are excellent...The service is beyond reproach, and their cannoli's are .  in fact every time I go  all I think about is "how quick can I get back"!  Oh did I say they have live music with Paul Stubblefield playing drums and singing on the weekend.  Remember the band S.O.U.L?  Yes it's that (he's in his late 70's now) Paul Stubblefield!  WOW DAMN IS HE GOOD!!!!!!  Oh.....and the beer is ice cold and the drinks are strong!  Is as close as I can get to Italian heaven here on earth .

bg6ioqyMp5hze4lsgToUqg.text: My husband is a big Buca Di Beppo fan and sometimes it's just too much for me. There is too much noise, very cheesy design and honestly as one who cooks at home, I have a hard time justifying the prices. I wanted him to be able to have that experience but on a more intimate, low key and mature level. So I chose Casa Di Amore. Just like most people I looked all over yelp for photos, menu prices and ambiance. This restaurant had a great selection of food at a more reasonable price with a more romantic atmosphere. It's dim lit and has large booths, which is always a plus and live music. I am a total sucker for live music at any capacity really.    I ordered the Penne & Greens and my husband ordered the Baked Mostaccioli. We shared a side of Garlic Bread because why not?! Both dishes were very tasty and quite large for the price which averaged $20-$23 a plate. Still a bit expensive considering I can make pasta at home for under $10, BUT we're paying for an experience.   Our waiter was very kind and attentive. There was not a long wait to be seated or to receive our food. Was it the best Italian food I have ever had? No, but it was still really good and the experience was very pleasant. I will definitely come back and as a side note they did have a few other vegetarian dishes on the menu which I am looking forward to eating in the future.

9RfIiu4mypTzygi49XJs_A.text: Very good place with interesting perks. They offer shuttle service to hotel guests in the area (or to locals that want to leave their car in a hotel near their house instead of driving) and live music daily, for example. Prices are a little steep, though. A meal for 2 cost us $120. If you can spare the $$, it's worth it.  Brad was our server and he's delightful! He's been here for years, so just ask him any question and he has the answer! He recommended fried calamari for an app, and it was delicious! Their marinara sauce is amazing! We had the Fettuccine alla pappasito and Eggplant di amore as entrees, and they were very good. Eggplant was a little too salty for my taste, but still good.  For desert we had tiramisu and cannoli, and they were both phenomenal!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli and tiramisu. Gotta try them!

rAoiPJUX0m0D2-YYLTIssg.text: Had the most lovely time here for Valentine's Day. We got a rose, small box of chocolate, and complementary photo taken. It was quiet, romantic, and the food was 10/10! Our waiter Robert was very kind and helpful with information. We would definitely go back! Loved every second of our time there.

5bw9SDuJSk-TRWfXtbVv8A.text: One of my absolute favorite dinner experiences ever! This place has such a quaint and authentic feel.  The food was delicious, service was stellar and the live music was the cherry on top.  If you haven't experienced this place check it out!

X_xIXTaCDj7q1e7RFkLQLw.text: Had a bad experience the 2nd trip!!! Don't know if I'll be back. I ordered the crispy salmon plate with vegetables and a twice baked potato and a side cesar salad. The cesar salad was coated in mayonnaise it had no taste and it was clumpy just tasted literally like mayonnaise! That was a bummer. Then my plate arrived and I wasn't impreSsed the veggies were partly frozen and tasted microwaved, the twice baked potato was for sure microwaved and dry. The salmon wasn't crispy but soggy and the sauce on top was like a combination of tomato paste and capers with way too much salt! We went on a Monday night they had  half of on all wine bottles which is a nice offer! Nice environment and live music. My hubby ordered the spaghetti and meatballs but he wasn't happy this time either he said something was going off this night with the sauce and the meat. We had stomach aches that night and the next morning. It just crazy when your food takes for ever and tastes like it was microwaved. I mean I could have done that at home. Oh well won't be making this my favorite italiano restaurante in NV.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GG_x82yZMOFJQmV5DtqA9A.text: The food was absolutely amazing.  We had a group of soccer players in town for a tournament and when reaching out to a family member (thanks Jeff)  for a dinner recommendation for the team, he recommended Casa Di Amore.   Couldn't be more please with our food choices for our group.  Will definitely be back if/when we return to Vegas.   We had a little issue with our Bill which was quickly resolved, Thanks Kathleen.

cdJYhklMHo4sdXGi3tiKvA.text: One of our friends who lives in Las Vegas told us about this place. I am fussy about Italian food. Once we got inside for dinner, I was amazed.  It is decorated in old style Vegas, Frank Sinatra and Ratpack photos. I loved it from the start. Food was pretty good and large portions.  The exotic mango ice cream desert was great.  Probably the best part wad going out to the back for the tiki bar.  Who would have thought! Even though it was outside, it was not terribly hot because there are mister fans going and we were quite comfortable.  Order tiki drinks and food in the tiki bar. If you have dinner in the restaurant,  your receipt has a coupon for a free tiki drink shot.

EDW9YOiePLheXRDrOC_JdQ.text: If you are in the mood for Italian, this is your place! This place is a definite dining experience! Everything we ordered was delicious. The garlic cheese bread is a must! The service was excellent as well!

VvMQ9IOdRH0ZN7YboxLAdA.text: I went here tonight with my husband for our weekly date, and I have to say this place was DELICIOUS! Amazing staff, very friendly and accommodating. The food was beautifully presented, and even better, it was very yummy.  The portions are generous, so expect to take more than enough leftovers home.  They also have live music and an extensive alcohol list, and many specials for happy hour and different days of the week, in case you're looking for a fun place with great food and drinks to let your hair down. It's also really nice, because the menu is a little pricey, and during happy hour the bar menu is 50% off.   Definitely come here! You won't regret it.

qdTiCbdVgjHlTP3LxRFzFw.text: This place is a hidden gem ! It's not much on the outside which is why I never felt the need to stop in, but after a friend recommended it we tried. It's beautiful on the inside ! Great energy, live musicians, and amazing food ! And to top it of there is a new bar right out back that we checked out after dinner bc they offered us free shots it's a cute little tiki bar! We loved it ! That is totally up my ally and the decor was awesome, bartender was sweet, and it was so relaxing. We forgot we were in the Vegas heat, it was such a cute date night

erYFkhDBORL0b5W4efXZ7A.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.  Really good food that is priced accordingly.  It's not cheap by nay means, but on par with any other good Italian restaurant off the strip.  You begin with free bread and a nice side salad for $3 more to any entree.  I had the gnocchi with prosciutto and coupled that with some drinks.  The gnocchi was exceptional but I wish it had more prosciutto and spinach to make it more a formidable dish.  The salad was fine, especially for $3 add on, but nothing more than a house salad.  The house wines were actually quite good and large portion.  Draft beers didn't have a large selection but they had a few IPAs and a few high ABV which I always appreciate. The greatest part was the bar area with plenty of TVs and good service from the bartender.  Overall I very much enjoyed my meal and would recommend Casa to anyone in the area or for someone looking for a romantic Italian not overly priced as if it were on the strip.  Half priced wine bottles on Monday and live music almost nonstop are always a plus as well.

iKokMa8CLk8U9nDe-vfU_Q.text: This place is great. If you haven't been here do yourself a favor and check it out. Very good food, excellent friendly service.  And a fun and moderately loud atmosphere.  I was recommended this restaurant by a good friend and would definitely pass that recommendation on.

fwI06lz1pY62TgcDp_sgxQ.text: Food was good.  Some what over priced. However I'm told they have happy hour At late night hours. The live music is Ridiculously loud. Service is mediocre. They charge a 18% gratuity fee for  Party's of 6 or more sometimes without even  Telling you. Food is good. The anti-pasta salad  Is probably the best thing there. Chicken Parmesan with Alfredo sauce is really good I don't like the marinara sauce.they do charge you extra for Alfred sauce. $4 I think. Don't get the garlic cheese bread it's not worth $9 they give you free bread regardless. It's hard as a rock, but hey it's free. Lol The pizza is also good.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary bread and garlic butter. The sauce you see on the side is a cup of gypsy sauce. I believe it&#39;s $7 for a cup
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza was great.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TeUjF3NYkAmOyv4kQFzL1Q.text: I had driven past this place SO many times over the years and always wondered how it is. Well, luckily my Husband planned our Valentine's Day dinner at Casa Di Amore and I am really glad he did!   It's small, the tables are tight and parking is atrocious. But don't let any of those factors scare you off! The service was fantastic and there was live music, which was great.  We shared clams as an appetizer and they were really good. My Husband was hesitant to order them because he wasn't sure I would like them (little does he know!!). He had veal piccata and I had the gypsy pasta (I think that's what it was called), which was REALLY spicy. I love spicy foods, but this was crazy hot! I would stay away from this if you don't order level 10 spice at Thai restaurants. We also shared tiramisu for dessert and ordered a bottle of wine. Overall, it was a great experience and I am so happy that I finally got to check it out! This is a great date spot and I can't wait to go back!

UfwjB1zf66-uS2n77qmy1w.text: We come to the Casa Di Amore every time we're in Las Vegas. From the free transportation to/from hotels on the Strip to the knowledgeable and professional wait staff/ to the always terrific food this is a must enjoy restaurant! The atmosphere is evocative of 'old Vegas' with a live musician there to entertain. The food, classic southern Italy, is not only delightful it's quite filling. Go, you won't be disappointed. Ask for Josh.... a top notch waiter who isn't afraid to offer help in selections and steering you to the 'right' dish you hoped for... Ess Tee

KM2yHtS4URvW-ih2e9Tjag.text: I came here about three months ago on a late night hunger voyage, I was going to order the appetizer size of lobster ravioli but the bartender talked it up as being supremely delicious so I ordered the full sized dish, what a waste of bodily energy & money that was!    Being a regular shopper of Costco, I can attest to saying they served pre-made frozen lobster raviolis from Costco,  I know this, I saw it in the shopping aisle.   The ravioli was not good, super salty as well as mechanically produced.   I did not taste love in that dish, what I tasted was sheer laziness, & someone seeking shortcuts to profitability.  The service was ok - decent, the bartender was pleasant.  I also had a salad that was less than decent, featuring croutons which were pre-made with preservative and additive crap all over them.    The environment is fantastic, I say this because I am into the tacky vegas chic old school type of vibe.  I am also aware the restaurant treats their staff well which is also a plus in my book but I can't give the restaurant more stars because I strongly disliked my food.    I would never come back for the food but for a drink, possibly maybe.  The aesthetic of the environment turned me on but the food and liquor selection is far beneath my personal dietary standards.

of__hE3QBWbTKm5cT-QC9g.text: Next to Nora's, this has to be my favorite Italian restaurant.  Been here a handful of times and tried something new every time. I love their old school vibes, the most. With the old school booths you can eat in, red brick exterior, and jazz band playing.   Monday's is always a great time to go with the half off wines! We, usually, have the waiter choose the wines for us.   It's great for groups and even saw families have birthday celebrations there.

SLUriMrTgdrSyo9ZlCeFPQ.text: Had a great time.  My 3rd time here. Usually sit outside. Tony gave exceptional customer service to my Mother & I inside the restaurant!   Great place to have a good time, and enjoy dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi

ciHFvG0lDEdNa_Ylzr6huA.text: We are Vegas locals and Casa Di Amore used to be our absolute favorite date night spot until our recent experience.   We had not been in a few years due to the fact that we recently had a baby and hardly ever get out for date nights, so we were so excited to finally go out for a date night and chose to celebrate our 4 year wedding anniversary at Casa Di Amore.   It started out wonderful as we were picked up by the shuttle service at Sunset Station by the driver Craig (he was amazing) and then we had a drink in the new tiki patio experience and that was great too! Once we went inside for our reservation things started to go downhill from there.  We had a reservation and let them know it was a special occasion but we were sat at a small table in the bar section where we did not get the same experience we have had many time before in the restaurant section.  Our order came wrong- that's ok mistakes happen! But once we got the right order the food was disappointingly subpar to say the least- definitely nowhere near the quality of food we have had all other the times we had dined there before. My husband and I looked at each other and both said this was probably our last time dining there :(

QMQVcdKhpDs1mTtq61SvxQ.text: We had a wonderful experience.  The atmosphere ,the food and the service were exceptional. We would like to specifically thank Tony for his services.   Definitely recommend and will most likely visit this spot every time we are in LV.

oLxuGGEm6G1SMqVIE0f9oA.text: Fabulous food, great atmosphere, friendly service. There is a complimentary car service to and from the restaurant from any hotel on the strip. Our driver Craig was very kind and gave us tips and points for getting around. He has been in Vegas for 18 years so he was very informed. The restaurant is definitely amazing and I would recommend.

Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Francaise
