UC1h0RRu5auLB6g7BzwFlw.text: Great Vegas spot. Just came for dessert and wine. Great service, cool vibe. Very glad we came.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmm!!!

Gho9mXsomWBV9mhT_viL9w.text: Visiting from Florida. I was so excited to eat here! The pastas were phenomenal. The staff was so friendly and kind. The servers were so busy but still made sure to check on their tables. The atmosphere and the music were top notch! Definitely will come back. 10/10.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gKTT5Z9iB0Wp7B1wZ4M48g.text: Great party tonight at the tili bar  Drinks Calimari people were great had a puch tgat had a punch live music like dick dale and the deltones  Loved it

eEfrJRjqEd_DAij8eTB08Q.text: Really good marinara sauce. Portions are large. Staff and service were helpful, knowledgeable and always checked on us. Would come again.

AUkj6ilJto4Ie8Kk-RNYMg.text: Authentic retro Vegas atmosphere! I had been to Casa Di Amore several years ago and loved it, so I hoped it would be as good this time. Well they've still got the magic! We had a reservation but still had to wait at least 45 minutes for a table, and even though it was standing room only in the bar as well as the minuscule entry, we didn't care. The place is cramped (in a good way) so when you see the incredible food as it comes out of the kitchen you don't mind waiting. Live old school entertainment helps the time pass too. Two in our party are finicky about their favorite dish, Chicken Marsala, and they raved about it. I had the Ciopinno, and it was exceptional. Great drinks, bread, salads, atmosphere. This establishment is a 10+. It's about a $14 Lyft ride from the strip, but break out of the box and try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Award winning Ciopinno

kCr3lZDcFxxJPYLdVlwrEA.text: Very worth considering a visit here.  I have eaten inside and that is a very quality experience.  good Live music and good food.  Not to be missed.  I have also eaten outside and that is not to be missed either.  The theme is tiki.  Good for families.  Enjoyed the live band outside called pyro surfers.  The food is very good in both locations and you can have happy hour prices outside

rxFZm_t_dVZlDQMSFVDfDA.text: I've been driving by this place for years (Dutch Brothers next door) finally made reservations and tried it out. Should have done that a long time ago. Every thing about the experience was great. The place was packed but the host got us the type of table we wanted. Kyle was awesome and the food was amazing! Truly a Vegas gem.

tn8al_tIxWmUpl730Fw4sw.text: This place was the real deal.  This is AUTHENTIC ITALIAN food; you seriously will feel like you stepped back in time. I had the Eggplant Parmesan, and my friend had Pasta Alla Forno.  Both were terrific. The only reason I give 4 stars is due to the bar service.  The drinks were not made correctly, and that was the only drawback.

8ZASPcU8q-9o_O5GQmaL3g.text: My kids wanted to bring their dad here for his birthday because they love it and wanted him to experience a little Amore'.  We all had a fun time with the usual great service and food. This time we had the frutti de mare, cioppino (amazing),  eggplant and chicken parmigiana (we aren't used to breading on our food so next time we would order without it), shrimp fettuccine alfredo, white clam chowder (yum) and ceasar salads. Oh, make sure you set aside some of your bread to dip into your cioppino broth, it's too good to toss!  Bottom line, this is always a great place to bring friends from out of town and a fun, family friendly venue for everyone. Next time I come here, I'm trying the pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XhWrdimrEt9MXEp6gQr2QA.text: My kids are still talking about this place.  We were seated right by the stage and my kids love the live music (the drummer/ vocalist came to our table with a dancing stuff animal----I'll leave it at that----come see for yourself if you have kids---they'll love the experience).  Great atmosphere, music, service and food.  Great job guys!  (linguine w/ clams was one of our favorite dishes and the ice cream dessert was to die for...lol.).

RQZKrQF6rlhKHz3os-LVbg.text: OMG, the food is delicious!!! My 1st visit, definitely will NOT be my last!! My server was Stefan & he was absolutely amazing/attentive!! I tried calamari, clams, chicken, shrimp & Alfredo sauce! Thee BEST Italian food I've ever eaten!! I highly recommend this restaurant!!

fi0tSQItCil6s6L2QHTNOA.text: Excellent atmosphere, nice live music, amazing flavors. I was a bit disappointed at the amount of seafood in the Cioppino for $35, but the flavor more than made up for it (maybe just add the other half of the lobster tail for that price). The Oso Bucco was perfect, tender, and packed with flavor. The risotto was very good, and the smoked sausage dish my wife had was great. We finished off with a creme brulee and a canolli, both were just as wonderful as the rest of the dinner.   Perfect date night spot, or party celebration. Staff was very friendly. Fantastic experience.

jzAB24cnQ-fMT0b5nr1kpw.text: I said this many times through the night, but Casa di Amore has to be everything I have ever wanted in an Italian restaurant. Upon approaching the building, a man dressed nicely in a suit opened the door for my boyfriend and I. The moment we stepped inside, we were transported into a world of live music, Italian food, and great company.   The restaurant was definitely crowded, I mean come on it was a Friday night, luckily there was an empty table to we were seated right away. Our server Brad came right away to our table just to introduce himself and let us know he was already getting some bread ready for our table. Brad was very helpful through the night in helping us decide which meal would satisfy our taste buds.I opted to get the Frutti Di Mare with a cup of soup. My boyfriend chose the Veal Piccata with a cup of soup.   The Breakdown:  The soup was an Italian take on chicken noodle. The noodles were tiny little pasta balls served in a hot chicken broth with chicken chunks, carrots, and celery.   The Frutti Di Mare was the best I have had in a while. It came with huge mussels, clams, scallops, calamari,  and ginormous shrimp! The shrimp and mussels were definitely my favorite part of the dish. I have never eaten shrimp so tasty or huge before. All of this seafood goodness was served on a bed of linguine with your choice of red or white sauce. The server knew I wanted something a little spicy, so he offered to have the kitchen make the red sauce with some spice. My gosh that was the best decision of my life. It definitely made the dish perfect!  The Veal Piccata came served in a sauce with lemon, mushrooms, basil, and a hint of wine. In addition to that, it came with a small bowl of penne pasta in a marinara sauce. My boyfriend enjoyed the dish, but felt that it was a little too small for him (he eats A LOT, so it's perfect for those who want a normal sized portion).   The night was wonderful and the atmosphere made me smile the whole night. Hearing the live music made me feel like I was transported back in time. This is definitely a great date spot, so definitely try it out! They offer a limo service as well, so if you give them a call earlier in the day they can pick you and your date up! Definitely a way to impress your significant other! It's free of charge, but obviously leave a good tip!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti di mare
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal piccata
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RwcHdAPAa6DV0cU_L5kjeg.text: wonderful old vegas place.food,service and price the best,entertainment is top notch music from back in the good old days.wonderful bar and tenders are the best.waiters and host/hostess can't be beat

mxJ5UDW8I6NRaMde5cCJwQ.text: What a great time.  Great staff, great music, and Fantastic Food and drink all the way thru from the calamari to the cannoli and creme brulee.  Ribeye flambe was perfect with a great peppercorn sauce.  The gnocchi and spaget with meatballs were both exceptional.  Yelp did not disappoint on this place.   If I wasn't on a gluten free thing I'd have even been more impressed - did sample a corner of the house bread with oil/balsamic and that ended up the only part of the meal I regret.  In the past I would have ordered a side of the house-made marinara and gone to town.

sKk-Zq5bf2baClJ1toWDRg.text: Ended up here on the recommendation of a waiter at one of the high-end Steak places in old LV. I asked "What is the Italian equivalent of this place" ( Unchanged since the 50's Las Vegas Gangster Vegasoid) Sorry to say I was VERY disappointed. This is basically foodservice grade Italian with decent sauce. Lobster Ravioli? Yep- it's the round frozen crap they sell at Costco... for $15 bucks (appetizer) Crazy. This place is mediocre by American Italian standards... if you've ever been to Italy, it's functionally inedible. Packed with screaming kids? Just like Jimmy Hoffa- you'll never see me in there again.

ujMKdMzjcAdDg8brWb5ywA.text: When Ruben and I get together with one of our group of friends (dubbed the "Eight-some"), someone else always plans the dinner, so we are just along for the ride. We came here last Friday night and definitely needed that reservation. The restaurant is small and there's practically no waiting area/lobby, so the hostess stand is very crowded. Our table was in the middle of the restaurant, right next to the bar, kitchen, and two-man band. Luckily, the booth seat is tall, so our view of the bar and kitchen were blocked.  Everyone enjoyed the complimentary bread and particularly the garlic butter that accompanied it. Ruben and I shared the Fried Calamari ($16) served with marinara and a side Caesar Salad ($3 with entree). Ruben ordered Pasta Alla Forno ($30) created with penne, chicken, shrimp, broccoli, and mushrooms in a light pink sauce, then baked in the oven with fresh mozzarella. While I had their Baked Lasagna ($21) filled with marinara, fresh ricotta, ground beef, Italian seasonings, and melted mozzarella. The calamari was good (didn't make my top 5 though) and I liked their marinara. The Pasta Alla Forno was very delicious! Great flavor and the shrimp was especially good. Although, very expensive for a dish of pasta. The lasagna was all right, borderline meh.  Way too much cheese and not enough sauce. It was really difficult for me to eat (I ate less than half). One of our friends ordered Tiramisu and I thought it was decent.  The band was really great! Very talented gentleman and I loved the music they played. The only thing was that with our big group, we couldn't talk to each other much since one end of the table was directly next to the band. Service was really great. Everyone was great, nice, and attentive. The restaurant has a really nice atmosphere and exemplifies "Old School Vegas." It's definitely a cool spot to check out. As far as Italian food goes, it was just okay and not worth the cost.  FYI: Great for families - we had an 8-month old with us and it wasn't too loud or rowdy for her. Also, the automatic gratuity is 20% for groups of 6 or more.

WhCgs4CBh6dwV5MZcqYe-g.text: Amazing ambience and feels like old Vegas...live band, great specials, good service.  I just wish Sinatra would show!

5QwSHwR6LtfuyEQwCPhvQA.text: Stephan was our server and he was amazing! Super friendly! My niece was getting cold in the restaurant and Maria came over and gave her a blanket of some sort, so nice! The food was very good. We ordered the "1 lb pasta" spaghetti and meatballs and 2 large pizzas, a Margarita and a Hawaiian. We had 5 adults and 2 children, we had pizza leftover. Everything was perfect! Will definitely come back again!

8xEWwmCBGhYqCynsvVYU4w.text: This place is top notch.  The food never disappoints, but what makes this place special is the staff.  The servers are absolutely outstanding!  The music made our night so enjoyable.  Randy Thomas is so talented and really engages with the crowd.  He played a lot of favorites.  The place was jumpin.'  It was like eating dinner with a huge italian family.  This is a must anytime you are in Vegas.

FyISBZZrGGUOIma1hD9rAQ.text: Loved the food and our server! We ate at several places on and off the strip and found this place to be the best we had. So thankful we came across it!! I doesn't look like much from the outside but the food and service is fantastic! We ordered shrimp appetizers and calamari to start - great! My parents ordered lasagna. I got the Tortellini soup - delicious! My brother ordered a salad and basically ate off of our plates because the portions were huge. My other brother got stuffed veal - AMAZING!!! We stayed for dessert - our server was wonderful! He even got the band to sing Happy birthday to my 6 yr old nephew! We will definitely return!!

tENzfxgRk1LEXXrsesJ-VQ.text: Excellent service, fast and friendly. Live entertainment is nice and gives an old school feel to it. Food is great, presentation is nice, over all, a very nice, and fantastic place to go to, especially if you're on a date!

cEzkYuiL5Oy2_HuOCkhGbw.text: Excellent find. Really friendly staff and the food was excellent. Was looking for  great "off the strip" find and was not disappointed. Check it out!

HN9ggD3hN39121mGIYcavA.text: This place is packed and loud. Service was good but when I got the balsamic and oil, the oil was obviously cut with water by 50 percent. The lasagna was good however., but there's not much flavor. Everything is made with cheap produce.

uP4gZIOZ5OygRVfPt7scXw.text: Nice Italian restaurant open late. Casa Di Amore has a romantic, intimate look to it. They have live music on different nights. My date brought me here for a late dinner and some music. We started with a bottle of red wine. For an appetizer we split an order of brushetta, which was pretty good. My date had pasta with clams in a white wine sauce. He said it's his favorite here. I had the lasagna and was a little disappointed. It was overly salty but otherwise flavorful and large enough to take half home for the next day. Our server was friendly and attentive but not too overbearing. We were able to enjoy our wine, food, and music without feeling rushed. I'd definitely come back here but would try something different.

-m73NVgUOPmts2m5jj6lDA.text: Went on a Sunday night and was pretty busy. I was shocked at how LOUD a place called Casa Di Amore was. You will literally have to SCREAM at the person next to you in order to have a chat. I'm good with locals places, not every nice restaurant has to be in a casino or be stuffy but if I am going to pay roughly 100.00 for a dinner for 2 I'd like to not sit 2.5 feet away from a white guy with dreadlocks and his date + hear them scream at each other trying to converse for an hour. Sorry, I'm not cool with sitting in the middle of a loud room in a small 2 seater table for these prices (8 bucks for a beer!!!?? in a restaurant off Trop and Mcloud???). Now if it was 3 bucks a beer and slash about 40% of food prices I can roll with it.  The service was rushed and not great, we saw the waitress twice the whole time (she was busy in her defense). Again for these prices and a spot that calls itself the house of love I was really surprised at the lack of attentiveness.   The food was not great, the calamari was squishy, mealy, flavorless and the kind you are bummed out when you get (anybody who orders it often knows what I mean). The dishes were very average and not large in portion. I had the linguine and clams and like I said it was ok. Can't recommend it though.   I'm going to take Piero's over this place 100 times out of a 100. At least I get great service and a nice atmosphere for my expensive meal.   In a nutshell:  not a place I would take a date because its loud as f and not really intimate (small but not intimate) Expensive as a strip casino for drinks so that rules out swinging by and hanging at bar to listen to the band (which you can barley hear with all the diners yelling at each other) Food on my visit is average at best and the portions were smallish. (in fact a few hours later we went up to Metro Pizza to share some food since we were still hungry). I'd venture to say many people that give overwhelmingly positive reviews did not pay the bill.  In addition I see a lot of reviews that say this spot is "so old school Vegas", I mean I guess if by old school means they threw up a bunch of vintage Vegas pictures they found online and blew up. This place hasn't been around THAT long and WTH is old school Vegas about charging 10+ for a cocktail in a local restaurant? The more correct term would be it's Old School/Rat Pack (whatever) Vegas for those that have no clue what that actually means.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine and Clams (red version)- It was decent.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari- Tough, flavorless and expensive, much like a Bellagio working girl.

YBodq7qvhWgB_ZwGmDLzsg.text: DELICIOUS. Honestly, some of the best food I've ever tasted. My friend got the Steak Sinatra, the BEST sauteed mushrooms and steak next to Mon Ami Gabi in the Paris. The martinis---go for the Italian Gatorade, don't get a Manhattan--up. Just DONT do it, tastes like bootyhole.   As far as service, everyone was more than friendly, the band noticed each and every customer. Ask for Michael, he took impeccable care of us and recommended each of our meals.

A85CVvr0dfGLwKoas4zQWw.text: This place is amazing!!!!!! Their food is definitely authentic and full of taste! The live entertainment was great and the staff was so accommodating! Love the bartenders!

M3H8xzXNbWwIGAH51gwAgQ.text: A really nice place for traditional Southern Italian in a relaxed setting. This is an Intimate place to eat (with some dressed casually and some dressed up) with live music (old classics like Sinatra, Dean Martin, etc., and not being played loudly at all but at a comfortable decibel level). As ex-New Yorkers used to good quality Italian TRADITIONAL fare that's hard to find on the west coast, this place fits the bill. We will be back and often!

n7AacH-J8wQlMcAM6iOwUg.text: Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and I got picked up by a limo and taken to the restaurant. The limo driver even asked if we would like to come earlier and was waiting outside the hotel for us. When we arrived, the place was packed, there was a singer and a Sax player, both very good. Our waiter was the best and even took our picture for us. I ordered the mojito, super good and not overpowering. I had the penne a la vodka in a giant bowl. I couldn't eat even half of it. Halfway into our dinner, everyone was singing "That's Amore" with the singer. I love this place because it isn't pretentious like the restaurants you find on the strip. I even got a shirt that says "We have medical marinara" I'm really happy we chose this place for our anniversary dinner!

TWHwWEPRW1HvO64UJ2TCvg.text: My husband and I were in Vegas the week of May 15th celebrating our 20th Anniversary and the one meal we wanted was Italian.  We asked a friend to recommend a place and he told us Casa di Amore.  The food was phenomenal!  One of the best we have ever had.  We will definitely go here again if we are ever back in Vegas!!!

6qIRBZyFrcroItlhAnqTqw.text: This was a great restaurant and if you want to get off the strip and get a taste of classic old Las Vegas, I would highly recommend this restaurant.  Make sure that you ask for the complimentary limo service when you call to make your reservations.  The limo picked us up from our hotel and took us to a non-descript brick building.  The moment the big heavy door opened for us to walk into the restaurant, you could smell the delicious Italian food and hear the sounds of a two-man band singing classic Italian love songs.  We were in love from the get-go!  There were old photos of the original hotels on the strip and infamous Vegas icons on the walls.  The food was good, not necessarily outstanding, but good.  It was worth the price.  They also had their wines at 50% off for the bottle, which made it totally worth it.  Afterwards, our limo driver actually took us downtown to Fremont Street so that we could enjoy that experience and then we cabbed it back to our hotel on the strip.  It was a good time.

9GZ-IVpEh554nNlTe_m6lQ.text: this place is my favorite italian place to eat in vegas. i've lived in town for a while now and it took me some time but i found a place thats worth going to. i'm italian and i grew up in chicago. chicago has the best italian food in the country. this place comes as close as you can get out here. i also live about 40 mins from casa, but its worth the travel every time. consistent and fresh. very good.

Mm61rWLevZiXfRcdP1uMCA.text: I'm sorry to say this was the worst value yet in Vegas.  I've never given anything two stars (you can check my record), and it's hard for me to even write this, but honestly I can't understand the positive reviews.  The only thing this place has going for it is a vintage ambience, but the food was exorbitantly priced for such mediocrity.  My boyfriend and I started with the fried calamari, which had no seasoning and no calamari.  Then he got the chicken special and I got ravioli.  For what little chicken was on his plate over linquine completely drowned in congealed cream sauce, it was remarkably average and needed to be doctored up.  My ravioli, while large, was the same.  We both were looking for someone to come around and shave some fresh parmesan over our meals, but all they offer is the shake can on the table.  None of this would be horrible if our plates were $10 or $12 dollars a piece, but his was TWENTY-EIGHT dollars (always ask how much the specials are first) and mine was $20--shocking (shocking!), to quote Joan Cusack.  For three small plates (the fried calamari, the chicken, and my ravioli), and just two small glasses of wine, the bill was $100.  Worst $100 ever spent on food.  In every other city, we can get two very well-put together and flavorful meals for the price of one forgettable piece of chicken at Casa Di Amore.  So . . .two stars because the food isn't completely inedible.  Just  underwhelming and a terrible bang for your buck.

LO01Vmt7_L0JA6uIrarbQg.text: This is THE BEST Italian food!! We discovered this hidden jewel about 5 years ago on one of our many trips to Vegas and now a trip to Vegas is not complete without a visit to Casa Di Amore!! Not only is the food AMAZING, but the staff is as well.  We always get the limo and the limo drivers are great.  We have had just about every server they have there and they are all fantastic! Even though we only go twice a year (being out of towners), they remember us!!! That alone is amazing, that they can remember us out of all of the customers they serve. I love the fact that the ambience hasn't changed since the Rat Pack ate there.  That's what makes this place so special, the highbacked maroon leather booths, the wood paneling with all of the pictures of Old Vegas, my only regret is that the Rat Pack is not still alive to join us for dinner.  Someone else reviewed that this place smelled of smoke even though it's a no smoking restaurant. I don't know what they are talking about because I have never smelled smoke in this restaurant and I am very sensitive to cigarette smoke.  The food of course is the most important part and all I can say is FABULOUS!!! We have NEVER been disappointed in anything we've ordered.  Can't say enough good things about Casa Di Amore, this place is the BEST!!!

Kd2z3JX4MiDe5P5bBOmLRA.text: Casa Di Amore' is  a very traditional NY-like Italian restaurant with a Las Vegas twist. There's a lounge singer crooning Sinatra ( primarily) tunes all evening. George Bugatti is amazing. I heard this guy open for Don Rickles a few years back and was blown away. If you closed your eyes you'd think Frank was in the room singing. The food is excellent. The service is over the top. The crowd is neat as its a good mix of locals with tourists.  Our table's top dishes- Osso Bucco and Veal Parm.

gYMWEv9A1duqhXML7TzhnA.text: Best Italian good in Vegas, great atmosphere - go when the live music is playing. Great wait staff. Eggplant parm, Veal, pasta, rampini, all their food is delicious and a glass of Chianti washes it down perfectly.  Finish your night with an expresso and a cannoli. Yum!

X2w2fjf3HiR7Csn2pjhm9Q.text: We recently returned to Casa Di Amore after having moved to the other side of town.  Prior to our move we frequented this restaurant often when it was opened 24/7.  Currently it no longer operates 24/7.  Since returning and then checking yelp for reviews, I was stunned that nobody mentioned the table situation since the renovations, because it is bad enough to ruin your dining experience.  One of the unique features about this restaurant is that it has booths to accommodate up to 6 people.  Since the renovation, the owner opted not to replace the tables that fit the booth!  Instead he opted to put TWO  2-top tables together turned sideways!  So these spacious booths now have two very narrow tables, side by side resulting with two people  eating where the two tables meet.  What was he thinking!  In addition, these tables have huge cafe stands which limit your leg and foot room.  The tables also are not balanced to the floor which means you need to be very aware of your plates at all times because they  tilt and swerve.  Who does this?  All the booths in this restaurant now have this impractical table setup.  Michael get the correct tables for your booths.  Another annoying feature about the renovations would be the extremely bright (pink) spot lights on each table.  It is like being in a room with over the top  pink fluorescent lighting in your face.  There is nothing warm about the lighting anymore in this restaurant unless you sit in the bar.  A lighting designer would never use this configuration.    The food.  The beauty of Casa Di Amore in its day was the quality and value.  The current prices at Casa Di Amore are very  inflated for the quality.  As in Sinatra pricing at the Encore minus the high quality food.  The food presentations are what my Sicilian grandmother would call "half-hearted".  Their signature wedding soup is now loaded with salt, missing the greens (that it use to have) and the broth that years ago you could tell took hours to make fresh, now tastes like it is out of a carton.    Our pasta dishes were delivered to the table unfinished.  As in, someone dumped penne into a bowl and then poured a tiny bit of sauce in the dead center.  Naked pasta is better left for a buffet line.  It was also grossly over cooked.    One good thing is that Casa Di Amore still has really good entertainment.   Sadly, we won't be returning to this restaurant again.  We will drive the extra few miles to get better quality food, correct tables and elegant dining atmosphere at Allegro, Sinatra or Capos.

q8HyXVEtO03VcxrZ24Jdug.text: Very nice atmosphere and great band up on stage. Really nice service with delicious food. Great for a Saturday night!

_o32pVIc_vGv4c_E10FF6A.text: Food was great. Good service. Nice atmosphere; photos of old Las Vegas on the walls and Sinatra on the stereo. Good place for a date or a group dinner.   Eat it!

37ItBVaX6UWEX45xOihiGQ.text: The food and service was excellent and very fairly priced! They have a live band playing which was a lovely ambience. A little off the strip, but apparently they have a free limo ride that brings you from your hotel to the restaurant and back! definitely worth the visit as compared to those horrible and overpriced food on the strip.

oCfPuYiGnr8YEyUaW4BG8A.text: My husband and I went here for the first time the other night and we both thought it was amazing! I had the Grilled Salmon Fiorentine and my husband had the classic Baked Lasagna. He said it was the best lasagna he had ever had and my salmon was absolutely ridiculously good. Went home with no leftovers! Yummy, everyone should try this place. We were each able to get a free drink from the bar with our foursquare check-in. We also used a $25 restaurant.com gift certificate that we purchased for $2!! Lovely date night with my husband at a romantic place on a budget. You can't beat it!!

y1sx-O6zZ5f3ULTUxlwzKQ.text: Fantastic experience, great ambiance, and top tier service. My friends were in town for our one year college reunion, so we took advantage of the free limo ride to the restaurant. You can't really beat that. The food an atmosphere are excellent. There was a live musician ready and willing to take requests. It's a little on the noisy side, but not bad at all.   Although the food is fantastic, what really made this place excel was the service. Our waiter never missed a beat. He was funny, informative, told us the history of the restaurant, and made sure our wine glasses were never empty. Highly recommended.   It was very busy on Saturday night, so I would suggest making reservations.

i-SwTbxnNNoYaWHbOjK8jw.text: Went there on our last night had a coupon from rest.com. the service was slow when we did get our wine it really had to be one of the worst glasses I have had in a long time. Had the antipasto for started and it was very good. I had the stuffed pork chop (half) order it was really nothing to speak of the twice baked potato I think was frozen at one point and just reheated with Jared roasted peppers. My wife had the pasta with ham in a cream sauce that was over loaded with salt. Fresh bread was good, the live music was maybe the highlight but not worth the trip. It may have the old school feel but with so many other choices in town save your time.

Kd5voC24u1Z69OBCoxIsdQ.text: Had dinner at Casa di  Amore last Saturday night.  This was our first visit, and unfortunately, it did not go very well.  The restaurant is not very big, and we were seated next to a large table of folks celebrating a birthday.  As they drank more and more, the decibel level became unbearable.  Added to that the fellow singing and playing the keyboard and his drummer kept getting louder and louder.  It was  impossible to have a conversation there.  I realize that the restaurant is not to blame (other than the singer/drummer), but it certainly made for a very unpleasant evening.  Food was good, but certainly nothing that special.  Service was attentive and professional.  Will probably not go back.

kIpdBzIlGapSBT00QhYyaA.text: If your looking for great italian food off the strip this is the place.  This place is not that big but it seems like there is always a table.  The food is amazing and they have live performer that sounds just like Frank!  How can you beat that.  We usually start out with a house salad and some calamari and I usually get the chicken Marsala or Parmesan.  Every time it has been delicious.  Usually too full for dessert  but always kill the wine which is very reasonably priced.  Now i'm a asian guy and don't claim to know what great italian food is ilke i do with more asian cuisines.  That being said I have been to italy so i think i have a good foundation.  If that doesn't help maybe this will.  A good friend of mine is Italian-American by way of NYC.  This is the only place he will eat.  Enough said!

Xbij3Gt4zNGdsbPRyACLVw.text: The wife and I heard great things about the place and so decided to check it out. We stopped by on a Monday because we heard about large crowds on the weekend. The place inside is a bit dark and reminds one of being back in the 50's and maybe catching Dino and Frank sitting in a corner enjoying a meal together. They had a singer who sang some great tunes. Our waiter was very pleasant and he walked us through the menu and we ordered several dishes and a bottle of sparkling spumante wine. All in all it was a great place to eat and recommend that anyone headed to Vegas should stop by and enjoy a great Italian meal. Don't forget to order a cannoli for desert too....

Czk3N-8vgHShhoZF9XLc1A.text: I went with a friend who said i hadn't lived until i got here. I stepped inside and i immediately felt like i was under dressed. It's old school, that's why.  Regardless, the owner i was told was belting out Italian classics. And was good too. The Chianti was great and I had the chicken parmigiana which was excellent.  But here is where I was impressed. My papa was the best Italian cook, well in the family. He came from a long line of Italian cooks. So my test is to see how good the meatballs are. And for three bucks they were great! love this place!

Lo0ry0hiWEgAwfoL3VJNCQ.text: Short trip off the Las Vegas strip! Excellent Food!  We had a party of 29 people!  Service was top notched! I had the Shrimp in Vodka, I wish I had taken some to go!  Would go just for this place.   It gives you the ambieance of an old Las Vegas club and the singer they had that night wasn't bad!  If your in Vegas you gotta try this place out.

0bGdPrrgyY6e5jQov0fStA.text: Bread & the olive oil / balsamic vinegar sauce is amazing. Calamari - mmmmm! i love the tenticle fried calamari!! Bruchetta - there's a sweet kick to it that I absolutely love  Pizzas / Pastas are great! and the atmospher is awesome!  Gotta love the female bartender there...obviously cause it's my homegirl! LoL!

Px89I_8Lftf6geD6be5TbQ.text: Best Italian food I have ever had.  I love the feel and absolutely EVERYTHING here is good...  It's a little pricey, but the fried shrimp and spaghetti is totally worth it :3

AWqcttmSsz08SlPt4YtSCQ.text: ok so first don't go here when I'm town making this place all crowded and stuff.. If you can agree to that then you can read the rest of my review. did a yelp search for a restaurant with live music found this gem.. Called ..hostess was super nice and helpful made our reservations and got us connected to the shuttle to come pick us up.. shuttle driver was very polite and took good care of us was friendly with out being overly intrusive or creepy.. restaurant was dimly lit and romantic.. live music was oldies soul my fave but also took requests and came around to the tables singing.. food was delicious as were the cocktails (thanks goodness for the free shuttle) my only gripe was the remodeling of the restroom that was in the works and the drunk that couldn't wait and walked in on my girl in the ladies room talking about he worked there or was regular or some bullshit and they share.. wish she would have told me before we left.. anyway.. the waiter was very fun and friendly great recommendations on food. this place is a grand slam!! as far restaurants go. We spent a pretty penny here but worth it in every way. not expensive or over priced but we did drink and feast and hey that's what you do in Vegas!

SiPqIDCu2Dl1qDsRsFAdVQ.text: Amazing dinner and ambiance!  Excellent service!  We will be back! Loved the live music on Saturday night.. Both of our meals were cooked to perfection!

XYNuWG3ZtWNj-nvLygCM1A.text: The reviews on YELP had me most interested in trying this place when I was in Vegas during my vacation last week. Everything you read on here is True...it is truly a good place to eat. The service and food were great! We even each got a drink for free just for checking in on foursquare. I had the stuffed pork chopped which were really good, just too much to eat and my wife had the chicken angelo which she also really enjoyed. We had a restaurant.com certificate that kept our bill under $60 for the meal. Our waitress, host and gentleman who was singing on stage were all super friendly and superb at their jobs. The only reason for leaving off one star was the seating was a bit uncomfortable and we both found the lack of lighting to be somewhat awkward. These are just little concerns for a great meal though.

NI2ENwxKGPmDd2Bds8fvKg.text: This is a great little place with a lot of atmosphere.  My wife brought me here for my Birthday on Monday night.  I must say that the other reviews are very accurate as to what you should expect.  It is a nice little place with live music. The food and service was very good!!  As a bonus the bottles of wine are 1/2 price on Sunday and Monday nights.  You need to ask because that is not advertised.  We had  an appetizer, two meals, and a bottle of wine for $80.00.  I would highly recommend this for a special occasion.

xnicKgQudOr8DsHQ25SVKw.text: GREAT hidden authentic Italian Restaurant!!  And my family is Italian from Staten Island and has owned Italian restaurants.  It's really worth a try...you will not be disappointed at all.  We have never had a bad dish here yet!  It has been open for many years and I can definitely see why!

-H96z3p56UTV_vS0rgEZ1A.text: My old stomping ground. This restaurant is a few blocks away from the house I lived in when I met my wife (10+ years ago)We would dine and party here 2-3 times per month. Recently we were in the neighborhood so we stopped in for a nostalgic dinner. The food, music and service were phenomenal. No wonder we spent so much time here. In Vegas to drive 30-40 min for dinner is rare but so is Casa so we have dedicated to coming back more often.

NZL6BSXxBcHVPZi7OdM7yg.text: Made reservations a few weeks ago for 7 people. When we arrive the hostess said 97r table was not ready. She said they were working on getting a table ready. There was no waiting seating so we had to sit in the car. Reservations were at 845 and we did not get seated till 930. This was very disappointing due to it being my birthday and it set us back alot. Nothing was done to show they valued their customers. The food was good but I'm disappointed they didnt have more empathy for us waiting so long. Mind you I was not in it for anything free and this is why I did not request to speak to a manager. I let it go but a simple apology for the inconvenience would have been really nice. This in not saying I wouldn't come back because the food and actual service once seated is amazing.

e81hX3tAOh1w9G3m6jrseg.text: The restaurant is small and cozy with a very nice musician/vocalist on a Wednesday night. The menu has all the classics you would expect for an old world Italian place. The wine list is varied with a decent amount of choices.  The stuffed peppers appetizer was phenomenal. Cooked to perfection with the pepper soft enough but not over cooked. The stuffing was delicious and the sauce on it matched perfectly.  The osso bucco entree was also excellent with the risotto side to match.  My wife had eggplant parmigiana that was bitter and had a dark marinara that made it more bitter. The homemade pasta was over cooked with the same sauce. She didn't like either.  None of the deserts are homemade, we didn't even look at the menu for it.

khPmxB3AYYuO0k-KXASJJg.text: So I am a huge Italian food fan and have even been to Italy for a long period of time.  I made reservations for this place at 5:30pm on a Tuesday to make sure we got a table.  Once we arrived, they sat us at a tiny table facing the stage.  I didn't care for whoever was performing because he kept talking to a guest he knew anyways.  And I really didn't appreciate the tiny table when there were other open ones.    Anyway, our waiter took awhile to get to us.  Once he came to us, we started with the Calamari ($14).  It was really really good.  Probably the best thing in this place.  I like that it wasn't overcooked and wasn't overly flavored.  It's a must get here.  For dinner, I went with their Eggplant Di Amore and the person I came with ordered a side of Pesto Pasta and a side of their Gypsy Pasta to try both.  After we ordered the complementary bread and butter came.  It was a long warm baguette that had been cut up.  It was decent.  My Eggplant Di Amore ($26) can be described as an eggplant lasagna.  It was fresh breaded eggplant with ricotta, mushrooms, spinach, sun dried tomatoes, and topped with Parmigiano Reeggiano and Mozzarella Cheese.  The entire thing was baked just like a lasagna and served with a large portion of Spaghetti.  I thought the entire dish was alright.  I didn't see much ricotta at all.  I thought it was a little dry and was more on the salty side.  The spaghetti that I had one bite of I could have done without.  I got to try the pastas that the person I came with ordered.  The Pesto Pasta was pretty good.  The Gypsy, which is basically their popular spicy marinara pasta was also pretty good but nothing crazy.  The total was $60.  Nothing there wowed us besides their calmari.    And the service definitely did not wow us.  The food took forever to come out and so did the bill and take home container.  The waiter didn't really made any good recommendations.  It was like he was just kinda there to do his work and quickly go home.  The inside of this place is small so probably why the long waits on the weekends.  There is the dining room and a bar area in the back.  The inside looked like a dive bar with booths to be honest.  There were a lot of locals there.  Mostly elderly people.  There was an annoying large group there to celebrate one of their son's birthdays.  One of the guys from the party knew the guy singing so they kept talking like I mentioned earlier.  The rest of his party also kept getting up.  They kept getting in the way when people were trying to use their bathroom.  No crowd control?  If this is Vegas top Italian spot, I feel bad.  Not sure I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant casa di amore
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pesto
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gypsy sauce

6ajcgaIyyYW4zXoe01A9gA.text: So glad a friend suggested this restaurant. The food and service were on point the entire time. You really should take a little jaunt off strip on your next trip and try out this delightfully delicious restaurant! Make a reservation. It's a little busy.

x_38RdI92JWLHSqt8H-dpg.text: Had a fun time dining at this Italian restaurant. The food is good but the atmosphere, staff, service & entertainment really makes the dining shine. Am told this is where the locals go. It is quite aways from the strip.

Jbyi3ewrBHixy0xRbtveAA.text: My favorite Italian spot in Vegas. Great menu, friendly service and the live music creates a cozy and inviting atmosphere.

xbMem2D0wfQu5Ql4HQplnA.text: This is one of the best 4 places I've ever ate at in Vegas. The other 3 are closed Fortunato's, The Flame and The Bellagio.

dfMSroD0WK8C_9HHUv4qRQ.text: My favorite place to come to eat, drink, listen to great live music, & hang out with friends n family!! I Love the environment. Whenever I come to Vegas it is A MUST that I come! Casa di Amore is the place to be for me!!

kTvKQBa3wTG25xX3Wa4q3Q.text: Long long wait.  Estimated times are not accurate.  Reservations are not honored or respected.  I called at 6:25pm asking for the wait time because if it is long then I'll find somewhere else to go.  Las Vegas has many places for dinner.  The woman on the telephone offered a reservation at 8pm --Ok, that's good because the initial reviews read are good.  We arrived at 7:50pm for our 8pm reservation.  I don't mind waiting sometime because we are early.  I check in with the hostess and was told that they are getting the table ready and it will be a "short" time.  Cut to FIFTY MINUTES LATER at 8:40pm, we are still waiting.  After checking in with the hostess a couple times, they keep telling us, "short" time, 10-15 minutes.  It is after 9pm now, more than 1 hour after we arrived and more than 1 hour after our reservation time, and definitely NOT a short time, or NOT after 10-15 minutes.  We left to In-N-Out a couple blocks away.  Throughout this entire time, we were told, they cater to locals and the people are not leaving, their checks are paid, but they are not leaving.  Well, I can understand that, but please do not tell me it will be a short time, or it will be 10-15 minutes, or promise me reservations at 8pm.  Just tell me the truth. Do not waste my time, especially on a vacation in a city that has so many other options.  If I knew about the 1+ hour wait (with reservations) I would have decided differently.  Do not tell me something that is not True.  The restaurant knows the estimated wait time and do not tell me it will be a short time.  This is what happened, my party of 5 and I lost  1+ hours waiting because this restaurant kept telling us the wait is a short time, promised a 8pm dining time, and kept telling us 10-15 minutes.

GY1TR_YiJAt4ydK-PksR3A.text: Seriously some of the best Spaghetti & meatballs I have ever had! Casa Di Amore is about 10 minutes away from the strip so it's not something you are going to just come across on the strip but do make an effort to come here when you are in Las Vegas. One of the main reasons this was a planned visit, was due to the great reviews. I will tell you that I was not disappointed at all. The spaghetti was absolutely fantastic, it was perfectly cooked with gigantic meatballs. The spaghetti was very fresh & hot.   I do wish they would have had a smaller portion as 1 pound was too much for just myself but I tried my best to still finish it because it was that good. It was a smaller place with a great feel to it and the spaghetti was better than I would have imagined it to be.   The staff was very friendly including our server and food arrived in a timely fashion. As a nice bonus, the server set us up with a shuttle from the restaurant back to the strip at no charge! I thought this was a nice gesture as again it's about 10 minutes outside of the strip where I wanted to get back to anyway. The shuttle was newer, clean & air conditioned. The driver was courteous and our party did tip him which you should do the same as after all it is a free ride.   If you like Italian food, don't forgot to make reservations when you are booking your trip to Vegas! I will certainly be returning on future trips to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool little place!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the best Spaghetti I have ever had!

ErRsyZ9O3JjJyHAXVFQGNw.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas!  Classic joint with Sinatra style live lounge music, friendly staff, great food.

sD-eIZpkoRt9qTwRfuakow.text: Clearly a local's haunt, Casa di Amore did not disappoint. Our party of 7 enjoyed the calamari appetizer, which was a little thin bit still very tasty, fresh baked Italian bread, the Osso Buccu, Linguine with Clams, veal cannelloni, and both a chicken and veal marsala. Each plate was removed empty. Add to that a fantastic waiter who provided attentive but not intrusive service.  If you are looking for off-the-strip authentic Italian, you have found the "diamond next to the gun range". And be sure to head to the outside Tiki Bar (yes, that is not a typo) and be sure to get your photo sitting on the Gorilla's hand or in the arms of the Octopus.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Cannaloni

dMQM4NMYP4bfSYX5pNJmqg.text: Love this place! Love the food! They are always pretty busy, which speaks for itself! The tiki area in the back is super chill and relaxed. Very nice atmosphere. One of my favs in Las Vegas!

dOoGDJxaFZKy5ltiUz288g.text: The place overall was great. The time of my reservation around 6pm on a week day it was not as busy compared to the weekends. The food was delicious and the server was great since it wasn't as busy they were really attentive. I love the theme of the place, it gives a chill, romantic but entertainment vibe. I would recommend this place.

-thLyHCAHFXWqCn7tVaVXA.text: My wife is the Italian food eater. Not me. I want burgers and fries, pizza, and soda. Typical American. But it was my wife's night and I wanted to take her to something I thought she'd love. So I took her to Casa Di Amore.  It was a win. The ambience, live music, the service, the food. They had it all.  I don't eat pasta when I go out. Such a complete waste of money. But the pasta here was great. None of that frozen crap. It was the real deal.  If you're looking for some good Italian cuisine, you might want to check this place out.

fUQRjN3qNoTmKhbBtoIC2w.text: Nice little find on our last day in Vegas. It honestly looks almost like a low key strip club from the outside, but when you walk inside it's like an old school 40's-50's kind of feeling. There's also a random tiki bar in the back. There were a couple of guys who looked like they were part of the Rat Pack that played some good live music. The staff was super friendly and service was quick. The food was good too. My boyfriend got Grandma's chicken soup and really enjoyed it. The antipasto platter was good, nothing fabulous, but you can only do so much with that so I won't fault them for that. We shared the chicken parmesan which was super tasty and a good size portion. Overall we were pleasantly surprised. We will definitely stop by again on our next trip. The best part was the free shirt you get when you order the cannoli, especially because it's from one of my favorite movies :)

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r6sEp_AUF0pj5T7Jfjg5jw.text: Such a neaaaaat place. The food was unbelievably delicious and the servers/management were top notch. Live entertainment interacted with our table and took tons of request. Worth the drive out from the strip. Plus they even picked up our party of 10+ from the encore to the restaurant.

QIs0brWCk0YoAQ-bAqbzcA.text: What?!  Outside looks like an old Pizza Hut. Inside?  Like you've time traveled to Vegas in the 1950s!  Fun lighting, close tables and booths, live music with sing-a-longs.  Service was outstanding (how could our server hear over all the singing??). Food was outstanding. Tiki Bar outside in the back is icing on the cake.   Go.

oU9UWcJep11armjApu05kQ.text: I've come here on two different trips to Las Vegas because I love it.  The first time we fell in love with the risotto, the second time I still loved it but the group I was with didn't as much. All the other appetizers we got were amazing, the Caesar salad is on top of that list! Who knew a restaurant could do such a basic salad so well! All other dishes both time have been fabulous!   I love the entertainment and the service. Worth a visit!

3tsvvDfuYv6Zko7EqrQDpA.text: I had friends raving to me about this place so I thought it was about time I check it out. I popped in w/ a friend visiting from out of town. Don't judge the outside because the inside is a whole other ballgame. Walking in, you see what an Italian restaurant is supposed to look like. Dimly lit, lots of booths, even ones for just two people, live lounge like music.   We were greeted right away and taken to a smaller booth. Our server greeted quickly as well. Seeing that it was just before 7pm, these two instances were both very surprising. Soon after we were sat, the rush came in. We placed our drink orders to our server and snuck towards the back of the place. The back is another world. In fact it's a tiki bar. On the backside of the same place. It's where the overflow goes for people waiting for their table. Pretty cool little area.  Once we finished playing around in the tiki bar we came back to the Italian world we started in. Our food came shortly after sitting down. The food is good, nothing outrageous to say.   This place is great for a drink and people watching, all while listening to some good tunes.

8nTxZ-eDEcSkndai6ZS34g.text: This place is awesome! Great Italian food and awesome live music by "Paul". Staff are incredibly helpful. We always go here if we have family gathering or occasion.   They get busy sometimes. If your waiting for tables, head right to the back. They have a tiki bar. Awesome drinks and occasional live music as well. If your are in vegas this is a place to visit.

eZdqi8slzQQP54_elBjWyQ.text: "When the Moon hits your eyes that's Amore..."  First off don't judge a book by its cover.  This one is a little ragged and torn but oh the treasures you will find inside. Well worth the 20 minute drive to get off the strip!  Dark and comfortable inside it a full menu and bar.   There was beer, Chianti and chocolate martinis had.   The menu... fresh hot mini loaves with garlic butter. And probably should have just stopped there but we didn't so: We ordered Chicken Parm that came out the size of a Texas a Chicken Fried Steak hot and tender. Chicken fettuccini Alfredo with a side of veggies that just wasn't finishable it was it was so big and delicious. Lasagna, bacon wrapped scallops rounded out our entrees.   Creme brulee was for dessert and we all shared ( honestly I ate most of it bc creme brulee should never be wasted even when on a diet).  I earned the t-shirt- literally-a great souvenir.   They had live entertainment mostly a la Rat Pack. But it was nice and soothing to our lively group of sales reps that just needed to bring it down a notch or ten at the end of the day.  Our server was a good sport and very engaging. Every thing served exactly right!   Do yourself a favor and stop by for a nice evening of good food and entertainment.   *Bonus* they have a van service than runs to and from some of the casinos on the strip. Just call and ask.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert shirt
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu cover
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fettuccine Alfredo with veggies.

_3uFXvX9G0O3WlikOpeslw.text: This was an experience!  Live music was my favorite part! The pianist/vocalist was amazingly soothing. It's so hard to find live music at restaurants in Vegas so I had a blast here! Perfect ambiance for a date night or any occasion that requires Italian food!   GET THE CHEESY BREAD!   Kind of pricey overall for the portion size but I'd still come back for the ambiance! It's like Buca di Beppo prices for not as large of portions. Oh and also prices per bottle of wine is extremely affordable!

cB9Iy9pohiiKoD7chW9bHw.text: This restaurant is not close to the strip which was perfectly fine with us since we were looking for a place with good food and what we got was great food!   Found out later that they have a free shuttle service which will pick you up and drop you off to your hotel.   The location and exterior is not very impressive from the outside but don't worry as you won't be disappointed with your meal.    We had a large party and they were very accommodating.   Ambiance is quite dim, but lively.  It has more of a classic old school restaurant feel.   They have a decent sized dining area and also have live entertainment which played very good music.  It was loud but you could still have a conversation and also sing along when you wanted to.  They have a very extensive menu including a kids menu.   This is not your typical Vegas meal with small portions, where presentation is more important than the taste and inflated prices.  They give hearty portions and serve fantastic food.  I ordered the Frutti Di Mare with white sauce and loved every single bite.  Generous portions of seafood.  Everyone was completely satisfied with their order and raved about how they would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti Di Mare
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino

gUq8XN2oZbE6EhN0vG7lWA.text: If I had the option to give 10 stars I would. ONly regret, we had stuffed ourselves so much before going to the restaurant that we could not do justice to it :(  Live music!  It was the last day in Vegas and we had no car, and luckily I researched this place which provides free transportation to and from any hotel on the strip.   Post the amazing KA show at MGM, we decided to head for dinner at this place which is located in Central vegas, a part which no one really talks about. It was about a 15 minute ride and we entered a neighborhood which makes you realize that normal people with normal apartments, family life with kids, schools , churches, supermarkets, also live in Vegas !  They do not have many vegetarian options, but they do customize. And they do understand that chicken broth with vegetables does not amount to vegetarian soup ! Mondays they have wine special which is half off whole night. And pizzas are half off after 11 pm.   We bought the pesto penne pasta. The vegetables it comes with is artichoke and sun-dried tomatoes, but we got them to add green peppers, brocolli. Kylie was as super helpful ( as he was cute ;) ), though he forgot to get our drinks and had to be reminded.   The ambiance is old timish including live soulful music.  We were grooving to the music all through dinner. You can even make requests and dance to their song. There was old couple who were dancing on their anniversary or something and it was super cute and romantic. It was all like getting transported back in time where mobiles and racing with time does not exist.   Food is on the higher scale but its worth every penny. Just HAVE to come back to try proper full course meal with dessert.   Tips:  1. Come hungry 2. Come well dressed preferably, u may just want to get up and dance

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Casa Di Amore _ 6
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Casa Di Amore _ 5
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Casa Di Amore _ 4

Lw1a6h83xVvj3ihg9j4XaA.text: House of love!!!  Hmmm. If your going on the weekend I would advise you to make reservations being as it was packed when we walked in around 7:30p. The atmosphere I would give a 3 out of 5 because of how cramped and small it is.  We were greeted right away, seated as well. They do live music which was very pleasant, don't hesitate to make an request of course within the same genre being performed. Our waiter, was nice..very quick. Mind you it's loud with chatter and music so it's best to have your order in mind when the server comes back. It's meant for small talk and enjoying an experience.   My date and I ordered a Cesar salad to split, it was perfect! Not over dressed or under,nice crunch and fresh.   Then we shared the lasagna. It was rich with the ricotta but very tasteful. I hear they make their own pasta..if that is so, that is very unique I may have tasted a difference just a tad. Everyone Taste bud are different.   We followed it with a cannoli, first and last one we will probably have. There was nothing wrong with it, I suppose it just wasn't our kind of dessert this time around.   Good Italian, worth going.

CcEmW9FAOwGgHNbTyL77AQ.text: Just had dinner here and was fortunate enough to get a last minute reservation on live music night.  Our waiter was very apparently annoyed by us when we declined any drinks.  Always bugs me when waiters treat you like crap because you don't feel like drinking.  Needless to say, she wasn't very attentive.    For dinner, we ordered the fried calamari, which was tasty, an 18" New York style cheese pizza, and a penne in rose cream sauce with chicken, broccoli, and mushroom.  It's not fresh homemade pasta, but sometimes I just want this type of rustic old style Italian feel eating. The pasta was a bit pricey at $31 and we added on a New England clam chowder for $3.  For dessert, we had the exotic Bombay which was a passion, mango, raspberry sorbet formed into a ball, covered in white chocolate,  then drizzled with chocolate and raspberry sauce.  It was so good.  Each dessert ordered also comes with a free t-shirt.   I would come back, but hope I get better service next time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our tab
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary warm bread and butter
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exotic bomba. Looks like its smiling.

ArJC1yFoNWTdj0qFTe1JSg.text: Less Old School than Ordovician School. This is the Land that Politically Correct Time Forgot (to wit: nudie club posters). Abandon all notions of a sensible, healthy meal. Consider skipping lunch.  Craig picked us up and entertained us on the short ride to the resIt's next door to the Gun Store. Book your ride before you leave for LV, as they may not be able to accommodate upon arrival.   We were pleased that they accommodated our request for a booth. It is LOUD, due to factors such as the live music (yup, Volare rang out), the conversation level and the singing patrons.   The menu cracked me up. There's a section called Touch of Italy which is supposed to represent meals that aren't commonly found on Italian menus. If that's True, then it should be titled Taste of Italy, no? Not sure where others grew up, but in my hometown eggplant parmigiana, gnocchi and lasagne (all $22) aren't considered exotic.  House white was about $9 for a small glass I believe. House red appeared to be a slightly larger pour. They had Peroni but I don't recall if it was draught or bottled.  Bread is housemade daily, and it's tasty. Don't fill up on it (rookie mistake) because you'll need room for your meal. As in rent an extra hotel room for your leftovers. There's a section of the menu called One-pound Pasta Bowls ($23-36). Not sure if that's how much the food weighs or how much you'll gain by eating it. At least 50% of our group didn't finish their meals, not that they can be blamed.   After your meal you can retire to the Polynesian delight that is the Casa de Tiki. Someone close to me says that my love of tiki bars knows no bounds. Close, but we were with the same people who attempted to navigate Frankie's Tiki Bar with us, and I'm still trying to live that Scavenger Hunt of Shame down, so clearly there are limits, even for me. CDT does not disappoint. Watch the changing posters! Take a photo with the Kracken! Enjoy the all-hour Happy Hour! Highly recommended.  Not sure that CDA is an every-time in Vegas experience, but I foresee at least a few more visits. Seemed to be a local-loaded crowd. No trouble with service. I'd wanted to go there for years; glad that we made it happen.

leaXUJYLhzdBylkwP55Lpw.text: We had A group dinner and it was a wonderful time there the food was out of this world I really enjoy the linguine with the calamari and the salad was fantastic cocktails were great the owner of the place his name is Michael came out and greeted us what a tremendous place to have dinner and have fun with friends then we went outside to the tiki bar and that was awesome please try this place it's very good I am from Chicago Illinois I give it thumbs up

tXUPhDz9e0E81mY1Ku7clw.text: The food was devious reason I'm giving it two stars!  But on our bill we had a mandatory 20% tip? Everyone has a mandatory tip? Or...   I mean food was great but services could be better, I mean our server forgot to bring us the house bread like come on. Lol

rW9ICYzxh-GbelByce8pDA.text: Here's what we ordered: calamari (nice balance of salt, crisp, and the marinara is spot on), caprese (run of the mill), prosciutto buffalo burrata (fantastic), and the steak ribeye flambe. All in all a great meal. Creme brulee and tiramisu (lady fingers have the perfect texture and a nice pronounced coffee punch) for dessert. Also highly recommend the Veronese Palazzo della Torre to pair with all of it.  Also, this place is quirky af. But it's rad. The crooner was legit. And tiki bar in the back is random but made a nice Zombie cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée

06OLUg4M_FgnScNsLGCw5Q.text: A delicious evening filled with so many carb filled dishes. I have come here several times, and I haven't been disappointed yet. Service is prompt, and I like to make a reservation because it can get busy even on a weekday. The bread and butter here is divine. I feel like you can tell how well the meal will go if the butter and bread are good. My favorite dish is the eggplant di amore, and it is a nice change from a meat dish. It is very filling, and a large portion of pasta with red sauce.  The dessert I enjoyed recently was the spumoni bomba, which consists of 3 layers of gelato (chocolate, pistachio, strawberry) covered in milk chocolate. It is refreshing and rich at the same time.  A little indulgence once in awhile doesn't hurt.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spumoni bomba

tGRmo41apFoHkjZBbc8U-g.text: One of the best Italian dinners I've ever had. I've eaten all over Italy and this meal is just as delicious and fresh.  This ended up being a big time naughty meal and I was trying to be good. I started out with a hearty Italian chicken and vegetable soup which was so simple - but so delicious. The veggies were perfect, chicken tasty, and broth was out of this world.   My main course was cioppino, a classic fisherman's stew with shrimp, scallops, clams, mussels, crabmeat, fish, and  two large lobster claws.   I've had cioppino from Rome to San Francisco and this was the best! The broth was spicy and complex but not hot or over powering, just flat out delicious. The seafood was fresh and succulent especially the lobster claws. Cioppino is my go-to meal to avoid fattening pasta but with a broth this excellent it begs to be dunked with a warm, crusty bread to soak up the flavorful broth. I ordered the their most naughty bread - the famous garlic loaf-crusty, feather soft inside, piping hot crammed with garlic and so much cheese. Well - I dunked the fantastic soup and the cioppino till every drop was gone. I felt wonderful till I got on the scale the next day. Bummer! now I gota pay for my fun.

M1K7Elq__zw_VzJSw72C-w.text: My husband and I go here anytime we are in town.  As usual we had amazing food tonight. The live entertainment was delightful. Stephen was our waiter and he was fantastic.  If you have a chance to go here I would highly suggest it.

wcnZLcQLesIGSFBl-NFyag.text: Delicious food and drinks from the restaurant and tiki bar!  Had an amazing, fun, and highly entertaining dinner at Casa di Amore last night!  I highly recommend!  This place is good for the soul and the stomach!
