x9eJYGB3vNVDqdEKXRaM-A.text: Quite simply, if you're reading this and you have any doubts, let them go and make your reservation.  We did and this place delivered, and we were eating there on Christmas Eve, but do be sure and make a reservation, as it's very easy to see that this place is small and very popular.  Do you like a loud fun room?  Again, they've got it covered.  Do you want a band to be playing?  They've got a small stage and two very gifted musicians playing on the night we are there.  Do you like your wine half off?  Well Monday happened to be half off night and so our group enjoyed not one, but two bottles of wine.  Do you like old pictures of Vegas casinos?  They've got a great selection of these as well.  Note that I have not yet referred to the food or the service, both of which emerged as excellent.  Our server struggled with the cork on the first bottle of wine, no problem, she simply got help, decanted the wine, and we were all happy.  At least four people made sure that our water was always filled, and we were able to enjoy two bread baskets with some of the best garlic butter in recent memory.  There was a lobster special happening that night, the scallops were some of the best cooked and most tender we've ever enjoyed and the chicken piccata arrived with the salt just the way that I like it.  We got out cannolis to go and they came with a free tee-shirt that said, "leave the gun, take the cannolis."    Great meal, great service, great music, great overall atmosphere, nice shirt, what more do you want?

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D6bu7LMbBs7rFX-oGAUOnA.text: Old school Vegas vibe paired with some tasty and generous sized Italian dishes is what you'll find at Casa Di Amore..  Ambiance & Service:  Brick walls with some great throw back pictures of strip casinos from the 90s adorn the walls.  Dim lighting and tight but comfortable seating make for a nice dining environment.  There was live music on the night we visited so it wasn't quiet but totally added to the cool vibe.  Our server was on point and very friendly.  His assistant server kept the drinks fresh throughout the evening.  Very well well done.  Entrees:  The portions for all our orders were very generous.  The calamari was tasty and the bruschetta made for great appetizers.  I had the chicken fettucine alfredo and it was loaded with plenty of chicken.  My niece had the Osso Bucco veal and it was so tender (you could tear it apart with a spoon) and delicious.  The cannelloni comes out with 3 huge pasta tubes filled with some flavorful meat and cheese.  All the dishes are rich in flavor and I got full very quickly.  This is a popular Italian restaurant for good reason as they really deliver at all levels.  They're a little pricier than your average casual restaurant but you're definitely getting your money's worth with the overall experience. I will definitely be back to try more dishes.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QOjk-3yXaHS0LlZssYwrMA.text: This restaurant is classic old Las Vegas! Your transported back in time by the decor and ambiance.  We had a party of 7 and were celebrating 2 of my sons birthdays.  Our waiter Tony was fantastic! He was truly one of the best waiters I think I've had the pleasure of getting served by!  We started with 2 appetizers, fried calamari and the bruschetta. The calamari breading was perfectly cooked with a light and crispy breading. The bruschetta had a delicious chopped tomato and garlic topping.  We had a variety of main entree's, chicken piccata, veal piccata, gnocchis with prosciutto, chicken parmigiana. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their entree's!  They also have live music with a 2 man band, playing and singing oldies.  Service 10/10 Food 10/10 Ambiance 10/10  Thank you for a wonderful night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GBPrXamt6PFzaE18q4nKUQ.text: Grabbed some takeout but it had such a charming vibe inside I will definitely come back for a dine in experience :)

3hwIPD2y5K0qLEF8_wyriw.text: Food was fantastic!   We waited at the bar for our table. Ordered a Luigi's lemonade and a mojito, both were great. Once seated we ordered sauteed mushrooms to start. Chicken masala with a side of fettuccine alfredo & cheese ravioli with a side of vegetarian meatballs. We finished it off with a cannoli, they're freshly made and tasted divine!   Our waiter was super friendly and nice, everything was just fantastic, both food & service! The only negative thing is that the food was slow to come out of the kitchen. They have really good fresh made bread with herbed butter though, it made the wait much better.

xujmvSpPoZdTZ50Phy4LKg.text: So I'd heard about this place a few times, but I had never actually been there.  The most I knew of this place was that the former Frank Sinatra sound-alike that used to be at the Brown Derby at the MGM Grand (now Craftsteak) performed there.  Well, I'll tell you that this is some of the best Italian food I've had here in Las Vegas.  Yes, the place is small, but the atmosphere is wonderful, especially the live music during dinner.  I liked the fact that the singer came from table to table shaking hands and singing.  Also that people felt free enough to dance and to toast each other.  I had the Pomodoro Fresco, which is the pasta with garlic butter and tomatoes.  Yummy!  And for dessert, I had their cannoli, which was absolutely fabulous!  Reminded me of cannoli from the late, great Albina's bakery and also from back east in Buffalo at Ilio DiPaolo's restaurant.  Also, because I got the cannoli, I got a free T-Shirt with the restaurant logo on the front and the immortal line "Leave the gun, take the cannoli" on the back!  So cool!  Will definitely be going back there!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back (and BEST PART!!) of T-shirt from Casa di Amore
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of T-shirt I got for ordering the cannoli at Casa di Amore

zWo3qwiIuoOb0PDtzzMpMw.text: It was very, very loud.  In part due to a live Jazz duo (drums and keyboard). Dim lighting.  Rip in the plastic bench booth seat.     Service was ok - fast enough, but inconsistent.   (We had to mention we never got our drinks).  The food was unremarkable and somewhat disappointing.  Not bad - but my baked ziti variation featured overcooked pasta.  Inexcusable in an Italian establishment that should know what al dente means.  There are so many choices in Vegas, and the best I can say about this place is: the parking was very convenient.

ciqN8YZ8PDtMUdQufSCiYg.text: This is the second time that I have been to this restaurant and it was a great experience both times. I love the fact that they send a limo to pick you up at your hotel which is a big help if you do not have a rental car. You have to set it up in advance, but it is worth it since all you do is tip limo driver and saves you from paying cab both ways. I definitely recommend doing this. Upon arriving at the restaurant, we were shown promptly to our seats.  We went on Monday night which is 1/2 price bottles of wine. We chose a Risota Muscat d' Asti which was a great wine. We decided to try the garlic loaf on this visit as appetizer and it was great. Good Italian bread with rich buttery garlic sauce and melted cheese. Very tasty and something I would get again. The wife and I both added a Caesar salad to our entree which is only a $3 addition. What a steal. They make a very good Caesar here and you must get it when you dine. For entree I chose the linguine and clams with red sauce and my wife had the eggplant Parmesan. Both were really good and generous portions. For dessert we shared a creme brulee and it was pretty good. Nothing terrific, but tasty. Good thing is you get a free T-Shirt when you order a creme brulee or cannoli for dessert.   Service here is top notch. Waiters are very courteous and come by often to check on you. They pour the wine and fill you glass as needed. This is an old school place that is classy. There is a lounge singer and saxophone player there that provide entertainment while you dine. The place looks and feels like an old classy location. We love coming here and it will probably be on our list to visit every time we come to town. If you are able to come and check it out, you will not be disappointed.

yYCAogJAizsPEUeDU0oMcg.text: Awesome resturant! My boyfriend and I were spending a weekend in Vegas, and he found this resturant (we felt like leaving the strip). This will now be a resturant we stop at every vegas trip.   First, the atmosphere is fun and a nice change from the Strip.  Second, the food was really good! We actually shared a 1lb pasta bowl, I personally am a huge pasta fan (favorite food) and this pasta was delicious. We got the Spaghetti and Meatballs with meat sauce. The meat was full of flavor and the pasta tasted so fresh.  Third, the live music was AWESOME! Unfortunately I don't recall the name of these two guys, but one played piano while the other drummed. They seemed to know any song, and we even requested a Frank Sinatra song and was not disappointed. They really sounded amazing and if I was local I would definitely book them for a party.  Fourth, the service was a bit slow, but with the music and nice atmosphere we didn't mind. The dessert was not up to par and they immediately took it off the bill and asked if we wanted another, altho we were too full, the consideration was very thoughtful and overall the service was very friendly.   Definitely a must try if you're looking for Italian and fun night!

m8-s3NGFEckqgWwcfq3gVQ.text: Very good food, great live music. Great personality from the staff. A little noisy, but it's just people having a good time. Great experience.

Agdy2Nr2y_pwxMLUxe1_GQ.text: I wanted to give them 5 stars so badly!!   The atmosphere is awesome. Small restaurant, old school Las Vegas. You can't beat it.   The service is simply amazing!! The bartenders are super friendly and our server was top notch!  But the food is overpriced and pretty average. There just wasn't anything special about any of the meals we ordered. For the price we were paying, we expected better. I've had tastier meals at Carabbas and Maggiano's (and paid a lot less).   Like I said, the atmosphere and service is unbeatable. But I feel like they are taking advantage of tourists with their prices (and I live here).

Aq5LqDQJwMY8_3atfQcmRg.text: OMG it was under a little construction but they still made it very comfortable,  very good atmosphere,  single gut band but did good old music, the food was so good amazing Italian.  Get the twice wrapped prawns explodes in your mouth with flavor. And the bread all I can say get off the strip and try this place you will love. Only 3 miles away also from the mgm.

plDBO7AjRwHfziim5GsQUQ.text: Walked n on a saturday evening around 6:45 and was seated within 10 minutes with no reservation.  Staff and servers were very friendly.  Had a spinach salad, calamari, and gnocchi. Food was great.  Will definetly come back if in Vegas again.  Live music was nice.  Atmosphere was a bit noisy.    This is a great place to go and get off the strip with all the tourist a holes and drunk people.

Qy5-t94lalaxrgmnXSnIKQ.text: I love this place! The food is not cheap, but the environment is great. Kind of loud in our area of the restaurant this time, but it was a loud patron's fault.

8eNlTz3PnGYJH0_V0hywMA.text: After reading all of the reviews, I was expecting a great dinner in a romantic environment. I was wrong!!!  The restaurant was under construction and had no atmosphere at all. There was a duo that played old school Sinatra type music but they were on break more than they played.   Food was ok at best. Had lasagna and a Ceasar salad. Just average. My date had pizza which was pretty good. Nice thin crust and cheese with just the right amount of burn. Only bright spot was the service. Our waiter was very attentive and checked in on us frequently but did not over do it.  I would be willing to try Casa again but only after the remodeling is complete.

Y7vA09gzNllKjx0xrYhDBg.text: I wanted to give this place a try but they would not have me. Had to deal with the most unprofessional lady manager yesterday. They will not serve you anything on the menu to go. They will also not allow you to sit, eat something, and then order something else to go. All because the bar is under construction and they don't have a place to charge me. It doesn't makes sense at all. More than half the seats were empty. I was willing to pay for an additional meal while seating. Pretty ridiculous policy and a manager that was unwilling to work with a customer. Instead of introducing herself, the manger stood right behind the hostess and had her repeat over and over that they can't serve me. Hey if you're the boss, learn to approach a customer head on and see how you could help instead of putting your bitch face on and standing there like a statue.

42iJzxu6GjchVb3I6wk79g.text: Classic old school local feel Italian. Kept looking for Frank and Dean over my shoulder. Good portions but flavor out of this world.

zfkmqeBMhAwNhNXaUZOGPg.text: My wife and I had decided to come here for dinner a couple of nights. We were looking for a place close to my work and UNLV. My wife mentioned there was an Italian restaurant near the coffee shop she frequents. I'm always up for Italian, so we decided to give it a try.  It had the feel of an old school New York Italian restaurant.  For our appetizer we ordered the twice wrapped prawns. It was okay but not nearly as good as I was hoping it would be. The flavors just weren't there.  For our entrees we ordered the pork chops with vinegar and peppers and the eggplant di amore. Both were quite good, and the portions were large.   The restaurant is a little pricey, so while I may go back, I doubt I'll be a regular.

wz8lFlZ0Ugi9iZlMovSFdA.text: This is a old time favorite place for Italian food. I have to say we have been going here for years. The food is freshly made, authentic, not premade like some chain restaurants. If you order Clams with red sauce or white sauce you get a ton of clams. They do not skimp. The atmosphere is like the old Vegas style and you will feel like you walked back into time, especially with the live music playing while you eat. The bread is delicious and we always seem to get a little too much cause we love it! You will for sure not leave hungry. We have never had a bad experience here and we have been going for years! It is a little off the strip but so worth going if your in the mood for some good food. If you are visiting and have no car, just call and make a reservation they will come get you in their limo. ( I recommend reservations anyway because they can get pretty busy at dinner time) Great place for special occasions or if you just want some good Italian food!! Oh and try their Cannolis you will love them!! Yummy!!!

bSLAiHV8C6hFNCCxrrHt9Q.text: Amazing food! The live entertainment was incredible. . Not a cheap place but worth it for date night!

sSGAsiTKXJrQsGz03wW-VA.text: Came off the beaten path from a recommendation from a bar tender on the strip. Wife and were picked up from a limo dispatched to our hotel ! The driver Pamela was hilarious and full of spunk. We always enjoy going to the local spots and this was a home run. Food was amazing, a full of taste and the atmosphere was old school Italian. I had the veal parmiganan with meat sauce, delicious!! The local musicians Roy & Paul we friendly and even greeted us when we arrived. Will come back for sure !!

JzLUMGEVb5xH4GjYvZxsvg.text: Want a great meal with live music and old school Vegas feel, then look no further. Loved it here. I wanted Italian and googled best Italian in Vegas and this was number four. When I looked at the other places they seemed so snooty and I didn't want to get all dressed up. So this seem to be the easy choice. What great service and the prices were unbelievable for Vegas. A must from now on when I visit. No 1 in Vegas as far as I'm concerned. Thank you for the great meal.

R4iDC9UdX8CQjItZnCLhBw.text: Food was okay. Service from Lynn not so friendly and personable if you are comparing it to the other gentleman waiter. She never took the time to greet us and explain specials or come back to check on us periodically. When we asked her questions, it was like we bothered her. If it wasn't for the other waiter being so nice to the other table, I would not come back here.

q_yvUuWTi9dGSqzZupv-eQ.text: Everything we ate was amazing, the ambiance was very old Vegas. Has a 2 pc band playing lounge music and taking request. Not cheap but definitely get what you pay for. Service was impeccable. The eggplant lasagna was like nothing I had ever tasted, cheesy and crispy

VAhTsJKwPuFMgatHG6-lBQ.text: This is The Gargoyle's favorite Las Vegas off strip place. Great atmosphere and phenomenal service. The food is fresh and homemade and always delicious. Treat yourself to a fine atmosphere with a laid back attitude. Don't be surprised if someone is dancing to the live lounge music. Plenty of locals and out of towers feel at home here.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j_8Ej8F1Q5zOzRlqKixPLQ.text: What can I say? Casa di Amore delivers the goods. We had no reservation, but our table of three was quickly seated for an early dinner. This is an old school joint with large red booths where vintage Vegas posters and photos of Sinatra dress the walls.   Warm bread got us started, an order of calamari ($13) followed. I love calamari when it's done right. When it's bad, it's BAD. There's nothing worse than deep fried rubber bands. No need to worry here, this calamari was tender and lightly breaded. The marinara sauce on the side was fantastic - well seasoned, not too acidic. I rarely find this to be the case. Needless to say, we devoured it so quickly I never snapped a photo.   Moving on to entrees, we ordered two orders of Eggplant di Amore ($24). And the house specialty, Osso Buco ($35). I couldn't tell you which is better. They are wildly different, but equally delicious.  Eggplant di Amore has slices of eggplant layered  like lasagna with ricotta cheese, mushrooms, spinach and sundried tomatoes. It is served with a side of spaghetti.  Osso Buco is classic Italian. They roast the veal shank to perfection, it falls off the bone. It's served with what I believe is an aged sharp cheddar risotto. It is unexpected and mighty scrumptious.  I was much too full for dessert, but a canoli and tiramisu were ordered. The canoli is filled to order so the shell remains crisp and the filling is rich and not overly sweet. It was a surprise to learn a free T-shirt comes with any canoli order. Service was steady and pleasant throughout. Not a single complaint could be made. Casa di Amore is a winner.

Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant di Amore

3kzqyr6JUDAifcmx5I9VfA.text: I love this place and their cannoli are the best in Las Vegas!  They also have live music and a separate bar area. #bestcannolieverrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr

ETGuMDspTeorU6E7xZkJDg.text: This place is the best. Spaghetti and meatballs were bomb. Garlic  yep try everything you won't be disappointed.  Must eat here for sure

yyZiAboBQixFmrLTe1JkJg.text: Absolutely perfect delicious food time less music very nice servers awesome ambience fun Place for the family

o_s0Oo0v_YD7Yw6k944CzQ.text: A surprisingly good "find" at a location where you wouldn't expect such a nice place.  The staff was very accommodating & efficient.  Food was good, a very upscale armosphere.

F73B514SSf1QuA0oIWOSwQ.text: KiiFood... EXCELLENT Service..... EXCELLENT Ambience.....9 out of 10 very loud Overall experience was very good can't wait to go back. I've lived in Vegas almost 50 years why have I not discovered this gem a bit earlier. My only complaint was the noise level but it was crowded and had tile floors

J3OSDunUfh7PyXpThM3tJQ.text: Get the gypsy sauce the stuff is spicy but great and the pork chops and cherry peppers love this place old Vegas at its best

DBrLERhTaIjAvabXXofq7Q.text: It's as if Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack still hang out here. It's "Old Vegas" and it really does embody American Italian cuisine. Honestly I love that the kitchen opens late until 4AM and the bar until 5AM but I find the prices to be a bit over the top. Don't get me wrong the food isn't bad but for a salad it's $12 and a 1 pound pasta dish is $22. Not to mention my girlfriends and I split the 1 pound pasta dish thinking it would be plenty but it was teeny. We are hungry young ladies who EAT! We ordered the cannoli and tiramisu for dessert. Final verdict; it's average and the prices are high. For late night I encourage happy hour in which they have but only for pizzas.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XDzBTaNidWROp2SRpYtwmA.text: Six of us decided to visit this pace based on great comments from our friends whom had visited over  the past years.  First, it was crowded, tight seating, and noise but I will say the life music is good which makes the small place and so so acoustic rather harsh on the ears.  That night it seemed like half of the guests had birthdays as it gets old quick to hear Happy Birthday being sung so often.  Our server was very good My veal was just average as I've had better for a few dollars less.  My wife's lasagna was better than my veal but a somewhat small portion.

tNX7pg3hL3M5aFbbMNnylw.text: I do not often write reviews, but this place needs to be documented... I am an executive chef and I have worked for some of the most prestigious places including Buckingham Palace.  On this visit I joined some friends and I was so glad that I got the invite. Smith the Manager greeted me as always what a guy he remembers all his guests. We got to the table where some appetizers had already been ordered and arrived a few minutes after we did. Brad who was our servers is outstanding...He remembered my drink and asked if I would like to enjoy my usual Gin and Tonic...For someone to remember such detail is awesome! George was singing as usual, NOW if you haven't been here before George is an amazing "Entertainer", If you close your eyes sip you Martini its just like listening to "A young Frank Sinatra".  We put our orders in and I ordered the Daily Special with Modifications I wanted to try the Risotto. I am so glad that I did...This dish blew my mind, I would rate this is as one of my all time best Risotto dishes. I have had quite a few especially as I did part of my Chef Training in Genova, this rates right up there with some of the best. My friend ordered the Cioppino and this was so rich and flavor full, the sauce was divine...  I have to say as a restauranteur I am amazed that the labor turnover is so low, this shows one thing that the team members want to be here to work, most have been there over a decade...  When visiting Las Vegas this is a must visit place I know it not on the strip but a 15 minute jaunt off the strip is totally worth it...They can even send a limo...we got one back to the Hotel... This is a secret that the locals all visit....YOU NEED TO VISIT THIS PLACE...DONT LEAVE VEGAS WITHOUT DINNING HERE

_fatW_k7RVpIVyrd_jBDUg.text: Great food and atmosphere. There was a terrific lounge bad who did some super songs from the 70s. Chicken parm and Caesar were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4jBXCEBZyvxI_RAASf28jA.text: Went here with my husband late night at 1 am. Great food and our server was amazing. We got a nice booth next to the stage. Best Italian food I've had in a while. Bit of a drive for me since I live completely on the other side of town but totally worth it. They're also open til 5am which is great since my husband is off late.

TPRYSKtDmMMPo_SB3VuzZQ.text: This is a must go place in Las Vegas for a great traditional Italian meal.  I just love that this place brings you the memories of Vegas in the 1950's.   I got the veal parmesan which comes with a side of pasta and consisted of 4 pieces of veal and almost too much for me to eat.  I had to take a break half way through the meal to rest before I could complete the meal.  The waiter was wonderful and personable; a joy to be served and gave great suggestions tailored to our tastes.  Along with the meal you get live music singing Sinatra songs and such from that era.  When we got close to the end of our meal we asked to call for a cab and he arranged for us to be driven back in there limo.  Really nice touch.

hBDNePXGNjxi3VCbEEMnyA.text: great food. very old vegas. a fun place to visit. always busy, so plan to wait even with a reservation.

5ogWRlWqwQK40PtaBtzS2Q.text: Our first visit and will not be our last. Husband and I were both impressed with each bite. The marinara was obviously simmered for long hours. You can tell things were roasted, sauteed, and detailed with thought and emotion. He had an chicken parm and I had shrimp scampi; to be safe for our first visit.  We also took a successful chance on Calamari fritti.    The staff wonderfully hospitable and entertainment unobtrusive to conversation but so sweet to the lover of crooning nostalgia. It was like having your Mama's dinner on Sunday night, no matter your ethnicity. No fluff: mouth and tummies very happy; AND we have leftovers for tomorrow!!!

xqeGKSkbJDlulxXnySOCnQ.text: Best marinara sauce ever and the food portion is a lot as well! Hidden gem on Tropicana for real.

nwj5ComHRaWWsAtj_O-sEw.text: What I like about Casa Di Amore is that it offers an escape from the prepackaged,  homogeneous vibe most places in Vegas have.  It's got a real old school vibe, although I'm not sure how long the restaurant has actually been around.  But if it was in business in 1959, you can bet Sinatra and company would've loved this place.  I went here with a big group of friends and all agreed that the food was great!  The service during dinner was also friendly, welcoming and the courses were brought out neither too fast or too slow.  As an added bonus they even sent a limo to pick us up and take us back to our hotel.

u_bDc4RwLNKOhgCEV29ehA.text: Great food, great service,  and great atmosphere!  We were told it would be a 30min-1hr wait so we went to the bar (bartenders were very nice)  We had just left Annies gourmet Italian restaurant and had a horrible experience!   We were only at the bar for about 10 minutes and my girlfriend had told the manager "Smitty" what had happened at the last restaurant, we were starving!  After hearing our story Smitty came right over and got us a table!  Awesome!!! Or server, i think his name was Bret or Brad, was great!  Eggplant was soooo good. As was the bruchetta and gypsy pasta with meatballs. ..can't wait to go back!

QwGY-JW2comPSh1cgBuQeA.text: I've eaten here several times now and this restaurant is constantly producing good food.  They have decent live music and if you go on Tuesdays selected bottles wine are half off.  It is a great reminder of what old Vegas use to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live music and 1/2 price bottles of wine on Monday night. The food is awesome!

yVeGlkZKfMAC_v_u7eLSgg.text: What more can I say the food was delicious and the service was phenomenal and the music and entertainment took me back to the old mafia days when Las Vegas had character.  My favorite dish was the angel hair pasta spaghetti and the special bread loaf.  Last but not least the singer reminded me of Frank Sinatra and Tony Bennett and Tommy Dorsey and Sammy Davis Junior.  good times and good food what more can you ask for.

qiKiwxTnxH5vVkVfQqPLxQ.text: Experience, food, nostalgia, and tradition. The way Vegas used to be and hopefully, this will always be the piece that stays.  The live music and ambience puts you in a trance of what life should feel like. Thank you, George, Paul, Bryan, Rebecca, and Roshy for making this place magical.

mrzFTb0QVCOep56-2RBEcQ.text: We had eggplant lasagna, shrimp scampi, eggplant parnassian. All three were great. Waiter suggested a little extra marinara on the side, great idea. Tiramisu and cannoli very tasty, and we got a T-shirt with the cannoli! Decor was nice but aging, waiter said they're remodeling in May 2015.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vi5LbMAAOThBgR5kfo1OCg.text: What a surprising place!  Too bad the place was dimly lit or I would have taken and posted pictures.  So crowded that we had to eat at the bar, but they had special wooden placement to make eating at the bar very easy.  Sitting at the bar, we were near the live trio entertainment. Something of a "old style Vegas act" performing 50's Rat pack type music. Up front and close they were quite the impressive guys.  Anyway lets talk about the food.  First, the bartender/waitress was extremely friendly and helpful. We followed her suggestions for the specials. A buratta and pancetta  bruschetta on toast with roasted red peppers was just excellent.  Next we shared a caesar salad which was a little disappointing - just kind of flat in the way of flavor. The entree was really special - very fresh ingredients - a garlic shrimp over fettuccine. The sauce was not ready or too rich and had some sausage, fresh tomatoes. The only thing that would have made it better was larger fresh shrimp. Had a great night here. People watching is always a great entertainment!

0NknJChFx1VjNv62aWW3gA.text: I am so confused by the positive reviews. I ordered takeout at 2am... Spaghetti meat sauce... A very difficult dish to mess up... Not exaggerating when opened the lid it literally smelled like DOG FOOD. Like a literal can of dog food. That smell. WTF????? The texture of the meat was grainy (how??? I don't understand; it was bizarre). I took a bite and called them back. There was very little sauce so I at first asked for more sauce, thinking maybe that would help. NO. There was something wrong with the meat. Mind you this is a $22.50 spaghetti meatsauce that smelled like dogfood. I don't even know how someone in their right mind could serve that to a customer... And charge $22.50... What????? The server and the manager dealt with the situation professionally and promptly so this review is not for them. They gave me a spaghetti meatball instead and gave me a canolli on the house. The canolli was great, but the dish they gave me was also sub par (waay too salt and i'm a salt addict)... not what you expect for $22.50 LOL!!! This review is for the cook: you need to re learn proper food handling/ safety because the 2 bites of your dogfood spagetti meatsauce MADE ME SICK. I will spare you the details. I cannot even wrap my mind around the ridiculous $22.50 price. How long was that sitting there???? Was that an old dish that was sitting there that you tried to get rid of? How old was the sauce and was it kept at the proper temp? There's no way. Would you serve that to your friends or family???? Would you pay $22.50 for that dish???? How would you feel if you were sick from eating it? Would you be pissed enough to write a one star Yelp review? Seriously, relearn proper food handling/ safety skills. If the health department came in there and saw you serving that, you would be shut down.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $22 dogfood spaghetti meatsauce

rDDBGL08MKRruhfKpyDwZA.text: Absolutely the best Italian restaurant I have been to here in Vegas. Reminds me of east coast. The staff is warm and welcoming, the garlic butter is delicious and I have yet to have a dish there I ever wanted to stop eating.

AHFsQjcSob-d8zjBhHOD9Q.text: My favorite place for pasta there customer service there foood the place it's all good quality to me you would have to try to find out n I fought anyone can be in satisfied so delicious here

sxRyDnFsmHV5hUbULEppog.text: Awesome atmosphere for a group or a romantic dinner.  Great wine list too.  The wait staff are on point from the time you walk in the door.  Stefan our waiter never let us sit and feel unattended.  I ordered spaghetti with meat balls and sausage.  Absolutely delicious, not overly saucy and the pasta was cooked perfectly.   The 2 meats were seasoned like my grandmother had made them herself. My wife had fettuccine alla pepasito. It was a wonderful dish.  It had just the right amount sauce and seasonings. Our friend had the gnocchi.  She was extremely happy with her dinner (she's been here 10+ times).  So if you're in Vegas for a getaway please try this awesome restaurant out and see what we found out tonight...old school Vegas still exists!

etyKkoLUCP70ESim_ZcZaw.text: A little gem in Vegas. We called around 5-6pm for an 8pm reservation. They made no guarantees but promised to accommodate us if we showed up. After a hefty wait at the bar we were seated and the evening could not have gone any better. Service was top shelf. Food was WOW awesome. Drinks and recommendations from our server top notch. The place was full of locals who came for dinner and the house band which was incredible. Hence the reason nobody leaves and the wait was a little long. I don't give 5 but this one was definitely worth it. Next time we will take advantage of free limo service. Too bad five stars is max!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our waiter took a ton of pics with my phone. Great memories.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House band was great!

_jL4ncLRcWIRzyX-1214og.text: I am sooo sorry, Casa di Amore. I didn't realize I never wrote you a review until my mother-in-law talked about how she's coming back and I had to look you guys up again.  On to my review...  I am anti-weddings or should I say I'm anti the weddings *I've* attended. The weddings I've been to in the last few years have been kinda mehh. The consistent theme that I've noticed is that the food is never really that wonderful, which sucks because that's the most costly part. When it came down to planning my whole shebang, I didn't want to throw a $20,000 wedding for 175 people with crappy food. Plus ever since Britney Spears got married in Vegas, I've always had this crazy idea in my head that I should get married there too. So, that's what we did. Our plan: to have a 15 minute ceremony that would have the best damn wedding food and greatest party you've ever experienced. Casa di Amore helped make my big night absolutely flawless.   We had originally planned for a Brazilian steakhouse that our chapel could package with our overall wedding. The chapel screwed up and forgot to make the reservation with the steakhouse. By the time they noticed their error, they told me the place was booked up. The problem with having your wedding on a hella cool date like 9-10-11 is that everyone  ELSE wants that hella cool date too. We called a bunch of different places on the strip including Maggianos and no dice. My mom, of all people, actually found Casa di Amore and told me to call them. Immediately after speaking with Kathleen, I knew that this was going to be a perfect fit for my wedding. She was absolutely one of the best people that I dealt with throughout my wedding process. She gave me their traditional catering menus but said if we saw something else on the menu we liked, they could change it and edit it.   The food: we had 30 guests and everyone raved about the food (my dad's review is even on here...look for Russ C.) My husband's family is all 100% Italian, so I was hoping this would live up to their expectation and it did. They all were so impressed by the antipasto platter that we had served as an appetizer and said "Wow, this place is authentic."  And yeah, I'm pretty darn competitive so to hear my dad and step-mom tell me the food was WAY better at our wedding than at my step-brothers, well that was one of my proudest moments of 2011.   The service: our waiters were great, very attentive and personable. They were happy to make wine and champagne suggestions but didn't try to push anything extra on us.  The $$$: Kathleen only made us pay a small deposit of $100 to reserve the space for us. She followed up with us throughout the whole process but sent us another follow-up email the day before just to make sure we were still good to go and that we didn't want to change anything. We thought the prices were extremely fair in comparison to how much food and how amazing it was.  Ambiance: so fun! There was a lounge singer there that night and my guests loved it. We got a free show while we ate.  If anyone is thinking of doing a dinner here, I would highly recommend it. The process is easy and Kathleen will put your mind at ease. OR if you've been there, done that on the whole wedding thing and are just thinking about a nice date, doooo it! It's great to get away from the strip and experience a little old Vegas. They also have limos that will come pick you up as long as you make a reservation and call in advance.

NfktfzTggyinVzRpRJJxfQ.text: 8pm on a Saturday night and only had about a 5 minute wait for the table. Excellent old Vegas atmosphere complete with a singer/pianist and drummer. Our waiter was friendly and let us know he was in no hurry to rush us, so we had a leisurely 2 hour meal, one of the best I've had in town this year. The chianti was a great selection paired with our meals. We had a basket of fresh bread brought to our table. For an app we had the prosciutto crostini ... Delicious. I had lasagna and my date had gnocchi. We both loved out food, and I have to say my lasagna was like no other I've ever had. We took 2 cannoli to go, but haven't had yet.  I would absolutely come back. It was a pricey meal but the quality made it worth it for a special occasion or an "impress your date" night.  FYI Monday is 1/2 price bottle of wine night!

bcdiLcsieRMHYTf1JZNHQA.text: Here we have another Las vegas classic, it's time to venture off the Las vegas Strip for that off beat hidden gem. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. The pork chops I will say were top notch. The service is also very good, and in Las Vegas that is not a given, there a couple of places that think that just because they have been here fora while that they can treat you like dirt (I think we all know who i am talking about.) Skip them and their bellow average food and come to Cassa Di Amore. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

ZA5UDW39Um_GukDrPnQ0vg.text: Pleasantly surprised.  No lie, I had some hesitation coming up to the east side not many great things are found here. This place however blew my mind! The vibe of live music, hospitable service and great food put a fat ass stamp of places I would forsure return back to.

5lPpjXlz8vbvEmWpNYk2Mg.text: This restaurant has it all, the decor, entertainment, service and the best Italian food!  We bring friends here from out of town instead of the strip.   Lynn is the best server!    Make sure you make reservations, instead of waiting because this place is PACKED!

T9hM0teT7KS_8QHxj8ReCQ.text: I had fried calamari and fettuccine, both of which were well prepared. Our waiter Joanne, was very professional and made a great recommendation for desert. The manager, greeted just about everyone who walked in, so I felt welcomed.

Ny_LVpqqCpbM_-ky-2dPIg.text: I love this place.....The food, the service and the entertainment always makes for a great family night.

Cz5a4F3J4eWgIEN6HG3-fg.text: First let me start out with saying we love this place and it has never disappointed. With it being only about ten minutes from the strip and they have complimentary shuttle service it makes it a great option for people looking to dine off the strip. It is a predominately a locals spot, however, a great place for anyone. The decor here reminds of a place straight out of the rat pack era/ old Vegas era which is an awesome sight to see, as Vegas has changed so much since then. We generally choose to sit at the bar as they have video poker games. The bartenders and the rest of the staff are friendly we especially like Roshy. Our most recent time there were shared the mini osso bucco which was served on top of risotto. This dish was absolutely fantastic, and loved every single bite. We waited a little bit before ordering our entrees but when we did we split the veal francaise which was served with a side of pasta. This dish was one of the best plates of Italian food I have ever had. The veal was perfect and tender the lemon butter was delicious. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the sauce that we chose for our pasta which was Alfredo was amazing. After gambling and drinking a couple more drinks they arranged for a shuttle to take us back to the hotel, and the driver was friendly and talkative. This is a must go place for great Italian food whether you reside in Vegas or just visiting make sure this place is on your list.

cY_zwzdUNzbnNUlP_AUVQA.text: The live music was a hit! The caprese and garlic cheese bread were great starters. The gnocchi with cream sauce and prosciutto was amazing! We will come back again when we are in town!

GsA6f-iBGBo5I0ZegKz6yQ.text: Such a fun place to eat a Birthday dinner at. Loved the look of the place. They had live music. A huge bar. Great servers and managers always asking if everything is ok. The food was sooooo good. We had pasta od course. Definetly a great portion size. And great tasting as well. Just the right amount of everything in it. The Garlic cheese bread is so soft and fresh. One of the best i ever had. Hands down. I thought everything was great.... Then the Canoli came out. OMG!!!!! The BEST!!!!!! You even get a free t-shirt when you order it. Which i think is hilarious to me. But damn...... One of the best Canoli's that i ever had in my life. And trust me... I had a lot of pasteries in my time. LoL. If you're not planning on going back for the music or pasta. You'll go back for the Canoli. Trust me. It's that good.

eqP8CekadahiZTuTxjhCCA.text: Amazing food, friendly staff, entertainment band. I recommend this to visitors and locals alike.

wJwYRCL54dRWtDkILvlY7g.text: Great place! Lobster ravioli to die for and spag and meatballs were super!  Wait staff were extremely friendly and attentive. Got a free T-shirt for ordering Creme brulee which was . Highly recommend this place!

SH7CnFO6LYA2XL4ykVSIFA.text: I was there last night for my birthday dinner.  Loved the food. I ordered the Eggplant Di Amore.  It was awesome as was the service.  I had a cannoli for dessert....omg, be sure to get one.  Be sure to make reservations to ensure prompt seating!!I will be back....

2EOfXD4ylW3hZtnfww1FJg.text: Better than 4 stars, but definitely not 5.  Overall, I liked this place a lot.  Chicken parm was very good.  They have something called gypsy sauce which is a spicy marinara.  It was great.  Tasted the veal parm which was very good.  The shrimp phyllo appetizer was just OK.  Desert was a great cannoli!

0X-uOdOfRNLe7eOFi2L-Ow.text: Being going there for years when in town just there yesterday again, always consistently good.  Bar - Good bartenders, make drinks well, video porker acceptable get a key so you spin. Wait Staff - Always professional, know the menu well good with recommendations food & wine. Food - Excellent. Entertainment/music - Nice.  My opinion reasonably priced and cant go wrong having a meal here.

mK-5jUMrBiUEmaOdPJGzYg.text: I came to eat here with a party of 12, and they also had a moderately large wedding reception in the middle at the same time, but they could handle everyone just fine. Apart from the surreal positioning of being in a booth on the edge of some stranger's party with no real partition other than a walkway, we were impressed by the food and service here. The mostaciolli with marinara is what I ordered, and it was fantastic. Their marinara is very flavorful, which I prefer to the meat sauce, which is a little dry and spicy. They have a decent wine selection if that's your thing. Plus, you can go blast an automatic assault rifle next door afterwards and fulfill your Godfather fantasies. Only in Vegas.

lA8tiJdACeYzQwdRxLJajQ.text: If you want something different in Vegas, try Casa di Amore. It's as authentic to Old Las Vegas as it gets. You can tell mobsters use to dine here.   Here's my quick notes:  Osso Bucco - this is a very rich dish and it came with the bone marrow. Quite impressive.    Cioppino - best fisherman stew ever. The only thing missing was pasta.   Gnocchi - soft pillow but a bit salty with the prosciutto.   Bruchetta - has a very fresh tomato taste to it.   Bellisima Bellini - best I've ever had.   Live music - Frank Sinatra reincarnated. No joke.   Bottom line -  very cool place.

5uvNt3l9j2EiC1AzleIPAw.text: Had spinach salad and they also buco and my wife had the veal parmesan everything was good the service was wonderful they had A 2 piece live music the aumbiance was great I would go back there again

THgvmU8ASn3jaE-TpORFaA.text: This is a great classic Italian restaurant. The food is AMAZING!!! I love that they have a True Italian atmosphere with the piano and singers, the authentic food, and it's pretty loud which reminds me of being in an Italian house! The only complaint I have which has nothing to do with the restaurant overall is I wish the people that are their dressed up a little more half of the place is dressed very nice the other half is in leggings and hoodies it just kind of brought the class of the place down a bit for me. But other then the atmosphere you can not go wrong with the food!

zK_0IJ7CKTneLGMeygEPpg.text: Amazing best Italian food in Vegas hands-down love love love love this place The servers are amazing food comes out in a proper timing matter The music is great to places a little small but can't complain about that but in other words great place

jtVobhMu5pLl4n-8reJ2tw.text: Just returned home from a week long trip out there and had to take the time to write a review on this gem of a restaurant. Although this place is always packed, the staff is always courteous, knowledgeable and treat you like you are a member of the family. The atmosphere is a time warp with a flare of modern. The walls are adorned with old pictures of Vegas and across from the bar are large flat screen TVs that rotate through pictures of how Vegas use to look as well as faces from the past. Now my favorite part, the food! On this visit I started with the arancini (rice balls) and bruschetta with buffalo mozzarella. I could eat both of these appetizers everyday and not get bored. For my entree I had the veal cannelloni. This was the best cannelloni I have ever had and will definitely be ordering it in the future. My last visit was unique in that the restaurant has opened Tiki Di Amore on the back patio. It was relaxing and a great way for our group to sit together and enjoy a drink before heading back to the strip. If you are visiting in town or a local to Vegas this place is a mandatory for dinner.

QLvtTkzE5IhZ_2g-sgTTYA.text: Great place...a little warm inside (but it was a dry heat).  Food was delicious, wine superb, the staff was top notch, and entertainment very Vegas-y. Will be back next time I am in town.

XthVC3KHMTBnI_naxTsOuQ.text: Great Entertainment, great bartender, strong drinks but the food is average and they should be ashamed of their prices.   We've been here dozens of times over the years and they are so nice that we've never wrote a bad word but enough is enough.   We went on Friday night and had the pretty damn good garlic loaf and a thin, kinda soggy pizza. Our friend picked up the check for driving him home so I don't know what it all coat. We returned the favor and took him back to Casa Di Amore on Sunday.   We had:  Two Jack and cokes, one small pepperoni pizza, and a slice of lasagna. IT WAS SIXTY DOLLARS!   The lasagna was $24 with a small caesar salad! How do they sleep at night? The pizza was just okay but the lasagna wasn't good, It was small and had little to no meat... $21 ala cart, add $3 for a tiny caesar salad. What could be in there to constitute that price? This was JUST a slice! Maybe 5"x5". That leaves 11 more servings in a pan right? What's that $250.00 for a pan of lasagna???   This is the main reason we never eat Italian out and if we do, we'll just split a pizza.  We will go back but only late night, order no food, have some over priced cocktails, watch the great entertainment. We do love the thick old Vegas vibe here.  To be fair a lot of Italian joints like Bootleger Bistro and Capos are priced about as ridiculous. We don't often eat there either. If we are going to spend $21, it aint going to be on $1 worth of pasta, cheese and tomato sauce.

rpj4v0Vrv20t6UxOldI6ig.text: Absolutely delicious, authentic, Italian cuisine. Relaxed, family style atmosphere... definitely worth a visit.

LC3EHHHCeqf9TvPs4ZkyNw.text: Its Always Great!  Especially the chippino.. My God!  DELICIOUS! osso Buco calamari bread basket  is also Delicious

LO9YugXCkGkoJntUn-PzQA.text: Tried the Gypsy pasta. Very spicy, but if you can take it, taste very good. Friendly service, complementary picture and live music. Baked lasagna was really good and cheesy, goes well with the bread. Excellent desserts, I recommend the exotic bomba and tiramisu cake.

h2eEKW9CiBy2sp3OUSM-FA.text: Totally found a gem!!!!! Thanks to good ol' yelp!!!! Great food! Great service! Tony was such a pleasant server! Very attentive and informative!!!!! If you want a great place to eat off the strip this is your go to!!! Supper yummy!!!!

aWHUrrkuqxEx08EojnZxeQ.text: I love this place. The atmosphere is wonderful, old Vegas style, homey, and relaxing. They play classic oldies live music. The musician even came to our table, and asked for any requests.  Everyone was supper friendly from our host, waitress, and bartender.  Yet, the food was the big star. We had the Chicken Parmesan, Osso Bucco, and a Ghnocci side. Everything was amazing, and the portions were very generous.  This place probably has the best Chicken Parmesan in Las Vegas.  The cheese on top was creamy, while the chicken underneath was crispy with just the right amount of marinara sauce.  There was no need for a knife with the Osso Bucco, and it just melted in my mouth.  I couldn't stop eating it.  The flavor was rich, meaty, yet light and buttery at the same time.  It had the perfect balance. The Ghnocci hands down was the best I ever had, anywhere! We had it with the meat scauce, which I was impartial to (due to a herb flavor I personally don't enjoy).  Overall, amazing experience from the food to the ambience.  Most definitely recommend, and most definitely will be back.

kiuJ8jcV9ogxBZNrLsTY6g.text: My meal was delicious! We got the antipasta appetizer with fried ravioli, calamari, and mozzarella. Amazing! Super friendly people and waiters as well! The live music is very enjoyable to listen to while eating.

ZpoGM_3fI3UqMINgyFXbNA.text: I love old Vegas establishments.  They are devoid of the glitz and forced atmosphere of many of the restaurants on the strip.  This is a small place, all wood and not very many tourists.  The food is decent and it's GREAT to hear jazz.  The only reason I didn't give 4 stars is the music is just too loud.  No matter where you sit.  Management really needs to instruct the band to turn it down.  I couldn't hear my guest without shouting

wLiANwjTqkQ3dQxO7BokPw.text: Love the old school Vegas vibe here! We have been celebrating family birthdays here for years and love the food, service and entertainment. If you enjoy live music (Vegas staples - Sinatra, etc), authentic Italian dishes and a good bottle of wine - this is the place. Always packed, so make reservations!

aGsK_NJEZYe5TOuLpCj0IA.text: Every time I come to Vegas,  I have to visit Casa Di Amore. The food is always amazing and the entertainment can't get any more entertaining.  It's so Vegas!!

oY4z0x7ZbfGyyMz6LbyoQw.text: Flattering original review (see below) ... complete with venue backstory ... but ... UPDATE: Houston, we have a problem.  I dropped in one recent weekday evening around midnight. I ordered the 16 ounce bone-in Ribeye Sinatra (again), medium rare.   What I got was a 10 ounce, no-bone, zero-marble cut of meat. I am pretty durn sure I was passed off a sirloin strip instead. OK, MAYBE the cook trimmed out the bone ... but that would have to have been a HUGE bone. And where's the marbling?  And it was dry. Really, really dry. Dry like chew-chew-chew dry. The exact opposite of juicy. Dry. Desert dry. I say again, dry.  And, under oath and penalty of perjury, I testify there was SOME pink in there to be seen, but really the steak was cooked to the far side of full-on medium. And it even tasted a bit sour; let's hope the day-shift hadn't already written-off this hunk of meat as too far out-of-date.   So we are talking wrong and/or bad cut of meat ... and cooked wrong, to boot.  Now I am wondering if my slab of ribeye actually landed somewhere else, given one was already paid for. By me.  Oh, and there was no waiter. He/she had apparently been cut and so the bartender - while trying to appease about 10 drinkers/players at the video poker bar - also had to appease me. Given he might miss a winner's sweet tip due to being too inattentive at the VP bar, I was fortunate he worked to give me most all the attention I required. But a scrambling bartender does not equal a waiter. And, as I said, not fair to the bartender either.  And what a racket! Blasting some kind of crazy hip-hop rock nonsense (instead of music) that could only be appropriate for mentally blurring the VP players into dropping more money.  After soda, salad (a $3 add-on) tax and tip, I was out-the-door for well over $50. At that price, this quality of steak & service & ambiance was just a flat-out fail.  And perhaps that is why the next booth over (the only other occupied booth in the house) they were splitting a loaded 18" pizza (that did look tasty) that was coming in at about $12.50 due to a late-night, half-off deal. Instead of ordering from the full dinner menu.  I thought about sending the steak back, but instead decided to just tough it out (pun intended) then take a pass on CdA for a while ... and give it a chance to smooth over these jagged edges. In the meantime, I've pulled a star back ... and started noting other all-night dining venues of merit.

Uf5Pw1oUEgR6gtWyLxI9dA.text: Boyfriend and I saw it on Jersey Shore lol and had to try it after they raved about it! Went to Vegas during our anniversary so decided to go there. I made a reservation through opentable and mentioned it was our 1 year anniversary. Didn't think much of it but wow when we arrived, they knew it was our anniversary and even sat us in this awesome little table near the musician. They even made him congratulate us so everyone in the restaurant knew! It was so awesome. And the food is beyond amazing, I had the lasagna. It was superb!! Thank you Casa Di Amore for such a great anniversary dinner :)

J1WWYS6Zvby5-TBhrrgcZQ.text: Hands down best authentic italian restaurant i have ever had the privilege of dining at. My family walked in on an extremely busy saturday night without a reservation and were seated almost immediately by the foh manager. Our server Tony was absolutely excellent from his attentiveness, to his knowledge of the menu and helping accommodate my 3 year old niece we had brought along with us. The food was AMAZING! Literally everything we had was so delicious i left the restaurant with an upset stomach because i couldnt put the fork down! This is an amazing place for a meet up, dinner date, solo dining or whatever your plans may be. 10/10 recommend, and we will be back for more excellent food.

XhGnj1o4a-w6vAxSpi5-1A.text: This maybe good but I don't know because we made a reservation and waited 45 mins for a table for two. Yet the manager kept telling his employees to seat parties of 3 or more first even if they had no reservations. So this is my review won't go there ever.

b0h6CUImUWF6QE-JGoM1qA.text: Came here for the hubs bday dinner! Was freaking delicious! We will be coming back for sure. Ordered cannolis to go and our server Robert informed us we get shirts with an order of cannolis which was cool. A bit loud in there with the live music and packed dining room but we can get past that for the great food.

F3gwhsD-AvWbAar9oIp-SQ.text: This was SUCH a wonderful surprise!!! We literally felt like we were transported to some Italian family's dinner celebration in the heart of NYC! This restaurant has the best energy, great good and delivers a great night! Live music every night?! I mean, come on! Go here stat!!

YNrqDlcgHlaoDgOlA7aizg.text: Great fresh Italian food. Awesome entertainment. The place feels like an old school joint Las Vegas forgot! Love it. We always visit.

z_DCNNM0qLiaBSNvJdTxYw.text: Sat and waited for an hour with a reservation at the bar. Too small for the amount of people left and decided not wait for longer. Disappointing. They had us sit at the bar for an hour for a reservation at 7:30 and we arrived at 7:10. We left and went to Pasta Mia up the street better entertainment way better service. It's sad cuz I really wanted to try this place. They really need to expand into a bigger space if they are going to make that many reservations plus half the people sitting at 2 seater booths were only there to hear this guy sing and have a drink. Like really we came to eat here not drink but that's all we did since there is nowhere to sit to eat and they insist you sit at the bar till you are seated and they don't check up on you about your reservation to make sure you don't leave.

J-tLIbxS_y-HQIYxvYz72Q.text: This place is a hidden gem and one of the best kept secrets in Vegas for authentic, delicious Italian food with a great atmosphere to match! Just walked in randomly one day with a couple friends bc we were in the mood to try a new place. Right when you walk in, the atmosphere is so inviting and you immediately get that old school Italian vibe. Their table side manner and service is impeccable. We lucked out bc they had a live band that night and it was like getting dinner AND a show; so cute to watch the older couples dance while you enjoy your dinner and wine. Great spot for birthdays, dates, or just when you feel like getting that personalized service.

c7YqOYuuVlBkvOpaHClK0Q.text: I went tonight with my family, we had a table of 9 reservation. Everyone got their plates about 30 mins after appetizers, except for me!! I ordered street tacos...my whole family ate and finished, when the waitress brought the check and asked me how I liked my meal i told her i never got it. She was like omg so sorry we ran out of tortillas so that's why you never got your meal....ughhh...i said it was fine she offered to get me something else but by then i was over it and just asked for a bloody Mary. Took 15 minutes to get my  drink and as i was sipping the last of it SURPRISE she brought my damn tacos, told me tacos and my  salad(which i didn't get till we were leaving) and my drink was on the house...I have three shrimp tacos and a salad in my fridge now...cool they didnt charge us but my family dinner literally didnt happen. Sort of disappointed but shit happens...gordon Ramsay would throw a fit over such a thing but I'm gonna smoke some legal marijuana and eat my soggy tacos...

xrcrNUOVVgh_aRwl6qsBVQ.text: This place had good music, but the food service was terrible.  Took 45 minutes.  They had a big party in the restaurant.  We were in tiki.   But the nice manager in back there took care Alex.  Was going write a nasty but situation turned out great. Food was good.

r-y2WnVPig1YH42fM1P3xQ.text: OMG. This place is delicious. Went around 10pm on Monday night and there was live music. Had the penne pesto. Superb. Yummy yummy

6Gvcj9A5jkTA50Di3blmFg.text: Impeccable comes to mind. Old feel Vegas at its best! Service was amazing. Food was outstanding! Entertainment was classic! Great time!
