g2zBdHtaoGR6hvOgX6UsNg.text: We had a wonderful time with our visit here. Our waiter Steffen was very attentive and the spaghetti with meatballs and sausage was exactly what the doctor ordered. A bustling crowd with live music added to the ambiance.

cxfvD2XaPdtlsZcz6Z4aHQ.text: This is one of our favorite Italian places in town. The sausage and peppers side should be a meal on the main menu it's amazing!! Also the specialty drinks are great too

ThKiUkQGX5Vo3aEz5bUxoQ.text: Fantastic service.  Great atmosphere and fantastic food.  A must if your in Vegas.   Off the strip so very nice and not crazy.

7-hQMa7lJYfAK4y-a9tlvg.text: If you're looking for GOOD Italian food and you don't mind driving 10 minutes from the strip, go check out Casa di Amore. The food was delicious (we got the gnocchi and the eggplant parmigiana). Both were excellent. And the garlic bread is not to be missed.  There's a live band playing in the background, adding to the already warm/family/old-school atmosphere.  And the service was top notch. Annie was super friendly and attentive. Another server, Todd, made us feel right at home as well. He even hooked us up with a fresh loaf of bread as he put our leftovers into carry out containers! The little things like that made us feel like we were truly welcomed.  Looks like a lot of locals come here which is always a good sign. Will definitely be back!

2eQIgQr1UVdmMtqoA6SHgA.text: Always fantastic and the food is pretty damn good!  This folks keep it OLD SCHOOL!!!  Thank you very much for the lovely dinner.  I'll be back in November!

lxIM_DihKY4dpHuGtBy-tA.text: This place is the best! So far, it is hands down the best Italian restaurant I have been to.. Although I went with a group I would also say it's a great place to take your significant other! I loved how they had a live jazz band playing frank Sinatra and others of that genera. The service was also fantastic! They also offer a limo that will pick you up and drop you off at your hotel! My GF and I shared a 1lb pasta bowl that was perfect for 2. And the pasta (penne & greens) just melted in my mouth. Next time I'm in Vegas I will be back!!

mNH_ikSOGZG22ujxjhHA3A.text: This is an interesting place. Some of the better Italian food I have had in town and the wine wasn't bad, either. Real meat or cheese ravioli instead of the pretentious spinach or Swiss chard type you get at the high-end Strip Italian restaurants. Atmosphere is very old school with posters of Vegas as it used to be. The dining room feels a bit cramped and service can be slow. The bar at the back diminishes the place a little, because its appearance and the crowd it attracts remind one of a sleazy dive from the 70's.   Singer/keyboard player Doug and 83-year-old violinist Bill entertained on Sunday night and were excellent - both very talented guys and not too loud.  The biggest drawback for tourists is that it is located a good long way from the Strip. It's right next door to The Gun Store, making it a good place to complete your Vegas Mafia Experience after trying out that machine gun you've been itching to get your hands on. ;)

coWUchUvkd0BmBNPrvy4Lg.text: Okay, so first off, I'm an Italian from NY who has been in Vegas for 2 years and I'm still in search of an Italian restaurant that I can frequent.  My husband and I came here for our anniversary dinner and because we had $20 off with our new entertainment book that we just got recently.    Normally I have no problem paying a little more for food, provided it is good.  SO, I'd have to say that I'm really glad we had a $20 off coupon to eat here.    The food itself is deserving of 2 stars but I gave the place 3 stars because it's cute inside and Brad, our server, was really nice.  My hope for him is that he will someday wait tables at a place that actually serves decent food.  So, on to the actual food..  We started out with fried calamari, which was pretty good.  The sauce that came with was actually decent as well. No issues here.  I ordered Eggplant Parm and my husband is a Chicken Parm fan.. For the money they charge for the entrees, $19 and $24 respectively, I would have hoped for more food.  Italian food is all about portions, and of course flavor, but you won't get rave reviews from me unless you actually FEED ME... Casa di amore didn't do this well.  My husbands chicken came with a steak knife, which, most people eating chicken parm would need.. My dinner also came with a steak knife.. first thoughts were "Why the hell would I need a steak knife for eggplant? I should be able to eat this with just a fork, no problem." BOY WAS I WRONG. Holy crap I could barely cut with it the steak knife it was so hard. With the time it took for them to actually COOK the meal, it should have been mush on the plate. Definitely NOT impressed with this at all.  I'm starting to think that the reason why there are no good Italian places in Vegas is because all of the REAL Italians stayed in the Tri-State area.

i9mvZK7vj97Tp5WoMXA3mA.text: it doesn't get any better than casa di amore.  the food is top notch; service couldn't be better; and atmosphere is unparalleled.  this place is my family's go-to for christmas eve dinner and it NEVER disappoints.    although i always plan to order something different each time i visit, CHICKEN PARMAGIANA is my staple, and i can't seem to get away from it.  thin chicken cutlet, slightly browned cheese and the perfect amount of sauce-- it doesn't get any better than this.    visit this place.  there is absolutely no reason not to and EVERY reason to.

OoTHl8GVkvj4Smhqx3eHGg.text: Casa Di Amore was a great experience and a nice Italian dinner.  We chose Casa Di Amore based on reviews on Yelp and Trip Advisor.    What really sealed the deal for us to go here was the free "limo" ride.  The limo is technically a limo, but it basically had seating for 4 comfortably or 6 a little tighter.  Either way, it saved about $40 in cabs so it was very welcome.  The restaurant is located in a strip mall on Tropicana and shares space with a gun store.  It felt like a real locals joint.    The atmosphere wasn't anything special.  There were old Las Vegas pictures and paintings on the wall and a keyboard player was singing Christmas tunes.  I usually hate music when I'm eating, but it was not obnoxious and added to the night.  Everything tasted as if it was made by a friends mother.  For my main course I shared a fantastic Chicken Piccata and Gnocci Bolognese.  Sharing is not only fun, but it's a good way to sample the flavors and not to overeat - something that happens a bit too often.  Casa Di Amore was a very home style type dinner.  It's another nice off the beaten path Italian restaurant in Vegas.  The last time I went a little out of the way for Italian was to Nora's, which was phenomenal.  Nora's is pretty popular and crowded since it's been featured on the Travel Channel.  If you've been there and done that and want another local Italian joint Casa Di Amore is another good option.  The food was very good, but not the best ever.  The decor was nothing fancy, but everything was good and fun.  I'd rate this above average but not great.

nVhwOpoTHNylNJ5E6EDIkg.text: cute little restaurant with great food. people are friendly. service is good. food is great. I love this place.

gOS1YQQdmmzjVmEPuhy4_A.text: Classic old style Las Vegas. Very good food and very good service. This is off the strip and not the easiest to get to, but well worth the trip.

V3zPoO9lNydK7dRG9rtG3Q.text: Thanks to Vegas yelpers, they led me to this place.  I made previous reservations and told the girlfriend we were going out but didn't tell her the details.  She was really surprised when the limo showed up and took us to the restaurant.    This place is great.  Very old school.  Wine bottles are 1/2 off on Sundays and Mondays.   So we started with the special appetizer.  Crostinis with buffalo mozz and prosciutto topped with roasted red peppers... MMMMM!!!   For my dinner I ordered the Osso Buco.  Holy crap.  I had never had it before.  The best meal that I have ever eaten.  And I eat a lot!  This was the best experience I've ever had in Vegas.  If I ever go back out, I'll definitely be hitting this place again.   With appetizer, 2 dinners, dessert and a half price bottle of wine it was about $110 without the tip. Little pricey, but definately worth it.  Plus the limo ride to and from was free! (I did tip the driver though)

VVLFstQEcOcEUl0I2ZB4bw.text: I LOVE this place. The food is delicious, the service is fantastic, and the ambience is to die for. It's your italian family restaurant, with the Frank Sinatra singer that makes you feel all mushy inside ( in a good way!). I've been here for dinner, and My best friend's wedding reception was here too. It was divine. You don't HAVE to dress up here, but isn't always nice to get a tiny bit dressed up to feel fabulous at a good restaraunt? Also, you can get picked up by their limo is you call to make a reservation! Casa Di Amore is wonderful, you won't regret going there!

0C6-ImW_QQqi5zq7dNkrlQ.text: Me and my wife come here every year, they pick us up in a limo and take you to the restaurant, the restaurant has a live singer, nothing but the best love songs, its very affordable, the fodd is GREAT!!!! I didnt want to yelp it as I dont want anyone to go, LOL!!!! must reserve in advance!

GQeGa4CPshz35lAtIaeNpA.text: honestly, this place sucked.  here's why.  I've NEVER left an italian restaurant hungry until I went to casa di amore.  The seating was ridiculous.  my wife and I were sitting so close to other guests, that we could've eaten off of their plates.  I had hopes in the "homemade" noodles only to be let down.  Couldn't tell the difference between that and store bought.  Not to mention, I ordered chicken alfredo, right?  I could have literally held the amount that they served me in the palm of my hand.  I had like 5 or 6 cubes of chicken in my pasta. It was pathetic and didn't taste any better than the $1 crap I could've bought in the wal-mart frozen food section.  I paid over $20 for a $2 dish.  The italian ristorante to the west or the sicilian ristorante to the east beats this place by leaps and bounds, no question, and they don't treat you like cattle.  Let this be a lesson to you casa di amore, stop screwing your customers.

aIb0KrjEbLnYr5dey0dt-Q.text: I have been going there at least 8-10 times a year over the past 15 years until lately.  I hate to say this about a place that I use to just love and thought that not only the food but the atmosphere was first rate.  Tonight ended my love affair with Casa.  This was the 3rd time over the past year that I was really disappointed with the food .  Granted the atmosphere still has people flocking to it but there are just to many fabulous restaurants in Vegas to go to and the quality in my opinion has really been compromised.  What did it.  To start with was the salad. In my opinion they must have prepared it well ahead of time and then refrigerated it.  Why, because the cheese and salami that make part of the base were basically frozen to the plate.  Yes, stuck and hard to peel away from the plate and finally when biting into it you could tell it was frozen.  Finally, the steak my wife ordered was way overcooked.  The waitress apologized but didn't make an effort to ask whether she wanted another.  Well, finally the service was slow as if they were understaffed.  We didn't complain about anything because we both knew that this was the end of an era.  I don't know whether ownership or management has changed but the quality has gone down hill and I haven't even mentioned my order.

FlX8ZYPtlmDqNRRhxvCXiQ.text: Great baked clams, desserts are good, fresh ravioli awesome. Service was terrific. This place reminds me of the Italian restaurants in NY

P2Q_H72959-1nEfr9mItqQ.text: We had a rehearsal dinner here for my sons's wedding. The food was great. The entertainment was great and the service was great. It is a wonderful restaurant even if you don't have a special occasion. I have never had better meatballs!

PAUia-5j5Feur4a5-5j_fg.text: Only gave it 4 stars because they used to be open for lunch, and this was our favorite lunch spot -- but no more.  Dinner is great, and I agree with other reviewers that the music can be overbearingly loud at times to the point that you have to yell at the people you're dining with for them to be able to hear you.  The Fettuccine Alfredo with Lobster is out of this world good, and so is the Linguine with clams.

1EtuxHfCQZjYwD5mhPbDaQ.text: My wife surprised me with this excellent rest!  WoW!  I was impressed the service excellent, the food was outstanding and the limo ride was fantastic!  I would highly recommend this location to anyone!  We need to come back and bring the kids!

EXDVr11241ozI64MvXeQ7Q.text: If you are looking for a place to have a romantic dinner or just a place with a gourmet feel, this is definitely the place to go! It's off of the strip so you don't have the loud noise of the casino atmosphere in the background. They'll also come pick you up in a limo if you request (for free I believe). The food was absolutely delicious, but what made this visit special was our waiter. Brad was the best waiter I think I have ever had at a restaurant! He was very attentive but not overly in your face. He was very professional but fun. Overall I would definitely eat here again and recommend this place to any and everyone!

3I8gICNNNCVarKFo1FFNfQ.text: We had a large party planned 4 mos in advance, they forgot we were coming, demanded we show  at 4pm, not enough  waiters, food not ready, very few of us ate the food  was so bad, over charged for cheap wine, then we had to be out by 6:15 for there next party, plus no music, sounds great doesn't it!

oMbe8ZmBxbasFBbdKkSJNw.text: As others have written, this is Old School Las Vegas...and I loved every bit of it.  Our party had Brad as our waiter...this guy is great!  He's very sharp, upbeat, and funny.  We brought wine in and they took care of all of that perfectly.  We ordered a lot of food and wanted our dinner served slowly throughout the evening so as to enjoy the musical entertainment.  Everyone raved about their dishes, and the food made me feel like I was back in Brooklyn...a very good thing. I will definitely repeat.

_iUI7c137Xr1Oe28hhCc8w.text: Fantastic, authentic Italian cuisine.  The way Vegas used to be.

s0CJN3lF2t_H9f0x-soyhw.text: This is the best italian resturant i have ever went too.  The drinks are good and the food is even better

aLefmeNmDyw63z3WqNB5vA.text: Last night was the third time my girlfriend and I have been here.  On my first visit, my thought was, "it's pretty pricey for a small portion of macaroni."  Macaroni is cheap, except for here.  But we enjoyed the authentic Italian, homey atmosphere and most especially the live music. We chalked up the (too) high price to the added ambiance.  The food is good as in decent but nothing extraordinary.  And it certainly isn't great enough for the price.  Last night we ordered the sea bass special.  We both love sea bass and have had great sea bass in town.  We got a VERY small steak-like piece of sea bass, twice baked potato that was very small, a few broccoli florets and a few julienne pieces of roasted peppers (I believe).  The plate was $40.  I order the sea bass at Don Vito's which is more than twice that size, possibly 3 times, it is luscious (light, buttery like sea bass is) for $38.  The sea bass last night was much more dense and firm like halibut.  It was tasty but had I seen the plate before I ordered, I would have never ordered it.  Before I arrived there and knew of the special, I was kind of set on the Pasta Alla Forno (penne with chicken, shrimp, broc, mushrooms in a light pink sauce baked with mozz).  Sounds yummy, eh?  I imagine it could have been.  The sea bass wasn't much so I ordered still the Alla Forno to take home, thought I would have it for the next couple days lunches.  At $30 for the plate of macaroni, I expected a good size portion.  I was stunned when I got home and opened the plastic bag.  There was so little macaroni that I could see the bottom of the silver tin they package to go items in. No two lunches there.  When I got ready to eat it today, I literally dissected the dish to search for the shrimp - 4 tiny pcs maybe the size of my thumb nail, count the broccoli florets- 1 sm floret and 2 fragments and the penne - 50.(I do have pictures of all that I will post.)    Here is the bottom line:  the food is waaaaaaaaaaaaaaay overpriced.  If paying a lot for the food is worth it for the ambiance, then I think you will find the food decent and love the music.  The ambiance is the ONLY reason we will go there on rare occasion.  If you could careless about the music and just want some good food for a decent price, this is NOT your place.  Since the closing of Tivoli Gardens, Nora's would be my favorite.  My favorite dish there is $20 (which I still think is overpriced) and in ways similar to the All Forno.  But I definitely get two meals out of it, way tastier and you don't have to hunt for the shrimp.  Full size shrimp.

6-aGFODR93uo4CpZZNDuJQ.text: Place was really nice and food is great. The hostess is not very bright. Be careful because she will seat you and not assign you a waiter or waitress. Bird for brains! Hostess has very poor customer service skills for such a nice place!

9qhYnFyIBn4jfIhbu4fMCg.text: Stefan... Very cool dude. Working to be a stand up giant.  Oh, by the way, the food here is really good!

OVWT1GVbSmIOLvZkOE5xLw.text: Casa Di Amore successfully tries to recreate the Rat Pack era vibe with it's ambience, music, and food. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. The lounge singer hit all the right notes with his Sinatra decade music. But our waiter, Brad, made it memorable with his service and quips. He was helpful but not intrusive. Corny but funny.

HoJNWuqYP-ZxrUx2iAvEWA.text: Very nice and cozy spot. Staff very friendly, food great, atmosphere relaxing. The only reason 5 stars was not given was the prices. The prices are strip prices. We paid about the same amount going to a couple higher end strip Italian restaurants.

GSOww6_Ir_fos6nv9aZaIQ.text: best time ever !!! bartender Dina makes the best Lemon Drop !!food was great atmosphere was pleasant ... The best out of everything was Dinas lemon Drop martini!!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinas Lemon Drop Martini ! The best !

iDzZB5_vUjXVvYKvu55ctg.text: Hit this for a friends birthday. I was impressed with the food and the atmosphere is classic vegas. A lounge band and singer really get the place moving and it is something that really feel like an old school experience.   Food was good. No complaints form our party and everyone was pretty satisfied. I would recommend for family style itialian with a Vegas lounge feel. Probably best for parties and large groups as the accomodation just feel that way. Also, have a limo service that will pick you up form the strip areas and drop you off. A nice feature for parties.

KB_lriSh-VsEiqNEL7dCYg.text: Came here with a group because they provide free limo service from the casino resorts.  Go back in time with old fashioned homestyle red sauce Italian cuisine in huge portions, with a crooner singing Frank Sinatra songs on a PA system, and pictures of the 1960's strip as atmosphere. This is not modern Italian cuisine. However, prices are not 1960's.  $11 for one small canole - but, as the waited points out, you get a free T-shirt with a quote from the Godfather on the back (even if you don't want it). I thought the prices were way too high for the mediocre quality. There are better Italian restaurants in LV - even ones of this type (like Bootleg Bistro).

PyngwwFB21mtvpqkEqpqrg.text: Amazing environment,  great live music,  and delicious Italian food. A great date night cozy place for two or 15 people.

Xe3oNakNvRv99VG3R5qppw.text: I spent my birthday in Vegas and wanted Italian food. My friends suggested this place and I'm glad they did. It reminded me of almost every "real" italian restaurant I ever ate at growing up in Jersey.  The decor is dark and the aroma from the kitchen is wonderful.  I started off with Shrimp Cocktail with this amazing cocktail sauce that had a large clump of horseradish in the middle.....mmmm..mmmm..good. My sinus were cleared immediately. The Ceasar Salad was good. I could taste the anchovy's in the dressing. The entree was Veal Marsala. This was to die for.  Thin slices of perfectly cooked veal in this mushroom gravy.  I didn't leave anything on my plate. The next visit to Vegas, I will be having Italian at this place.  Don't let me forget to give "props" to the lounge singer, George.  He sounded alot like ole' Blue Eyes himself.

-WDWqFlfbJya_ZAhENJ-jw.text: This place is just fun. The music is entertaining,  the service is attentive and the food is authentic.

vSsc0YUcDarNDjHbx-OJoQ.text: We chose this restaurant based on a restaurant.com certificate we had and read all the terrific reviews. The food (dinner AND dessert) and the prices didn't put me over the moon, but the service and ambiance were awesome! Old style Vegas with live music (we were there too early to enjoy the live entertainment; it started shortly before we left). Our reservation was for 5pm and we walked up to the door to find it locked at 4:55pm. They should open a little bit earlier for their first reservations. We would have enjoyed a drink before going to our table. Everyone raves about the free limo ride, which we passed up because we live in Henderson. Overall it was a nice experience, but one that I'll only have once as a local.

B45Zo4OMntWO9fl_9MFu0g.text: Love this place... The food is terrific, the staff is super friendly! Feels like an old local Italian restaurant in Chicago! Love the live music on weekends and the old world feel... Again, the food is terrific!!!!

8Gf3NEz1WQwRd7JMPYZrkw.text: When it comes to old school Las Vegas, this is the real deal. It is not a place where you rate just the food...you rate AND enjoy the experience. It's off the strip and next to a gun range. Perfect. Forget the celebrity chefs for a night and do something you will want to tell all your friends about. Really. Do it.

YwWmPgWOtx6A8I3tLFLJPw.text: My wife and I and our group of 6 were looking forward to a meal off the strip for a change. I came across Casa Di Amore while reading some other reviews.   It started out great with their limo picking us up at our hotel (Aria). If you call them far enough in advance, they may have their limo pick you up and take you back to a strip hotel. There is no charge but make sure you tip the diver. He was great and picked up and dropped us off in style.   The atmosphere is fun in the style of "Old Vegas" meaning pictures of Sinatra on the wall and live music every night. It is very lively and loud. The dress is casual.   I am a New Yorker born, raised and currently living. Good Italian restaurants are the norm in NY but I couldn't wait to try some of their dishes after some of the rave reviews. Well, The 6 of us had some starters and 6 different mains. The chicken parm., chicken florentine and the other standards were all fine. But just fine-not more.   The service also was fine-but not more. And yes-the desserts were fine-but not more. I will say the wine list was above average.   It can also be a pricey evening depending upon what you order.  I would still recommend Casa Di Amore if you want to get off the strip for a meal and experience a little "Old Vegas." It's a good change from some of the more upscale restaurants on strip. If you are in Vegas for 3 nights or more, make this one of your dinner stops and enjoy the limo ride!

wgVmGDIT_XrBy1sJ6Cy2Dw.text: Excellent as always!  Had the 1/2 off bottle of wine on Sundays, followed by the baked clams and stuffed pork chops.  Also always get a side order of meatballs to split for an appetizer.  The service is terrific and the live music creates the perfect evening!

ftX98mtswnfdespnLorCDw.text: Simply the best restaurant in Vegas.  Casa blends the decor of old Vegas with the warmth of an Italian family and food that is consistently *perfect*.   No ... seriously ... this food is ridiculous.  There's not a single item I've tried on the menu that did make me stop chewing to stare at my wife in wide-eyed amazement.   Everything from the tender meat to the pasta to the sauces to the tangy, perfectly salted house dressing is incredible.   The staff is friendly and funny, the live music is old Vegas and hilarious.    You'll eat like royalty and feel like you're in Goodfellas (without all the murder).   Casa di Amore is the very spirit of Vegas.

u32wIVg3LulBrS5ESfqqow.text: Came in today and service was so bad sat at the first table after 20 mintues still no service never asked if we wanted a drink.  Bus boy, host and waiters walked by us each at least 8 times we ended up walking out. Very disappointed!

pgosbVC01MBGraz4KiZooQ.text: The only Italian place we eat at in Las Vegas. Food and service is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine. Half off on Sunday and Monday.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. appetizers.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sandwiches.

uex7C9g2ce4qexuZqzRYzg.text: Absolutely the best.  I am sure all wait staff is wonderful, but I've had Stephen the last few times and he makes the experience rise to a whole different level.  Highly recommend this spectacular off the strip location!

SxI5o8mWN1aDXqRZF2FSxA.text: This is my boyfriend and I's favorite date spot! The ambiance is classic Las Vegas, and very fun & romantic. The food is delicious, and the service is always prompt and friendly. Every server we've had is the perfect mixture of professional but casual and fun; they make you feel like you're a regular, even if it's your first time dining. They have a live duo singing classic hits, and tons of cool vintage Vegas pictures that are neat to check out. The lobster ravioli is one of my favorites.

Hg0VUCeCxvssAKKLfkkEiA.text: Apparently the meatballs have pork in them now and we waited 40 minutes for our table so taking back stars.

fP9SYlGBQxv4Rr9x_Dtt2g.text: The food is amazing. Which is what keeps me coming back. However, I brought my fiance to dinner tonight for his birthday and we were seated at a booth by the bar. The service was less than pleasing. After our main course, we were going to order dessert, but ended up not. We sat for 30 mins with empty glasses and no one even acknowledged we were still sitting there. We finally get asked if we want a dessert menu and at this point I am so annoyed, all I want is to leave. I don't think I will be coming back again no matter how good the food is. If you do come here, the food is not disappointing at all! It is truly delicious, but I don't recommend sitting in the booths by the bars if you want service.

Fb7TPupPMVF5k477FWJ6-A.text: Went here with a couple co workers last night for half price wine and pizza and had a wonderful time.  Amazing ambiance. And food tasted absolutely delicious. Server was attentive and made sure we were enjoying ourselves.

PQ6b2Xrn4kOERiYaII0QrQ.text: Probably the best Italian food besides my nonna's. Great drinks, friendly staff, delicious food, and fun musicians. I highly recommend their gnocchi's. Been many times before but never remembered to write a review. Can't wait to go again!

L6Cww_Vw7G7WV3yy_8KhkA.text: I can say confidently that this is a restaurant id happily give 120$ to again. I got an EXPERIENCE. Driver picks us up, wonderful lady. Unloads us, we get sat down in front of the band, the place was great! Old vegas pictures, Frank Sinatra and the Rat pack, the band was jazzy and the place felt like a New York Italian restaurant.  Waitress was full blown Sicilian and helped me make my decision and going rightfully so. The food was excellent, the service was excellent, my girlfriend and I had a very memorable experience

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The excellent desert, Cremé Brûlée !
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Veal Franchaise! So awesomely wonderfully tenderly delicious so help me god
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My girlfriends AWESOME stuffed pork-chops, came with 2 MONSTER sized chops! 7/8/13

RvvForvUJuxUCWfVNAcpzg.text: Such a gem. This place has an amazing old fashioned vibe, some of the best service I've ever encountered, and amazing food! This place is a little loud with the live music, but they played some pretty classic songs that had the whole place singing along.   Although it is off the strip, I would say this place is a must. They have a complimentary limo service that will pick you up and drop you back off if you're are staying on the strip, so there's no excuse not to go!

jkZmJ9RwbCKiNOd45yWc1Q.text: After driving past this place about a million times (and admiring the bright red, white & green neon sign,) I was finally brought here by my boyfriend for an early Valentine's Day dinner last week. I've heard so many great things about the place, so I was super excited!  We were seated & served immediately by a super charming man (whose name currently slips my mind, sorry!) and the food was fantastic! I highly recommend their calamari & the jumbo ravioli entree.

M_iRnWiEKSiD1P0faPgjdQ.text: I have eaten at this restaurant two times. So I'm not listing it as a five-star even though I have experience five star service there. One and the first time I ate there it was absolutely excellent. No problems whatsoever. The second time I ate there ...there were problems with the waiter bringing the incorrect food and also charging us the wrong amount of money. So hopefully since time has past this type of an issue has resolved itself. I ordered clams. The first time they were absolutely perfect the second time they had sand in it which made it uncomfortable to eat.

8AlXG4od8ZDrRIXcXgp_sw.text: Totally nailed it! Took a shot in the dark with good reviews and being close to my hotel (way off the strip)  Old school italian as advertised. This is a small free standing restaurant near the airport and when you walk in, you know its a long time joint.   I ordered the baked clams as an appetizer and was blown away as to how fresh, hot and exactly like home they tasted. They were prepared perfectly and tasted fantastic. Yum.  Next up was linguine luciano, which was linguine and sauteed calamari in a fra diavlo marinara. I was in the mood for fried calamari, so i asked my server / bartender if they could do it fried. She checked and the answer was yes. Food came and it was a steaming hot, generous portion of fresh fried calamari and linguine in the perfect balance of fra diavlo sauce that was not sitting in a bed of liquid. Again, so perfect and tasted so east coast, i was in heaven.  Sat at the bar for my meal, listened to the nightly house jazz / sinatra band which was the perfect atmosphere for this place. I will be back!!!

EzrVbSXrmCjseBjG7Q2I7w.text: Yum Deluxe! More bustling happy wait staff than any place I have ever been. Everything was delicious. Authentic throwback Italian place from the good ole days.

u-DBEnjfyWeNxJLNxLOJgA.text: Had a coupon for buy one get one apps and Bryan was an amazing bartender and server ... The food was cooked perfect ...it was 3am and still amazing ... Thanks Bryan for a great night!!! :) I'll be back ASAP...

T3JxK0BXwm1CySbTUrHHQA.text: There were six of us. To be quite honest, this is a place for people who like Italian food, but don't know what their getting. It's a small place and it was packed. It has music and looks lovely and like it may have come out of the 50's. The people are nice and Toni our server from Brooklyn just wonderful. The food is mediocre at best. The ingredients that go into making up their food is lacking quality and are not the best. We ordered some appetizers, calamari was good, shrimp was doughy and the escarole tasted more like broccoli. The wife got the Osso Bucco, just ok, not a great flavor and the Risotto that came with it was rice-a-roni at best. I had the Veal Parmigiana, tender but again it lacked flavor, no taste because again the quality of the ingredients are not that good. My other friend got Moscatelli pasta and it was dry and something you would expect at an Olive Garden. All in all, this is probably equivalent to a Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill. I'm sorry, we had high hopes for this place, but it just didn't satisfy our palates. I would not return. There are to many other great places such as the Italian American Club, Trattoria Reggiano or Sicilliano's,

epX3KETuNd1BMrJpoQAAcQ.text: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants. It has an old school mobster feel and great live music that plays all the old school favorites. We love the Pesto Pasta, chicken parmigiana and my sons favorite is the New York steak. Service is always great. We usually come for birthdays and they bring you a complimentary Canoli and sing Happy Birthday. Always a great time! Everyone should experience this place! I would highly suggest reservations because on the weekends they are packed and won't take walk-ins.

Wtqlb_UjUjurQdIuYtx8xg.text: Love love this place!!! The Italian food is so authentic and the service is great! They also have live music which I enjoy a lot. The calamari is to die for and up to know I have loved every dish I have had. Go there every single time I can and will continue to do so for as long as they keep the great food and service.

7RIvUwRXf65Xgt4YIDGBIQ.text: Food is a 4. Experience is a 3. The caprese salad is not very good- the tomatoes were under ripe and barely any basil on top. The pastas were very good. The music here is EXTREMELY loud!!!! Not average like it says, making everyone have to yell in the restaurant creating an aggravating buzz and it's not romantic having to scream to my husband especially over "When the saints go marching in" is being screamed in my ear...that is not an ideal song to play in a romantic setting?? The service was super slow, we didn't get bread til 25 mins in and then had to wait 15+ mins before he came back to take our order and over an hour from when we sat down to get our entrees. Anyway it left me feeling very annoyed bc of the loudness of it I didn't even feel like conversating bc my husband had to lean in and kept saying "Whaaat?"

c-nVsyNRU_cQHD-4QZAr0w.text: Real ITALIAN food. Amazing dishes and incredibly friendly staff. It's the LOVE restaurant.

HPWGXaJJjCnNGh40SUVIhQ.text: Came here for my birthday dinner with my husband and I absolutely loved it! The whole feel of the restaurant makes you feel like if you were in the 40s. Excellent service. Forgot our waitress name but she was amazing! The only thing I was a bit confused on was the entrance. We walked to the 'front' which is facing Tropicana and the door was closed. We then saw people going in through the back and that's how we got in. Keep in mind this was 7pm and the back entrance was only intended to be used after midnight I believe. However, other than that excellent service and food! I will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LhX94SechXHg9HrzpxKIiA.text: This place is somewhere to go if you want to get away from the busy vegas life style. Fine Italian food and soft atmosphere. You truly feel you're in Europe, or a classic old Las Vegas. Beautiful. Live music that is always on point. The only thing I'd say is the service is slow. Not sure if it's the atmosphere or the pace you should be at. I enjoyed the slow pace though.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Alfredo
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed pork chop. YUM!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atmosphere

ItM89a58-KWNSmGFrYDq6Q.text: I took my girlfriend there for our anniversary everything was great the service most importantly the food was amazing! My girlfriend is a picky eater and she loved it

JC1kbnjlq6UEA8Jdf9_gDA.text: Free limo ride is great if it doesn't break down from the heat.  Got a call right when they were supposed to pick us up asking us to grab a cab & they'd reimburse us (took the $17 right off of our bill).  Kinda small inside so definitely make a reservation - but it's dark like those old school Hollywood club/restaurants - not sure what anyone means about the mobster feel.    We ordered (2) sets of Osso Bucco & (1) stuffed pork chop.  Tony (our waiter) came back and said the chef didn't like the condition of the Osso Bucco & didn't want to serve it...so I ordered the flambed rib eye & my friend ordered the special of the day filet mignon w/ marsala sauce & mushrooms.  EVERYTHING WAS YUMMY, the filet literally didn't need a knife, rib eye was juicy & medium rare as requested, pork chop was stuffed w/ delicious goodness & all at great pricing.    We even got a recommendation on wine from Tony & grabbed a bottle of 2008 Mac Murray Pinot Noir @ 1/2 price bottle (Sundays/Mondays) for $21 instead of $42.    We had the Pistachio gelato dessert which was delicious too but kinda sweet for us.  We were serenaded most of the night by two men...but only remember the name of the 80+ years old violinist Bill...who's fiddler fingers just flew all over the strings.  AMAZING!  Definitely coming back here in  August on my next LV trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Buco w/ risotto
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked clams arreganata

MbJ7TJGvfOXMBLGJ4gTMog.text: My wife and I eat here often with friends and family. I really like the live music and the food is great.

lD-JEEKxqBRY2EvVJ_0-0Q.text: One word. Incredible. The food is the best. I grew up on this food. The capizzoli's are the reason I need a diet, but damn, it's worth it.

07glnpPzAScGXF_awZZLsA.text: They have something to eat and drink for everyone, great service, live entertainment, and super romantic... We come here for date nights.... It can get really packed so we always make a reservation.

k9ggyO1zrYW6z6BFSoj6Jg.text: My wife is a cookbook author and food critic / blogger - so we eat out at fancy restaurants at least once or twice a week, and are very critical of the places we go.  As we are always eating out and looking for another hidden gem for her to write about, we tend not to frequent any restaurant unless it is way better than average.  I proposed to my wife at this restaurant almost 5 years ago, and it is incredibly rare if we are at Casa less than once or twice in a month.  The drinks are good, the wine list is acceptable (with half price bottles on Sunday and Monday), the food is SPECTACULAR, and the service is impeccable.  We have never had a bad meal here.  We have dubbed this place "The Mob Joint," as the atmosphere is very "Old Vegas."  The decor is straight out of 1960's Vegas, and the brick walls are lined with pictures from the days of Frank and Sammy.  The booths and tables (lined in white linen) are dimly lit, with a romantic ambiance, and the place is just fabulous.  Their nightly entertainment is usually George, who sounds a lot like a young Frank Sinatra, and does a lot of fabulous old crooner tunes, interspersed with some comedy, some show tunes and some Billy Joel.  He is amazing.  The twice wrapped prawns that everyone here seems to be complaining about are great, wrapped in cheese and then baked in a puff pastry dough.  I think that the salty of the shrimp and cheese mixed with the slight tangy of the dough plays really, really well against the super-sweet of the caramel sauce.  (and we save the caramel sauce to drizzle over the ice cream at the end of the meal)  I like this dish quite a bit, though we don't order it every time.  What we DO order every time is their cheese garlic loaf and a side dish of Alfredo sauce for dipping.....Oh My GOD there is nothing quite so sinful.  You simply MUST try it.  Their steaks and stuffed pork chops are what we usually order, and they are beyond superb.  Their Osso Bucco is the best I've ever had.  It is so tender it literally falls from the bone.  The Vodka Shrimp is incredible as well.  Over the years, we've had most of the pasta dishes on the menu and have never been disappointed.   Their prices are on the high side, but nothing that I wouldn't expect to pay at any of the restaurants of this caliber in Vegas.  For us, with a (half price) bottle of wine, the bread loaf, an appetizer to share, side Caesar salads, our meals, and a shared ice cream treat, our bill usually runs about $125 - $150, which is what we generally spend any time we go out for a really nice dinner - and with their portions, we always have some left over for lunch the following day.  My only minor complaint about this place is that their desserts are less than spectacular, as they are currently pre-made off-site. I do love that the waitstaff are all willing to be honest about the desserts they like, and which to avoid (my wife ordered a creme brulee once, and our waiter leaned down and said with a meaningful look, "I would really recommend the Chocolate-Peanut-Butter Bomba...The creme bruleee is, well, not what you would expect.").   Fortunately, the last time we were there the Maitre D' mentioned that they were bringing on a pastry chef in the very near future, so now the only problem will be saving ROOM for dessert!  Overall, if you are looking for that perfect little hole in the wall, that will give you the True old Vegas kind of experience, Casa Di' Amore will deliver in a big way.  Oh, and if you call in advance, They even offer complimentary limo service from/to any of the hotels on The Strip!

p50NBAbKSJfylMYS_tO3EA.text: After reading all the great reviews, I took my husband here for our first anniversary. We had an amazing time. The food was great!!! We had the chocolate truffle for dessert and it was one of the best things I've ever tasted!!!  The atmosphere was the best part. I would recommend this place for sure!!

RwtoRpkHJHiL0AdGHfxzQA.text: I cant say enough positive things about this old school, authentic Italian restaurant!  It is off the strip...so you get the amazing quality without Las Vegas Strip prices.  It is a great place for any kind of date night, business lunch/dinner, or really anyone who just wants a relaxing dinner with a cozy atmosphere.  They have a nice bar towards the back with a few gaming machines for those who do not prefer a table.  The service was is second to none and with the cabaret style live music, excellent food and great location off the strip, Casa Di Amore is a restaurant I recommend to all locals and tourists for an amazing time!

VHmYu20EJc45SuHOKgGymA.text: Loved the music, the old memories of Vegas on the walls and the atmosphere.  The food was fantastic and the service was perfect.  We had four different plates at the table and each and every one was as good as it gets.  The portions were large enough that no one finished their plate.  We had no reservation and stopped by about 6 pm, they sat us immediately.

AsamxOj2tvI1VCSvAtOh1A.text: We were lucky to have gotten in without a reservation on a Tuesday night! Did not feel touristy, but it seemed that most people in the place were not from the area. Loved all the canvases on the wall of Old Vegas--definitely more history than you'll get anywhere on the strip.  The food was good--we split the alfredo and it was a perfect split size. Not very many wines by the glass, and cheaper to order the bottle anyway. Soup and salad does not come with the entree, and I would not recommend spending the extra money--the entree itself was very filling and we had split it! Plus it was nothing that special--chicken noodle "spin off" as some others have said.   A few complaints: Our server was sort of kissing up to us, but when it came time to get our bill he was nowhere to be found. They also don't seem to have serving sections, so it would have been hard to grab his attention. Luckily the manager(?) walked by and heard us talking about it so he ran the check for us. Also unsure whether bread comes with the meal--we were not offered any and ordered the garlic loaf instead, but the table next to ours got bread with olive oil and vinegar.   I will give it another chance, but there are other places I'd recommend to out-of-towners.

jH1s2vceQxvHqlcU6ljtAg.text: The food was great, and they had a very large menu. Our waiter was fantastic! He made the experience that much more enjoyable. The scallops au grautin are to die for, and both our portions were exactly the right amount of food, and we came starving. Their Cesar salad is only an extra $3.00, and pretty large. There was definitely an old vegas feel, and a singer and piano player were there crooning all of us with mostly oldies, but it was so soft it in no way impeded on our conversation. Highly recommend, especially for couples! They also have a bar in the back with sports. Monday night is half off wine night, too.

rDXTTF4e3nuGaWgITP8uyw.text: I guess the limo thing is a gimmick for tourists. I'm a local Las Vegan. The atmosphere is like a cafeteria. It was so loud that it gave me a headache before we ordered the food.The prices are stupid high for what you get. $25 for a bowl of spaghetti with some crappy sauce & some red pepper flakes thrown in (no meat). Add $10 for 5 small Vandecamp style fried shrimps & $5 for a small & I mean small loaf of cheese bread.. I think this place is for stupid tourists that don't know any better. Any steak house at any Station Casino blows this hole out of the water.My wife & I went because our friend gave us a gift certificate. When the waiter realized that we were not impressed & we paid $80.00 of $100 gift certificate including a large tip, He through a $20 bill at us & said "Lets call it  good". I don't think they care about locals, they just want the big spending tourists.

kQ6T35sA-5snOMD0PCBvMA.text: Ambiance is fantastic. A bit crowded and clustered, but it makes for a loud and fun environment. Hostess, waiter, and the rest of the staff were very attentive and friendly. The live music was a nice touch.  Food was delicious all around from the large meatballs to the calamari linguine and cioppino. Exotic bomba was a refreshing dessert.  Came with a group of 8 and it was unanimously our favorite meal of the weekend. We ate at a varitey of places like Bacchanal, Gordon Ramsay Burgr, Yong Kang Street, and Hash House.

pG71Jaorq9IQZZnkn2J98w.text: My man surprised me with an impromptu dinner here. I was still in my work clothes covered in liquor and muddled fruit (I'm a bartender) but I decided to leap at the chance for some tasty old school Italian food.   So yummy to the tummy! Brad (I think that was his name) was our server and just a delight to talk to (its amazing how nice people are when you smile and are polite...a lesson to the inexperienced diners and all-around rude people out there). He led us to the best dishes on their vast menu (I had the osso buco and garlic cheese bread). He also was very helpful in picking out the ideal glass of Super Tuscan wine.   The night couldn't have been better. It was a much needed break from my kids and work. I loved the music, the lighting, the food and the service. Will definitely be back.

PzKSd4xPMTN-83g0QRkU7w.text: This place is wonderful. Very romantic setting. They do have a live band and it can get loud at times. From our appetizer of crustini to the fresh baked bread garlic butter and the spicy gypsy sauce to dip your bread into. It's wonderful all around. With an extensive wine menu. And there staff if very knowledgeable on all of there wines and menu items. I recommend this for a date night!!

8e2XDipYzTr8WL8raHHekA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT  if it's not right they will make it right and probably give you a free t-shirt too! I worked their AMAZING SUPERBOWL party this year. (not at the tiny resturant) and that too was awesome!!! a place to laugh enjoy old school Vegas and some lounge style dinner music

rUJDCj29TrghnT1LjNBOyw.text: Great food, great music, great atmosphere! The meal was about $30 per person and the portion was a little on the small side but I still left a very happy customer! Just topped this night off with some desert from my favorite ice cream shop on the way home!

Q3auiSbl56wiY0qbwBMytA.text: The is by far one of the best meals I have eaten in my life. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. Always the best service and the best food as well as great music. Make yourself happy and have dinner here.  We had 10 people in our party and we were treated like kings. The Oso-bucco is amazing, the drinks are great (and very creative) and the staff could not be better.

Q825NTM5FhwPvohPeo8idw.text: This place has been here since it can remember and I've been in Vegas 30+yrs.  The place gets a pretty good mixed crowd, parking lots a lil small and it can get loud but it's a great place to sit at the bar and grab sum drinks or sit at a table to eat.  I've had pretty much everything on the menu and have yet had anything less than par.  I love the pork chops w/side of gnocchi or keep it simple w/a couple of meatballs (with a side of gnocchi, lol)

UeCEGSrNkubSQEjQt7qPMw.text: Great atmosphere and great service! Highly recommend making a reservation if you have a party larger than 2. They have great live music playing the best oldies. Food is traditional italian style, their homemade marinara sauce is so good!

Z01yb646XBS37g-G67HdWQ.text: Excellent food and service.  Staff is very friendly and personable.  Wonderful atmosphere, excellent live music.  Wonderful date night experience for us!   Would definitely recommend and we will come back when in Vegas.

LplcxF8y9b4aNwLudd3FJg.text: Wow. Cioppino and frutti de mare. Excellent. Calamari cooked perfectly, not rubbery. Flavor of the broth is superb.

7oYz7FfW61P6nSan2fE6rw.text: Food was excellent as was the service and the environment. Live music,  nostalgic environment what more could you want oh yeah the food it was over the top I had the rigatoni broccoli which was really good only thing is it was such a large portion I had to leave 1/2 of it behind as my hotel didn't have a refrigerator. I highly recommend you try this place out I'm glad I did

AtA5g7No5QCZpiEQK-MTtg.text: Great old time atmosphere.  Live music from two very experienced singers. I went back into time here and loved it! Great service from our waiter to the bus boys. Food delicious. Had the special which was sirloin tips in potatoe gnocchi in a lite cream sauce. This was excellent and needs to be on the regular menu! A cannoli was the finishing touch.   If you visit Vegas you must visit here. Uber, Lyft or taxi will take you here...no excuses!

n25_v_nHCJhZXAfyhppmbw.text: I've gone now around four times as others seem to love Casa Di Amore and I just don't get the wow factor. Maybe being a vegetarian it's because I'm cutting my options down? Cost wise for me it's just not worth it.

n2_ZIBUv5mo9ObeFJYEtlw.text: Best Italian I have ever had. All around SPECTACULAR in every single way. All the way from the service to the food to the atmosphere with live music. Five star plus more.

ZQWVYPyEWwqXn-44v1SxZg.text: I took my newly proposed-to girlfriend (now fiancee) here for a nice dinner and it was thoroughly enjoyable!  I had made reservations the night before by calling in, although you could probably do them online as well via OpenTable or something like that. We arrived slightly early, but we were seated immediately. I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was fantastic. You could tell he was vastly experienced, as I believe he mentioned he had been working there for 10 years! He got a feel for how much time we had to dine that night (we had around three hours before our show) so he slowed everything down for us so we could enjoy each other's company and the wonderful live music, as well as the overall ambiance of the restaurant.   We munched on the tasty bread and butter that were provided and decided to order some bruschetta to share. The bruschetta was delicious! It's strange how something so simple can taste that good. After a long while we decided to make our entree orders, which were the Gypsy Pasta and the Chicken Marsala. When I told our waiter I wanted the Gypsy Pasta he warned me about how spicy it was and that it was usually not very enjoyable for most people that ordered it. This brought to mind the question of why it was even on the menu, but before I could ask he told me it was because actual gypsies (there were two groups of them dining there at the time) would come in and order it and just love it. In the end, our waiter brought me some of the sauce to sample and, my goodness, it was hot. I promptly ordered some linguini and meatballs with a slightly less spicy sauce!  Our meals were delicious, and my pasta bowl was huge. We had to get boxes to go. It was a great experience. I feel like if I had told someone we had just gotten engaged we probably would have gotten a cannoli or something because there were lots of other people getting them for their birthdays and weddings!  Also, we had the cheesecake with strawberry sauce and it was very good.  To top off the impeccable service, when we first arrived I asked our waiter if it would be possible to use the complimentary limo service to get a ride to the Bellagio where we were going to see "O" after dinner. He said he couldn't make any promises, but that it would probably work out. Turns out he procured us a ride, so we got to show up to the Bellagio in a limo. The limo driver was fantastic. He was playing Star Wars music, so we had a nice chat about the new movie.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini and meatball pasta bowl! Chicken Marsala for my fiance.
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Bruschetta!

KY_AfHffZk8djmKhJkbMcQ.text: To quote Jerry Seinfeld: "See, you know how to take the reservation, you just don't know how to hold the reservation and that's really the most important part of the reservation, the holding. Anybody can just take them.". This was the problem this past Sunday evening (and based on reading other previous Yelp reviews, has been an ongoing problem for awhile). Everyone who had made dinner reservations that evening were complaining that they were waiting an hour or more for their table (and to make matters worse, they initially told everyone that it would only be about a 15 to 20 minute delay). Many people were angry about the wait, and they probably lost several customers forever. But putting this mismanagement aside for a second, let me outline the positives of this restaurant: They have pretty good food, the service was fast (once you were finally seated), the atmosphere has that old world Italian charm, and the entertainment (singer/band playing old classics) were very good. The outdoor Tiki bar in the back is also a unique touch, and a great place to hang out, drink, and order food from their bar menu. To summarize, I could have easily given this restaurant a poor 1 or 2 star rating, just based on the reservation screw ups. But I will rate it 3 stars (for now), based on the positives I outlined....and although I would go back, I would never go on any weekend night, or any other time I may think it would busy, because there is a high likelihood you will be waiting a long time for a table, and your dinner reservation will be completely meaningless.

HHFd20QuxYnn0LIYUSVwFg.text: You go here for the ambiance. The old Vegas vibes are alive and well. the music was excellent, and our server was nice. But, we had good ordered that was not entered into the system. The bruschetta was good, but no other dish was worthy of enough interest to come back for it. I would take someone here for a drink and to listen to the great band.

09a6VH21ywXnoXgfZrJPdw.text: I come to Las Vegas probably twice a year and we try not to eat on the strip.  Casa Di Amore is one of the reasons you leave the strip.  If you are looking for great Italian with all the trimmings (atmosphere and all) this is the place!!!!  This place was amazing with the old school feel.  They had the singer that was amazing, singing the Sinatra classics and all, the booths and a family feel.  The food was great!!! You must get the garlic bread, I had the egg plant parm and it was great and I wasn't able to finish it and I finish everything!!!   My cousins had the classic spaghetti and meatballs, and lasagna they were both raving about it.  This is a place that I definitely return to.  I had a blast!!!  It was like a dinner and a show.  Well worth the trip off the strip.

L1kkTXyM95JI1lPvtxRB-A.text: Loved loved loved this place!!!  I'm from the east coast and it's hard to find places like this out here!!  They seated us right away (even though we didn't have reservations), we had a beautiful table near the entertainment that was incredible and family friendly, and the staff was amazing!!  Very well done!!

mIJCLsugWb9b7xa_CVCENg.text: The house of love is the best Italian restaurant I have been to in this city!! Came here for my birthday on Thursday and had the pleasure of sitting right next to the stage with live music. Had a salad and chicken parmigiana. So bomb! Two pomegranate cosmos, as well. Dinner for two came to about $140. Would def recommend for a nice off the strip upscale eat!

sA9fY89s-fJ9ixkXoT7yzA.text: I wasn't that impressed unfortunately with the food I've tried a couple of things off the menu and it's just not to my liking. The scenery is pretty cool and laid back a fun place to hang out. And the waiters and waitresses are every friendly

y2vQMffH_S2Hj8sQC4AZaA.text: Just a mess. We made reservations and arrived at the restaurant on a sat. night. We arrived at 7:50pm. There was a band playing horrible western music. Nothing says fine italian dining like a junky western band cranked up so loud you cannot hear anything! Am I right? Yes! We bolted.

We had a reservation and were directed to the bar for a few minutes while they set up our table and by the time we got our drinks, our table was ready. There was live jazz playing which was a nice touch. The servers were very attentive to our needs.

sfFcu15h8AzWS3hlQi5XIQ.text: My boyfriend & I went here last night & it was packed! So I immediately thought there would be a wait to be seated but surprisingly there wasn't, we were seated right away. Very small inside but they did have a live band of 3 and full bar.  I give a 3 for the atmosphere & the customer service. I love that it's old Vegas themed & our waitress was very friendly & attentive. For the food, I wasn't thrilled. I got the lasagna & my boyfriend got the chicken alfredo both being a little bland. We've both had better of the dishes. Little pricey but that's expected for an Italian restaurant. Overall, descent.

i52uIZ6-Xohd6G2_FWl4IQ.text: Amazing food, great service and wonderful ambiance. Well worth the drive away from the strip to go there. I was pleasantly surprised at the low cost; my daughter and I shared a 1 lb pasta dish and we were both stuffed!  Our waitress was very attentive without hovering and made great suggestions. Recommended by our Uber driver, we're glad we rolled the dice and gave this place a try.

hLDd7XmKJkK_-TQf0EBIcw.text: Delicious food ate here last night best Italian food I ever ate would definitely recommend to any one

FTuoQQypnHj1DVVx-lw5sQ.text: We have been to Vegas, many many times. This is hands down the best experience and food you will have while staying here.  Located about two miles off the strip and just around the corner from our place sits this little whole in the wall.  When you pull up, the first impression you will get is  "this is what all the rave is about?" It literally looks like a run down bar with an old door out front that your not sure you want to walk through. The parking can be a bit off putting, but I'll get back to that in a minute. Just find a spot and go in (reservations our highly encouraged) we did not make any and later found out we were very lucky that we even found seats.   So... you walk through this door and are immediately taken aback by the intimate atmosphere.  The waitress asks if we have reservations and we tell her emberaasingly "no" she takes our name and say "go back to the bar, I'll find you when more seats open" no question or hesitation, we do so. When we arrive to the bar there were no two seats available, a waiter kindly asked a couple to move down one so. My husband and I could sit together (the couple ended up being regulars who we sat and talked with our whole visit at the bar, which was nothing more then 20mins) I actually wished we could have stayed their longer. The bar tender was awesome, she was making a drink that intrigued me, told me it was a mudslide and I said I would take one as well "she replied with, you can have this one, the floor can wait" and she gave me a big wink. My kind of gal. My husband had a manhattan, of course.  And we chatted away with the locals who gave us some insight on the the place. The restaurant is open from 5pm-5am, they recommend reservations and too come early for a drink at the bar and play virtual poker or black jack (my cup of tea) there's live music all night long and if your there during late late hours you may see some celebs walking in after their shows.   Moving on to dinner.... our waiter... we never did catch his name, but if you have a chance to encounter him, consider that you'll never have a more wonderful evening. He had us cracking up all night and was wonderful to watch interact with all his other tables. The other servers seemed just as nice, but he stood out the most. One thing we learned is that most of this group have worked at this place for years and it's amazing to see them work together.  Ok ok food: I ordered the Veal Marsala "delicate and prefecto my husband had the chicken parm, which was rich and amazing. Their red sauce is like no other. I had angel hair with my Veal, perfectly cooked and brought on the side, couldn't have asked for it served any other way. Prior to dinner we had a loaf of bread that were small pieces with garlic butter (my arteries are screaming at me with all the cholesterol) but it was worth it. Between the two of us we couldn't decide if the Cesar or Italian house salad was best, they were both that good!  We need the night with the Spumoni ice cream dipped in chocolate, enough said. Over we had 4 drinks 3 courses and we were out of there with a bill of $131 (tip included)  I would recommend this to any couple and family, great experience.  One last thing we did learn is that they have ride service. They want you to be able to enjoy their amazing wine/drinks and not have to worry about transportation- underutilized but there as an option  Not enough can be said about this place, from the time you walk out there door, they are wonderful, every dang one of them.

mDrEpkKFG-WfGTJYa-bViQ.text: The food was very very good, the waiter attentive and friendly, and the manager came and spend a few minutes getting to know us. The chicken piccata was delicious.    The entertainment was very nice, but not so loud as to ruin conversation. We enjoyed hearing the great music from the 50's so nicely performed.   Casa Di Amore must be popular with the locals, as many people coming in were acknowledged by the entertainer and employees. All in all it was definitely worth finding it, thanks to Yelp!

r-NJp0GRdBZ8j9EJvtBoFQ.text: Overall this was a very pleasurable experience.   The Italian American food is good with huge portions.   They're sauces were very flavorful and the pasta was cooked perfectly.   The appetizers are very large so be aware when you're ordering that you might get full fast.    The service was great.    Our server was very attentive as well as the server assistants.  We got our food pretty fast and with a good pace.   The ambiance and decor was very nice.   The live singing was also a very nice touch.

GH7nJp2F5W0VCtQTeX808w.text: I am giving them 5-stars for the service and atmosphere. The atmosphere is cool. The pictures near the bar would change and show old Vegas photos. For a short while, they had live music. The service was great! We had an awesome, personable waiter. (I didn't ask his name, but the receipt said the server was "Brad G".)  I would have to give it 4-stars for the flavor of the appetizer and main course. For appetizer, we had the twice wrapped prawns. For our main course, I had the chicken piccata with angel hair pasta and my bf had the chicken Parmesan with angel hair pasta.  The food was good with a good portion size.   5-stars for dessert! For dessert, we had the cannoli and the creme brulee. Those were the bomb! And what's cool is that if you order a cannoli or creme brulee, you get a free T-shirt :)  The next time we return to Vegas, we would definitely go back to this restaurant.

LJho-uWDBgy6A87Kv9JwKA.text: We went yesterday for the first time. Parking was slightly limited on a busy night, but we were able to find a spot. The restaurant does not look like much from the outside. The inside is old school, cozy, and inviting. The lights are dim and live music is playing. We are greeted by a very friendly hostess and taken to a booth, rather than a regular table, after making reservations. Very comfortable and cool. The menu is vast and has a lot of choices. We start with two glasses of the Merlot which is delicious. The bread is warm and absolutely delicious, along with a homemade garlic butter that demands a second serving. I ordered the mini osso bucco which is an appetizer with risotto and it was absolutely delicious. It was impressively flavorful and melted off the bone. My friend ordered a Caesar salad which was fantastic. We both got pasta dishes.  She got the lasagna and I got the mastaciolli, which is like a baked ziti, both with meat sauce. They were good, yet a little too dry, like they may have been over baked. They were still good.  We did not order desert as we were full!  The service is very friendly and the prices are more than reasonable.  Why 4 stars? We are actually giving it 4.5 stars. The main dishes were good, but not great. We will definitely be going back and will try other dishes on the menu.

YfzptbQJdt4E8JXfzcwe7g.text: Hidden gem! Didn't even know this place was here but so glad we found it. Delicious! Make a reservation. But definitely go.

Y_EQSkTMUn3rCBajIF0sfA.text: Honestly service was great!! It was the food that was not very good.. I had the chicken Alfredo and it was salty and watery, my bf had the chicken Parmesan and the chicken was rubbery and had a weird after taste. Waste of money  good band tho

ejzDFWjFtnlAOee07tSoHA.text: Favorite Italian food in Vegas!! Feels like you've stepped into old Vegas, love the music, atmosphere, service, and THE FOOD... where do I even begin? Everything we ordered was fantastic!! We forgot to make a reservation so we landed a seat at the bar since it was an hour wait for party of 2, it was prime dinner time on a Saturday so not surprised it was packed after experiencing this phenomenal restaurant, we didn't mind sitting at the bar but will keep that in mind for next time. The bartender Roshy is a sweet heart!! Our new fav spot

9A0G0NJv7I3UPDLLwaSeyA.text: Found this little gem..  food, atmosphere, and service was outstanding.  From start to finish this Italian restaurant was one of my better dining experiencing in Vegas.  Amongst all the well known restaurants in the Vegas strip this is worth the trip.  Did I forget to convey the music during the dining experience.

yBZ1pTHxSdcBfkMAkzO90w.text: Classic Italian dishes in a cozy atmosphere is what you will find here. We had a fantastic server named Tony who took great care of us and offered many great suggestions. Food was hot and fresh out of the kitchen. Music on stage wasn't over bearing or annoying, it was very pleasant. My Italian gatorade martini was yummy. Nice to get away from the strip on a business trip where Im stuck there. Good times, will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Italian Gatorade&#34; LOL

GlltrqPvr4FA2aX78M-u5A.text: Service from Tony was excellent as was the atmosphere and food. We had hot cocoas and fettichini alfredo, which were both very tasty.

NFKJaUTVuapEucxyenZupQ.text: Given all the positive buzz, we thought eating there twice wouldn't be a bad thing.  Wrong.   It might have just taken the award for the worst meal we have ever eaten in Las Vegas.  The only way to describe my baked lasagna is "truly horrible."  We also had eggplant parmesan.  Not good and super greasy with overcooked pasta.  We tasted our friend's pizza which looked really great - but blech!   The drinks were good though. You need a drink to put up with this place.   The place  was totally packed and really hopping - with lots of tourists and conventioneers, many of whom had started their happy hour experience several hours earlier.  [The restaurant runs a shuttle to/from the Strip.]   It was very crowded and very noisy - with really bad live music that just added to the cacophony.  When you could actually hear the music/singing above the din, well, that was not a good thing either.  The restaurant itself leans a bit towards the "dive" end of the restaurant spectrum without exactly being quite that bad.  According to our waiter, it is a favorite hangout spot for gypsy gangs who meet there to plan out their robberies and arsons - and then try to stiff the restaurant on their bill or pay with counterfeit money.  The counterfeit problem is so bad they had to install a machine to scan and detect them.  All of this might have been amusing had the food been good.

86a8Amgs32DXDRp_WLy06A.text: Look no further if you're looking for a great, memorable Italian dinner not far off the strip. They have a full bar and live music that's not overbearing. Everyone was singing the hits having a great, festive time.    Let's start with the service. I had the pleasure of getting Stephan as my server, he was very helpful in guiding me to what my taste buds wanted. I ended up getting the appetizer "Garlic Loaf" and for my entree, I got the "Fettuccini Papasito", creamy and loaded with flavorful sausage. My mouth is watering now! It was wonderful, I can't wait to try other dishes when I return.  I called before I went to Casa Di Amore to see if there was a wait and I also had the pleasure of speaking with Lisa who was helpful with my questions. When I was done eating, I wanted to thank Lisa and she gave me a tour of their new OUTSTANDING huge Tiki bar in the rear.  You have to see it, It's straight out of Hollywood and very comfortable.  I can't wait to bring the work crew back to Casa Di Amore because now, I'm in love!  This place rocks from the top to the bottom.

Fabulous foods! Sadly, it's  pretty pricy on everything for hwte we ordered our meal. Please don't get me rongvit qw lovely being here with family or loved ones to celebrate  something special!

kf-Tsy_Yqb62q2eBSP-NNw.text: Really really disappointed.  I was so excited to try this place. I called to make a reservation and I asked for 7pm and the lady on the phone said 7:15 was a better time to get in.  I come in and sign in. She said it will be a few minutes.  Fast forward, 25 minutes had passed, and the ppl around me had the same reservation time as me, they were being seated and we kept asking when we will seated.  35 minutes pass and they said there's still 2 more parties ahead of us.  We walked out. We weren't going to wait 1 hour.  How could you reserve a bunch of people under one time slot? You could of told me 7:30 or 7:45.  The manager wasn't very nice and was not very accommodating.  We ended up going to Italian American Club Restaurant not to far away.  Go there if you're waiting a while here.

YVzya7_vcvxj2UBYmD4qow.text: Came here with a  wedding party.  Not a place to go if you want a QUIET romantic dinner. It has a nice atmosphere. Live band and friendly staff. Food is good. Huge portions that is enough to share with several people. My only complaint was that it needed a tad bit more sauce.   We ordered the appetizer sampler and everything on the plate was delicious. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. Took couple bites and boxes it up because we had to drive 8 hours home. Warmed it up the next day and it was good but hardly any sauce. Felt like all I was eating was the noodles.

PUsVEMO7yIkmKXWdsAljMQ.text: Casa di Amore is a throwback to the days when you could count on being treated like a welcome guest at an authentic, old school Italian restaurant run by pleasant, hard working people.  Stephen is an exceptional server, and everyone who came to our table was polite and efficient. The food is solid, high quality cuisine (Cioppino and NY Steak Flambe both excellent, highlighted on the menu for good reason). $3 dinner salads definitely worth the nominal extra charge.  Great in-restaurant dinner entertainment, classic Vegas decor all part of a great dining/entertainment experience. With apologies to Arnold: We'll be back.

6Y1LCNGKoYuWDConpFoDxg.text: Coming from a Yankee, the Italian food here is excellent!! Service was excellent, and there was appropriate live music when we were there that wasn't too loud. I had the veal parm and my boyfriend had the chicken parm. Both were excellent, the red sauce was fabulous. Just a 15 min uber ride from the strip, this is worth the time to venture out.

18SGsYsEgh5Zdc5kT0oLRg.text: I don't even know where to start with this place.. The service, vibe, and atmosphere is impeccable! Casa Di Amore has become my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. The "Eggplant Di Amore" dish is TO DIE FOR & is the best eggplant I've ever had. The tiramisu is also amazing. The owner Mikey is such a nice and genuine guy! Always makes sure his guests are happy. Alex usually runs the floor and she's always on top of everything, plus she's such a sweetheart! Lastly, the Tiki Bar outside is so cute and so much fun when the weather is nice. Highly recommend to check this place out!

kQOmXD_aZ5Pbywwu9UDDdA.text: Such a cute and cozy place. Their pizza is AMAZING!!  I loved their chocolate dessert and honestly it's so nice to be able to go to a sit down restaurant, with great service and atmosphere at such a late hour.

EUlvlbTnahdh5mQQDiA4DQ.text: I wish I would have knew about this place earlier!  I'm absolutely in love. It's such a great atmosphere as soon as you walk in. There's a cool tiki bar in back and the restaurant floor is so classic. There's live music, and the musicians are fantastic. Our server Blake was such a good host, treated us like a friend. It was our first time there and he gave us a detailed informative tour of the menu. Ordered the mini osso bucco and the spaghetti and meatballs. I highly suggest both and if it's only 2 of you you only need one pasta bowl, it's about a pound of pasta!!  Oh and the garlic loaf is a must. The osso bucco is over risotto and the spaghetti and meatballs were to die for. So much flavor in the meatballs. Definitely will be returning!  I love it here.
