Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs huge serving and the best spaghetti and meatballs I ever had. Ordered with angel hair

76y0h7Rc-omNOWc6KMTdVg.text: They offered a free shuttle to and from our hotel so we thought that we would give them a try and are happy we did. Their special of the day was delicious as was their canniloni and cheesecake. Service was prompt and friendly. Reservations are recommended as they were busy when we went on Sunday night.

A6YG9IVvI_9jDFS9aigWvg.text: Had a recommendation from my dentist in Portland as he knew I spend the winter here in Vegas. Interestingly, I already had flagged it on my go see list. I tried out several items last night and all were top notch!  Started with the chicken noodle soup which was delicious, but I would probably name it, chicken vegetable with noodle. I then tried the appetizer osso bucco (my first time ever). It was really good but had a little meat, along with a good amount of fat, but I think that is the nature of the beast! Mega tender!!! I then tried the Chicken Marsala. This sometimes is a sweet dish, but I checked to see and I was promised it was savory... and it was.... I Liked it very much! Oddly, one of the best parts of the dish was the side of pasta that came with it. I was able to select which pasta I wanted as well as the sauce. I chose angel hair with the meat sauce. It was fantastic! For dessert, I had the creme brulee. It was also tasty. My dentist is Italian and told me it was done of the best Italian he has ever had... I must say I would agree even though I am not Italian. The place has an old Vegas vibe... atmosphere a bit dark. By 6:30 on a Wed night, the place was packed, so many others must agree! I will be back!

e1EHLlZZLbbNY4bT2vi6nA.text: The Long Island Iced Tea was great! Don't bother ordering the baked mostaccioli. Very dry and when I asked for extra meat sauce, it had a burnt taste to it. Room for improvement!!!

XPiNYFTV6k3FwJ-Y21WOUQ.text: Love this place!  It feels like you are having dinner with the Sopranos!  It's a small comfy and cozy little Italian place off the strip with live music and Great Service.  It makes you feel like Old Las Vegas with memorabilia of how old Vegas used to be.  Taking a Lyft or Uber from the strip isn't that bad it's about $13, but if you call ahead they do have a complimentary shuttle service that will pick you up and drop you off!  I would highly recommend their Calamari as a starter it is very soft and lightly battered and comes with a delicious marinara, and you can't go wrong with the Chicken Parmigiana!

e95I0C6qifpI8uP6eBefjg.text: Excellent food, great atmosphere, great fun!  We came here when friends saw it on an episode of  "Jersey Shore."  We were not able to be seated right away so we sat in the outside lounge. They had live entertainment and the game on.   Less than 10 minutes later we were seated inside and ready to attended to right away. We had everything from the calamari, DIVINE garlic loaf, cannelloni, spaghetti and meatballs, and more. Their bean soup was amazing.   Top it off with GREAT entertainment. The two piece band was excellent. We sang along when they sang everything from Sinatra to the Stylistics! We had a great time. The wait staff was amazing and we never wanted for anything!  We would recommend going and we will come back.

-R3rN2u4ak1-RMbGteey9w.text: Frank Sinatra ribeye! Leave the gun and take the canoli. What a romantic place.  Live music, food is whats expected with a name like House of Love.  Cant wait to return on our next trip to Vegas.  Thank you Tony.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xM4b2YRc30CqFVISfipFxQ.text: What a great spot, the customer service is always spectacular. The food is amazing, the environment is very versatile. I've gone here on date nights, business meetings & girls night on many many occasions. Sometimes I'll stop in just to get food to go. The chicken parm is a must try. 10/10 don't hesitate, GO!

eh3GG34ZssodU4S4SGkvRg.text: Diamond in the rough just minutes off of the Vegas strip.   Be ready to be transported back to the 50s.   I'm excited to go back to Vegas just so we can go to Casa Di Amore.   We were there on 1/2 price bottle of wine night - they don't even need to give half off but they do.   There was also a deal that if you buy a dessert you get a free T-shirt - get out.  The dessert prices were NOT inflated to cover the price of the shirt - they just do it to be awesome.  Tiki bar - not sure who came of with the idea but it's almost the exact opposite of the restaurant.   It makes you smile.  Plenty of seating.  Various nooks and crannies to hide in and enjoy a drink.  I recommend checking it out while you wait or come early and grab a drink.  You can take your drink to your table with you if needed.  The tiki room we sat in made us feel like we were at Disneyland.  Thanks staff specially Anthony (our waiter), the owner for stopping and speaking to us and the two man band playing all the Vegas classics.  See you guys soon.

mXxw-fNyb_UY88ypAVViPA.text: We really enjoyed this hidden gem. We took friends and were shocked at how classically Vegas it is once you enter!  My friend had the Chicken Angelo, which was perfectly seasoned and tender. Her man had the ravioli which were fresh and tasty.  I enjoyed the Gnocchi with four cheese sauce. I'm a huge cheese fan and this touched all of my buttons. The gnocchi was freshly made and the sauce complimented it perfectly! My husband got the Fruite del Mare. It was perfectly prepared. The seafood was fresh and tender. It was incredibly tasty. We topped off this feat with both the tiramisu and cannoli. The tiramisu was excellent. The cannoli was on par like the freshest I ate in Italy!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi alla Proscuitto

e17ohgEC8W-uRqjfC-Td3g.text: This is a family favorite of ours. Everything about Casa Di Amore is great from the second you walk in. The walls are lined with old Rat Pack photos and there's live music in the evenings. If I want Italian food, this is where I'm going almost every time. The staff is all very friendly and remembers my family even though they don't live here.   I recommend making a reservation. When you arrive you can hang out in the back where the bar is. They've redone the bar to add more booths so it's a little harder to do this but the whole restaurant is small so there's not much of an option. For starters I've had the bruschetta, calamari, and arancini. We've tried to order the clams a few times but our waiter didn't recommend them because they were apparently small at the time. The calamari is a good choice for a group and the arancini was crispy and creamy. The bruschetta is alright, but they give you a big basket of bread for dinner so it's a little redundant. They'll ask if you want to add any soup or salad to your dinner for a charge but their portions are pretty big so it's certainly not necessary.   For dinner I pretty much always go for the pasta. I've had the gnocci alla prosciutto, fettucini alla pappasito, and pasta alla forno. The fettucini alla pappasito is one of my favorite pasta dishes ever. It's a creamy fettucini dish with chunks of sausage in it. I add a good amount of pepper flakes and everyone that tries it thinks it's the best dish of the night. The pasta alla forno is a close second.   Other than taking family here for a nice dinner, I go to Casa di Amore sometimes as a late night option. It's a lot more casual and we usually sit at the bar. After I think 11pm they have 1/2 off pizzas so we'll usually do that or order a 1 lb pasta bowl to share (penne alla vodka). It's a great  option for late night food where usually your only options are smoky bars or chain restaurants. Casa di Amore is actually open until 5am so you can get there pretty late.   One interesting thing that may be happening is we saw some tiki decorations out in back of the restaurant recently. Rumor has it they'll be opening a tiki bar soon so that will be awesome and add some more room for people waiting for a table or wanting to hang out in a tiki bar. Casa di Amore is easily the coolest part of this part of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels Marinara
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chops
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto

QddfHMQVOPw2OEypzopfLA.text: Unfortunately came without reservations, busy Thursday night. Went back into the tiki lounge and had fried calamari, wings and pizza. All three items were amazing. Best I've had by far. The calamari was perfectly crisp and flavorful. The wings had a nice kick to them, nothing crazy spicy and the pizza was perfect. Loved it, definitely will be back next time I come to Vegas!

cWNDq0i3lKTB-WLGQAoZHg.text: So I went here on a first date recently and I wouldn't say its a good vibe for that! Lol Its very loud and to top if off they sat a family with a baby right behind us.. so when the singer is there with the loud music its hard to have any conversations here... the sweet sound of baby crying didn't help either. The patrons that come here is also on the loud side. This would be a good place for a large family to come to.. or friends that want to get together and want to be loud. I didn't choose the restaurant for our first date.. but its definitely not a nice romantic italian restaurant.. its more on the loud, bright and non fancy side.   So lets talk about how the place looks.. its not fancy.. kinda bright lighting.. and more on the casual dress side. The service was okay.. Theres also a tiki bar in the outside back patio side of the restaurant which is kinda cool cause its very Hawaiian theme! but they close early back there around 11pm! even though the restaurant is open til 3am.   So the food was alright tasting.. nothing amazing to rave about. I believe I ordered the gnocchi with prosciutto and added grilled shrimp no top of that. It tasted alright but its not something I would order again. The bread and butter at the beginning of the meal was actually pretty tasty! bread was warm and the butter was soft! very delish.  I also ordered moscow mules there and it tasted okay. not overly sweet which i loved.   Oh parking is plentiful and no valet needed. Like I said its a very casual italian restaurant.

yOFvA6NWS2UFrGfiGqRkjw.text: Wonderful food, music, ambiance, and great service! Our waitress welcomed us, especially after hearing this was our first visit. She checked on us several times to ensure we had everything we needed and our drinks were refilled. The musician singing the classics sounded Ike Sinatra. We WILL be back!    Started with the Arancini (rice and cheese balls) with a nice, big, gooey, cheesy center, and ossobuco over risotto. The ossobuco was flavorful and smooth.  The garlic cheese bread had cheese in the center and was delicious with the spaghetti sauce from the Arancini.   The chicken Parmesan was tasty with a nice melty layer of cheese. Couldn't finish it all but really wanted to. The fettuccine alla Pappasito (2 kinds of sausage) was smooth and satisfying. Now, it's time to roll home and go to sleep with a happy and full stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini - Italian Stuffed Rice Balls &amp; Ossobuco Appetizer (background)
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettucine Alla Pappasito
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmigiana

z4qlVY9KPEY0u7A_T3-Clg.text: I could of sworn I reviewed Casa Di Amore last year... but nothing here so I am doing a combined reviewed of two visits.  First time I went last year, it was AMAZING.  I would have given it 5 stars for the food, the service, it was all top notch.  There were 3 of us, we were sat in a corner booth and ordered a bunch of appetizers and entrees to share.  Even had dessert.  It was all delicious and fabulous.  Service was on point and I enjoyed my wine to top it all off.   Second visit was a few weeks ago.   Unfortunately went with high expectations based on the first visit.  Oddly we were sat in the bar area, which I didn't really care for.  The only advantage to that was our bartender was our server and she was great.    This visit had some highlights and low points.    Highlight was the lobster ravioli.  Was as delicious as the first time.   Low point was the meatballs that came out cold - AND when we asked it to be hot they literally just NUKED the meatballs in the microwave and brought it back out.  Didn't this that was this kind of restaurant.    Highlight was the chicken parmesan hubby ordered.  Low point was my veal parmesan which seemed a bit tough... esp conidering it was veal.  Overcooked maybe?  I dunno.    The old school Vegas feel was still there and we mostly enjoyed our dinner, but those were some odd things like microwaved meatballs.   Lastly, we made our reservation through Open Table and the restaurant told Open Table we never showed up.  So I get some kind of note from Open Table in which I have to "explain" myself that we were there with the bill to show as proof if need be.  Yeah... just a little irritating to a dinner that was already just about 3 stars.  Hopefully they fix their little quirks.

lhEwJM8xGcPwvfHzpN7YvQ.text: How Yas Do N... love this spot when in Vegas. If you are into the old school Vegas scene, you know, the one where folks disappeared in the desert and respect ran the joint you will love this place and its mafia ambience. The dim lighting, smell of red sauce and walls covered in history take you back to a time before the corporate giants charged you to watch fountains and guys wearing pantyhose hang from a ribbon. The foods not bad too.    Leave the gun and be sure and take a box of cannoli's (love my shirt)!

Stx8f-Jtg3-ONWx5PAzQGw.text: We found this place by typing Italian Food. Yelp reviews looked promising and I'm looking forward to the food and dining experience. Toni Girl greeted us quickly and professionally making our group of 8 feel important and welcomed.   The ample parking was a plus and the Resturant has a nice visual appeal from the outside. As we walked in, the decor and ambiance was spectacular. I felt transported to a time when the "Rat Pack" was the hit of Vegas and the patrons inside were part of some big event in town. We felt under dressed but they extended a warm welcome regardless.   We ordered water and drinks and was amazed at how quickly it was served. Appetizers of lobster ravioli, calamari, prosciutto, and bread was plentiful and absolutely tasty- The music of the 50-60's was so appropriate and lighting perfect, creating an ambiance of calm and delight.  The food came out so quick as well and words just can't explain how delicious the dishes were. I really did enjoy my stuffed pork chops dish. The pork was tender and flavorful. My friend did enjoy their pasta and seafood dishes.   Overall, my experience here was amazing with the staff being so pleasant and attentive to our needs. Foodies, this place is a must try- you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Music Duo...
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Alfredo with Shrimp
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eqMJnQPf1uQKB1bQEYehrg.text: I would give it 3.5 stars, if I could, for atmosphere and live music. The singer was amazing, it was busy and people were having a lot of fun. Kind of reminded me old school American Italian family atmosphere. But let's get to the most important part why we are here. Based on food, I don't know how this place got 4.5 stars on Yelp. We had veal francese and chicken parm, and both were very mediocre. I would say for this type of "Italian", go to Olive Garden. You will get better food quality, and your check will be cut in half. So, kudos for atmosphere but food is not so good.

HMw6uKZAE8zV2BPORawQ6g.text: We come here every trip to Vegas. We have tried the new upscale restaurants on the strip, but we keep coming back to Casa Di Amore where the food, and prices, are far better. The food here is consistently good. If you do not have a reservation, be here at 5pm. Don't let the front of the building fool you. It is old Vegas speakeasy style on the outside and upscale on the inside. Many nights have live music too. Great meal and great service.

7txsI-CAV_BW6IN4pf5WlQ.text: The food was great (best fettucini alfredo in town) but don't bother making a reservation.  If they can't seat you at the reserved time, they send you to a crowded bar to wait for an undefined amount of time.    The hostess just says oh it won't be long.  People are wrapping up now.  She wouldn't tell us how many people were in front of us either so we could gauge our own wait time either.  She was pretty useless.   Always clean and delicious food but the reservation thing happens every time.  Plan to wait 20-30 minutes with or without a reservation.

AfnE2YpY05nJgRXHgGM2mQ.text: This is a slice of old Vegas.  The ambiance is vintage and makes you feel like Frank is in the next booth. The service is good, and the food is excellent. There's only one thing to say about this place. "Leave the gun, take the Cannolies."

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chianti &amp; Cannolies

DnlEBU6-oVFc7slGoU_0vA.text: How do you alter the Yelp info on this restaurant that says "good for kids" because it needs to say "no" after we were turned away for having a baby. This place isn't called Casa Di Amore - it's called Casa Di Ashole.   I came here with my parents, my husband, and my baby. The two hostesses working tonight (Friday 4/7) initially quoted us a 30 minute wait. In the 4 seconds it took us to decide that we would go for it, the bald burly black guy in a coat (general manager?) walked over and discreetly shook his head at the hostesses.   Suddenly, the two girls were then telling us that they weren't taking walk ins. We were probably looking really confused because they back tracked and then said "well we would have to push two tables together because you have a baby". Literally being turned away because of my child.   The manager stood there blankly staring at the hostesses making sure they do their job in sending us on our way. He did not even look at us. We turned around to walk out and one of the girls said "sorry! Try another night!" I think she felt bad but either way I'm highly annoyed and offended by our experience.   We went to Sergio's down the street and it was AMAZING. Such great service and amazing Italian food.

4OfUO9dxqjKuoKKwS-0w9w.text: My favorite old school Italian! Besides great food at a reasonable price, you'll be entertained by a small band that plays Sinatra, Elvis and requests. The restaurant isn't very big but they cram a lot of tables in there. Still, you should make a reservation unless you want to hang out in the bar and play video poker while you wait. Lots of fun old Vegas pictures hang in the walls too. Large portions of food! The gnocchi with steak tidbits is amazing! As far as I know, it's a special they offer occasionally and isn't on the regular menu. They also make a great martini!

5VUrYY6XRo_6gy6W-w7Q_Q.text: I have been coming here for years. Honestly, I thought I already reviewed this place, and I am confident I have tried half the menu. I have a favorite server (Brad), although, they are all great. The ambiance, live music, and old school vibe makes you feel like you are dining with mobsters in the 1970's. They use to rep the NY Giants during football season, but I don't remember seeing the flag out this past year.  When people ask me my favorite Italian food in Vegas, unless I know they are looking for a fancy strip environment, I recommend Casa Di Amore. Once you walk through the doors, you forget you just walked in a small restaurant off Tropicana. Dim lighting, attentive staff, and classic Italian food that reminds me of my grandmother on the east coast.  Some of my favorite dishes include linguine and clams, eggplant di amore, chicken picatta, and the appetizer of a mini osso bucco with risotto. The risotto is always cooked to perfection. I always add a house salad because their home made dressing is to die for. If I can't make up my mind, I stick with a basic spaghetti and meatballs. Perfect, classic comfort dish.  They have a bar, but right now it is under construction so they are only serving beer and wine. I can't wait to come see the newly remodeled lounge area once they are done.  I love the feeling I get when I am here. Everything is exactly how an Italian restaurant should be. Welcoming and comfortable with amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs

jkABouthP_gHPpVDu-WCVA.text: Service was phenomenal. Food was good and we enjoyed the atmosphere. There was a live band which was good as well. This place was recommended to us and I see why. The score is based on the overall experience. I'd say food alone was 4. We were served warm bread w/olive oil & vinegar while we waited and it was tasty. My spouse and I split a salad, plate of pasta and a cannoli and we were full from the portion size (pretty big eaters too).

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LmqVCI4h5R4FMMGLkN7EaA.text: WOW!! If I could give them 10 stars I would! This place is FANTASTIC from atmosphere to the service to the food.  From the moment we walked it it's like stepping back to" Vegas the way it used to be" our waiter Brad awesome personality AMAZING waiter. Superb service through out the entire resturant from hostess to the bus boy. The live entertainment was great. I could go on and on!!! Quite possibly the best dining experience I have had to date. Haven't left and and I already can't wait to come back to Vegas just to return to Casa Do Amore! Fantastic authentic Italian food. And Holy Canoli

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honestly &#34;the way Vegas used to be!&#34;

_VHSZHJh0PYeF2OQJej8cQ.text: Loooved it! Went for my birthday and it was perfect! Jazz music and dim lighting, very nice place. Free cannoli for birthdays with a candle and song

28DgiveTMdf4ndkelarV4A.text: This place reminds me of the typical Italian eateries from the East Coast. For atmosphere, I give it a 5/5. There was live music, singing, celebrating, and interaction with the guests. For service 5/5, the server was attentive. For food 3.5/5, my frutti di mare had shrimp that were gray, so it was not even edible. I also find that salmon is not the best choice for that pasta because its flavor is much stronger than the refined flavors of the other elements.   If you want fun, go. If you are looking for great food, it's a toss up.

zDQcUJ32JPrwBNiHh4eiug.text: Casa Di Amore: Super Fun, Fantastic Food: "Old School Vegas"  Casa Di Amore: "Old School All The Way, Authentic Italian Pasta, 1950's style eatery" Even though this restaurant is off the strip and out of the way the food, friendly staff and old school atmosphere make it worth the trip. If you call well in advance they will pick you up from the strip and bring you back. The pasta dishes are better than anything I've ever had on the strip. I would prefer to spend an evening at Casa Di Amore than any restaurant on the Vegas strip, hands down the very best authentic Italian food and friendliest staff. The restaurant is recently renovated but none of the 1950's flair was lost, actually, it was enhanced. Can't say enough about the fun, relaxed atmosphere.  Last Visited June 2017

Uzwgn0Yh9dst3_-wAVFtJA.text: So refreshing to get away from the strip. And much cheaper!!! The live music, the ambiance and the food transports you back to when Vegas was such a cool place. Had a great meal and the service was awesome.   I'll recommend this place to all of my friends & hope to be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dtlpOaCp_d_ceai1S4jjhg.text: Casa Di Amore is a classic. We go there on each visit to Vegas. We giggle with delight upon the arrival of the vintage limo to pick us up at our hotel. The staff from the limo driver to the hostess to the servers are all impeccably personable and make for a wonderful dining experience. Is it the best food I've ever had? No. But the pasta is delicious and it's the experience that you have when you get to Casa Di Amore that makes it so memorable. You feel like you've stepped into a neighborhood haunt in Vegas with a large Italian community and many diners celebrating life's milestones. It's cozy, charming, and somewhat tacky but in the best way. The live music is great. We highly recommend a visit to Casa Di Amore on your visit to Vegas. PS -- try the Gypsy pasta and tri-flavored ice cream dessert. Yummo!

2BMEcjPEU5aE1liiLkYmCA.text: Iv'e lived here in VEGAS 30 years. FORTUNATOS was my favorite Italian joint in town till it closed a few years ago. A neighbor from "JOISEY", highly recommended this place so my wife and I tried it out a few months ago. This is my follow up review. I am not surprised that this joint gets all these rave reviews from millennial diners! I will say that I am a DALLAS NATIVE (1941 - 1988) that has "traveled the world" and KNOW what a fine dining experience is. Casa Di Amore has to be one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. The room is so dark that you need a flashlight to read the menu and the OVERPRICED food is MEDIOCRE at best. I don't care about "atmosphere" (dining in the dark), I DO CARE about the food. I guarantee you, you can get a 100% better dining experience for a fraction of the cost and be able to SEE what you are eating at any OLIVE GARDEN.

y3EN_DOE1g778uDw3PwjdA.text: Very romantic place. It's very old Vegas feel for sure. We went by chance on a Saturday and they had a small band playing. The lights are very dim and the food tasted great. I had the mushroom gnocchi and lasagna. Yummy. Will come back even though it's a far drive.

Q18EJq0CpdGYYxSBE4pK4w.text: Found this place on Yelp....definitely a fun atmosphere..loved the staff and entertainment...we chose appetizers of sauteed mushrooms and their garlic cheese bread.. .very solid 10, then we ordered the chicken marsala and shrimp scampi....we so wanted to love this place but the main courses were mediocre at best.  I also tried the meat sauce....not impressed...While our visit was fun with the Sinatra sounding singer and drummer that reminded me of BB King....I would go for drinks and appetizers...but the place was packed so try it for yourself!

b_4R-1QKTuJN--gLbYXieA.text: Super spot!  Old time Italian/American food.  Generous portions and our waiter Tony was a blast.  Loved the live entertainment with music from Sinatra, Dion, and a variety of 50's and 60's groups!  Lots of locals so you know they're doing something right.  Poker machines at the bar and generous pours make this a great place to enjoy drinks and dinner before hitting the casinos; or make a night of it - their hours are 5 PM to 5 AM (not a typo).  Brought back memories from the Vagas of my youth.

gO_wSvGUMCdtObckyJghkQ.text: I had Casa Di Amore bookmarked for years and heard rave reviews from several friends.  It was one of those places that kept getting skipped over, usually for somewhere newer or fancier.  Boy was I was missing out.  This is totally my type of place.  You walk in the door and are instantly transported to Old Vegas.  I had a drink at the bar while waiting for my friend.  They were playing Motown, the bartender was friendly and my drink (lemon drop) was great.  I could have hung out there all night.  I seriously want to become a regular here.  Eventually my friend arrived and we were seated in a large booth.  We started with a couple drinks, Chocolate Martini for me, Italian Gatorade for her.  Both were delicious.  For our mains we ordered the Famous Garlic Loaf, Penne Pesto and Baked Mostaccioli.  Food was fantastic.  I've been craving it ever since.  Service was good and before we left live music started playing.  This might be my new favorite restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Famous Garlic Loaf.  Only $6.  Get this!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Ravioli Appetizer

Z7o9Sn4f0m_Hh2wyl0K-ow.text: Italiana!!! I found this place... Where... of course on Yelp!   I was craving Italian food and I though we'd go check this place out and it was a hit.   As for parking, we didn't have any problems finding one. They have parking on the side and also in the back of the restaurant. When you walk into the restaurant, it has a really nice feel to the place. The lighting is not to bright, people are having a good, there's live jazz music and it all just makes you wanna eat good food lol...   There menu is just like any other Italian restaurant and you can look them up online. There price ranges anywhere from $13 to $45 depending on what you get. I went with the Cioppino ($38) which is a house favorite. If you like seafood, I recommend it!   It's a dish packed with lobster, clams, mussels, scallops, crab and shrimp. I added some pasta to it as well. The portion is pretty nice.   The staff there is really welcoming and overall I thought it couldn't have gone any better. Well unless if it was free but who are we kidding lol. If you're in the area, go check out Casa Di Amore.

DcQrKhafE2eey8W_DtSbbw.text: Came lastnight and it was packed! We didnt make a reservation but got sat in the bar area quickly. The oil vinegar and cheese sauce wasnt what I expected. It was full of minced garlic and parsley instead? Bartenders were awesome with our orders. I def recommend making a reservation. The food was okay for very pricey menu

cjXzPdexbQoUF4zCoeHXqQ.text: Love this place! Came to Vegas to celebrate my birthday and I had to try the best in Italian food. Many people raved about this place and it's live music..  I set-up a reservation and had a car pick us up! The place was undergoing reservation but it was still very quaint. The food was really good. I'm glad I asked for extra sauce because they don't give a lot. Overall, I had a good night with great tasting food.  The singers were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I enjoyed my bday dinner!
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j9I7KW10gv998kK1GNYoAQ.text: The Mrs & I were lost looking for the Sam Boyd Stadium(Supercross)& ended up by the UNLV main Campus.....Duh... Hungry,rolled by this place ,clicked on my Yelp app & saw a lot of good reviews,so we pulled in. Just as decribed,an old school mobster hang out. My rib eye steak,suggested by our waiter Tony(figures),was cooked & seasoned spot on. The Mrs had the Chicken Floretine,also excellent. Served with sauteed veggies,twice baked potatoes all good. They serve fresh made French bread,with a garlic butter,that I had to stop myself from eating the whole basket.Soooo good. Appears to be a local hangout,as we were at the retiree dining time of 4:30 & were the only couple ,other then the bar flys ,chatting up the staff. An intersting alternative to the masses on the strip... I will be back...

9UfW2GqiAknDguN-wIpF_Q.text: I gave this 4 stars but it's more like 4 1/2. Very retro Las Vegas decor, very romantic. I don't drink much but I did order a grasshopper while waiting to be seated and it was delicious. They had entertainment in the form of two elderly gentlemen playing dean Martin, Sinatra and Bacharach classics.  Very charming. The employees were extremely courteous. I had the New York steak and my boyfriend had the lasagna. Both were very good. Would definitely go back again to celebrate a special occasion. Also a good place to take out of town guests.

Jd9fP65guup2duSbGRcvqg.text: This is our second trip to Casa Di Amore within a year. Consistently amazing! Service is excellent! Good is excellent!! Live music makes the evening complete. All four of us had different meals and they were all perfect! Nobody had a pasta hangover because the portions were perfect!!!

QWVzMVyoDFDRvdul_WVY8A.text: Love the atmosphere there.  It's a nice American Italian place. We and my girlfriend use to be regular there and unfortunately no more. We tried almost all they pastas and weren't bad. They started making their pasta portion really small and since it isn't handmade fresh pasta and cost most of them over 20$ or  30$ if you order it with sea food, so for me is not ok. Think that a good brand of Italian pasta cost them less than a dollar. The service on the other end is one of the best you could ever get in Las Vegas and that's why of the 3 star.

YfADjijZA3XL2umzuwtQUQ.text: Found this place on Yelp with a ton a of great reviews! I was not disappointed. The service we had was just as amazing as the food. I also enjoyed the decor, old Italian mafia feeling...great place 5 stars! Brad was our server and he KICKED ASS. Ask for him. Cheers!

5vM7ee9zrR4Ekm0_MRbmiw.text: Delicious food, good service, great live music! They took a photo before we ask! :) I would love to go when I visit Vegas again!

nBQr3z51V4pV6JUgYIZYpw.text: We had a large party(about 30 people) here and we were so pleased with the service, food, and ambiance. Kathleen helped us coordinate the party and set a menu. She was very helpful, professional, and accomodating to last minute changes.  They sent two limos to pick us up.  This was really nice!  The drivers were very friendly. The restaurant is very old school east coast Italian. There was a singer...and he made the restaurant feel very intimate.  The food was great! The antipasti was really delicious and I was very pleased with the veal piccata. The service was especially wonderful! The wine was flowing...we didn't need to ask for anything!  They were so on top of it!  Brad was especially great!!!  He took extra steps to make sure we were all happy! Thanks for such a great experience...we will come back on our next trip to Vegas!  We will recommend this place to our friends and family.

nrXo0jGiGrxCBxaI6rHjug.text: Great service all thanks to Michael, he was an outstanding, friendly waiter. Made my wife and I feel like we were at home and not just guests. I highly recommend you ask for him next time you go in, what a wonderful experience!

93ptgtqNYZ-9Cj4pda6gWQ.text: My husband and I go to the Casa di Amore once a week. We always have a great time and enjoy sitting at the bar and visit with the best bartenders in town: Roshy, Brian and Nicole..So I thought it would be nice to give my husband a surprise birthday dinner and invite some of our close friends. The guest list grew to almost 25 people. The management (Kathleen & Mike)and servers (Stephen)were perfect and everyone was served with courtesy, promptly and at the same time (which has never happened in a large group situation anywhere else I've been). Even late arrivals were served immediately. No one had to ask for a thing because the service was flawless. The entertainment George Bugatti and Paul Stubblefield are the best you will ever experience! Thank you Casa di Amore for a great birthday dinner! We had the time of our lives!! I highly recommend this restaurant for all of the above!!

zf75Am2GEAle4EjECTvxdA.text: Hands down the best dinner/ bang for your buck! We called and got a reservation and they cane and picked us up in a limo! The four was absolutely fabulous! The meatballs were melt in your mouth! The chicken parm was to die for! Service was outstanding! Can not say enough good things to say about the place! Make a reservation they are full every night. Price was spot on.

Z-q1FXtwp5mm48H4riEbIg.text: Spent two weeks in Las Vegas last year for my honeymoon and finding this little spot at 1am is still one of the greatest highlights of the entire trip.  I let everyone know who tell me that they're going to vacation in Vegas that they MUST try this place!!!! Go now!!! Why are you still reading this?!?

hBcd0p3nwi4w6SMrpDe_NA.text: Old school Vegas.  Try the "broken leg of lamb."  Just kidding.  Lots of managers that look like they could have been in Casino or Goodfellas.  Solid food and good drinks.  We loved the band-- Randy and Stubbie.

afhkGQoQJrD5gv8_YmVWgA.text: Came here while visiting Vegas was looking for a good Italian restaurant ended finding a great Italian Restaurant! Everything from service to food to drinks was excellent a must try!

FqU7qkuADhPgtCuYWan_Jg.text: Great name and old style Italian restaurant. I have went there a couple of times and really enjoyed it, the atmosphere is nice. The service is very good and staff is friendly. There was live music which is a plus also. I would get a reservation depending on when you plan on going as the place is not very large and can get packed. Mange! Mange!

8kIRtb2H9wASNlkM6-6EKA.text: Had reservations for 4 on Wednesday night. After waiting 50 minutes were told another 15 to 20 minutes wait for our table. This was unacceptable and we left vowing to never return!  Be warned.

U7w97xXGUNLAG0CT2Nx3MA.text: I finally got to try this place out - after having wanting to have gone my past two trips to Vegas.  Res. at 8:30 on a Friday night and the limo was available for pickup at Mirage.  Dunno how we lucked out, but we did.  Well, we weren't seated til 9:15 or so.  This was a little ridiculous.  Fortunately we chatted up a few others around the bar.  Other than that, everything went well.  The vibe is nice, but the dude they had singing was a bit much.  Our waiter was outstanding.  This is what service should be like in the most expensive city in the US to eat in.  We (5 guys) did an order of mushrooms and calimari to start off with.  Mushrooms were great and the calimari was THE best i've had, to date.  Dinner comes and my veal parm is great.  a lil pricey at $30, but it was also the best I've had.  The cheese was melted perfectly - starting to turn brown to give that extra little crisp.  Our limo driver was ok at best.  He didn't really say much of anything even tho I tried shooting the shit with him when he picked us up.  But, for a free ($15 tip) cab ride I didn't complain.  Worth a stop if the limo is available.

xLRPoMwpFchIlZy_5a8dcg.text: I love Italian food, and this spot make me recall the time when i lived in Italia 5 years ago. It was memorable. The foods are okay, the price is reasonable for sure. The only thing they should be better is time serving, i had to wait a little bit long.

1kuGoSS3nqOSN70RBBBSkw.text: Someone pinch me because this was the BEST italian food I have ever had! Such an old school place and I can't believe how  many times I drove by it and never stopped in. It looks unsuspecting on the outside but goodness...the food is to die for! The marinara sauce is the stuff dreams are made of and the Eggplant di Amore? OH LAWD! I've gone to this place twice already and I will definitely be going again in the future.  Oh...and make sure you try the garlic loaf. AMAZEBALLS!

OpcHkjT1Jii2BovYyF5qXQ.text: We had a great time.  We got picked up promptly by the limo, the driver was nice and fun to talk to, we were seated quickly, the food was really good, the portions were good, the vibe was fun, the entertainment was great and we had a nice conversation with the drummer, and we really enjoyed ourselves.  For the price, I would not go often, but for a special treat, it was pretty perfect.

VuKF-sKcSXnsmdeo59PULg.text: Amo la Casa di Amore! (in english: I love "house of love")  Honestly we ended up here because of the free limo rides they offer.    Best. Marketing. Idea. Ever.    Ok.. in a long time at least... and I'm sure they are cheaper to operate to draw the tourists in than it would be to have built that place on the strip and pay the strip rent premiums.  Pretty genius...   I still scoped reviews  to make sure I wouldn't regret giving up my holiday time to a restaurant with a limo if it wasn't worth it.  Needless to say the reviews were glowing and we booked our limo/reservation.  Limo ride was fun.  Obviously retired by a regular limo company and bought by the restaurant as it's a little run down and not the height of luxury anymore... but it's still a sweet ride and we felt quiet VIP on a trip over the to restaurant.   Obviously the limo isn't REALLY free - you'll have to tip but it's still got to be less than a cab and way more awesome and a cheap way to have the limo experience in vegas.   The restaurant has some great atmosphere to it - very mobster and old vegas.  There was live music playing and it felt very romantic.  Everyone is very nice and service was top notch.   I settled on garlic bread and the 1lb spagetti with meatless balls (yes... a whole pound... you'll need to share or take a doggie bag).  ZOMG - it was delicious!   I eat a lot of pasta and frankly the food is usually consumed and as quickly forgotten but this stuff was so good and completely stands out as great pasta.  Meatless balls were great - even my meat loving sweetie enjoyed them.  I wished I could have teleported the contents of my stomach out (or subsequently gone back in time 30 minutes while maintaining my memories) just to eat a second helping of both the bread and pasta. I ate way more than I should have and I'm not sure how I found room for dessert but I'm glad I did.   The cannoli was to die for (maybe not literally... can't tempt a mobster right?).  I've since read you get a t-shirt for ordering the cannoli but that wasn't offered to me that night so i'm not sure what the deal with that is :(.  The night we were there they had 50% off bottles of wine which was very good since the bottles were all reasonably priced to begin with and needless to say we left a little giddy for a couple reasons.     Prices are decent but not inexpensive and more than worth it.  You'll be able to find a couple promos and coupons around for these guys but you can't stack those on top of special pricing like discounted bottles of wine so I'd find a couple coupons and do some math to figure out the best promo for you on the day you go as sometimes the in restaurant deal might trump the coupons available.   With tips we still did better cost wise than a couple dinner buffets and drinks on the strip and had more fun and enjoyed the food much more.   The limo was ready almost immediately after we paid... everything was amazing and I can't wait to return next trip down there and tell all my vegas bound friends back home about this little gem.

oPInnCnzxX_CXCKXxuoADg.text: This place is a hidden gem!! Reasonable prices delicious food and awesome atmosphere!! Great live entertainment 1950's 60's cool vibe Rat Pack style old school Vegas with a modern twist.

v5n-C8oNIDx8pPRc3Z6NNw.text: We looked on Google for the best Italian restaurants in Vegas and it gave us Casa Di Amore as one of the search results. As it is pretty close to our hotel, we decided to choose here for dinner. When we first walked in, we quickly realized just how eclectic the personalities of everyone working there were. It seemed like they all had great senses of humor, yet still keeping things classy like a classic Italian restaurant should have. The Food was excellent (I recommend the classic spaghetti and meatballs), and they had classic Vegas live music the Saturday we went as well. For dessert we had cannoli, which was fantastic. Overall a very satisfying Italian experience in an old style Vegas restaurant.

57_21NI3bE0X1mbEdgNkEg.text: Last night, I went out with my sister in law and some friends to the club. After a long night of dancing, we had DEFINITELY worked up the appetite to eat a good meal, so we stopped here at the Casa Di Amore restaurant.   Let me start off by saying how LATE we were coming; we went around 3:30 and the bartender (I believe), Brian (or Bryan) was getting ready to close after what seemed to be a long night. He decided to let us dine in and extremely sweet about it. I have to commend someone who is so willing to risk a little more of their late night to please a few strangers. Brian has reminded me of why I'm a people person.   The service was incredible to say the least. I had the Philly Cheesesteak Sliders. They came with wonderfully made fries and I had a lemon water. On the side, we all had warm bread and butter.   The meal was delicious and Brian came by to check on us periodically to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. The setting and the lighting of the restaurant is gorgeous and romantic for any couple who may consider going (including my man and myself).   Thank you so much, Brian. You are an outstanding server and person. If you haven't gotten one already, it's definitely time for your promotion!!

xh33Iotc_l2FKBapKprMWw.text: ATMOSPHERE:  Aside from the perimeter of booths, the tables are so close together in one big room it feels a little like a beer hall or cafeteria, so it feels a little crowded and loud.  However, the Love Shack gets props for being too dark to see the prices and very old school Vegas/Italian. I can't imagine going on a night without the live entertainment which made the experience.    The night we went it was one older black guy and one older white guy singing mostly 70s easy rock and R&B covers. They should call themselves "Grey".  "Hi, I'm white" "And I'm black", "And together we're Grey".  SERVICE:  Great, but it's the kind of place that gets super busy, so we ordered drinks, appetizers, and entrees all at the same time just in case.    DRINKS:  Not weak. And the bar has video poker/keno/blackjack. And if you want to eat in the bar, they will give you something that looks like a cutting board with high heel clogs.  LIMO/VAN:  You better reserve that in advance.  We missed the limo, but the manager hooked us up and sent us home in the shuttle as we stumbled out.  FOOD:  We shared the bruschetta.  The bread was kinda crouton-ish, but interesting and yummy.  The meatballs (a side for $4) were perfect.  I made the mistake of ordering the gypsy sauce even though I was told that on a scale from 1 to 10 in spiciness it was a 15.  It was like someone dumped a whole red pepper flake shaker into it.  I sweated throught it, and the server gave me some McDonald's coffee to cool my mouth down.

A4eQ_zHYpInvc216sTldXA.text: Easily the worst meal I've had since living in Las Vegas for the last 13 years. Went there to celebrate my birthday. Really wished I hadn't. The food quality of this restaurant is marginal, at best. I ordered the lasagna tonight. It literally was so bland and flavorless, two bites was all I could stand, and I forced the second bite. Frozen lasagna from your local grocery store has more flavor. The garlic loaf didn't really taste like garlic. More like hot melted cheese and grease bread.  After deciding I didn't want to try anything else. They brought out a cannoli and sang happy birthday. Truth be told, the birthday song was cheesy and the cannoli was even worse. The filling was gritty and frankly, really bad. It was like the fitting finish to a really really bad meal. The whole dining experience was poor. I had high hopes for this restaurant. I ended up getting a refund from the manager, but I more than likely won't be back nor will I recommend this spot to anyone else

ytH1vpABCe16jZ0czAMaJg.text: Grab a Uber and leave the strip! This place is worth the drive. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. The food delicious. Save your appetite because the portions are filling. This is our 5th night in Vegas and this by far our best meal experience. Next time we are town we won't wait until our last night to enjoy this place. Highly recommend!!!

MsZUA7dzp4K_SPMzGI8nlg.text: Our server was Tony which was absolutely fabulous, and very attentive. He offered menu suggestions that were great. I had the special filet mignon tips with gnocchi and gorgonzola sauce- it was amazing with fresh basil. The gnocchi was cooked perfectly which is hard to find, sauce wasn't to heavy and steak was cooked to medium. My husband had the flamade steak (may not be spelling this right) and he enjoyed it. Double espresso and tiramisu for dessert was good. The tiramisu had extra chocolate sauce on top which seemed to much/heavy for us. We had a nice dinning experience and definitely will come back.

dpxxkTaO88zCeUrPslrKig.text: A friend and I went on a Thursday night after 7pm, and it was packed. We didn't have reservations, but were seated quickly and our waitress promptly introduced herself and began serving us.  There was live music, and at first it seemed to add to the noise of the crowded restaurant, but after we settled in, the songs flowed naturally into the background. It added a nice touch to the atmosphere. Everything on the menu looked delicious, so it was hard to choose any one thing. Even just the bread provided at the beginning was enough to take me to heaven and back. For appetizers, we ordered the arancia (sp?) - sort of bread-covered rice balls - which were DELICIOUS. Their Caesar salad was perfect, and my friend's gnocchi and my eggplant pasta dish were both mouthwatering. We absolutely loved everything we had, especially the large cannoli at the end. And we got a free t-shirt! We were both extremely happy with both the service and the food and will definitely come back. Special shout out to Todd, whose consideration and wonderful service helped us to have such a fantastic experience.

nxlQYkMtuV7ohrG96JFkYA.text: Memories of evenings here with MoM and DaD early 90's.  Here for my birthday and had an amazing time listening to Sinatra n contemps.  Caesar like olde days.  V parm was large and tender w crispy crust.  Complimentary birthday cannoli is from Brooklyn, literally.  Such attentive service from Tony...tyvm!

mywC2dFR9HoRYlLSdtlPzA.text: Fantastico!   Casa Di Amore is an incredible Italian restaurant.  It's cozy, authentic and the staff is very friendly.  This is our second time here and it's the best we've had here in Las Vegas so far.    My wife, bro in law and myself got here about half hour early and they received us with open arms.  They made us feel like old friends.  I had the Eggplant DiAmore, bro in law Shrimp Fetuccini and my wife, good grief, turkey dinner.  And all was delish.  Bottle of red wine, raviolis and mini Osso Bucco.  Molto buona!  Topped off with a canoli and coffee.   Not kidding, this has to be one of the best places to have dinner.  It was our 22nd wedding anniversary and they had the gentleman singing during dinner sing for us.  And guess what?   He sang our wedding song!  What a fabulous evening.    Casa Di Amore, you are on top of our list in Las Vegas.  Congrats to you and your fabulous staff.

kVy5-WfGIIePB42fDk09iA.text: We discovered this restaurant on a recent trip based on a recommendation from a family member. Everything about the experience was awesome. The staff, the food, the ambience. We ordered the stuffed pork chops and chicken caprese. I think my husband might of fallen in love with the pork chops. The twice baked potatoes were surprisingly delicious. Love that it was off the strip, and more local. I'm Italian and originally from New York, and this honestly was some of the best Italian food I ever had.

KSUJ6eCXjstppXuvTLKCmA.text: We were referred here by 2 friends who dine here frequently, friends that we share similar taste buds with! So of course we had to try. When we drove up it seemed to be another great hole in the wall restaurant. Nothing too fancy on the outside...but when we walked in it was like walking into Old Vegas...live band playing great tunes, Old Vegas pictures on the wall, dim lighting, wait staff dressed very nice. We were sat in a corner booth by the entrance. It was a great spot, overlooked everything. If you want a quiet, romantic spot...not the place to come during the busy hours! But we were not there for that. We were there for some great Italian food. Our waiter came over introduced himself, asked if we had been before and then proceeded to tell us about the menu and the specials. We ordered our drinks and were served yummy hot bread and butter.  I ordered the special, gnocchi with filet tips in a gargonzola cream sauce and my man ordered the Fettucine Alla Pappasito Fresh homemade egg noodles tossed with a combination of crumbled and sliced smoked sausage, mixed with sauteed sweet onions in a white wine four cheese sauce. Our food came out fresh and hot and DELICIOUS! The sauces on both dishes were AMAZING... Our 1st experience here was fantastic. Food 110% spot on, service as well and for the price was worth it 5 star experience . Now for last night...we had such a great experience the 1st time we wanted to go back...I don't normally write a review unless I have been at least 2 times or if it was just terrible the 1st. I have to say I am very sad to report that this time we had about a 2 star experience which is why I am giving it a 3 star total.  I called ahead to see how busy they were, it was late and I didn't know what time they stopped serving. The lady on the phone who is so very pleasant said they didn't stop til 3:30am ...it was about 10:30pm  so we were good.  We got there and the band was done, so it was very quiet, perfect time to come if you want that quiet atmosphere. We were seated at a booth. It was not busy inside. There were about 5 tables with people all together. We sat and looked thru the menu. Sat some more, sat even more...about 10 mins, no waiter, no water, no service. Then a waiter walked over, helped the couple sitting at the table next to us, turned around when he was done and apologized for the delay. Not sure why there was a delay since the place was dead. We ordered waters, he said that he would get that and have bread sent over to the table. He brought back our waters, told us about the specials, which sounded amazing, so we ordered one of each. Mine was penne pasta with a cream sauce, cheese and lobster, he suggested a side of marinara to counteract some of the cheese...and my man ordered the fettuccine with this steak a that had spinach and cheese rolled up inside with seasoning and marinated over night and slow roasted to perfection, the sauce was a butter garlic.  The bread finally came out, but went to wrong table, so the waiter reached over, took it off their table and gave it to us. Was it warm? Yes...but didn't taste or feel fresh, not like our 1st visit. Waters were refilled regularly which is big for me...I don't like an empty glass. Our food came out and it looked delicious. Unfortunately, it was not a big hit. Man's dish had very little meat, surrounding a pile of spinach inside, no cheese, he said no flavor and like it had been broiled really quick...tough. not like the waiter described at all. Mine was good. Not great. I mixed it all up looking for the lobster...we paid  $32 for each plate. I had maybe 3 pieces of lobster that were SO small I had to rub off the sauce with my fork to see if it really was lobster....disappointed to say the least. For $32 there should have been some hefty chunks of lobster in there and my man's food should have been as described by the waiter. The marinara sauce was delicious. We did order cesar salad prior and those were fantastic as well. Our service,once we finally had some, was good.  But I am truly disappointed with my $72 bill for what we had. I really wanted to be able to give this place 5 Stars since our 1st experience was so wonderful but am sadly giving it a 3. Had we not been prior I would have only given it a 2. :(

YU5FlRjg7-qlZ2FmlBBV1Q.text: This place is a little gem! It's a really nice place to bring a date. Cozy feeling with good live music and an old school Italian vibe.   The service was great here. Came in yesterday for my bday and they made sure to take care of me. The manager, Smith, was very friendly and it seems like it rubs off on the whole crew there. Michael was our server and he was awesome. He was very knowledgable about the whole food and drink menu and I felt I could ask anything and get an answer (I can be picky and confusing at times lol). It really baffles me when you go to a restaurant and the servers are clueless about the joint.   The food was delicious and I am excited to come back and try more!!!

BxRvE5OTScQqLs_DjvT7mw.text: Solid old style Italian food.  Service was great and the food was spot on.  It's no North End Boston, but for a good family style meal in Las Vegas, make this a place to check-out.

uvMlggbu4Mm8Slzq9jLppw.text: We popped in for dinner midweek on a trip to Sin City in February after being told about this place for years. Good food, good wine, and unique atmosphere of Old Vegas made it a dinner to remember.

FM-wEIZLQ2_KK3zqCIWVZw.text: Eating at this old school Italian restaurant comes with live renditions of Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin songs. We went on Monday night with no reservation however they put table for our five together quickly.  The highlights of what I tasted were warm bread, calamari app, half priced bottle of wine, fettuccine alfredo and stuffed pork chops all very good.  I wasn't a fan of arancini rice balls app and wish I had room for cannoli for desert.  Regardless, this is a must try LV Italian restaurant.

fdY9AscRGWdt143T-XHGlA.text: I have to say we totally were looking forward to this and overjoyed ourselves. Don't get me wrong the place is very beautiful and the entertainers are amazing the singer was awesome. The food was just ok though.I wanted authentic Italian but it didn't have all the flavor. I think once was good enough for us not to mention is was insanely crowded and very loud.

Gayz-fLuJIM19pIgVBjGUw.text: Food is good but overpriced and the service is not that great(tony)... bad service will ruin the atmosphere. Not be back for a very long time and that's how you lose business

LO9Lti4kg1J288FVduNXUg.text: Came here for a last minute Valentines Day Dinner celebration.  We agreed to take the available 545p seating, when we arrived, we were asked to wait at the bar until our table was ready which is never a problem for us.  As soon as we took a seat at the bar, a young girl approached me and handed me a rose and small box of chocolate which was a nice, cute little touch.  Before we could even order a drink our table was ready.  We were seated in front of the stage where live music was playing classic lounge tunes.  Our server, Robert came by and asked us if it was our first time visiting.  We told him it was and he responded with, "this will be your new favorite restaurant"  He told us about some of the specialties and took our drink orders.  While we were waiting for our appetizer, fresh sourdough bread came to the table served with butter and a shaker of parmesean cheese.  The bread was warm and delicious.  Our calamari came next and the calamari was good but what really made it was the marinara sauce that it came with, we could've eaten the marinara by the spoonful.  I ordered a cup of pasta fagioli which was full of flavor and so comforting :)  Entrees came out soon afterwards, I ordered the frutti de mare pasta with red sauce and my boyfriend ordered the lobster/shrimp ravioli special.  I finished every last bite of my dish.  We saved room for dessert and ordered the cannoli (with complimentary t shirt) and had a vodka martini and baileys coffee while we waited for dessert.  The vodka martini was so good, nice and dirty, I would've ordered another but was starting to get a little tipsy so decided to make martini's at home instead.  What we got out of this dinner, was a great Valentines Day Dinner date, a feeling of old Las Vegas, great ambience, excellent food and service and a new favorite restaurant, I guess that's why their motto is, "Vegas, the way it used to be!  Leave the gun...take the cannoli"

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chianti and vodka martini

gXZ8GzYgmcAD4jfb-CsDTg.text: Are you serious? How am I just learning about what is going on inside Casa di Amore (CDA)? I've seen this restaurant more times than I can count, and never, not once even considered stopping in to check it out. I'm not a fan of Italian food so it never even occurred to me to see what they were offering inside CDA. That was a huge mistake.  I feel like I've been looking for this place for years. And didn't even know it. I don't trust anyone who doesn't dig their old-school decor and energy. And the service is outstanding. Lynn, the music coordinator helped  turn a simple birthday gathering into a real celebration. The band sang a special birthday song for everyone that requested it.  From what I can tell, this is a go-to birthday spot for many people. How do I know? I heard Happy Birthday at least 4 times. But who cares? There was certainly an air of celebration in the place.   The food was solid--the insalata di amore, calamari, and cioppino were all tasty. The cioppino was (rightly) the standout of the night. And the atmosphere is pure retro-Vegas charm. I am such a fan.

aRBxzz3o3HVTub9pHX33BQ.text: We will come here everytime we come to Vegas or pass through. We loved everything! The food...the ambiance...TONY! Ask for his section...he's awesome!

HUyfeK3EhVtgRsJEcgszKw.text: Even with a reservation, it took about 45 minutes extra to seat our party of five.   This is a small, very busy restaurant with limited space once you are inside.  Seating is congested and you need to get accustomed to the general noise level which includes the live music and  chatter of waiters and customers  Surprisingly, I was the only one of our group to order a regular meal off the menu.  I chose the Chicken Alfredo which I found to be a nice size, tasty and fairly priced.  The others in my group elected to try various side dishes for their meals including a tasty meatball and various pasta options.  Overall, most of our group felt the portion sizes were larger then they wanted to eat and were happy with the smaller plate options.  Service was attentive, prices were fair and the noise level was higher then we would prefer. .

Z0bZB--J_svIzy_bMvk0iQ.text: Delicious food, live music, and very friendly service.  Laid back, casual delicious broccoli rigatoni dish.

qGqqMb33ryjkIQLWKF6sYg.text: Wonderful food. Great atmosphere.  Live music a plus.  The limo driver was THE BOMB.  Should advertise this place!

4_oBrWACE5wFZtgGS4R__Q.text: I drove by this place so many times and I finally ate here! It's very cute and small. Inside the restaurant it's "old Vegas" decor with a live band. Attracts the older crowd, but I love enjoying authentic Italian food in a family owned kinda restaurant. The staff was very friendly, and the guy who performed had an amazing Frank Sinatra kinda voice...my kinda jam.  I got the Osso Buco (veal on a bed of risotto rice---very tasty) paired with an awesome glass of Chocolate Shop red wine--which was a sweeter kind of red wine. Great place if you want a little something nicer than Olive Garden with a twist of Vegas authenticity!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmigiana
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Buco
Photo of Casa Di Amore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i6-TA6BLbgzOkqeTEg2EBg.text: This place offers a free complimentary limo ride from the Strip with reservations to the restaurant! What an inexpensive way to experience a limo ride in Vegas. Service was prompt and the menu included many choices from chicken, steak, pasta, and veal. I wish I had room for dessert--also tons to choose from.  I ordered the gnocchi, which was tasty. The place reminds me of an old-fashioned Italian restaurant from the 60s. Live music starts around 6:30pm. This would be a great place to bring a date.

V5adeAAL7rM-5Oe5t_W-wg.text: A fabulous off the strip find.  The descriptions of mobster hangout, old school italian, etc. are all accurate.  We were here on a Sunday night and it was packed with locals.  The gentleman who does the entertainment/singing/piano is quite a character, he has a lovely voice and we enjoyed his music and spirit.  One of the highlights was him pulling his old friend, an actor/performer, on stage for an impromptu performance, very neat.   Our waiter, Tony (of course), truly made our evening; the wine recommendation from Cakebread Cellars was bang on - and because it was Sunday (& Mondays too) all wine bottles were 50% off, wow!   The lobster ravioli special was incredible as was the pomodoro fresco.  The bruschetta was good, but we wouldn't order that one again.  Desserts were excellent, made in house and imported from Italy. The ambiance, entertainment, service, food and wine were fantastic; we thoroughly enjoyed this fun, cozy and romantic evening; for that, we thought the prices were reasonable.  It cost us $24 for a cab from the strip to here, but they do offer a complimentary limousine that we may take advantage of next time - oh yes, there will definitely be a next time. A nice break from the high priced, fake, stuffy places on the strip.

NTzCTHcUFFwE2RmzGvTr8g.text: I give this place 3 stars because it is very romantic. There's live music and a romantic ambiance at night. Tables are small. You can't really go with a group over four people without a reservation. I recommend making a reservation to get a booth, otherwise the tables are fairly small. Dinner was good but not greAt. Perhaps they need to make their pasta a little more fresh from scratch for an extra star from me. Overall the romance was there. The live music sends me back to Sinatra times. Service was great.  Menu options are numerous but pasta needs some work. People now a days expect freshly made mouthwatering pure pasta from a mom and pops place like Casa Di Amor.

zuWpsYo7kk_YjlCXnWhpSw.text: I've been wanting to go to this place and the wait was worth it.  Very friendly staff and the food was pretty amazing.  Not your usual Italian food.  I was impressed.  I had the stuffed pork chops and it was amazing! A must try for anyone who visits this establishment.  The only thing I would say is that the price is a bit steep for a neighborhood place, but I guess you can't put a price on a hidden gem like this place.  I will definitely come back.

c1X2GlG0zcwW926O9BxDFA.text: My friend recommended this restaurant (we are both from CA). My friend told me to request waiter Brad or Tony(male). I called and spoke to Lisa on a Wednesday for reservations for Friday night. She said Brad works later that day but Tony will be there. Lisa asked Tony male or female. I said Male. We get to the restaurant and I tell the hostess I'm here for my reservations.She said Tony female will be your waitress. I told hostess that I requested male Tony. Hostess says he comes later:( we get seated and Tony female arrives. She says something about the computer system so she took a while to come out. Another table had their waiter come to them and very social! Toni female is not friendly and seems like she doesn't want to be there. Doesn't check on on us. Did NOT tell us the specials for the day! The other table with the guy waiter was so personable ! Wish we had him!Poor customer service with female Toni!The lady bussing the tables was nice.The food was good but with female Toni the service was horrible!!!! Later she puts the dessert menu down and says we can take a peak! Really?! I don't know if we would go again! If we do for sure we will NOT want female Toni !!!!!!!!

a7qKH-L-_TVAQvm79igVfg.text: The perfect date night place, hands down! The atmosphere is beautiful and everyone is very friendly. Our server Tony was awesome.  I had the Fettucine Alla Pappasito. It was perfect, just perfect! The Caesar salad was the best I've ever had. Their wine selection left a little to be desired, but other than that, this place is great. The live entertainment was a perfect compliment to our meal.  I cant get over what a wonderful experience this place was. I'll definitely be back!

CO1JtYLORQZShCrFyHoVWA.text: My wife and I had a great experience, they were able to get us a table even though we had no reservations and the place was packed!   Our waiter Tony was very attentive and answered all your questions and provided us a few of his personal recommendations.   I didn't realize that they are willing to pick you up from your Hotel in a limousine for free!  So next time were planning ahead and take advantage of the limo ride service so I can indulge in all the fine wines that they have available.

gW2xLOw6TrEwOX1yJ1J8tA.text: This place was recommended by our concierge when we stayed in Vegas and he was kind enough to get us a reservation (which I would definitely recommend doing).  Great off strip location and not hard to find.  It is a little on the loud side and very intimate.  No complaints on the food-it was incredible!  I hope to visit again if we get the chance.

n0UOegig2ska7d6QpIj_vQ.text: Where the Rat Pack must have held court  This is the real deal for good 'East Coast' Italian food.  No LV strip bling.  It's old school baby!  I've been here 3 times both with a group and just my teenage son.  Great Osso Buco, great service. The pictures of Bugsy's Vegas in the 50's that adorn the walls make it a throwback to a quiet place that the rat pack would hang out to avoid tha paparazzi.  Lots of locals, not a tourist stop.  Live piano and guess what? He channels Dino and Frankie.  Great evening and located not far from the strip.  It's next door to an indoor machine gun shooting range - go figure.  On the way in, you drive past the Liberace museum.  What a city: Gangsters, Guns and Glitter all in an evening's dinner.

V5RjHttUY6uH6OjeDoRFDw.text: I asked my limo driver for a recommendation for a place to eat off of the strip and he recommended Casa Di Amore.  I had high hopes because there isn't any good Italian in Dallas, where I'm from. It was the best dining experience I have ever had in Vegas.  The ambiance is fantastic with the live jazz band and everything we had was delicious.  The scampi, linguine clam and the tiramisu.  Not your usually Vegas tourist destination, seemed like a lot of regulars, but a must try the next time you visit the strip.

8tAW41kXo7180kJisJDPMg.text: Great place to take a first date.  It looks like a hole in the wall from the outside, but the inside is very classy.  If you're visiting, they offer complimentary limo service!  Lighting is dim and every now and then somebody is singing or playing the piano on their mini stage.  This place has the best shrimp scampi.  You get a free t-shirt if you order the cannoli.

QSe1Rp9KLhAm3jaeQzXBzA.text: Cheesy as f*ck. That being said... the service and the food are AMAZING. Yes, it's on the pricy side... but man I had the best Chicken Marsala of my life.   This is a pseudo-romantic restaurant off the strip with plenty of parking... and we went there with a group of 3 dudes. We were swooning alright... for the delicious food.  Thanks!

mWfeW3ARC0Xyp6XsUeFaIA.text: My first review.  We had 3 locals/bartenders on the strip recommend this place.  It's  10 minutes  off the strip but totally  worth the s $11 taxi ride.  Forget about the food on the strip.  This is the best Italian food in Vegas.  The waiting staff was friendly, from the bartender to the table server. Highly recommended.

gZqSso_2p6I91-AhRZ9a8g.text: Take a step back in time into this classic Vegas Italian restaurant. Absolutely excellent food,service, and ambiance. We go every year no matter what !

znMWf0oTF_kPQo0ijGbtnw.text: Ever feel like you want to experience old school Vegas? Walk into Casa Di Amore and its like walking into a time warp. Classic pictures on the walls, dark leather and warm brick, ambient lighting. Live music every night, impeccable service, fantastic menu. Our server Robert was on top of things! Wine glasses were never empty, his menu selections were spot on, and we felt like we were family. The bus boy was like a thief in the night.... We never knew he was there but somehow our water was always filled and our empty plates mysteriously disappeared from the table. Food was delicious. Calamari was lightly breaded and crispy. My eggplant was stuffed with cheese and spinach and still managed to stay firm. Hubby had cannelloni with ground veal that melted in your mouth. A word to the wise, they are closed on Tuesdays and MAKE A RESERVATION! We happened to walk in on a Monday night and there was one open table. ONE! There is a small bar area with a few open  2 person booths. Just goes to show how amazing this place is that a Monday is standing room only.
